I'll say only that I'm not at all sure whether the fate that eventually catches up to Michael is the result of his young-man-on-the-make stinginess or of plot details I didn't catch.Making his film debut in "Obsession" is John Lithgow, a fine New York actor, who plays Michael's best friend and business partner, a fellow of old New Orleans stock that represents the culture that Michael, and all others like him, are in the process of replacing.With "Obsession" Mr. De Palma is moving into the big time. He's a very talented director and one must be glad for him, though I still prefer those films he made on shoe-strings ("Greetings," "Hi, Mom," "Sisters"), when he didn't hesitate to give a Bronx cheer to the Establishment that he now aspires to join.The film has been rated PG. There is nothing terribly shocking by way of nudity, or rough language, but the kidnapping sequence might terrify small children.

title: No Hares in Sight, Turtles Win
description: CHESTER TOWNSHIP, Aug. 1  The second annual International TurtleRacing Championships drew more than 150 enthusiasts to the Chester Turtledome here this weekend.

title: W. H. BURKHART OF LEVER BROS.
description: William H. Burkhart, who retired in 1964 as the chairman of the Lever Brothers Company, died Saturday at Phelps Memorial Hospital in North Tarrytown, N.Y., after a short illness. His age was 77.

title: Imprisonment of ExState Policeman Poses Problem for Officials
description: TRENTON, Aug. 1A former state trooper who worked as an undercover narcotics agent and who helped convict more than 100 drug sellers in the early 1970's is facing a state prison term for a bank robbery conviction.

title: Jewish Congress Asks H.E.W. To Destroy Ethnic Questionnaire
description: The American Jewish Congress yesterday called on F. David Mathews, the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, to order destroyed a form that has been distributed in the public schools of five major cities that requires teachers and principals to identify themselves and their pupils by race and ethnic origin. One of the cities involved is New York.

title: Schweiker's Church Keeps Simple Rites
description: SALFORD, Pa., Aug. 1At dusk members of the congregation in the Salford meeting house arose from their straight wooden pews and filed out to the trim burial plot a few yards away.

title: Business Urged to Press South Africa
description: BOSTON, Aug. 1Vernon. E. Jordan Jr., executive director of the National Urban League, urged today that American corporations with investments in South Africa declare a moratorium on future investments in that country until it changes its apartheid policies.

title: Montreal Olympics That Opened in Strife Close on Brighter Note
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 1  The most expensive Olympics in 27 centuries and the most contentious of the modern era ended here tonight on a note of unscheduled hilarity. As 500 young women opened the closing ceremonies in a splash of choreographed color, they were joined by a male streaker who scampered among them in the buff while 70,000 witnesses in Olympic Stadium howled.

title: Trial in Officer's Slaying In Mosque to Open Today
description: More than four years after a melee and shootout at a Black Muslim mosque that led to the death of a policeman and rioting in the surrounding Harlem community, the trial of a mosque member charged with the officer's murder opens today in State Supreme Court in Manhattan.

title: Carter Goes to Church And Wins 2 Ball Games
description: PLAINS, Ga. (UPI)Jimmy Carter went to his men's Bible class and church today, and then to a family reunion of his wife's relatives.

title: Bedside Tables Don't Have to Be So Incapable of Holding Anything
description: Mention the words bedside table to most salesmen and one is usually led to an undernourished piece of furniture, supported by four somewhat spindly legs, that could conceivably hold a lamp, telephone and memo pad. The design is as practical as pointedtoe shoes.

title: Thousands in Vermont Watch Fiddling Contest
description: CRAFTSBURY, Vt., Aug 1 (AP)The hills were alive with the sound of oldtime country fiddling this weekend as thousands gathered in muddy field for the 14th annual Craftsbury Fiddlers' Contest. Each competitor mounted a tractortrailer to perform one at a time.

title: Bridge:
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 1 A star California foursome coasted to victory in the final of the Grand National Teams here yesterday, ending a remarkable run by a New Jersey  Westchester County team that had upset a string of highly rated opponents.

title: 40,000 From State On the I.R.S. Carpet
description: NEWARK, Aug. 1 (AP)More than 40,000 New Jerseyans have some explaining to do to the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Agencies' Activity Set A Few Records in 1975
description: Financially speaking, last year was one for the record books at the American Association of Advertising Agencies at least in three categories.

title: Drug Raid Leader Jailed For Vermont Frameups
description: ST. ALBANS, Vt.  Paul D. Lawrence came into this town in August 1973 like Wyatt Earp.

title: Kill That Dam!
description: Theoretically the Tocks Island Darn has been dead for a year. Congress has yet to bury it, and the project's interment is proving almost as controversial as its life.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Susan Stern, a Radical Activist And Writer, Dies at 33 on Coast
description: Susan Stern, who first worked with and later wrote about the radical leftwing political organization known as The Weathermen, died Saturday at University Hospital in Seattle, six days after suffering an apparent heart seizure. She was 33 years old.

title: John C. MacCarthy, 76, Founder of a Law Firm
description: John C. MacCarthy, founder and senior partner in the law firm of MacCarthy, Schultz & Mulholland, 225 Broadway, died Saturday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., where he had been living since retirement seven years ago. His age was 76.

title: Commodities
description: Of all the many factors that determine prices of commodity futures, none is so commonly ignored as the quality of the raw goods covered by the contracts.

title: Thousands View the Opening of Eucharistic Congress
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 1 (Reuters)One of the largest religious gatherings ever held in the United States began here today with solemn services, ceremonial processions and the first of eight days of studies on hunger in the world.

title: Files Disclose Sort of Data And Informant F.B.I. Uses
description: DENVER, Aug. 1  Nearly 2,000 pages of confidential files made public here last week have provided the first comprehensive look at the sort of information collected by the Federal Bureau of Investigation on radical organizations in this country and at the kind of individuals the bureau hires to inform on them.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Schweiker's Church Keeps Simple Rites
description: SALFORD, Pa., Aug. 1At dusk members of the congregation in the Salford meeting house arose from their straight wooden pews and filed out to the trim burial plot a few yards away.

title: Washington and Business
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1One of the most maligned figures in American economic life the elusive middlemanhas come under direct legislative attack by consumerists.

title: Drug Raid Leader Jailed For Vermont Frameups
description: ST. ALBANS, Vt.  Paul D. Lawrence came into this town in August 1973 like Wyatt Earp.

title: Mark Lomas, an Injured Jet, Fears for His Career
description: The Jets' return from nowhere may have started in the early hours yesterday.

title: South Africa Blacks Press Demands for Racial Reform
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 1 (AP)Black leaders presented South Africa's white minority Government today with a list of demands for racial reform.

title: Druggist Finds Service Is a Prescription for Success
description: Can a boy from Brooklyn find happiness and prosperity as a smalltown pharmacist in the Berkshires?

title: Israelis Start Providing Jobs To Unemployed From Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 1  The first contingent of unemployed Lebanese crossed the border security fence today to work in Israel, opening the latest phase of what the Israelis call their good fence policy.

title: Brooklyn Precinct Cut to the Bone by Police Layoffs
description: A look of pain spreads across Detective Stanley Katta's face as he talks into the telephone at the 70th Precinct station house, in the heart of Brooklyn.

title: Rhodesian Leader Urges Whites Not to Emigrate
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 1 (Reuters)Prime Minister Ian D. Smith today asked whites planning to leave Rhodesia to reconsider, declaring in an interview published here that he had every confidence in the country's future.

title: A Certain Panache
description: Sheila Mosler dropped in for a fitting at Arnold Scaasi's new salon a while ago and got more than she bargained for. The scarf collection the custom dressmaker had designed had just come in from Italy. In addition to trying on the evening dresses she was going to take to France with her, Mrs. Mosler also had a variety of square and oblong scarves draped around her neck and head. Mr. Scaasi was eager to see how they looked on a real woman.

title: REFUNDING STIRS A HOPEFUL MOOD
description: The big event in the credit markets this week is the Treasury's August refunding, and a positive mood by investors seems to be assured. In two auctions and a subscription, the Treasury will redeem $4.5 billion of maturing debt that is held currently by private investors and will raise at least $2.5 billion in new money.

title: Krumm Asks Federal Aid In Olympics
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 1  The president of the United States Olympic Committee urged the Federal government today to plan a financial role in future development programs for American athletes.

title: Coalition Backs Beanie in Effort To Bar Extra Aid to Schools
description: An ad hoc coalition of 11 health, social welfare and labor organizations has joined the Beanie administration in a bid for legal sanctioning of its refusal to implement the schoolfinancing formula of the new StaviskyGoodman Education Aid Law.

title: Bold Reagan Tactician
description: It was an Entebbelike strike, deep inside enemy territory, a lightningquick action designed to snatch the prize while the opposition was caught flatfooted and confounded. The capture of Senator Richard S. Schweiker of Pennsylvania, a liberal even by Democratic standards, by the conservative forces of Ronald Reagan was a daring stroke to give the candidate a foothold in the more moderate ranks of the Republican Party.

title: U.S. View: Plunge in Gold Price Hurts Russians, Not Americans
description: PARIS, Aug. 1In the official American view the decline in the price of gold, to the lowest levels since January 1974, has been a pretty good thing.

title: Recreation Aide Named
description: ALBANY, Aug. 1 (UPI)Margaret A. Payne has been named assistant commissioner for recreation in the State Office of Parks and Recreation, Commissioner Orin Lehman said today. The new assistant, a native of Ithaca, is now Commissioner of Parks, Recreation and Youth Services for the Town of Greenburgh in Westchester County. She will receive $30,000 a year in the state post.

title: France Takes Finale
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 1 (AP)  French riders won the Olympic gold medal in Grand Prix show jumping today, in the final competition of the 1976 Olympic Games. West Germany, the 1972 gold medalist at Munich, took the silver medal. Belgium gained the bronze on a superb ride by Francois Mathy on Gai Luron in the final round.

title: Tracie B. Felker Bride of Charles C. Taliaferro Jr.
description: Tracie Brooks Felker, daughter of Dr. Fort Felker Jr., and Marcia Felker of Kaneohe, Hawaii, was married yesterday afternoon to Charles Champe Taliaferro Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Taliaferro of Hobe Sound, Fla., and Locust Valley, L.I.

title: WORLD FOOD FUND SHORT OF TARGET
description: More than two years after it was proposed, the International Fund for Agricultural Development, which it was hoped would help to increase food production in the chronic fooddeficit countries, is still $63 million short of its $1 billion target.

title: Third World vs. Press
description: Serious questions about the future of freedom of information in Latin America are being raised in the aftermath of a UNESCO conference in San Jos, Costa Rica, last month when representatives of 21 Latin American governments met to draw, up communica tions policies for the region.

title: 3 Rivals for U.S. Senate Go Strolling for Support
description: City Council President Paul O'Dwyer, who is the Democratic Party's designee for the United States Senate nomination, campaigned on Manhattan's Lower East Side yesterday afternoon while two of his opponents hit the beaches.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Family Planning In Poor Nations
description: WASHINGTONLike many others who are concerned about the effects of the surging world population, I once firmly believed that citizens of poor, developing nations would not limit family size until they realized a significant improvement in their socioeconomic status. But a recent trip to several Far Eastern nations has convinced me that this is not true. Poor people will practice family planning given the means to do so.

title: Federal Effort on Car Safety Is Turning to Controversial Plan to Require Passive Restraints Like Air Bags
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1Ten years after the landmark Motor Vehicle Safety Act of 1966, signs are growing that the Federal Government is retreating from its aggressive role in making cars safer.

title: The Young of A.A.: When Euphoria of Wine and Drugs Is Gone
description: PHILADELPHIALWhen Kate and Chuck were married in the little church on Philadelphia's Main Line, it must have been a beautiful wedding. They are both so fresh, so handsome, they almost take your breath away.

title: Foreign Diplomats In Peking Sending Their Families Out
description: PEKIN, Monday, Aug. 2Hundreds of foreigners left the Chinese capital last night on specially scheduled flights after Chinese authorities repeated their warning of further earthquakes and advised foreigners to stay outdoors.

title: Brenner to Offer Bouts to Medalists
description: Teddy Brenner, director, of boxing for Madison Square Garden, is planning to meet tomorrow with Rollie Schwartz, the manager of the United States Olympic boxing team, and offer all seven medalists bouts on the Muhammad AliKen Norton card on Sept. 28 in Yankee Stadium. The five goldmedal winners on the team are Leo Randolph, flyweight from Tacoma, Wash.; Howard Davis, lightweight from Glen Glove, L. I., Sugar Ray Leonard, lightwelterweight from Palmer Park, Md., and the Spinks brothers from St. LouisMike, a middleweight, and Leon, a lightheavyweight.

title: Cold War Pits Indian vs. Indian And Both Against City of Oneida
description: ONEIDA, N. Y.  Halfway down the dirt road that splits the 32 acres and 25 trailers of the Oneida Indian Nation here, David Honyoust, the war chief of the Oneidas, clambers over a faded red and rusteroded 20yearold fire engine, trying to make a donated nozzle spray the way it is supposed to.

title: Irit Spierer Wed to Jonathan Greenberg
description: Irit Spierer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Wolf Spierer of Yonkers, was married there yesterday afternoon to Jonathan Greenberg, who expects to receive medical and law degrees from Columbia University's College of Physicians and Surgeons and its Law School next May. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Greenberg of Somerset, Mass.

title: Judy Hirschberg Becomes a Bride
description: Judy Hirschberg, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Erich Hirschberg of Valley Stream and Southampton, L. I., was married at noon yesterday to Timothy Atwood, son of Dr. and Mrs. Lewis Atwood of Shrewsbury, Mass.

title: Thais Report Skirmish With Cambodians in Gulf
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. between two Cambodian gunboats and a Thai Navy ship after two Thai fishing boats came under attack, the police said today.

title: Advertising
description: There are committees working within the American Association of Advertising Agencies whose ultimate goal is to improve the image of advertising among consumers.

title: Mets Lose Twice To Phils, 76, 20
description: The Mets found two ways to lose to the Philadelphia Phillies at Shea Stadium yesterday afternoonslowly and quickly.

title: Petty 500 Victor as Pearson's Tire Fails
description: LONG POND, Pa., Aug. 1 What started as a 500mile stock car race abruptly changed today to a 27mile sprint among four cars over the triangular course of Pocono International Raceway.

title: Brooklyn Man, 26, Tells Of Harsh Life in Saigon
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 1I thought I was the last American in Saigon, Gerald Posner said tonight. I decided, well, if they kill me, O.K. But meanwhile I would look for my wife.

title: STRIKING GISELLE STARS TENNANT
description: Veronica Tennant was the impressive Giselle and Rudolf Nuryev danced Albrecht in the National Ballet of Canada's production of Giselle yesterday afternoon at the Metropolitan Opera House.

title: Louisville Pipefitters Strike
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 1 (UPI)From 850 to 900 pipefitters went on strike early to day after their contract expired. They are members of Local 522 of the United Association of Plumbers and Pipefitters, and are skilled craftsmen who install and repair large cooling and heating syetems.

title: Quakes in Guadeloupe
description: POINTEAPITRE, Guadeloupe. Aug. 1 (Reuters)  Two earth tremors of medium intensity shook the French Caribbean island of Guadeloupe yesterday, officials said today.

title: Spa Opens Today
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 1  New York racing's annual summer vacation begins tomorrow when the thoroughbred scene shifts to Saratoga. The meeting will run until Aug. 28 with racing Monday through Saturday. The track will be dark on Sunday.

title: A List of Those on Flight From Saigon to Bangkok
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 1 (AP)Following is a list of Americans and others bound for the United States who arrived here from Saigon today. Those named were either traveling alone or heads of family groups. The list was compiled from official sources, Associated Press files and the travelers themselves. It gives the name, date of birth, hometown if available, accompanying family members and available biographical data.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, AUGUST 2, 1976

title: On Aime Beaucoup Hildegarde, Fifty Years in Show Business
description: Hildegarde is celebrating her 50th year in show business during the next three weeks at Brothers and Sisters, 355 West 46th Street. Her goodnatured act is full of selfkidding, parodies, throwaways and just enough of the genuine Hildegarde to make it apparent that this is the real thing.

title: Olympic Games End
description: The Olympic Games, which for the last two weeks produced a mixture of political quarrels and athletic achievements, ended last night with closing ceremonies in Montreal. Page 15.

title: Computer Finds 1,200 on Relief Who Work for New York State
description: New York Slate's Welfare Inspector General said yesterday that a computer check of 190,000 state employees had turned up the names of 1,200 who were receiving welfare assistance from New York City between January and midApril, and he said the list included many questionable cases.

title: Big Foreign Concerns Top U.S. Rivals in Sales Gains
description: Despite the generally gloomy trend of the world economy last year, leading foreign companies outpaced their American counterparts in sales gains, according to the latest Fortune director of the 500 largest industrial corporations outside the United States. The directory appears in the August issue of the magazine to be published tomorrow.

title: Performers May Get W. 42d St. Housing
description: The city is expected to recommend that the troubled Manhattan Plaza complex on West 42d Street be turned into subsidized housing for New Yorkers associated with the performing arts.

title: Do You Have a Fine 14th  or 20th Century Mind?
description: We are living in what is called a space age, an atomic era, an age of technology. Citizens of such an era have an obligation to each other to be knowledgeable in scientific matters in order to make proper judgments on ABM's, SST's and other sets of initials they might encounter. They also have an obligation to themselves to know about some of the most powerful and exciting concepts in the history of ideas.

title: The Olympics
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 1Waving a small American flag, Bruce Jenner seemed about to leap over the Olympic Stadium in a single bound after winning the decathlon. On his victory lap after completing a double in the 10,000meter run and 5,000meter run, Lasse Viren was convoyed by countrymen with two fluttering Finnish flags. That's what the Olympics are all about. But on that same brick red track, the tall Haitian jogged as slowly as a jogger in your neighborhood. Except that he was competing in the Olympic 10,000meter run. Lasse Viren had lapped him eight times but the tall Haitian kept jogging around and around the track that was empty except for him. Eventually. the bell ringer in a yellow blazer signaled his final lap That's when the cheers for

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Film Chairman Will Head March of Dimes Chapter
description: The New York March of Dimes yesterday announced the election of Leo Jaffe, board chairman of Columbia Pictures Industries, as chairman of the executive committee of the Greater New York chapter of the National FoundationMarch of Dimes.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TAKE A BREAK Starting today, midtown visitors and office workers have a week of free lunchhour music, jazz and pop, to look forward to as a midday breather. The place is Bryant Park, the spacious benchandgreenery oasis behind the main branch of the New York Public Library, Fifth Avenue and 42d Street. All performances begin at 12:15 P.M., continuing until 1:30. The publicservice and citysanctioned concerts are financed by the recording industry and the Union Dime Savings Bank.

title: London Telephone Strike
description: LONDON, Aug. 1 (Reuters)About 70 percent of London's international telephone operators went on strike here today over a raid on one of their exchanges by 100 police searching for drugs in which four men were arrested. The walkout caused long delays In overseas calls.

title: HighRisk Loan Program Salvaging Homes in Queens
description: An unusual and unpublicized housing program sponsored by the Federal Government is helping to revive a large, deteriorating neighborhood of private homes in South Jamaica, Queens.

title: The Uncommon Heritage
description: Representatives of more than 150 nations will assemble at the United Nations headquarters here this week to resume negotiations on a new body of international law to regulate the uses of that 70 percent of the earth's surface that is covered by watera vast, still largely virgin territory which the United Nations once declared to be the common heritage of mankind.

title: Reds Top Padres, 54, Foil Jones's Bid for 19th.
description: The Cincinnati Reds not only foiled Randy Jones's attempt to win his 19th game this season with a 54 victory over the San Diego Padres in Riverfront Stadium yesterday, but they also stopped Jones's mastery over the National League Western Division.

title: Schweiker and Sears Predict Delegate Shifts Toward Reagan
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1Two leaders of Ronald Reagan's Presidential campaign said today that there would be significant favorable shifts of delegates behind the Californian next week, but neither man cited specific delegates or numbers.

title: French Take to Road en Masse For Annual Vacation Exodus
description: PARIS, Aug. 1  It came as a fragile bit of good news for half of France's 50 million people on the move this weekend, most of them headed for vacation, a smaller number headed home.

title: Allin Beats Crenshaw By a Shot
description: SUTTON, Mass., Aug. (AP) Brian (Bud) Allin scored his first golf tour victory in two years today, edging Ben Crenshaw by one stroke in winning the $200,000Pleasant Valley Classic. Allin, a consistent moneywinner since joining the tour in late 1970, posted a final oneunderpar 70 for 277 in the rainplagued tournament. He earned $40.000.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: We have noted before that thoughts on food seem to go in cycles, which is a preface to stating that twice within recent weeks we have had inquiries about the lowly acorn as an edible.

title: John Fey Marries Mary C. Mach
description: Mary Callimanopulos Mach, a registered representative with the investment banking firm of Moseley, Hallgarten, Estabrook, Inc., was married yesterday afternoon to John Theodore Fey, chairman of the Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States.

title: Radio
description: 6:059 A.M., WNCN. Hungarian Rhapsody No 1, Liszt; Serenade for Flute, Harp and Strings, Hanson; Fantasies for Flute, Telenann; Let Thy Hand Be Strengthened, Handel; Amahl and the Night Visitors, Menotti; Sinfonia a tre, Stradella; Overture to Orpheus in the Underworld, Offenbach; Nocturne from Carmen, Bizet; Introduction Teatrale No. 5. Locatelli; March in D, Mozart; Habanera, Ravel; Violin Concerto in A minor, Vivaldi.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, AUGUST 2, 1976

title: Army Commanders in Uganda Are Reported Jailed by Amin
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 1 (AP) President Idi Amin of Uganda has placed several army commanders under arrest to head off a possible attempt to topple him from power, the Kenya newspaper Sunday Nation said today.

title: Catholic Church Struggling With Role in Bonn Politics
description: COLOGNE West Germany, July 29When Julius Cardinal Dpfner, the spiritual leader of 127 million Roman Catholics, died in Munich of a heart attack on July 24, a centuryold gulf between his church and the Social Democratic Party, which governs West Germany, seemed almost to close in an outpouring of national condolence.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Aug. 1The Assembly will meet at 2 P.M. tomorrow to grapple with the loose ends of the state income tax.

title: 65 Killed as Rains Flood Colorado Recreation Area
description: LOVELAND, Colo., Aug. 1Tragedy marred Colorado's centennial celebration of statehood today as a flash flood along the Big Thompson Canyon 50 miles north of Denver took at least 65 lives,

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two Long Island men with $1,200 in counterfeit $10 bills in their possession were arrested Saturday night at Roosevelt Field in Carle Place, L. I., and charged with firstdegree forgery, the Nassau County police reported. A department spokesman identified the suspects as Paul Aversa, 20 years old, of 3912 Carrel Boulevard, Oceanside, L. I., and Terrence Hirten, 20, of 3100 Shore Road, Bellmore, L. I. The spokesman said that Edward Cooper and John Bradley of the department's Bureau of Special Services were on patrol at the shopping center when they spotted Mr. Aversa and Mr. Hirten sitting in a car on the upperlevel parking lot counting a large amount of money. Upon further investigation, they [the officers] found the bills were counterfeit, the spokesman said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In an article published in The Rhodesia Herald, following his recent visit to Salisbury, the British Member of Parliament Eldon Griffiths correctly diagnoses a sine qua non of any proposed settlement to be the need to convince whites that their property will not be expropriated. Incorrectly, however, in my opinion, he suggests that compensation could not automatically be guaranteed.

title: Soviet Defector Is Granted Permit to Remain in Canada
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 1Sergei Nemtsanov, a 17yearold platform diver from the Soviet Union, met with Soviet Olympic officials today and told them he wanted to remain in Canada.

title: Yanks Fall, 54, to Red Sox In 9th; 6th Loss in 7 Games
description: BOSTON, Aug. 1Better early than late, said Dock Ellis.

title: Lucy Deans Hanes, 47, Dies; Was on Virginia Arts Panel
description: Lucy Deans Hanes, a member of the Virginia Fine Arts Commission, died yesterday in Georgetown Hospital in Washington. The wife of John W. Hanes Jr., an investment banker and former Assistant Secretary of State, she was 47 years old and lived at 600 Innsbruck Avenue, Great Falls, Va.

title: Personal Finance: Wages After Age 65
description: One of the aspects of the Social Security system that has aroused the most misunderstanding and resentment among recipients of benefits is the limit on earned income placed on those getting retirement benefits. You do not have to retire completely to receive Social Security checks, but your earnings will determine whether you will receive all, part or none of your benefits.

title: HONEYWELL LINKED TO F.B.I. SPY TACTICS
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 1 (AP)  Federal Bureau of Investigation agents in Minneapolis spied on persons critical of Honeywell Inc. and passed on information to company officials who were preparing to fend off their critics at an annual stockholders meeting in 1970, The Minneapolis Tribune reported today.

title: 4 Hurt in Lye Attack Escape Blindness, But May Be Unable to Return to Duty
description: Four policemen who were seared Saturday when a man barricaded in a Harlem apartment hurled buckets of lye, ammonia, drain cleaners and gasoline at them, were told by hospital physicians yesterday that they might never be able 10 return to active police duty.

title: Arbitration Averts Strike Threatened In Private Hospitals
description: A threatened strike against 17 profitmaking hospitals in the city was averted yesterday as union and management representatives agreed to submit the issues to binding arbitration.

title: Prosecutors Weigh Move To Delay Harris Verdict
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 1The Los Angeles District Attorney's office is giving serious consideration to asking the judge in the William and Emily Harris trial to suspend jury deliberations, pending the outcome of a hearing into possible judicial and juror misconduct.

title: Deaths
description: ALLISONNancy Jacksonon July 31, 1976, at her home In New Canaan, Conn. Wife of Gordon Allison. Mother of Thorne, Seward and lorwerth. Sister of Gwenn Hansen, Ann Atteridge, Norma Boin, and Winifred Oberreit. Memorial Eucharest, Wednesday August 4, 8 P.M., at St. Mark's Church, New Canaan. Memorial gifts to St. Mark's Instead of flowers.

title: MEYER LEWIS DIES; EXLABOR OFFICIAL
description: Meyer L. Lewis, former Western director of the American Federation of Labor and then general manager of Tillie Lewis Foods, headed by Mrs. Lewis, whom he married in 1948, died Saturday night in New York HospitalCornell Medical Center. He was 72 years old and lived in Stockton, Calif., where he had headed Overseas Marketing Company, an importing concern, since 1973.

title: Jailing of an ExPoliceman Poses Perils
description: TRENTON, Aug. 1A former state trooper who worked as an undercover narcotics agent and who helped convict more than 100 drug sellers in they early 1970's is facing a states prison term for a bank robbery conviction.

title: Bernard Feldman Dies at 73; Pharmacist Led Cooperative
description: Bernard Feldman, a retired pharmacist who was founding president of the Drug Guild Cooperative, died Saturday in Miami Beach, where he was living. He was 73 years old.

title: Parsifal' Is Offered at Bayreuth
description: BAYREUTH, West Germany, July 31The first integral unit of the centennial Bayreuth Festival ended tonight with a performance of Parsifal conducted by Horst Stein. From here to the end of the festival, the Ring, Tristan and Isolde and Parsifal will be repeated, though with different casts. Hans Sotin, for instance, who sang Gurnemanz tonight, will be the Wotan in the next Ring cycle, replacing Donald McIntyre.

title: About New York
description: At 10 A.M. last Friday, Phyllis Blackman left the Burden Center for the Aging to start calling on her clients. From 85th Street and York Avenue she strode over to 87th near Lexington, which is a pretty good walk on a hot and humid day.

title: HEALTH TRAINING OF BLACKS DROPS
description: NASHVILLE, Aug. 1The delivery of badly needed health care services in large urban centers may be further jeopardized in the future because training opportunities in the medical and dental professions for blacksthose who traditionally practice in inner cities are beginning to diminish.

title: Constance B. Doolittle, 57, Teacher of Mathematics
description: Constance Bancroft Doolittle, a former chairman of the mathematics committee of the National Association of Independent Schools, died Saturday in Sharon (Conn.) Hospital. She was 57 years old and lived on Interlaken Road, Lakeville, Conn.

title: Brooklyn Man, 26, Tells Of Harsh Life in Saigon
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 1I thought I was the last American in Saigon, Gerald Posner said tonight. I decided, well, if they kill me, O.K. But meanwhile I would look for my wife.

title: QUESTIONS REMAIN IN ABDUCTION OF 27
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 1All three suspects in the abduction of 26 Chowchilla schoolchildren and their bus driver are now in custody, and the authorities say that the case against them is a strong onealmost ironclad, one police official called it in a private conversation.

title: HOSPITALS DEVISING PLANS FOR A STRIKE
description: Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, the New York City Health Commissioner, plans to call on the city's voluntary hospitals today to begin cutting back elective admissions so they can serve emergency patients in the event of a strike Wednesday against municipal hospitals.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: CEMETERIES

title: U.S. Checking Mobil's Role in Rhodesia
description: Allegations that the Mobil Oil Company fashioned an elaborate and secret chain of bogus companies to disguise the flow of gasoline and other oil products from South Africa to Rhodesia in the last decade are being investigated by the United Nations, the United States Treasury and Mobil itself.

title: Two Court Rulings Roil Serenity of Ocean Grove
description: OCEAN GROVE, Aug. 1Today was a typical Sunday in Ocean Grove, a day almost like every other Sunday in this Methodist community for the last 107 years.

title: VINCENT ROSS, 80, OF PRENTICEHALL
description: Vincent C. Ross, retired vice chairman of PrenticeHall Inc., book publishers and providers of financial services, died yesterday in his apartment at the Westchester Country Club in Rye, N.Y. He was 80 years old and had a home in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: MARS OXYGEN DATA ARE SLOWING DOWN
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 1 (UPI) The rate of oxygen emission from Martian soil in a Viking testing chamber has slowed down, a Viking scientist said today. It was still not known whether the oxygen came from a chemical reaction or some form of life.

title: STUDY FINDS IRAN DEPENDENT ON U.S. IN USING WEAPONS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 United States experts maintain that Iran is now so dependent on American personnel that it could not go to war without U.S. support on a daytoday basis, according to a Senate staff study made public today.

title: Echoes Of Helsinki
description: LONDON, Aug. 1A year ago today, in Helsinki, leaders of 35 countries signed the Final Act of the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe. In it they promised, among other things, to facilitate freer movements and contacts among people and to deal with requests for any necessary exit permits in a positive and humanitarian spirit.

title: HARRY COPLAND, 80, PIONEER PILOT, DIES
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Aug. 1 (UPI)Harry Depew Copland, a pioneer pilot who flew in three wars and was a member of the Aviation Hall of Fame, died at his Fort Lauderdale home yesterday. He was 80 years old.

title: Life Continues Normally For Rest of the Chinese
description: SIAN, China, Aug. 1. (Reuters)While the earthquake zone of northern China struggled to cope with disaster, life in the rest of the country seemed to be continuing normally.

title: STUDY FINDS IRAN DEPENDENT ON U.S. IN USING WEAPONS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 United States experts maintain that Iran is now so dependent on American personnel that it could not go to war without U.S. support on a daytoday basis, according to a Senate staff study made public today.

title: Patriots Beat Giants In Overtime by 137
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Aug. 1 Larry Csonka made his debut with the New York Giants tonight and was the team's leading rusher.

title: Books of The Times
description: Peter used a hammer to murder his mother, who had pestered him, and two halfsisters who had adored him. Tom fatally shot his uncle, who had provided him with the only home he ever had. Rose prepared dinner for her younger brother, put him to bed and then killed him while he slept.

title: New City U. Board Will Meet Today With Public's Confidence Seen at Issue
description: Educators and others concerned with the City University agree that restoration of public confidence in the university's ability to manage its affairs looms as the major task confronting the new Board of Higher Education when it begins formal operations today.

title: MINERS TRY TO STOP BACKTOWORK MOVE
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Monday, Aug. 2 (AP)Pickets were out in force early today, attempting to halt a backtowork movement in the northern West Virginia coalfields that could weaken a twoweekold wildcat strike.

title: ITALY SEEKS HELP IN HANOI ON FUMES
description: ROME, Aug. 1 (UPI) The Italian Government today asked a North Vietnamese expert on American jungle defoliants to come to Italy and help detoxify a northern area contaminated by poisonous fumes.

title: Louisville Police to Protest
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 1 (UPI)The Fraternal Order of Police, representing members of the Louisville police force, plans to loin with other public employee unions tomorrow morning to demonstrate against the labor policies of Mayor Harvey Sloane. Police negotiators and the city have broken off talks again in the continuing dispute over a new police contract. The police have been without a contract since July 1.

title: Bujones of Ballet Theater Will Spend Time Abroad
description: Fernando Bujones, the 21yearold wincipal dancer with American Ballet Theater, who two years ago became the only American to win the Gold Medal at the Varna International Ballet Competition, has decided to spend more time in guest appearances abroad and with regional American companies outside New York.

title: Hispanic Protestant Church Group Forges New Role for the SpanishSpeaking in New York City's Affairs
description: From the Sea of Galilee Pentecostal Temple on the Lower East Side to the Lighthouse of Salvation Church in the Bronx and the Damascus Christian Church in South Ozone Park. Queens, Accion Civica Evangelica is beginning to make its presence felt.

title: Foreign Diplomats In Peking Sending Their Families Out
description: PEKING, Monday, Aug. 2Hundreds of foreigners left the Chinese capital last night on specially scheduled flights after Chinese authorities repeated their warning of further earthquakes and advised foreigners to stay outdoors.

title: Yugoslavia Pulls Out
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Aug. 1 (Reuters)Yugoslavia has withdrawn from the paraplegic Olympics, which start in Toronto tomorrow, because South Africa will be taking part, officials said today.

title: Heartworm Disease Rises Among Dogs
description: The dog days of summer are starting, and it's questionable whether humans or dogs will have the worst of it. For dogs, August is high season for canine filariasis  heartworm disease.

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: MRS. MARTIN CONBOY
description: Bertha Mason Conboy, widow of the late Martin Conboy, United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York from 1933 to 1935, died Friday in a nursing home in Hyattsville, Md. She was 98 years old.

title: Solomon, Fibak Gain Net Final
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 1 (AP)Wojtek Fibak of Poland pulled his game together after early difficulties and defeated Stan Smith, 46, 61, 62, in a semifinal match of the $125,000 Louisville International Tennis Classic today.

title: Valley Also Flooded in '62
description: The flood in Colorado this weekend was one of the worst in recent years and was the second devastating flood to hit Big Thompson Valley in 14 years.

title: Algerian Chief Cements Power but Widens Debate
description: ALGIERS, July 29Eleven years after gaining political control in a military coup, President Houari Boumediene, a remote and secretive leader, is widening public participation in political life while reaffirming his power.

title: ACHESON SUSPECTED JANITORS OF SPYING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (UPI)The late Secretary of State, Dean Acheson, believed the Soviet Union obtained more United States secrets through charwomen, janitors and stenographers than from top officials such as Alger Hiss, according to 1949 congressional testimony released today.

title: Brooklyn Precinct Cut to the Bone by Police Layoffs
description: A look of pain spreads across Detective Stanley Katta's face as he talks into the telephone at the 70th Precinct station house, in the heart of Brooklyn.

title: Olympic Games End
description: The Olympic Games, which for the last two weeks produced a mixture of political quarrels and athletic achievements, ended last night with closing ceremonies in Montreal. Page 15.

title: 49 U. S. CITIZENS AND DEPENDENTS FLY FROM SAIGON
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 1  Fortynine United States citizens and dependents of Americansvirtually the last in Vietnamwere allowed today to fly from Saigon to Bangkok, ending more than a year of uncertainty about their fate.

title: Arbitration Averts Strike Threatened In Private Hospitals
description: A threatened strike against 17 profitmaking hospitals in the city was averted yesterday as union and management representatives agreed to submit the issues to binding arbitration.

title: The Dying Flame
description: The Olympic flame that flickered out last night in Montreal carried with it some stirring moments of individual achievement, and some thoroughly distasteful displays of political chauvinism, moneygrubbing hucksterism and misplaced expenditures of energy and ideals. How much longer will it take a youthful generation of athletes the world over to recognize how crassly they are being exploited by persons and organizations paying allegiance to less than noble goals?

title: Trinidad and Tobago End Ties to British Monarchy
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, Aug. 1 (Reuters)Trinidad and Tobago became a republic at midnight last night, ending a 179year link with the British monarchy.

title: Helen Moed Has Nuptials
description: Helen McWilliams Moed, a former researcher and producer for CBS News in New York, was married yesterday to Lawrence Kennedy Pomeroy, Midwest producer for the CBS Morning News in Chicago.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: In Memoriam

title: U.S. Checking Mobil's Role in Rhodesia
description: Allegations that the Mobil Oil Company fashioned an elaborate and secret chain of bogus companies to disguise the flow of gasoline and other oil products from South Africa to Rhodesia in the last decade are being investigated by the United Nations, the United States Treasury and Mobil itself.

title: Martha Brown Bride Of Paul W. Rosenblum
description: Martha Mary Brown and Paul W. Rosenblum, graduates of Boston University, were married yesterday at the Metropolis Country Club in White Plains, where Rabbi Paul R. Feinberg performed the ceremony.

title: Varied Interests of Carter's Pollster Raise Conflict Question
description: PLAINS, Ga., Aug. 1Patrick H. Caddell is the public opinion poll taker for the Democratic Presidential nominee, Jimmy Carter. But more than any other poll taker in past elections, he has also become an influential adviser to his candidates on political tactics and strategy.

title: Athletes Assess the Games
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 1The food was good and available 24 hours a day, the dormitories were overcrowdedespecially with only one shower for every 12 persons and the security was a drag, but necessary.

title: Cold War Pits Indian vs. Indian And Both Against City of Oneida
description: ONEIDA, N. Y.  Halfway down the dirt road that splits the 32 acres and 25 trailers of the Oneida Indian Nation here, David Honyoust, the war chief of the Oneidas, clambers over a faded red and rusteroded 20yearold fire engine, trying to make a donated nozzle spray the way it is supposed to.

title: Lauda Critically Hurt in Prix
description: ADENAU, West Germany, Aug. 1 (AP)James Hunt of Britain won the 50th German Grand Prix auto race today after the reigning world driving champion, Niki Lauda of Austria, suffered extensive injuries in a fiery crash at the Nuerburgring course. Lauda was in critical condition tonight at the Mannheim University Clinic.

title: QUESTIONS REMAIN IN ABDUCTION OF 27
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 1All three suspects in the abduction of 26 Chowchilla schoolchildren and their bus driver are now in custody, and the authorities say that the case against them is a strong onealmost ironclad, one police official called it in a private conversation.

title: A 4Term Representative and Michigan's Secretary of State Lead Primary Race for Hart's Senate Seat
description: DETROIT, Aug. 1A black Democrat from Detroit and a Republican Representative from Ann Arbor are considered the men to beat in party primaries scheduled for Tuesday to fill the seat now occupied by Senator Philip A. Hart, a Democrat who is retiring after 18 years in the Senate.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Mary Gnaedinger, Editor Of Fantasy Magazines, 78
description: Mary C. Gnaedinger, editor for nearly three decades of Famous Fantastic Mysteries Magazine and Fantastic Novels magazine, died Saturday at her home in Morningside House in the Bronx. She was 78 years old.

title: New York City Discloses $25.6 Million in New Cuts
description: Beame administration officials, with cautious optimism about New York City's fiscal fortunes, revealed $25.6 million in additional cuts that they will make in the city's budget to cover apparent slippages in the city's savings plan for this year.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Monday, Aug. 2, 1976 Petition tiled by;

title: U.S. Is Reported Near an Agreement On Reactor Sales to Egypt and Israel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2A top State Department official reportedly told a Senate committee today that the United States had virtually completed negotiations for the sale to both Egypt and Israel of nuclearpower reactors under strict safeguards to prevent their diversion to production of atomic weapons.

title: Report on Army's Drug Tests Tells of Efforts at Concealment
description: An internal Army report made public yesterday tells of a Government effort to conceal the Army's sponsorship of experiments with hallucinogenic drugs that resulted in the death of a civilian subject in New York 23 years ago.

title: Rubber Strikers Sentenced
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 2 (Reuters)Thirtyfour members of the striking United Rubber Workers union received suspended jail sentences today for violating an injunction against mass picketing at rubber plants here. They were arrested early today at the gates of a Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company factory after an allnight picketing vigil and a sitdown demonstration designed to prevent office workers from entering the plant.

title: LEBANESE AGREE ON CAMP RESCUE
description: BEIRUT. Lebanon, Aug. 2The International Red Cross today obtained permission from rightwing Christian military commanders to begin the evacuation of wounded civilians from the beleaguered Palestinian camp to Tell Zaatar tomorrow.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, AUGUST 3, 1976

title: Yield of About 7% Likely on 3Year Treasury Notes
description: The Treasury's new threeyear notes to be sold today will likely yield a little less than 7 percent, Government securities dealers estimated yesterday as they assessed the state of the fixedincome markets. The $2 billion note issue is the first installment of a three  part Treasury financing that is designed to refinance $4.5 billion of maturing Federal debt and to raise $2.5 billion or more of new cash.

title: Four Democratic Aspirants for the Senate Find That Campaign Donors Are Less Than Lavish
description: Four major Democratic contenders for the United States Senate nomination in next month's primary are running lowbudget campaigns that reflect continuing parsimony by onetime big contributors as well as the restrictions of the new Federal electionfinance law.

title: Fibak Bows To Solomon In Net Final
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 2 (AP)Harold Solomon, with six service breaks and some unexpectedly strong volleying, scored a 62, 75 victory over Wojtek Fibak of Poland in the final of the $125,000 Louisville International tennis tournament tonight.

title: Enclave in India, Once French, Genteelly Going to Seed
description: PONDICHERRY, India, July 30The sound of the ceiling tans, the indispensable backdrop to colonial life in the tropics, is a squeak now in this sweltering enclave on the Bay of Bengal that France ceded to India more than two decades ago, and the flies hover low instead of clearing out.

title: New York Lottery Will Give Refunds In 3 Halted Games
description: The New York State Lottery announced yesterday that it would make refunds on the approximately 1.8 million outstanding tickets for the last three games of the state lottery suspended late last year by Governor Carey.

title: Arab Escort for Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 2 (AP)The State Department acknowledged today that it relied on ??scorts from the Lebanese Arab Army to guard Ambassador Talcott W. Seelye to his meetings with various Lebanese leaders in Beirut.

title: Chiefs Ton Oilers. 93
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 2 (AP)Emmit Thomas, a cornerback, scooped up a blocked Houston field goal, attempt and sped 68 yards for a touchdown that gave the Kansas City Chiefs a 93 suddendeath overtime victory over the Oilers tonight in a National Football League exhibition game.

title: Homer in 9th Beats Mets, 54
description: The darn in front of Joe Frazier's frustrations in his rookie year of managing the Mets burst last night at Shea Stadium as his team suffered another devastating defeat, 54, to the Montreal Expos.

title: Top British Court Backs GiftedChildren Schools
description: LONDON, Aug. 2An attempt by the Labor Party Government to eliminate privileged schools for gifted children received a setback today.

title: 8 SEIZED IN THEFT OF 15 BULLDOZERS
description: The Suffolk County District Attorney yesterday announced the arrest of eight men allegedly involved in the organized theft of 15 bulldozers and tractors valued at a quarter of a million dollars.

title: Security Police Seal Off Peking's Railway Station
description: PEKING. Aug. 2 (Reuters)Security police sealed off Peking railway station tonight after official warnings that the city could soon be the center of a new earthquake.

title: BUDGET FOR CARTER CUT TO $19 MILLION
description: PLAINS, Ga., Aug. 2 (AP)Jimmy Carter met with top staff aides today and pared the operating budget of his Presidential campaign to $19.2 million.

title: Trane Raises Prices Of Products Used For Heating by 5%
description: The Trane Company in La Crosse. Wis., announced yesterday that its commercial airconditioning division was increasing prices by an average of 5 percent for heating products, effective immediately. The products affected include unit heaters, steam specialties and convectors.

title: Hidden Ownerships Found By DayCare Center Audit
description: Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin's auditors are unraveling a network of concealed but concentrated ownerships of daycare centers in New York City that is sharing more than $14 million a year of public funds.

title: Arnsparger Is Pleased Despite Loss
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Aug. 2We did everything we wanted to do, except we didnt win.

title: Newest Hotel in New York: Elegant, Meticulous, Secure
description: The views of the East River and the city's skyline are spectacular. The white shag carpeting in the suites is the kind you'd like to walk barefoot through. There's a grand piano to pick out a little Chopin on, a bar with its own refrigerator and two kinds of soapNeutrogena and Dialon the marble washbasin in the bathroom. And a huge tennis court on the top floor and a glassedin swimming pool on the 27th. Plus a reception staff that collectively speaks 27 languages. Altogether, it's a place that one diplomat found likely to be habitforming

title: Human and Plant Cells Grow Jointly for First Time
description: Human and plant cells have been fused and grown in combination, apparently for the first time, according to the journal Science.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Aug. 2Although it is taking the State Legislature a few extra sessions to complete the state income tax package, Sidney Glaser, the State Tax Director, says he will he ready to begin collecting the tax on Sept. 1.

title: South Korean Ship Seized
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Aug. 2 (UPI)The Coast Guard cutter Jarvis seized the South Korean fishing vessel Dong Wong 707 yesterday for catching crab in violation of United States laws. The seizure was the second of a South Korean fishing vessel in Alaska waters in the last two weeks on a similar charge.

title: LyeBurned Officers Tell Of the Ordeal in Attack
description: Almost as if he were filing a police report, Sgt. Richard Reichman, recounted yesterday, from a bed in St. Luke's Hospital, the events that have left his eyesight and his future as commander of the Special Emergency Squad in jeopardy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Yesterday's Results at Saratoga
description: FIRST$7,500, cl., 3YO, 6f.

title: Frederick S. Wildman Sr. Dead; Importer of French Wine Was 77
description: Frederick S. Wildman Sr., the board chairman of Frederick Wildman & Sons, a New York City importer of French wines, died Sunday at his home in Colebrook, Conn. He was 77 years old.

title: REAGAN AIDE SAYS MORE DELEGATES SHIFT FROM FORD
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2Ronald Reagan scored today his first gains in the Republican Presidential contest since he chose Senator Richard S. Schweiker of Pennsylvania as his VicePresidential running mate.

title: New York City Discloses $25.6 Million in New Cuts
description: Beame administration officials, with cautious optimism about New York City's fiscal fortunes, revealed $25.6 million in additional cuts that they will make in the city's budget to cover apparent slippages in the city's savings plan for this year.

title: Deaths of 6 to 14 Who Attended Convention Studied
description: Epidemiologists from the United States Public Health Service and the Pennsylvania State Health Department began an investigation yesterday of an apparent outbreak of a mysterious illness that might have caused from six to 14 deaths among 10,000 people who attended a state American Legion convention in Philadelphia July 2124. Estimates of the number of persons affected vary.

title: Killanin's 1980 Goal Is Olympics for All
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 2In an I Love You postscript to the Games of the XXI Olympiad, Lord Killanin of Ireland held out an olive branch today for Africa, mainland China and Taiwan. He wants them all back in the fold for the 1980 Olympics in Moscow.

title: Loch Ness Search Is Reduced in Size, But Scientist's Faith Is Undiminished
description: DRUMNADROCHIT, Scotland, Aug. 1When Dr. Robert Rives is not adjusting his cameras or trolling the dark lake, he amuses himself with hundreds of letters that have arrived to cheer him on in his latest effort to explain the legend of the Loch Ness monster.

title: Crowd Sets Record at Spa Opener
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 2A campaigner for less than a month and already a stakes winnerthat was the distinction earned by Mrs. Taylor Hardin's Mrs. Warren today as a 24day meeting was launched with the usual countryfair flavor at Saratoga Race Track.

title: SYLVIA U. RUBIN
description: Sylvia Unterberg Rubin, for 40 years a director of the Young Men's and Young Women's Hebrew Association at 92d Street and Lexington Avenue, died yesterday at her home at 911 Park Avenue. She was 84 years old.

title: Hotchner's $125,000 Libel Award Upheld
description: Ernest Hemingway has received an unfavorable review from a Federal judge who characterized the late novelist as a rich libertine and destroyer of wildlife.

title: Gielgud and Richardson To CoStar in Pinter Play
description: John Gielgud and Ralph Richardson will be costarred in No Man's Lead, a new play by Harold Pinter, the celebrated British playwright who has written such striking plays as The Caretaker, The Homecoming, The Birthday Party, The Dumbwaiter and The Collection.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: S.E.C. Accepts Bid For a Settlement On Energy Device
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 2 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission's Los Angeles office accepted an offer of settlement today from the Presley Companies of Newport Beach, Calif., which had eroneously reported that it possessed a working model of a machine that converted water into hydrogen energy.

title: House Bars Move to End A Bonus in U.S. Pensions
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 2An attempt to reduce the Federal Government's pension obligations was blocked today by the House when members rejected a move to eliminate a bonus feature for retired workers and thus save the Treasury $1 billion a year.

title: BID AT SETTLEMENT BLOCKED BY ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 2Israeli forces blocked an attempt by more than 50 Jewish militants to set up an unauthorized settlement near Jericho in occupied Jordanian territory today,

title: Air Crash in Iran Kills 5
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 2 (AP) A South Korean Boeing 707 cargo jet crashed early today a few minutes .after taking off from Teheran's Mehrabad Airport, and all five crewmen were killed, the Iranian Government's press agency reported.

title: Cecil A. Rollins, Professor: Stricken at Church Service
description: GORHAM, Me., Aug. 2Cecil A. Rollins, retired professor of English at Colby College, Waterville, died yesterday. He was 83 years old.

title: Interior Fund Bill Signed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (UPI) President Ford signed a bill today giving the Interior Department and other agencies $5.8 billion for the fiscal year starting Oct. 1. He also signed a measure extending for another year the Transportation Department's power to issue aviation war insurance for civilian aircraft when no such insurance is available commercially at reasonable terms.

title: People and Business
description: Ruddick C. Lawrence, president of the United StatesArab Chamber of Commerce, told a businessmen's conference yesterday at the University of Maine in Orono that American knowhow and Middle East dollars are a good partnership.

title: CITY'S HOSPITALS READY FOR STRIKE
description: New York City's 16 municipal hospitals made preparations yesterday to stay open to offer at least emergency services in expectation of a strike by 18,000 nonmedical workers set for tomorrow morning.

title: Manhattan Headstart Leaders Question Fiscal Dealings by Their Central Office
description: Community directors of several Headstart preschool programs here have complained to the Manhattan District Attorney's office about fiscal dealings in their central administrative office that they feel are fraudulent.

title: Israelis Stepping Up Patrols in Lebanon
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 2Israel is moving vigorously to exploit the power vacuum in southern Lebanon and prevent Palestinian forces from reasserting control over the area just north of the Israeli border.

title: COUNT DE LEUSSE
description: PARIS, Aug. 2 (AP)Count Pierre de Leusse, former French representative in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, died of a heart attack at his Paris home today. He was 71.

title: FLOOD EVACUATION ENDS IN COLORADO; TOLL RISES TO 77
description: LOVELAND, Colo., Aug. 2Rain and fog grounded search helicopters for a time and slowed other rescue efforts today as the estimated death toll in the Big Thompson Canyon flood rose to 77.

title: PRICES ON AMEX CONTINUE TO FALL
description: Stock prices on the American Stock Exchange continued to decline yesterday, losing 0.34 to close at 103.33 as measured by the market value index. The decline came on slightly higher volume, which totaled 1.8 million shares, up from Friday's 1.5 million.

title: Shipping /Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Apartheid on Trial
description: South Africa's separate development policy has been dealt a savage blow which the country's white rulers will find it difficult to explain to 18 million blacks and an already skeptical outside world. Three months before the showpiece homeland known as Transkei is to be granted independence from the white Government in Pretoria, its black leaders headed by Chief Kaiser Matanzima have arrested nine prominent members of the opposition Democratic Party.

title: Strikers Defy Court Order
description: CHESTER, Pa., Aug. 2 (UPI) Some 2,700 workers at the Sun Shipbuilding and Dry Dock Company, defying a return to work order from a Federal court and pleas from their union leaders, continued a weeklong strike today. Federal Judge Louis Bechtle last Thursday imposed a daily fine of $10,000 on the strikers' union, Local 802, International Brotherhood of Boilermakers.

title: Wood, Field & Stream
description: LITTLE PLEASANT POND, Me.A loon laughed and wailed and laughed again when we began an afternoon of fly fishing for brook trout on Little Pleasant Lake deep in Maine's glorious Allagash region.

title: Now That The Mighty Hath Fallen
description: Not even the Central Intelligence Agency in all its travail has undergone a more precipitous drop in public repute than the once untouchable Federal Bureau of Investigation. Merely to summarize the bureau's various troubles is becoming difficult:

title: People in Sports
description: The names of the Olympians Bruce Jenner, goldmedal winner in the decathlon, and John Naber, winner of four gold medals and a silver in swimming, and of O. J. Simpson were added yesterday to a long list of celebrities who will appear in the Robert F. Kennedy Memorial procelebrity tennis tournament at Forest Hills on Aug. 28.

title: A Hampton Crosses Bridge to Chicdom
description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 2They used to call this quiet little village the poor Hampton, because it wasn't as cute and quaint as the other Hamptons, because it had a sizable black population, and because it seemed mainly a link on the Montauk Highway between the two rich Hamptons  Southampton and East Hampton.

title: Soviet Dissidents Charge Violation of Helsinki Pact
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 2 (AP)  A group of Moscow dissidents said today that the Soviet Union was violating the Helsinki accord by restricting the freedom of unrepentant political dissidents who have completed prison terms.

title: Portugal's Premier Offers a Program To,Restore the Authority of the State
description: LISBON, Aug. 2Portugal's new Socialist Prime Minister today presented a program intended to restore the authority of the state, revive the paralyzed economy and improve the quality of life.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The reconstituted Board of Higher Education, the governing body of the City University, elected last night as its chairman Harold M. Jacobs, a Brooklyn businessman who was chairman during the final days of the previous board.

title: Ferry Mishap Injures 19
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass., Aug. 2 (AP)Nineteen persons suffered minor injuries today when a Cape Cod area ferry rammed a dock at Woods Hole, a ferry company spokesman said. The ferry was inbound from Vineyard Haven when she rammed the ferry slip at about three knots after the engines apparently failed to reverse.

title: Report on Army's Drug Tests Tells of Efforts at Concealment
description: An internal Army report made public yesterday tells of a Government effort to conceal the Army's sponsorship of experiments with hallucinogenic drugs that resulted in the death of a civilian subject in New York 23 years ago.

title: Cigarette Truck Hijacked
description: A truck containing $17,000 in cash and cigarettes was hijacked yesterday in front of 11 Broadway in Lower Manhattan. The truck, belonging to the Lansen Tobacco Company of Long Island City, Queens, was seized at 7:45 A.M. when its driver was held at gunpoint by two men.

title: Monmouth Entries
description: Horses listed In order of post positions FIRST$5,000, cl., mdns., 2YO, 5f.

title: Dominicans Sue G. & W. On Filming of Sorcerer
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Aug. 2 (UPI)Businessmen from the town of Altagracia have filed a $260,000 lawsuit against a movie company based in the United States for alleged damages involving the filming of The Sorcerer.

title: Thinking About the Germans: I
description: NEW HAVENThe German question, which has long haunted the civilized world, seems as acute as ever.

title: Judge in Harris Case Refuses to Declare a Mistrial or to Remove juror Accused of Prejudice
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 2Superior Court Judge Mark Brandler, suggesting that two sworn witnesses might have been less than honest in reporting a possible prejudicial remark by a juror now deliberating the fatel of William and Emily Harris, rejected today defense motions for a mistrial and to remove, the juror.

title: COURT BARS MOVING OF U.S. DRUG SUIT
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 2 (UPI)A longstanding Federal antitrust suit seeking more than $376 million in damages from five major drug companies should be tried and decided promptly in Minneapolis and not be moved, the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit ruled yesterday.

title: RentRise Exemptions Grow
description: Mayor Beame signed into law yesterday a measure that extends rentincrease exemptions to certain elderly residents in MitchellLama housing. Eligible for the program are persons 62 years old or older whose household income does not exceed $6,500 annually. Such exemptions previously were limited to elderly tenants in rentcontrolled and rentstabilized housing.

title: F.B.I. BreakIn Inquiry Is said to Widen
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2The Department of Justice has drastically widened its investigation of allegations that agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation burglarized the homes and offices of militant political figures during the last five years, F.B.I. and department sources said today.

title: Results at Monmouth Park
description: FIRST$5,500, cl., 3YO and up, 6F.

title: Peking Is Believed Seeking the Conquest of Taiwan
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 China now seems to be taking the position that Taiwan can be reunited with the mainland only by military force, according to authoritative diplomatic, sources.

title: Earlier Plan to Kidnap Hoffa Reported
description: DETROIT, Aug. 2 (UPI)The abduction of James R. Hoffa, former president of the Teamster Union, might have been prevented about 12 years ago by a man who is now a prime suspect in Mr. Hoffa's disappearance last year, according to The Detroit News.

title: More Big Banks Cut Prime Rates to 7%
description: Many of the nation's largest banks reduced their prime lending rates a quarter point yesterday, establishing the industry's prevailing prime rate at 7 percent.

title: JUNE INVENTORIES SHOW A 1.2% RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 Manufacturers' inventories increased in June by more than in any month since the economic expansion began, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: BRITAIN PROTESTS YUGOSLAV ARREST
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Aug. 2The British embassy said today that it was protesting about the failure of the Yugoslav Government to notify the British mission of the arrest of two British subjects, one of them a London church vicar.

title: City Hall Basks in Summer Calm As Frenetic Fiscal Pace Eases
description: At his post at the front door of City Hall, Police Officer Robert Budion, casual in plaid mufti, asks where are the loose hingesthe eccentric visitorsof summers past.

title: He Sees Faith Vindicated
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 2Now that it's over, Drapeau's Folly doesn't seem to Drapeau to have been such a folly, after all.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Off at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Lye Attack and Aid by Unseen Hands Recounted by NearBlinded Officers
description: Almost as if he were filing a police report, Sgt. Richard Reichman, recounted yesterday, from a bed in St. Luke's Hospital, the events that have left his eyesight and his future as commander of the Special Emergency Squad in jeopardy.

title: 13 FOOD PLACES FAIL SANITARY INSPECTION
description: The New York City Health Department has cited 13 more food outlets as Health Code violators and warned that failure to pass a followup inspection could result in an order to close.

title: Work on a Deepwater Port To Start at Rio de Janeiro
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 2 (UPI)Construction of a second deepwater port for metropolitan Rio de Janeiro is set to begin this month, the Companhia Docas do Rio de Janeiro announced today.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Henry McEnroe, the director of the Essex County Board of Freeholders, welcomed a proposal to build a $30 million state prison in the county, but said he was not sure the state would be able to find the 30 to 60 acres of land needed for the proposed 400inmate prison.

title: Continued Growth In Economy Is Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2The Congressional Budget Office forecast today that the economic expansion would continue throughout this year and next without accelerating inflaton.

title: Tonight's Entries at Yonkers
description: Horses listed In order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Exemption on Abortion Reported in Italy
description: SEVESO, Italy, Aug. 2 (Reuters)A local mayor said today that Italy's Christian Democratic Government had agreed to change the law and allow abortions for women affected by poisonous vapor leaked from a chemical factory.

title: Slave's Daughter Wills $10,000 to Negro Fund
description: BOSTON, Aug. 2 (UPI)The daughter of a slave who worked as a domestic until she was 90 years old has donated her life savings of $10,000 to the United Negro College Fund.

title: Ma, Chinese Composer, Dies
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 2 (UPI)Ma Ko, one of China's leading composers of revolutionary music, died in Peking last week at the age of 58, Hsinhua, the official Chinese press agency, reported today.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Monday.

title: Mondale, on Questionnaire From Carter, Told of Two Minor Questions Raised About His Campaign Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2Before being chosen as Jimmy Carter's running mate, Senator Walter F. Mondale, like at least five others in competition for the VicePresidential nomination, answered a questionnaire about everything from his income taxes to his health.

title: Crash Kills Two TeenAgers
description: SCHUYLKILL HAVEN, Pa., Aug. 2 (AP)Two teenagers were killed yesterday when the car they were riding in ran off the road and hit a tree near here. They were identified as Richard Yarish, 17, and Dennis Poretti, 18, both of Schuylkill Haven.

title: Cointelpro Taint
description: The predicament in which Associate F.B.I. Director Richard Held finds himself sheds a great deal of light on the general predicament of the F.B.I. these days and on the monumental task the bureau's Director Clarence M. Kelley faces in trying to clean up the mess that has piled up over the years.

title: REAGAN AIDE SAYS MORE DELEGATES SHIFT FROM FORD
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2Ronaid Reagan scored today his fiat gains in the Republican Presidential contest since he chose Senator Richard S. Schweiker of Pennsylvania as his VicePresidential running mate.

title: SPEED CHECKS DUE ON L I. PARKWAYS
description: BABYLON, L.I., Aug. 2The Long Island State Park and Recreation Commission announced today that a special police radar patrol would operate on three major parkways in Nassau and Suffolk Counties in efforts to reduce flagrant violations of the speed limit.

title: CITY'S HOSPITALS READY FOR STRIKE
description: New York City's 16 municipal hospitals made preparations yesterday to stay open to offer at least emergency services in expectation of a strike by 18,000 nonmedical workers set for tomorrow morning.

title: Allen's Woes in Washington: 16 Unsigned, 2 Refuseto Play
description: Although it has long been George Allen's policy to please his players through generosity, the man who runs the Washington Redskins is having problems this summer. Sixteen Redskins, 12 of them regulars, have not Pro signed contracts and two, Frank Grant and Dennis Johnson, refused to play in Washington's first exhibition game at Atlanta on Saturday night.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Court Orders Gag in Muslim's Trial for '72 Murder of Policeman
description: A State Supreme Court Justice yesterday prohibited both the defense and the prosecution in the murder trial of a member of a Black Muslim mosque in Harlem from discussing any asnect of the case with the press.

title: Widows and Children at Police Outing
description: The face of 6yearold Ennis Johnson beamed as bright as the sun above, and he broke into a grin that revealed a gaping hole where two front teeth once were.

title: Doubling of Food Deficit of Tropical Nations Possible
description: Food deficits in many poor tropical nations could be double those of the crisis year 197475 in less than a decade, according to a study by the International Food Policy Research Institute.

title: Radio
description: 7:308:55 A.M., WNYCFM. Russian and Ludmilla Overture, Glinka; Quintet No. 7, Boccherini; Three Romances, Schumann; Violin Concerto in A minor. Vivaldi; Chamber Works, Purcell; Hungarian Rhapsody No. 4, Liszt.

title: Millionaire Dies of Poison After Receiving Life Term
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Aug. 2 (UPI) Jack Rose, a millionaire who swallowed two cyanide pills Friday after receiving a life prison sentence for plotting his former wife's murder, died yesterday at a hospital. An autopsy was ordered.

title: A Voice for H.E.W.
description: Gov. Jimmy Carter has indicated that the Department of Health, Education and Welfare would play a key role in a Carter Administration's attack on the nation's domestic problems. Fulfillment of the promises of better schools, of improved health services and of fundamental welfare reforms depends in large measure on strategies to be devised and put into effect by H.E.W. But as presently organized, the department is not equal to such a mission.

title: MINER PICKETS BALK BACKTOWORK MOVE
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug 2 (AP)A backtowork movement fizzled in the country's coal mines today as determined miners continued wildcat picketing.

title: Lauda's Condition Still Critical
description: MANNHEIM, West Germany, Aug. 2 (Reuters)Niki Lauda, the world auto racing champion whose car crashed in flames during yesterday's West German Grand Prix, was taken off an artificial respirator today but his condition was still listed as critical. A medical bulletin said the 27yearold Austrian, who suffered severe burns on his hands and face and severe internal injuries, was being given oxygen and was still being artificially fed. Lauda was conscious and able to respond to questions by nodding or shaking his head.

title: STATE ELECTION LAW CHALLENGEDINCOURT
description: MINEOLA, L. I. Aug. 2  A lawsuit was started today challenging a section of the State Election Law that permits party chairmen in three counties to recommend themselves for elections commissioner.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Savings Banks Association of New York State reported yesterday that the state's savings banks closed $758 million in mortgages in June, the secondlargest monthly volume in the group's 157year history. The June total ranks second to the $777 million in mortgages closed in December 1972. The total for the first half of this year, the association said, was $3.2 billion, up $530 million from the first half of 1975.

title: Squibb Admits $1.9 Million in Questionable Payments
description: The Squibb Corporation, a major pharmaceutical company, said yesterday it had made about $1.9 million in questionable payments in eight countries abroad from 1971 to mid1976.

title: Fritz Lang, Film Director Noted for M, Dead at 85
description: Friz Lang, the Vienneseborn film director best known for M, a terrifying study of a child killer, and for other tales of suspense, died yesterday in Los Angeles at the age of 85. lie had been ill for some time, and had been inactive professionally for a decade.

title: British Ship Leads Fleet
description: PLYMOUTH, England, Aug. 2 (AP)Great Britain II was the first to cross the finish line today in the transAtlantic race of 28 Tall Ships from Boston. Sabre, another British ship in the race that began July 15, also finished.

title: Conspiracy Is Laid To Kepone Makers In New Indictment
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 2 (UPI)A Federal grand jury investigating Kepone contamination of the James River in Virginia returned another indictment today against the former manufacturers of the toxic pesticide.

title: Mexican Oil Exports Up
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 2 (UPI) Mexico will export an estimated $447 million worth of crude oil this year, PEMEX, the Governmentowned oil company, said today. The Under Secretary of Finance, Alofredo Navarrete, said that a rise in production of petroleum products and petrochemicals as well as domestic and foreign sales had already resulted in a 52 percent gain in crude oil exports and a 16 percent advance in the company's profits.

title: Public Advocate Bids Utility Rate Request Be Cut
description: NEWARK, Aug. 1The State Department of the Public Advocate recommended today that an increase in utility rates sought by the Public Service Electric and Gas Company be reduced to about onequarter of its record $447 million request.

title: Too Few Petitions Signed On New Haven Recall Vote
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 2 (AP)A group of New Haven residents trying to force a vote to recall Mayor Frank Logue from office has collected only 79 percent of the 8,125 petitions required by today, one of their leaders says.

title: Analysts Cite Concern of Investors on Economy
description: The stock market eased slightly yesterday in continued sluggish trading. The Dow Jones industrial average dropped 2.38 points to close at 982.26.

title: BAY MINING TO SELL WESTERN DECALTA
