description: The Hudson Bay Mining and Smelting Company of Toronto said yesterday that it had granted an option to the Loram Company of Toronto to buy its controlling interest in the Western Decalta Petroleum Company, a gas exploration and producing company that operates mainly in Canada. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed, but last month the Great Lakes Power Corporation, an investment subsidiary of Brascan Ltd. of Toronto, terminated a plan to buy Hudson Bay Mining's holding in Western Decalta for $36.3 million.

title: Islands in Trust
description: How to save the priceless islands of Nantucket Sound from the immediately threatening blight of overdevelopment is the question now before a subcommittee of the House of Representatives.

title: Howe Asked Again to Quit
description: PROVO, Utah, Aug. 2 (UPI)The Utah County Democratic Party executive committee has joined the list of organizations urging Representative Allan T. Howe to drop out of his reelection race. The committee sent a letter to the Utah Democrat, who was convicted in Salt Lake City on July 23 of soliciting sex from two police decoys posing as prostitutes.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Hidden Ownerships Found By DayCare Center Audit
description: Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin's auditors are unraveling a network of concealed but concentrated ownerships daycare centers in New York City that is sharing more than $14 million a year of public funds.

title: HOUSE OF COMMONS BACKS GOVERNMENT
description: LONDON, Aug. 2The Government tonight survived the first test in the House of Commons of its policy to cut public spending.

title: Books of The Times
description: For years, after the publication of The Feminine Mystique, Betty Friedan searched for a second book to write. She had produced what she claimed, probably justly, was the alarmbell that awoke the feminist movement after a sleep of nearly half a century, but struggle as she would she could not complete another volume.

title: George W. Lee, 82; Was Leader Of Memphis Republican Blacks
description: George W. Lee, for four decades a leader of black Republicans in Memphis, Tenn., died there Sunday following an automobile accident. He was 82 years old.

title: 3D FIGURE BOOKED IN MASS ABDUCTION
description: SAN FRANCISO, Aug. 2Frederick Newhall Woods, one of the three suspects in the July 15 kidnapping of 26 Madera County children and their summer school bus driver, today (was turned over by Federal officers to state authorities.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Rocky Mountain Energy Company of Denver announced yesterday that it had signed a $1 billion, 20year coal sales contract with a major Midwest utility. The agreement, which includes appropriate price escalation clauses, provides for delivery of three million tons of coal annually, beginning in 1979, from a mine near Rock Springs, Wyo. The purchasing company was not identified.

title: Players Approve Baseball Contract
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (UPI)Major league baseball players have approved a new labor contract with the owners that recognizes freedom of movement of the players for the first time, it was announced today at a Congressional hearing.

title: E.E.C. Reports Complaints On U.S. Phosphate Practices
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 2 (Reuters) The European Common Market Commission has asked the United States for its views on complaints that the American phosphate industry is trying to dominate the European market, commission sources said here today.

title: Japan's July Reserves Up
description: TOKYO, Aug. 2 (UPI)Japan's foreigncurrency reserves totaled $15.94 billion at the end of July, the Finance Ministry announced today. The ministry said the monthly increase was the third highest this year, after a rise of $978 million in February and $755 million in April. It said a favorable trade balance and brisk investments in Japanese securities by foreign investors were the chief factors.

title: 2 Armed Men Get $80,000 At Bank in Brownsville
description: Two armed men held up a branch of the Chase Manhattan Bank in Brooklyn yesterday and escaped with about $80,000, the police reported.

title: Charles S. Munson of Airco Inc.; Once President and Chairman
description: Charles S. Munson, former president and chairman of Airco Inc. a diversified manufacturing company, died yesterday at his home in Southport, Conn. Mr. Munson, who was 87 year:; old, did not stand for reelection as a director and honoraiy chairman at Airco's annual meeting last May 6.

title: Brooklyn Bridge Is a Whitney Hit
description: It was the usual museum crowd at the Whitney Museum of American Art's downtown branch the other day: a lawyer, an actuary, an option trader in a brokerage house, an architect and facilities engineer and three bluecollar workers, among others.

title: Box Scores and Standings
description: EMadlock. DPPhi ladelphla cago 1. LOBPhiladelphia 9, Chicago 4. 2BMadlock, Schmidt, MItterwald, Trilio, Johnstone. HRLaCock (6). SBonham.

title: A Mean Town in Georgia in the '60s Sinks Into Euphoria While Awaiting Carter Election
description: AMERICUS, Ga., July 29 This was a tough town, a place civil rights workers still talk about as one of the meanest in the Deep South in the difficult days of the early 1960's.

title: Sets Down Leis, 2920
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Aug. 2 Sandy Mayer defeated Ilie Nastase, 76, in a wild men's singles match filled with stalling tactics by both players and arguments with offidais as the New York Sets beat the Hawaii Leis, 2920, in World Team Tennis before 4,566 at the Nassau Coliseum tonight.

title: Secret Service Warns Of Counterfeit $5 Bills
description: Watch out for counterfeit $5 bills.

title: Youth Held in Murder of Man Locked in Closet 3 Days
description: A 19yearold Bronx youth was charged last night with robbery and murder in the death of an elderly man who, along with his wife, had been bound with ropes and locked in a closet for three days by robbers who ransacked their apartment.

title: SOWETO STUDENTS RETURN TO SCHOOL
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 2 (Reuters)Prompted by black community leaders, many pupils returned today to classes in the Johannesburg suburb of Soweto.

title: Boy, 16, Sexually Attacked in Court Cell
description: A 16yearold boy was sexually assaulted by five teenage youths while awaiting arraignment in a holding cell just outside the courtroom at New York Criminal Court last weekend, the police said yesterday.

title: Sea Law Parley Resumes, With Third World in a Militant Mood
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Aug. 2The Conference on the Law of the Sea today opened yet another sessionits fifth since it began in December 1973amid heightened militancy of thirdworld nations and the newly aligned landlocked and geographically disadvantaged countries.

title: S. E. C PROPOSES NEW TENDER RULES
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 2The Securities and Exchange Commission appeared today to be taking a major step toward increasing the flow of information to investors in a comprehensive series of proposed new rules governing tender offers.

title: Advertising
description: For the first time in its 44year history, the National Advertising Agency Network is going to make an allout attempt to increase membership.

title: F.T.C. BEGINS INQUIRY ON DRUG PRACTICES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 2 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission began an investigation today into whether pharmacists should be allowed to substitute lesscostly drugs when the substitutes are the same as brand name drugs prescribed by a physician.

title: Soybean Futures Down by 20c Limit
description: Prices of soybeans plunged the daily limit of 20 cents a bushel yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, and floor traders described the market as demoralized. November beans ended at $6 a bushel, off the 20cent limit.

title: Market Place
description: Two researchers at the University of Chicago are offering new hope to those who believe that the stock market offers the investor his best chance to beat inflation.

title: In Memoriam
description: ACKIRONJoan. This is your Birthday, May your slumber be bless'd my darling Joanto.

title: BOEING PROFITS UP 35.5% IN QUARTER
description: The Boeing Company, a leading producer of commercial and military aircraft, reported yesterday profit increases of 35.5 percent for the second quarter and 10.9 for the first half.

title: Bridge:
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 2 The outstanding performers in the first three days of the American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals here have been Peter and Nancy Weichsel of New York.

title: 17 U.S. Urban Areas Troubled By Midsummer Racial Violence
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 2In the last several weeks some of the country's larger metropolitan areas have experienced outbreaks of racial conflict and violence.

title: Cleanup of New YorkNew Jersey Harbor Beginning
description: A $60.5million program to clean up the Port of New York and new Jersey was started yesterday with the removal of the first bit of debris in a 1,500square mile area that contains 2,200 rotting ship hulks and 100 rundown piers.

title: Poor Little Rich Children? Study Shows They Often Are
description: CONCORD, Mass.Robert Coles, the child psychiatrist who has written extensively about the children of the poor and working class, has completed a study on the children of the rich and upper middle class in which he records their developing a class and money consciousness, a sense of entitlement he calls mindboggling and their struggles with the moral ambiguities of their wealth.

title: Chess :
description: BIEL, Switzerland, Aug. 2 (AP)Robert Huebner of West Germany jumped into first place of the interzonal tournament here today with 10:5 points as he drew with Efim Geller of the Soviet Union to move half a point ahead of Denmark's Bent Larsen in the 16th round of the 19round tournament.

title: Today's Entries at Saratoga
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Israelis Stepping Up Patrols in Lebanon
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 2Israel is moving vigorously to exploit the power vacuum in southern Lebanon and prevent Palestinian forces from reasserting control over the area just north of the Israeli border.

title: Urban League Finds 25.4% Of Blacks Are Still Jobless
description: BOSTON, Aug. 2Although the nation's economy has shown signs of improving, black unemployment remains at the same high level of 25.4 percent reached during the peak of the 197475 recession, a report by the National Urban League said today.

title: Findings Are Hailed
description: Thomas S. Nurnberger, A.T.&T. executive vice president, said yesterday that he was gratified that Judge Kraushaar found our overall level of interstate revenues reasonable and the rates and charges for message telecommunications service reasonable and just.

title: LONGLINES RATES OF A.T.&T. UPHELD
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2  A Federal Communications Commission administrative law judge ruled today thai the American Telephone and Telegraph Company's longdistance telephone rates were reasonable in relation to its rate of return.

title: Events Today
description: Films

title: Notes on People
description: Brig. Gen. Dan Shomron, leader of the raid on Entebbe Airport in Uganda, is being given a larger command and promoted to higher rank in the Israeli Army, Tel Aviv sources said yesterday. In a Paratroop Day speech to his troops Sunday, General Shomron said he would be leaving them soon.

title: Yanks Top Tigers, 10, On Alexander 2Hitter
description: Doyle Alexander pitched his routine near nohitter last night, but there was one thing about this one that wasn't true about a couple of the others. He won it.

title: Fireman on Leave Leads 16 to Safety In Atlantic City Fire.
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 2A, New York City fireman was instrumental today in the rescue of 16 persons as an earlymorns ing fire swept through the sixth floor of the Howard Johnson. Regency Motor Lodge.

title: IRVING W. COHEN
description: Irving W. Cohen, a garment industry executive, died yesterday at the Teaneck, N.J., home of his daughter, Joan Barran He was 75 years old and lived at 200 East 71st Street.

title: Deaths
description: ALLISONNancy Jacksonon July 31., 1:76, at her home in New Canaan, Conn. Wife of Braden Allison. Mother of Thome, Seward and lorworth. Sister of Owens Manses., don Atreridge, Norma Boin, ann Winifred Oberreit. Memorial Euchaiest, Wednesday Au, gust 4, 8 P.M.. at St. Mark's Church, New Canaan. Memorial gifts to St. Alark's instead of flowers.

title: Tourist Influx Is Expected
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 2Though reactions are mixed and the full returns are still to come in, authorities interviewed here are generally agreed that the Games of the 21st Olympiad have been an economic and a sporting success for Montreal.

title: Stassen to Campaign At G.O.P. Convention
description: WASHINGTON, 2 (UPI)Conceding that it would take a near miracle to win, Harold E. Stassen announced today that he would campaign for the Republican Presidential nomination at the national convention starting in two weeks.

title: The Lingering Aroma of Olympus
description: Six of the 11 championships had been won in Olympic boxing before the judges began to perform like Olympic boxing judges. Then an earnest Venezuelan named Pedro J. Gamarro whipped Germany's Jochen Bachfeld, who was promptly elected welterweight champion by voters from Mongolia, Yugoslavia and Iran. This happened last Saturday night, so the air in Montreal's Forum has had two days to clear, but the rich, ripe aroma of that decision will probably linger until Les Canadiens are back in the joint playing hockey. Also lingering, no doubt, are the echoes stirred by about 17,000 witnesses, who reacted as though the judges had kicked Guy Lafleur's mother. Bachfeld is a blameless 23yearold from the town of Suite and all he did was get punched around, but the chances are there hasn't been a more unpopular fighter in the Forum since Dave Schultz last showed there with the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: ARCO and Union Oil Accept Indonesian Plan
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 2 (AP)The Atlantic Richfield Company and the Union Oil Company of California have accepted an Indonesian Government productionsharing proposal of a split of 85 to 15 percent in favor of Indonesia, the stateowned oil company announced today.

title: Richard Archbold Dies at 69; Explored New Guineas by Plane
description: Richard Archbold, who organized, led and sponsored expeditions to New Guinea, where he used flying boats to reach remote areas before World War II, died Sunday at the age o 69 at the Archbold Research Station in Lake Placid, Fla. The station, where he had resided for many years, and the expeditions were among his contributions to the American Museum of Natural History.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Ilie Nastase is losing a tennis match to Roscoe Tanner. Annoyed at the turn of events and at an official's call against him, Nastase turns his back on the tournament referee, calls him an obscene name, walks off the court and sits in the stands, his feet on the railing, refusing to continue to play. The crowd becomes restless. Play tennis! someone yells.

title: Mars Chemistry Still Puzzles Scientists
description: Viking Project scientists, still puzzled by the apparent abundance of oxygen and chemical activity in the soil of Mars, said yesterday that their current working hypothesis was that some unique and rare photochemistry might be operating on Mars to cause the reactions we are seeing.

title: Court Backs E.P.A. on Air Quality Slash
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (UPI) A threejudge appeals court today unanimously upheld Environmental Protection Agency regulations permitting some deterioration of air quality in growing communities.

title: U.S. Family Welfare Rolls Increased 0.3% in March
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (AP)  The nation's family welfare rolls rose threetenths of 1 percent in March as more joblessfathers signed up for public assistance, the Government reported today.

title: City Hall Basks in Summer Calm As Frenetic Fiscal Pace Eases
description: At his post at the front door of City Hall, Police Officer Robert Budion, casual in plaid mufti, asks where are the loose hingesthe eccentric visitorsof summers past.

title: Badillo and Velez Trade Heated Charges in Race
description: Representative Herman Badillo and his opponent in the Democratic primary for the South Bronx Congressional seat, City Councilman Ramon Velez, traded angry charges yesterday in what is becoming the roughest campaign of the primary season.

title: Fritz Lang Dies at 85
description: Fritz Lang, the Vienneseborn film director best known for M, a classic study of a child killer, and Metropolis, a vision of a futuristic Big Brother society, died yesterday in Los Angeles at 85. Details, page 32.

title: F.B.I. BreakIn Inquiry Is Said to Widen
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2The Department of Justice has drastically widened its investigation of allegations that agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation burglarized the homes and offices of militant political !figures during the last five years, F.B.I. and department sources said today.

title: Monroe J. Rathbone Dies at 76; Former Exxon. Chief Executive
description: Monroe Jackson Rathbone, retired board chairman and chief executive officer of the Exxon Corporation and one of the most important figures in the history of the oil industry, died yesterday at General Hospital in Baton Rouge, La. He was 76 years old.

title: Crucial Meeting Due Tomorrow On Bills to Reorganize Courts
description: ALBANY, Aug. 2The special legislative session on court reorganization is still scheduled for Wednesday at noon, but it will be late tomorrow night before anyone mows for sure whether the session has even a remote chance of being productive.

title: Heavy Miami Rain Causes Many to Be Late for Work
description: MIAMI, Aug. 2 (AP)Thousands of Miami commuters needed up to two extra hours to get to work today after a heavy rain teamed with storm drain construction to flood streets and bring rushhour traffic to a halt.

title: Catholic Antihunger Fight Dramatized
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 2The emergence of world hunger as a top Roman Catholic priority was dramatized today at the first full day of the 41st Eucharistic Congress when Mother Teresa, the celebrated missionary to Calcutta's poor, said a prayer over a table of loaves of round bread and then broke one to share with others.

title: Motorcyclist Skids and Dies
description: CORBIN CITY, N.J., Aug. 2 (AP)Dwight D. Hosler, 22 years old, died yesterday when the motorcycle he was riding crashed into a car here on Route 70, the state police said. Mr. Hosler, of Corbin City, was riding in the rain when his motorcycle skidded broadside into a car driven by Mary Trakimis of Philadelphia.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold prices Monday.

title: Open Interest
description: Monday, August 2, 1976

title: Dollar Declines Abroad; Rumors on Mark Denied
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 2 (UPI)The United States dollar hit a threemonth low in Frankfurt today as it declined in trading abroad, and persistent upward pressure on the West German mark brought considerable intervention by central banks to support the weaker European currencies.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TWO BY TWO Two former Hollywood names, Denise Darcel and Bobby Breen, are the newest bookings at See Saw, the uptown club at 1201 Lexington Avenue (at 81st Street). The French entertainer, who has turned to vocalizing in recent years, is known for such postwar movies as Westward the Women and Vera Cruz, having made her bow as the only woman in Battleground, a war drama familiar to Late Show viewers. She is singing tomorrow through Saturday at 10:30 P.M. and 12:30 A.M.

title: Carter Picks a Bostonian To Run New York Race
description: A Boston lawyer and former campaign aide to Senators Robert F. and Edward M. Kennedy was named yesterday to direct Jimmy Carter's Presidential campaign in New York.

title: 16 in Jersey Fire Aided By New York Fireman
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug, 2A New York City fireman was instrumental today in the rescue of 16 persons as an earlymorning fire swept through the sixth floor of the Howard Johnson Regency Motor Lodge.

title: Pledge to U.N. Is Completed
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 2 (Reuters)The United States today handed over a check for $16.9 million to complete its pledge of $26.7 million in contributions for 1976 to the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees.

title: BANKS SEE 11% RISE IN FOREIGN LENDING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 United States banks estimate that their foreign tending will increase about $11 billion, or 11 percent, this year compared with an increase of $15 billion last year, the Treasury reported today.

title: Last Call for Court Reform
description: The special session of the State Legislature, called by Governor Carey in the midst of normal summer doldrums, must make a start at restructuring the court system if the neglected judicial branch is to attain coequal rank with the state's executive and legislative branches. Without effective action now, New York will continue to lag behind more than half the states in the reform and modernization of their judicial structure.

title: Yonkers Results
description: (OTB payoffs subject to 5% state tax). FIRST$9,000, pace, mile.

title: TIES OF AFRICANS TO U.S. STRESSED
description: BOSTON, Aug. 2  Stating that American realization of Africa's importance to foreign affairs had not come easily but grew out of painful experience, Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger promised a pre dominantly black audience tonight that the United States will pursue our new Africa policy with conviction and dedication.

title: Settlement Made In Robertson Suit
description: The final settlement between the National Basketball Association and the National Basketball Players' Association of the Oscar Robertson lawsuit received approval yesterday from Federal Judge Robert L. Carter.

title: DEFECTOR ABDUCTED, SOVIET AIDE CHARGES
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 2A Soviet Olympic official charged today that Sergei Nemtsanov, the 17yearold Soviet platform diver who apparently defected to Canada last Thursday, had been abducted and brainwashed by provocateurs.

title: Kennedy Center Bill Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (UPI) The House approved today a $3.3 million authorization bill to repair leaks in the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing

title: Japan Charges an ExExecutive With Passing Funds to Tanaka
description: TOKYO, Aug. 2 (Reuters)The Tokyo Public Prosecutor's Office today formally charged; Hiro Hiyama, former board chairman of the Marubeni Corporation, with having channeled illegal payments from the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation to former Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka.

title: Assembly Fails to Wrap Up Tax Package
description: TRENTON, Aug. 2Stating that they wanted to dramatize the fact that legislative sessions almost never begin on time, 28 Republicans and two Democrats delayed the start of today's Assembly session for more than an hour.

title: Information Available On Those at Flood Site
description: LOVELAND, Colo. Aug. 3 (UPI)The authorities said today that persons wishing news of relatives or friends possibly involved in the Big Thompson River flood could call an engineering concern operating twoway radios in the disaster area.

title: Inquiries Into Grain Find New Data on Gratuities
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 Federal investigators, pressing their inquiries into corruption in the grain industry on all coasts and in many inland areas, have found new evidence of illegal payments to inspectors and possible shortweighting of shipments, according to separate statements by the Agriculture and Justice Departments.

title: Market Place
description: Although businessmen seldom welcome added reporting duties, the resentment over the new Securities and Exchange Commission rule requiring large companies to estimate the impact of inflation on their business appears to be unusually strong.

title: Monmouth Entries
description: OCEANPORT, N.J.

title: Advertising
description: Lawyers, having settled most of the world's other problems, are quietly infiltrating the advertising agency business.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Aug. 3 (UPI)  Britain's economy has reached a turning point and the future looks a lot brighter, a group of Oxford economists said today. They have completed a study that concentrates on intermediate term prospects affecting private enterprise.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Two Congressmen Win Michigan Races
description: DETROIT, Aug. 3  Representaitve Donadl W. Riegle Jr. of Flint won the Democratic nomination tonight to run for the Senate seat in Michigan that is being vacated by Senator Philip Hart, who is retiring.

title: Seaway Sailors Back Pact
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 3 (UPI)The Seafarers International Union announced today ratification of a new twoyear agreement covering 5,000 seamen working on vessels along the Great LakesSt. Lawrence Seaway system. The union president, Roman Gralewicz, said the membership voted 93 percent in favor of the pact, the largest acceptance vote in the union's history.

title: U.S. Citizen Tells of His Ordeal In Yugoslavia as Accused Spy
description: THORNTON, Colo., Aug. 3Laszlo Toth says he is a nonspy who has come in from the cold.

title: COURT DEADLOCK BROKEN IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Wednesday, August 4The leaders, of the Legislature, meeting for more than four hours with Governor Carey, broke a partisan impasse this morning and agreed to call their members to Albany later today to enact a package of amendments to reorganize the state courts.

title: Strike Shuts Thai Airport
description: BANGKOK, Thailand Aug. 3 (AP)All flights at Bangkok were canceled today because of a strike by about 4,500 employees of Thailand's two national flag carriers, Thai International Airlines and Thai Airways.

title: Previn to Write and Star In Music Series for PBS
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 3 (AP)  Andre Previn, the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra's new music director, will write and star in a series of eight programs to be produced by WQEDTV, the Public Broadcasting System station here.

title: For Tots: Zip On, Zip Off
description: What do you get when you cross a children's wear designer with a playground architect? Why, unusual children's play clothes, of course.

title: House Unit Moves to Activate Swine Flu Vaccination Plans
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (AP) Concerned that a type of influenza might have caused the deaths of a score of persons in Pennsylvania, a House health subcommittee voted late today to break an impasse over legal liability coverage for President Ford's massive swine flu vaccine program.

title: 20 FLULIKE DEATHS IN PENNSYLVANIA, 115 ILL, A MISTERY
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 3The death toll from an explosive outbreak of a mysterious flulike disease in Pennsylvania rose to 20 today as teams of Federal and state epidemiologists intensified their search to identify the cause of the illnesses.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The president of the Policemen's Benevolent Association of New Jersey said he would expel more than 2,000 Bergen County police officers if they joined the teamsters union. Members of the Bergen County Police Department are expected to receive their union charter and 12 police departments are expected to join soon afterward, according to union officials.

title: Public Trust
description: Representative Robert L. F. Sikes of Florida got away with much too mild a penalty for the profitable conflicts of interest that have marked his tenure in Congress, but his case may well have served a useful purpose. While the House was prepared to give him no more than a reprimand, it is finally showing signs of overcoming its long resistance to the idea of compelling Federal officeholders, including its own members, to make full disclosure of their financial holdings and outside income.

title: F.B.I. Told to Release Informer Files
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation was ordered by a judge yesterday to release all its files on six alleged F.B.I. informers who were identified by the Socialist Workers Party.

title: HOSPITALS STRUCK AS PICKETS FORM; UNION DEFIES WRIT
description: Municipal hospitals were struck this morning as leaders of 18,000 workers defied a restraining order obtained by New York City.

title: Missouri Senate Nominee Dies In Crash Alter Upset Victory
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 3Representative Jerry Litton, who won the Democratic nomination for the seat of retiring Senator Stuart Symington in today's primary, was killed tonight in a plane crash.

title: Wilson Out of Public Sight But Still in G.O.P. Politics
description: ALBANY, Aug. 3The gavel banged down smartly at 1:25 this afternoon, and a voice proclaimed, in the deep tones and preCise diction familiar to Albany for more than three decades: The Senate will please be in order.

title: LOCKHEED PROFIT TAKES 24.2% DROP
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation yesterday reported earnings declines of 24.2 percent in the second quarter and 10.1 percent in the first half this year. It attributed them to substantial writeoffs and costs related to the air bus, the TristerL1011.

title: A L.I. Policeman Who Sought Psychiatric Aid Is Suspended
description: EAST HAMPTON, Li., Aug. 3In his first year as a policeman, Alex Wasilewski turned in a superior officer for stealing and was chosen as the valedictorian of his class at the Suffolk County Police Academy.

title: Notes on People
description: Finland should not be pitied because of its imagined economic dependence on the Soviet Union, President Urho Kekkonen said in Washington yesterday. Paying a Bicentennial visit, Mr. Kekkonen was welcomed at the White House by President Ford and Secretary of State, Henry A. Kissinger along with Foreign Minister Kalev Sorsa.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: UNDIMMED Gilbert and Sullivan fans will welcome back tonight the Light Opera of Manhattan company's productions of The Pirates of Penzance, to be followed by two more G & S works, as the eightyearold troupe revives the most popular Savoyard works in its repertory. Sunday, the company closed its hit reprise of Romberg's The Student Prince.

title: Families of the Victims Tell Similar Stories
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 3For Charles Seidel, an 82yearold veteran of World War I, the American Legion's state convention here two weeks ago was a chance to share his military memories with those who would appreciate them, to march once more behind the flagand, perhaps most important, to get away from his little house in Reading, Pa.

title: ITALIANS WRANGLE OVER POISON ISSUE
description: ROME, Aug. 3The political wrangling that Italians have come to expect in every national crisis burst into the open today as officials of the towns in northern Italy contaminated by a cloud of poison accused officials at the regional level of making decisions without consulting them.

title: Wilfrid Smith, ExAthlete And Chicago Sports Editor
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 3 (AP)Wilfred Smith, former sports editor of The Chicago Tribune, died today after a long illness. He was 77 years old.

title: TEENAGE RUNAWAYS PLAY TO FANTASIES
description: The Runaways, who made their New York debut on Monday at CBGB, the rock club on the Bowery, arc five 16yearold girls from California who play crude, basic rock. Their producer, Kim Fowley, seems to have helped them design their act and shape their material with the idea of appealing to the fantasies of male rock fans and rock critics, and on these terms he has succeeded. At CBGB, only the women looked less than enthralled.

title: Ford Seeking to Require Report of Payouts Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 President Ford asked Congress today for new legislation that would require reporting by United States businesses of all substantial payments made in foreign countries designed to aid sales to foreign governments, whether proper or improper.

title: Thinking About the Germans: II
description: NEW HAVENIn 1967, Alexander and Margarete Mitscherlich, two distinguished German psychoanalysts, published The Inability to Mourn, an appraisal of the Germans' failure to master their past. And critics, in West Germany as elsewhere, have pointed to war criminals, unprosecuted, now even in influential positions, as signs that German expiation is incomplete.

title: NursingHomeHead Indicted for Fraud Of Kind He Decried
description: A nursinghome operator who testified last year as a wouldbe reformer of the industry was indicted yesterday for allegedly engaging in the same practices he had denounced.

title: From Bellevue, a Strange Exodus
description: In the main lobby of Bellevue Hospital last night, lined up beside the lush schefflera plants, on tile floors facing broad giass windows, a row of patienis on stretchers, intravenousfeeding bottles dangling overhead, lay on their backs and waited lor the ambulances that would take them to other hospitals.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3If the car's engine has a chronic wheeze or the auto dealer will not honor the manufacturer's warranty, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has some advicefree of charge.

title: U.S. Team Off for Everest
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, Aug. 3 (Reuters)  Members of an American expedition left here today for an attempt to scale Mount Everest. The team will walk in the monsoon season over trails at lower altitudes to reach Everest and get into position for an attempt on its summit before the cold winds of late October and November.

title: FORD ASKS REPORT ON PAYING ABROAD
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 President Ford asked Congress today for new legislation that would require reporting by United States businesses of all substantial payments made in foreign countries designed to aid sales to foreign governments, whether proper or improper.

title: DAVID R. GEORGE. 63; NEWSDAY OFFICIAL
description: David R. George, former director of public relations for Newsday, died yesterday at St. Francis Hospital in Roslyn, L. I., after a long illness. He was 63 years old.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES CLOSE WITH A GAIN
description: After their recent sharp de cline, soybean prices posed a question yesterday when they closed higher. November beans, which had dropped the daily 20cent limit the previous day, regained 12 cents to end at $6.12 a bushel. On Monday the close was $6.

title: Revolution Derailed
description: For a long time the military leaders in Peru who overthrew an elected government in 1968 seemed to be something new under the South American sun. They had seized power not to buttress the country's traditional oligarchy but to destroy its economic power. They set out to gain control over Peru's resources and basic industries from foreignmostly Americanowners and to build a cooperative, socialist society.

title: Teacher Is Guilty of Assault
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y., Aug. 3A former sixthgrade teacher charged with imprisoning and severely beating a 16yearold boy last February pleaded guilty yesterday to a charge of seconddegree assault.

title: Senate Overrides Veto
description: The Senate voted, 75 to 18, to override President Ford's veto of a bill increasing the states' share of royalties from private development of coal and other minerals on Federal land to 50 percent from 37.5 percent. The House is to vote on the bill today. Page 34.

title: End of City Layoffs Is Still in Doubt, Beame Aide Says
description: Stephen Berger, executive director of the Emergency Financial Control Board, said yesterday that it was too early to tell if New York City's latest round of budget cuts designed to control the city's $12.6 billion budget could be accomplished without more layoffs.

title: Key CarterArtis Case Witness Refuses to Testify and Vanishes
description: A principal witness in the Rubin (Hurricane) Carter murder case has refused to testify again and has disappeared, the Passaic County, N. J. prosecutor's office said yesterday.

title: La Peche a Ile d' Anticosti
description: This is the second and last installment of a report on salmon fishing on Anticosti Island begun here some days ago by one who feloniously and temporarily deserted his post at the Olympics. On the second day on Riviere  la Loutre (Otter River), Paul Boulet, the guide, drove to Black Pool where the stream rushes under a leaning cedar tree on the far bank, sweeps on past a skimmed log caught in brush, then flattens out to curl left into shallow rapids. Facing downstream, the angler has the fast water and the log on his right. On the left a rock shelf drops off abruptly, and far below in of the dark depths, grass can be seen moving gently. Leaving camp, Pierre d'Auteuil of Montreal, riding with the drivers, grunted and pointed. The fisherman and fisherperson in the rear seat watched a doe racing ahead of the pickup truck. For about 50 yards she went flat out along the dirt road, then veered into the forest, taking the timber jump like a bird.

title: Strike Against Recovery
description: A temporary restraining order, issued yesterday by State Supreme Court Justice George Postel, offers municipal hospital workers and their leaders a chance to draw back from selfdefeating follya threatened strike that menaces not only the city's sick but the survival and recovery of the sick city.

title: Yonkers Raceway Results
description: (OTB payoffs subject to 5% state tax).

title: S.E.C. Says 4 Rigged Bond Transactions
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission charged the former head of the Fidelity Union Trust Company's investment department and three others yesterday with rigging a series of fictitious bond transactions to cover up $3.3 million worth of losses in the Newark bank's municipal bond por??folio.

title: Archie...Archie Andrews, wherever are you running off to now? Oh, gee. Just to the drugstore to see Jughead.
description: MILWAUKEE TO BE a woman whose teenage years were in the 1950's is a privilege. Many writers call my generation the lost generation, the generation that was afraid to speak up, the backward age. I disagree. I definitely feel that the term best depicting the period I grew up in is happy days.

title: STATE DEPT. REPORTS ON BLACKS ON STAFF
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (UPI) The State Depart ment, in seeking to defend itself and Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger against charges of racial discrimination, produced statistics today showing that most of its black employees were in lowerpaying nonprofessional jobs.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Johnnie Ray Gets Standing Ovation
description: LONDON, Aug. 3 (AP)Johnnie Ray returned to sing at the Palladium here last night after 18 years, and a nostalgic packed house gave him a 15minute standing ovation.

title: Campaign Group Named To Aid Democratic Races
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (UPI) Robert S. Strauss, the Democratic national chairman, named a 43member national campaign steering committee today with 21 women members, including the wives of the party's standardbearers.

title: Soviet Weekly Accuses the C.I.A. of Plot
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 3 (AP)A Soviet publication accused they United States Central Intelligence Agency today of having) tried to recruit a Soviet diplomat in New York and then of threatening his life when he declined to cooperate.

title: Tonight's Entries at Yonkers
description: Horses listed in order of Post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Why the City Ended A Nuisance Tax On Designer Fees
description: Although the prospects for repealing taxes in this financially beleaguered city are about as likely as a rollback in transit fares, the City Council voted unanimously late last month to get rid of one levya tax on interior design and decoration services. Mayor Beame signed the bill Monday.

title: Peru Regime Imperiled By Economic Misfortune
description: LIMA, Peru, July 29  The Peruvian Government, which came to power eight years ago as a revolutionary experiment, appears to he coming apart at the scams. The problem, as so often happens in Latin America, is money.

title: Jets, in Search for Punter, Test Todd, Rookie Passer
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 3 The Jets' long search for a new punter took a bizarre turn today when it focused on none other than Richard Toddthe rookie quarterback who is eventually to become Joe Namath's replacement.

title: Bergen County Acts to Improve Welfare Management
description: HACKENSACK, Aug. 3New safeguards against fraud, and other improvements in welfare management in Bergen County, were announced today by the county's Board of Chosen Freeholders and the Welfare Board.

title: WINE TALK
description: On July 14, the space was given over to some remarks on the labeling of American wines and the current discussions between the wine industry and the Federal Government on the subject. The column suggested in part, that we should not call jug wines burgundy or Chablis, that we should not call our sparkling wine champagne, and that it should not be possible for a vintner to put the designation cabernet sauvignon on a bottle that contains 49 percent of something else.

title: DELAY ON AIR BAG DRAWS NADER IRE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3Secretary of Transportation Wil liam T. Coleman Jr.'s oneday marathon hearing on whether to require air bags on automobiles provoked a sharp verbal; clash today between the Secretary and Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate.

title: Education Board Chief
description: Harold M. Jacobs remembers well the five years he spent working days as a salesman of women's laces, collars and cuffs to put himself through night courses to get his degree at St. John's University. He chose to work his way throuhg college even though his father, a prosperous manufacturer, could easily have sent him.

title: Dresden Captures Title For Large Pony Hunters
description: AUGUSTA, N. J.. Aug. 3The Sussex County Horse Show, one of the leading events on the Eastern outdoor circuit, has moved just down the road to new headquarters here.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Aug. 3State officials said today that the size of a fish kill from a slowmoving mass of dead algal material off the New Jersey shore, while impossible to estimate in number, was significant.

title: Troubles Beset State Council on Arts; Chairman Says She WillNot Resign
description: An official at the State Council on the Arts said yesterday that the agency was behind schedule in processing hundreds of applications for grants from arts groups around the state.

title: Kopp Is Named Leo Burnett Chief
description: There are few agency jobs as important as chief executive of the Leo Burnett Company, especially in Chicago. And yesterday C. R. Jack Kopp, 55yearold president took over that job at the home of the Jolly Green Giant and the Marlboro Man the country's thirdlargest agency, which ranks fourth worldwide among American agencies. He has also been named chairman of the executive committee.

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: 100th of Career Blasts Turns Back Expos
description: Ed Kranepool's 100th career home run transformed another Met debacle into a 98 victory over the Montreal Expos at Shea Stadium last night.

title: The Mass Consists of 1 and 1 and 1 and 1 and...
description: As Viking I brings us details of the soil on Mars, and the press is filled with new details about the human brain, we realize our tremendous indebtedness to instrumentationto the telescope, the microscope, the computer that can delicately pick a landing spot on another planet.

title: Teamster Official in Newburgh Is Indicted on Extortion Charge
description: Theodore G. Daley, the top official of a teamsters' union; local based in Newburgh, N.Y., was indicted in Manhattan yesterday on Federal charges of extortion for allegedly obtaining free construction materials and free trucking services from teamster employers.

title: THAILAND AND LAOS TO REOPEN BORDER
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug. 3 (Reuters)Thailand and Laos agreed today to reopen their common border and Thai prisoners held in Laos are to be freed.

title: FreeAgent Rule Fails to Hurt N.F.L.
description: The returns are in on the 24 players of the National Football League who became free agents last May 1 and had the opportunity in an open market to join whichever team pleased them the most. These returns failed by quite a margin to substantiate the contention of the N.F.L. owners, and commissioner Pete Rozelle, that pro football must have a reserve system or all the best players will want to perform for rich owners, such as Lamar Hunt of Kansas City, Clint Murchison of Dallas, or play in sophisticated cities like New York and Los Angeles, where they can moonlight profitably and in the case of Los Angeles, possibly enjoy the climate.

title: Dollar a Bit Firmer In Europe's Markets
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 3 (UPI)The dollar recovered a bit on most European money markets today as upward pressure on the West German mark and downward pressure on the French franc eased.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Franklin Kolk, Helped Develop Many American Airlines Planes
description: Franklin W. Kolk, vice president of technological engineering for American Airlines, died yesterday in a restaurant in Manhattan. He was 57 years old.

title: About Real Estate
description: The world that Victor Barouh wants to conquer is small and well defined. The boundaries are Kent Avenue, Wythe Avenue, North 9th Street and North 10th Street in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn.

title: Dean Witter Is Planning Own Market in Odd Lots
description: Dean Witter & Company, one of the nation's largest brokerage concerns, announced yesterday that it would shortly ybegin making its own markets in odd lots, or orders involving fewer than 100 shares, of all New York Stock Exchange issues.

title: Payout in Slump Had Been 60c
description: DETROIT, Aug. 3  The General Motors Corporation, which earned a record $909 million in the AprilJune period, restored the quarterly dividend of 85 cents a share, which had been cut to 60 cents during last year's auto slump.

title: Unisex Softball Team Is Called Way Off Base
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 3 Westport's allstar teenage softball team has Ivan the Connecticut state championship in the little League's girls' softball program and has touched off a controversyall because 10 of the 14 Westport players are boys.

title: Reagan and Schweiker to Open Tour To Attract Conservatives and Liberals
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 3The new campaign team of Ronald Reagan and Richard S. I Schweiker takes to the road for the first time tomorrow in Mississippi as the former California Governor tries to sell his liberal running mate from Pennsylvania to conservatives of the Deep South.

title: Senate Turns Back Two Moves To Weaken CleanAir Measure,
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 3 (UPI)  The Senate rejected today two efforts to weaken legislation designed to insure high standards for clean air.

title: Democratic Rivals for Senate in Joint Appearance
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Aug. 3In their first joint speaking appearance of the campaign, five candidates for the Democratic nomination for the Senate gently vied with each other in attempts to show how their records and positions differed.

title: U.S., WEST GERMANY REACH TANK ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 3The United States and West Germany have agreed to work toward a common gun and engine in their new main battle tanks, Pentagon officials said today.

title: Wilson Out of Pubic Sight But Still in G.O.P. Politics
description: ALBANY, Aug. 3The gavel banged down smartly at 1:25 this afternoon, and a voice proclaimed, in the deep tones and precise diction familiar to Albany for more than three decades: The Senate will please be in order.

title: A Chicken Liver Pat
description: THE BAKERY LANE SOUP BOWL COOKBOOK.By Marge Mitchell and Joan Sedgwick. 129 Pages. Bakery Lane Soup Bowl, Middlebury, Vt. $6.50.

title: Dance: Nikolais Troupe Opens at Beacon Theater
description: While dance is part of theater, it is not true that theater is always dance. To Alwin Nikolais, theater has always come first.

title: West German Jailed as Spy
description: DUSSELDORF, West Germany, Aug. 3 (Reuters)  Ulrich Reeps, a 47yearold psychologist. was sentenced to two years and nine months in jail today for spying for East Germany. Judge Clemens Amel unken said that Mr. Reeps, who worked in the African department of the Konrad Adenauer Foundation of the opposition Christian Democratic Party, gave reports on his Africa journeys to East Germany.

title: Indian Agency May Expire
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (UPI) The Indian Claims Commission, created 30 years ago to last 10 years, would finally die next April if a bill passed by the House today is approved by the Senate and signed by the President. The House voted, 374 to 13, for the measure after adopting, on a 270to122 vote, an amendment to let the commission die as scheduled on April 10, 1977.

title: Foe of Marcos Says He Won't Take Part In His Military Trial
description: MANILA, Aug. 3 (AP)Benigno S. Aquino, once the main political oppopent of President Ferdinand E. Marcos, refused today to participate in his trial on charges of subversion, murder and illegal possession of weapons.

title: Belts by White, Gamble Top Tiger Ace
description: The swallows never create as much fuss at Capistrano as The Bird does wherever he goes. But the Yankees, with one touch of psychological warfare and two doses of home runs, grounded The Bird last night.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: In Memoriam
description: CAMPBELLHarriet Yates. In cherished memory of a very loving and devoted wife and mother. You are always In our thoughts and hearts. Stewart, Bruce, Roberta, Phyllis, Duncan, Russell 8 Diane.

title: HOSPITAL STRIKE IS SET FOR TODAY: UNION DEFIES WRIT
description: Leaders of 18,000 workers in municipal hospitals said yesterday that they would defy a restraining order obtained by New York City and go ahead with the walkout set for this morning.

title: New Bond Issues
description: UTILITIES

title: Morton, in Shift, Concedes Nomination Is Still Open
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3President Ford's campaign chairman, Rogers C. B. Morton, conceded today that neither Mr. Ford nor Ronald Reagan would he able to lock up the Republican Presidential nomination before the party's national convention.

title: Urban League Calls for Panel To Fight Discrimination in Jobs
description: BOSTON, Aug. 3The National Urban League recommended today the establishment of a broadbased, blueribbon panel that would find ways to enforce antidiscrimination laws more effectively in government and in private industry.

title: Drive Against Injustice Proposed for Catholics
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 3 (UPI) Speakers at a symposium on The Hunger for Freedom and Justice told the 41st International Eucharistic Congress tnday that love, and not nationalism, must he the motive for Roman Catholics to deal with injustice in the world.

title: People in Sports
description: I'm back, I'm practicing, but I still haven't signed, said Fred Biletnikoff, Oakland's veteran wide receiver, after he reported to the Raiders training camp late yesterday. He did not play in Saturday night's Oakland victory over the Dallas Cowboys, and reportedly told Coach John Madden before the game that he did not intend to play.

title: Lili Kraus Has Vigor, Conviction, Confidence
description: Next to talent, the greatest gift nature can bestow on an artist is conviction. Lili Kraus, for one, oozes conviction when she performs Mozart, as she did Monday night at the Mostly Mozart Festival in Lincoln Center's Alice Tully Hall. In the face of such confidence, which Miss Kraus has built up through many years of hard thought and hard work, even one who might prefer another Mozart style to hers could only sit in admiration.

title: CABLE TV REBUKED ON HIRING PRACTICES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (AP) The Federal Communications Commission conceded today that its rules had failed to produce a positive impact on minoritygroup employment in cable television. It proposed changes designed to achieve better results.

title: Senate Approves Tax Benefits For EnergyConserving Efforts
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3The Senate approved tonight 19 separate provisions of the pending tax bill, each granting a new tax benefit to businesses and individuals that are taking steps that are said to conserve energy.

title: Voters in '73 Poll Favored Election for Chief Judge
description: An unpublished survey shows that nearly threequarters of those who voted in the last election for Chief Judge of the State Court of Appeals favored the current election process for that jobthe system that the Legislature meets today to change.

title: Young and Old Are Making a Pitch for Horseshoes in Philadelphia Suburb
description: BRISTOL, Pa., Aug. 3In the American pattern of upward mobility, horseshoe pitching does not have the cachet, say, of tennis, golf, skiing or yachting. But there is a band of more than 500 dedicated people here who are cheerfully working to elevate the status of the game.

title: Monday's Fight
description: PEABODY, MassTony Lopes, 146 pounds, Brockton, Mass., and Gerald Bouchard, 153, Montreal, 10 rounds, drew.

title: PRESS IS UNEASY IN SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 3The South African press, hemmed in by a web of legal restraints on what it can publish, faces new anxieties following the detention of four journalists by the security police last week.

title: TUCKER BAND ADDS NOVEL ROCK TOUCH
description: When the Marshall Tucker Band from Spartanburg, S.C., began playing at the Schaefer Festival on Monday, some fans in one corner of the packed Wollman Rink hoisted a homemade banner calling it the tiniest band in the land. The point is debatable, but it does indicate the devotion of the group's following.

title: Players Critical of Forest Hills
description: Forest Hills is one of the most unpopular tournaments among the world players.

title: Food Prices in City Drop Slightly
description: A drop in retail meat prices brought down the cost of the city's 41item market basket by 43 cents, or 0.6 percent, during the week ended last Friday.

title: About New York
description: Heads down, legs pumping furiously, the intrepid bicyclists of the Can Carriers Messenger Service help to keep the heart of the nation's commercial capital throbbing.

title: UP JOHN DISCLOSES ADDED PAYMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3The Upjohn Company, expanding on an earlier report of questionable foreign payments, said it paid $4.1 million over five years to obtain business valued at about $46.8 million, according to a registration statement filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission made available today.

title: Radio
description: 6:059 A.M., WNCN, Sonatina in D, Schubert; The Egyptian Helen: Awakening Scene, Strauss; Overture No. 2, Arne; Harpsichord Sonata in C minor, Soler; Le Jugement de Midas Overture, Gretry; String Trio No. 1, Schubert; Coriolanus Overture, Beethoven; Concerto in B minor, Vivaldi; Concerto Grosso No. 4, Scarlatti; Overture to La Cenerentola, Rossini; Trumpet Concerto in B flat, Handel.

title: Deaths
description: Beckhard, Julius

title: Alcoholism Controversy
description: Recently published reports by a group of Rand Corporation researchers suggest that such moderate indulgence may be without danger in some cases. They emphasize, however, that there is no way of distinguishing in advance between former alcoholics who can drink safely and others for whom any resumption of drinking is the beginning of serious relapse.

title: Belgian Economy to Slow
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 3 (Reuters) Economic activity in Belgium can be expected to level off and growth of production to slow in coming months, the Economic Affairs Ministry said today in its latest monthly assessment.

title: Today's Entries at Saratoga
description: Horses osted order of post cosiliens Letter designates OTB Island

title: Salvino Bowling Victor
description: DAVENPORT, Iowa, Aug. 3 (AP) Carmen Salvino won the 15th title of his Professional Bowlers Association career tonight when he captured the $60,000 Quad Cities Home Box Office open. Salvino, of Chicago, defeated Larry Laub of San Francisco, 210192, in the title game to earn $6,000.

title: F.L. REDEFER DIES; N.Y.U. PROFESSOP
description: Frederick L. Redefer, a retired professor of education at New York University, died Monday at his home in New Milford, Conn. He was 71 years old.

title: S.E.C. Says 4 Rigged Bond Transactions
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission charged the former head of the Fidelity Union Trust Company's investment department and three others yesterday with rigging a series of fictitious bond transactions to cover up $3.3 million worth of losses in the Newark bank's municipal bond portfolio.

title: New Test for Food Stamps Approved by House Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (UPI) The House Agriculture Committee approved today a new assets test that experts said would deny aid to some families who now qualify for the Government's food stamp program.

title: Carter, in New Hampshire, Promises To Seek to Restore Respect for Family
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., Aug. 3 Jimmy Carter made sweeping promises today to act as President in ways that would restore respect for the family system, which he said had been degraded and weakened in the United States.

title: Violation of Berlin Pact Is Charged by Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 3 (Reuters) The Soviet Union today told the United States, Britain and France that participation by West Berlin in elections to the European Parliament would violate the 1971 fourpower agreement on the city.

title: Alexandria Gets U.S. Garbage Trucks
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, Aug, 1In ancient times themonarch Ptolemy Soter gave this fabled port a lighthouse that was one of the wonders of the world.

title: Are We or Is Our StrategyMAD?
description: PARISA gloomy stir has been created in NATO Europe by the University of Miami's publication of a book called War Survival in Soviet Strategy, by Prof. Leon Goure. The Russianborn Goure emigrated to the United States in 1940, eventually becoming an adviser on civil defense to the United States Government.

title: About Education
description: The growing complexities of big government are helping give birth to a new academic discipline, the graduate study of the planning and analyzing of public policy.

title: FLOOD DEATH TOLL NOW ALMOST 100
description: LOVELAND, Colo., Aug. 3 (AP)The death toll in the Big Thompsnn River flood neared 100 today, as the authorities, continued to pull bodies from the rubble and the muck.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 4, 1976

title: Supreme Court Is Not Supreme in New York
description: Is the highest court in New York State the Court of Appeals or the Supreme Court?

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Red Cross brought 99 wounded civilians, the first of more than a thousand, from the besieged Palestinian camp at Tell Zaatar to Moslemcontrolled west Beirut, touching off an explosion of joy. The evacuees told of a water shortage for a month and no medicine except salt. The ceasefire to bring the convoy across the lines did not extend to other fronts in Beirut and the mountains. [Page 1, Columns 12.]

title: Mystery on Mars
description: Unmanned space exploration has never had the popular allure of dramatic manned flights. In the two weeks since Viking I landed on Mars, however, the journey of a sophisticated but inanimate apparatus has suddenly come alive with unexpected mystery.

title: Park Foremen Given Fiscal Autonomy
description: A joint labormanagement pilot program to let the general foremen of three selected park districtsrather than the New York City Parks Departmentmake major management and budget decisions began yesterday.

title: Senate Overrides Veto
description: The Senate voted, 75 to 18, to override President Ford's veto of a bill increasing the states' share of royalties from private development of coal and other minerals on Federal land to 50 percent from 37.5 percent. The House is to vote on the bill today. Page 34.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: THIRD CONFERENCE ON LAW OF THE SEA: Committee on seabed regime and machinery10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: U.S. Arms Taiwan To Resist an Attack
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3The Ford Administration is carrying out an arms sales program intended to put Taiwan in a position to defend itself, without United States participation, against an attack from the mainland.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, Aug. 3, 1976

title: Signs of Tougher Line by Amin Increasing Concern for Britons
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 3Concern for British subjects in Uganda heightened today, with reports from Kampala indicating that President Idi Amin was taking a tougher line since Britain's break in diplomatic relations last week.

title: Tintoretto Works Returned to Italy
description: ROME, Aug. 3 (AP)Two valuable paintings attributed to Venetian Renaissance painter Tintoretto and exported clandestinely to Japan have been recovered and returned to Italy, authorities announced today.

title: 2 FIRMS WILL FORM INVESTMENT GROUP
description: Goldman, Sachs & Company announced yesterday that it had approved a proposal of Kleinwort Benson Ltd., a London merchant bank, to organize jointly an independent investment management company.

title: State Officials View 100Acre Meadowlands Tract as a Possible Park
description: LITTLE FERRY, Aug. 3Two state officials toured by canoe and on foot today a 100acre tract in the heart of the Hackensack Meadowlands and pronounced the area a worthy candidate for a state park.

title: People and Business
description: Stanley E. Shirk, awaiting hearings before a reluctant Senate Banking Committee on his nomination as Comptroller of the Currency, called on Senator William Proxmire yesterday to schedule hearings to allow Mr. Shirk to have a chance to answer charges of potential conflict of interest raised by his long career as a banking specialist with an accounting firm. Mr. Shirk said in a letter to Senator Proxmire that he was certain his responses will be more than adequate to answer the questions to everyone's satisfaction.

title: Peddlers Bitter; Stores Are, Too
description: New York City may appear to be a peddler's paradise. But neither the executives who operate the city's big stores, with their huge rental and competitive burdens, nor the itinerant merchants who sell their wares on the city's streets are happy with the situation.

title: ROCKEFELLER FUND LISTS 1975 GRANTS
description: The Rockefeller Brothers Fund made contributions totaling $9.8 million to a wide range of institutions in 1975, according to the fund's annual report released today.

title: Court, in Reversal, Gives T.V.A. Right To Go on With Dam
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Aug. 3 The Tennessee Valley Authority was granted approval today to continue construction on the $116 million Tellico Dam by the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit.

title: Red Cross Starts Removing Wounded in Beirut Camp
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 3Ninetynine wounded civilians, the first of more than a thousand, were brought out of the besieged Tell Zaatar Palestinian camp today by the International Committee of the Red Cross.

title: Elderly Ederle Fan Meets Heroine
description: It took Mildred Cook 50 years to meet her childhood heroine, but yesterday, her face streaming with tears, she finally shook hands with Gertrude Ederle, the first woman to swim the English Channel.

title: U.S. Arming Taiwan Against an Attack
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3The Ford Administration is carrying out an arms sales program intended to put Taiwan in a position to defend itself, without United States participation, against an attack from the mainland.

title: Bridge:
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 3Four New York experts, each playing with an outoftown partner, were in strong positions going into the final session of the life master pair championships at the American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals here tonight.

title: Grenade Kills 4 in Burma
description: RANGOON, Burma, Aug. 3 Reuters)Guerrillas killed four persons and injured 67 in a grenade attack on Rangoon's central railway station, an official announcement said today.

title: Jenner, Still in the Clouds, Weighs TV, Movie Offers
description: Everyone has been asking Bruce Jenner, who is now called the best athlete in the world because of the gold medal he won in the Olympic decathlon, what he is going to do now. So yesterday he held a news conference at a public relations company here and said he didn't know what he would do yet.

title: Philharmonic Graces Central Park
description: Central Park's Sheep Meadow had treetotree people last night, as it usually does when the New York Philharmonic comes to call. Balloons and streamers added to the festive mood, and the Weather Man was at his most cooperative as the Philharmonic opened its twelfth season of free park concerts before crowd estimated by the police to be well over 100.000.

title: Dow Posts 8.07 Gain to Close at 990.33
description: Strength in some blue chip issues combined with bargain hunting enabled the stock market yesterday to post its best gain in about three weeks.

title: Rockefeller to Aid Stafford
description: WOODSTOCK, Vt., Aug. 3 (AP)Vice President Rockefeller will visit Vermont later this month in an effort to help the reelection campaign of United States Senator Robert T. Stafford, Republican of Vermont, aides said today. Mr. Rockefeller and his wife will be host and hostess at a reception for Mr. Stafford on Aug. 28 in Woodstock.

title: Peru Regime Imperiled By Economic Misfortune
description: LIMA, Peru. July 29  The Peruvian Government, which came to power eight years ago as a revolutionary experiment, appears to be coming apart at the seams. The problem, as so often happens in Latin America, is money.

title: SENATE OVERRIDES VETO ON COAL FEES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (AP) The Senate voted today to override President Ford's veto of a bill increasing the states) share of royalties from private development of coal and other minerals on Federal land.

title: Girl, 17, Restores Plane
description: HARVARD, Ill. (AP)Working every night and weekends for about two years, Susan Dacy, a 17yearold high school senior, has restored a Stearman biplane, a type of craft last built in 1943. Miss Dacy has flown 10 hours in the Stearman out of her 135 solo hours as a pilot.

title: Girl, 9, Alive in Plane Wreck
description: SILESIA, Mont., Aug. 3 (AP) After 26 hours pinned in the wreckage of a small plane, a 9yearold girl was found alive yesterday beside the bodies of her parents and the 75yearold pilot. Rescuers said the girl, Angie Loos of Cody, Wyo., was fully conscious and coherent. The singleengine plane, piloted by Roy Shreck of Cody, crashed on Sunday. Also aboard were Donald Loos, 46, his wife Dorothy, 37, and Angie.

title: NEW MOVE TO OUST HAYS IS DEFEATED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3An attempt to unseat Representative Wayne L. Hays as chairman of a House subcommittee failed today when committee Democrats voted overwhelmingly to keep him in the post.

title: U.S. Starts Arts Program in the Schools
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3The arts would begin to be assimilated into the regular public school curriculum for the first time under a program announced here yesterday by the Federal Office of Education.

title: Morton, in Shift, Concedes Nomination Is Still Open
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3President Ford's campaign chairman, Rogers C. B. Morton, conceded today that neither Mr. Ford nor Ronald Reagan would he able to lock up the Republican Presidential nomination before the party's national convention.

title: HARRISES' JUDGE ASSAILED BY TWO
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 3As jury deliberations went into the fourth day in the trial of William and Emily Harris, two former prospective jurors, whose honesty had been questioned by the presiding judge, said today that their experience in disclosing possible bias by a sitting juror had left them appalled and humiliated.

title: Teenage Kansas Girl is Missing After Her Father is Found Slain
description: HARIS, Kan., Aug. 3 (AP)A natioinwide alert was issued tonight for a 16yearold girl whose father was found shot to death in his bed after she called her sister and said she had been kidnapped and was being held at gunpoint.

title: CEAUSESCU MEETS BREZHNEV IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 3 (AP)Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist Party leader, received the Rumanian President and party leader, Nicolae Ceausescu, at a Crimean retreat today. The meeting was seen as a conciliatory gesture between Moscow and Bucharest, long at odds on aspects of domestic and foreign policy.

title: Club Golf Pros Also Share in $4 Million Prizes
description: While a small number of the touring professionals have become wealthy playing in those glamorous weekly tournaments of the Professional Golfers' Association, their P.G.A. colleagues in the club shops earn a of good living selling equipment and teaching the hackers. And there is quite an opportunity these days for a club pro to supplement his income by playing the local P.G.A. circuits.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Paul Silvergleid, whose fouryear chairmanship of the Connecticut State Gaming Commission has been marked by controversy, announced yesterday that he would resign as of Sept. 1. The ninemember agency voted unanimously to have another commissioner, Beatrice Kowalski of Wallingford, to succeed him. Mr. Silvergleid denied that he had been forced out of his post and asserted: It's really very simple. I'm tired. I want to relax, play golf and be left in peace. The commissioners are paid $10,000 a year. The chairman earns $12,500.

title: Monmouth Results
description: OCEANPORT, N.J. By The Associated Press

title: FreshVegetables: How to Enhance Them
description: A garden is a lovesome thing, God wot! Thomas Edward Brown (18301897)

title: LONDON METAL MARKET
description: (In pounds sterling per metric ton)

title: HERMAN'S HERD BACK IN THUNDERING FORM
description: For more than 30 years, Woody Herman's band has been known as the Herman Herd. More recently it has become the Thundering Herd and the current version, playing at the Bottom Line through tonight, has expanded the title to the Young Thundering Herd.

title: Ashe, in Slump, Is Beaten by Yugoslav
description: NORTH CONWAY, N.H., Aug. 3 (AP)Slumping Arthur Ashe, who has not reached the quarterfinals of a tennis tournament since May, was beaten by Zeljko Franulovic of Yugoslavia, 64 64, in the second round of the $100,000 Volvo international today.

title: Tuesday's Major League Baseball Box Scores and Standings
description: LGBOakland 8, Chicago 6 :??BRudi 2, North, Lemon, Teppre. Bando, Dent 3BGarr. SBNorth, Bando, Garr. S.Campaneris. SFJ.Spencer.

title: Studebaker Move To Add Turbodyne Opposed by Holder
description: StudebakerWorthington Inc., said yesterday that a share, holder of Turhodyne an 83 percentowned subsidiary, had filed suit in the New York State Supreme Court challenging a merger proposal to make Turbodyne a wholly owned subsidiary. Under the proposal, Turbodyne's public shareholders would receive $19.50 a share. The plaintiff, who was not named, called the price grossly inadequate and said that the proposed merger involved an unlawful attempt to freeze out the public shareholders. The plaintiff claims to be suing on behalf of the public shareholders and has named StudebakerWorthington, Turbodyne, and Turbodyne's directors as defendants

title: Knick Hopes of Getting Barnes Hinge on Hawks' Pick in Draft
description: What are the Atlanta Hawks going to do?

title: Ali Extends Reach to Sheets
description: Bride's magazine was there. So were House Beautiful, House & Garden, Good Housekeeping and Harper's Bazaar, and there was not a shred of doubt in anybody's mind (including Ali's) that the most beautiful object in the room was Muhammad Ali.

title: Election Agency Recommends Rules on Financing Campaigns
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (UPI) The Federal Election Commission asked Congress today to approve a set of regulations) governing all major areas of the Election Reform Act. The regulations will automatically take effect if Congress does not veto any of them within 30 legislative days.

title: TV: Home Life of 6 Families to Be Seen Nationally
description: Six American Families, a cycle of documentaries purporting to represent a microcosm of home life in the United States, will be presented nationally next year on a combination of commercial and pub lic television stations.

title: Lawyer in Muslim Murder Trial Asks End of NoDiscussion Rule
description: A lawyer for Lewis 17X Dupree, who is on trial for the 1972 slaying of a police officer in a Black Muslim mosque in Harlem, asked a State Supreme Court Justice yesterday to vacate his order prohibiting lawyers from discussing the case with the press.

title: Pauline Chotzinoff, 73, Widow Of Critic and Sister of Heifetz
description: Pauline Chotzinoff, sister of ??ascha Heifctz and widow of Samuel Chotzinoff, the pianist and critic who was music director of the National Broadcasting Company, died yester day of cancer at her home, at 171 West 57th Street. She was 73 years old.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: A SKID IS HINTED IN TRAIN ACCIDENT
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Aug. 3The crowded rush  hour commuter train that crashed here last month may have entered an oilsoaked stretch of track at an improperly high speed and then gone into a skid when the engineer jammed on the brakes and attempted to make an emergency stop.

title: Panel in House Votes Honor for Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (UPI)  The House Armed Services Committee voted today. 15 to 6, to bestow posthumously on George Washington the highest rank ever held by a United States military officer.

title: Golf Results at Nearby Areas
description: AT BRIAR HALL C.C.

title: Germans: Socialist Victory
description: EAST BERLIN, Aug. 3As East Germany's athletes returned home from their spectacular triumphs at the Olympics in Montreal, the country's Communist leaders were celebrating the triumphs as a victory for socialism.

title: McCarthy Petitions Filed
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Aug. 3 (UPI)Supporters of Eugene J. McCarthy, former Minnesota Senator and 1968 antiwar Democratic candidate for the Presidential nomination, filed petitions yesterday to put him on the Nov. 2 ballot as an independent Presidential aspirant. Officials at the State Board of Elections said that Mr. McCarthy's nominating papers appeared to contain well over the 25,000 signatures required of minorparty candidates, whose filing period ended yesterday.

title: Braves Defeat Padres, 73, On 2 Homers by Gaston
description: Andy Messersmith is a household word to followers of major league baseball. But how many fans can identify Clarence Edwin Gaston?

title: 20 FLULIKE DEATHS IN PENNSYLVANIA, 115 ILL, A MYSTERY
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 3The death toll from an explosive outbreak of a mysterious flulike disease in Pennsylvania rose to 20 today as teams of Federal and state epidemiologists intensified their search to identify the cause of the illnesses.

title: PROFIT OUTLOOK: UP 2530% IN 1976
description: Corporate profits, after a solid secondquarter advance, will rise 25 to 30 percent this year over the 1975 level, Citibank economists forecast.

title: Hog Transporting Banned
description: BOSTON, Aug. 3 (AP)An order banning the transporting of all hogs in Massachusetts took effect at noon today, a result of the reappearance of hog cholera.

title: Yesterday's Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: French Offer to Help Italy End Economic Difficulties
description: PARIS, Aug. 3 (Reuters)France has offered to help Italy pull itself out of its current economic difficulties, a spokesman for President Valery Giscard d'Estaing said today.

title: McRae Is Leading dh
description: Hal McRae of Kansas City continued to lead designated hitters with a .353 average through Monday night's games, the American League announced yesterday. McRae, hitting .349 overall this season, has 77 hits in 218 times at bat as a designated hitter. Second was Rico Carty of Cleveland, at .321, and third Craig Cusick of Minnesota, at .305.

title: Stewart Airport Is Trying Its Wings as Auction Site
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y. Aug. 3  Seventyfive thousand dollars for the lot, sang the auctioneer. Sixtyfive thousand starts the lot. Sixtyfive, sixtyfive, sixtyfive, sixtylive, sixty  five thousand. Sixty five  five, sixty  fivefive, sixtyfivefive, sixtyfiveeight, sixtyfiveeightcome, come, gentlemen! sixtyeight bid, sixtyeightfive, sixtyeightfive, sixtyeightfive. Sold to order.

title: Zany New Dinnerware Watches as Eater Eats
description: Dansk is rephrasing that byword of the Bauhaus, Less is more. Less, the design company says, is enough.

title: State Election Board Examining Peyser Petitions for Senate Bid
description: ALBANY, Aug. 3The State Board of Elections began a linebyline examination of the 27,602 petitions filed by Representative Peter A. Peyser, the Westchester County Republican who is trying to get on the ballot for the G.O.P. senatorial nomination in the Sept. 19 primary election.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Tuesday.

title: PROSECUTION URGES JAIL FOR 15 IN SEOUL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 3 (AP)The prosecution asked prison terms of up to 10 years today for Kim Dae Jung and 14 other dissidents charged with having plotted to overthrow President Park Chung Hee. Defense lawyers walked out of the court in protest at the way the trial was being conducted.

title: Red Cross Starts Removing Wounded in Beirut Camp
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 3Ninetynine wounded civilians, the first of more than a thousand, were brought out of the besieged Tell Zaatar Palestinian camp today by the International Committee of the Red Cross.

title: BYRNE CRITICIZES F. C.C. NEWS PLAN
description: TRENTON, Aug. 3 (UPI)Governor Byrne today criticized the Federal Government's recommendation that one news crew and one correspondent be assigned to New Jersey by each television network affiliate in New York and Philadelphia.

title: HOWARD WOOD, 59, ST. LOUIS PUBLISHER
description: Howard B. Woods, newspaperman and a leader of the St. Louis black community, died Monday, apparently of a heart attack, while attending a National Urban League convention in Boston lie was 59 years old.

title: GAS IN MARS SOIL VIRTUALLY STOPS
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 3 (AP)Viking scientists said today that the unexplained generation of gas in a Martian soil sample had virtually stopped and that they tended to think it had not been caused by living organisms.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Sony Corporation of America and the Paramount Pictures Corporation announced yesterday the formation of the SonyParamount Home Entertainment Center.

title: Books of The Times
