description: The only way to get to Stony Creek, N.Y., is by car and it's a long trip, at least four hours from Times Square. Take the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway Interchange 24 at Albany and go north on the Adirondack Northway (Interstate 87). At Exit 23, just north of Lake George, go west to Warrensburg on Route 418, then on County Routes 2 and 3 to the four corners of Stony Creek.

title: Copyright for 1976
description: The contending forceslibrarians, educators, public broadcasters and publishers and authorsare finally compromising their differences and the first major revision of the 1909 copyright law seems possible this year. The Senate has already approved its version; now the House Judiciary Committee ought to pass the measure before the Republican convention begins. Otherwise, the archaic law could become ensnared in party politics.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Off
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5The ??? of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States, railtoads during the latest week totaled an estimated 14.7 billion, tonmiles, 0.8 percent below the same week a year ago. The decline resulted from work stoppages in many of the nation's coal mines. Carloadings in the same period totaled 449.246 cars, 2.3 percent below last year. The American Trucking Assbeiations reported intercity truck tonnage was 6.9 percent above last year.

title: Tickets and Program
description: The Theater Dance Collection will offer the following program this weekend at the Clark Center Festival (City University Graduate Center Mall, West 42d Street):

title: Open City Leads OldFilm Series
description: A program of movie classics featuring two films daily for the next few weeks will begin Sunday at the Quad Cinema 3 with Open City and Under the Roofs of Paris.

title: Catering to the Inner Olympian
description: When the triumphs and abrasions of the Montreal Olympics are forgotten, the picture that will stay longest in memory is that of a muscular character who has just eaten up a storm pausing on his way out of the mess hall in Olympic Village to stuff a shoulder bag with apples, pears, bananas, oranges, grapes, plums, apricots, figs and peaches. As many as 14 athletes might be stacked like cord wood in a single room of the 19story apartment buildings; rigid security measures were a constantthough admittedly necessarysource of irritation; politicians were always gkting in the way competition kids had striven toward for four years. There was one area, and one only, where it was almost possible to believe Baron Pierre de Coubertin that the Olympic movement tends to bring together in a radiant union all the qualities which guide mankind to perfection. That was the carpeted pasture, about the size of three football fields, where Roger Gagnon supervised the preparation and serving of 36,000 meals a day to healthy young animals from a hundred ethnic backgrounds.

title: ESTATE TAX RELIEF VOTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5The Senate approved tonight some changes in the estate tax laws that would reduce the tax owes by almost all estates and pro vide some special tax relief to those who inherit farm prop erty.

title: Weekend Gardening
description: Inflation has not left the flower garden unscathed. Delphiniums, those regal midsummer favorites, often sell for $2 a plant these days. The same is true for Astilbe, sedums and even rudbeckia, the common black  eyed Susan of our summer meadows. Yet, if grown from seed. these same plants can be had for pennies each.

title: Vagrants and Panhandlers Appearing in New Haunts
description: The Bowery scene has spread. In the late hours vagrants now can be found singly and in twos and threes in the triangles on Broadway from Herald Square to 72d Street, along the southern edge of Central Park, in the side streets off Times Square, around the fountained plats of the Avenue of the Americas, along Lexington Avenue above 42d Street, in the small parks of the Lower East Side and in Trinity Place.

title: Ford to Get a Science Aide And 4 New Advisory Units
description: A major overhaul of the apparatus for determining national policy in science and technology at the highest level is to take place after the expected Senate confirmation today of Dr. H. Guyford Stever as director of the new Office of Science and Technology Policy.

title: 15c Dividend Is Declared By Chrysler
description: DETROIT. Aug. 5  The Chrysler Corporation's board of directors today declared a quarterly dividend of 15 cents a share and company officials said the action showed that the company expected to continue its comeback from record 1975 losses.

title: CourtAppointed Lawyer Is Charged With Shaking: Down Indigent Client
description: A New York City criminal lawyer was arrested yesterday outside a Manhattan Criminal Court on charges of shaking down an indigent defendant for $1,000.

title: RIVALRY VIEWED IN BRONX BREAKIN
description: The police said yesterday that members of the city's laygest electricians union might have been involved in Wednesday night's breakin at a Bronx eqummentrepair garage where six men systematically destroyed $100,000 worth of electrical equipment installed by a rival union.

title: American Priest Arrested At. Seminary in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 5An American Roman Catholic priest has been arrested in Crdoba Province, in central Argentina, (apparently for political reasons, according to the United States Embassy here.

title: More NursingHome Ties To DayCare Units Found
description: Investigators who are unraveling a network of ownerships of daycare centers in New York City have found a growing list of names that appeared in similar studies of the nursinghome industry.

title: Vagrants and Panhandlers Appearing in New Haunts
description: The Bowery scene has spread. In the late hours vagrants now can be found singly and in twos and threes in the triangles on Broadway from Herald Square to 72d Street, along the southern edge of Central Park, in the side streets off Times Square, around the fountained plazas of the Avenue of the Americas, along Lexington Avenue above 42d Street, in the small parks of the Lower East Side and in Trinity Place.

title: Broadway
description: MARIA SCHELL will make her debut on Broadway next season in Poor Murderer, a play by Pavel Kohout, which will be produced here by Kermit and John Bloomgarden and Ken Marsolais. They have been negotiating with Miss Schell for the last month, and now it has been agreed that the celebrated Austrian actress will be with Poor Murderer when it goes into rehearsal Sept. 20 and opens at the Ethel Barrymore on Oct. 24. Miss Schell has been on many European stages, although she is best known here for movies, among them The Brothers Karamazov, The Hanging Tree and The Mark.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Federal Departmen of Labor announced yesterday that it intended to begin proceedings to bar Uniroyal, one of the biggest tire and rubber concerns, from holding existing or future Federal contracts on the ground that the company had failed to provide equal employment opportunities for female and minority works. The action was brought under an Executive order that banned employment discrimination by Federal contractors.

title: Rejoining the Slovak Community
description: EAST HAMPTON, N.Y.I was walking into my past and it scared me, mostly because I don't often acknowledge that I have a past.

title: Lag in Mississippi
description: JACKSON, Miss., Aug. 5The ReaganSchweiker team made little apparent headway yesterday in its visit here to try to reassure conservative delegates to the Republican National Convention.

title: General Dynamics Profit Up by 12.4% to a Record
description: The General Dynamics Corporation, the diversified aerospace producer, reported yesterday a record secondquarter profit with an increase of 12.4 percent, Halfyear earnings also reached a new highreflecting the increased business in its varied fields, such as shipbuilding, space, electronics and natural resources.

title: BILL TO IMPROVE U.S AIR QUALITY VOTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5The Senate approved today, 78 to 13, an omnibus bill revising and broadening the Clean Air Act of 1970, which established an ambitious Federalstate effort to improve the quality of the country's air.

title: Summerell Is AWOL From Giants' Camp
description: The Giants conceded yesterday that Carl Summerell, their young quarterback who performed well in his first start last Sunday, had left the club without permission.

title: DuffyMott ExPresident Is Indicted by U. S. Jury
description: Donald M. Klock, former president of the DuffyMott Company, was indicted yesterday on charges of fraudulently obtaining $400,000 from the company and failing to report it on his income tax returns.

title: Conquering a Phobia That Makes Healthy Women Stay Home
description: At little more than a year ago, Irene Fields was afraid to ??? her house in port Washington, L.I. Sfie couldn't go to the beach, because it was so oper, and crossing it made me feel like I was standing on top of the Empire State Building, ready to fall. She couldn't go shopping, she couldn't plant a garden, she couldn't play Bingo with her women friends.

title: Indian Mounds Searched for Hints on How to Help Urban Centers Survive
description: COLLINSVILLE, Ill.  In an area cluttered by gasoline stations, discount stores and fast food restaurants, the dominant feature on the landscape here is an ancient manmade mound of earth that rises over 100 feet from its massive base of 14 acres.

title: Chips Fly at Loggers Meet
description: Lumberjacks from all over New York State will gather Sunday in the tiny north woods community of Stony Creek, N.Y., to compete in various events, including cutting through a log in the briefest possible time.

title: Goldin Cuts Off Rent Payments To Nine More DayCare Centers
description: City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin said yesterday that he had stopped monthly lease payments by the city to landlords of nine more directlease daycare centers on the grounds of unsatisfactory building conditions and failure to fulfill lease specifications.

title: Moscow Fire Destroys Australian Chancellery
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 5 (Reutrs) Fire today destroyed the chancellery offices of the Australian Embassy here and damaged part of the Ambassador's residence, an embassy spokesman said.

title: Spolis Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Events and Openings
description: GUS, a Walt Disney Production directed by Vincent McEveety, at neighborhood theaters.

title: Brewers, Rain Top Yankees
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 5It rained today at County Stadium. On and off, like the tap on a beer keg at the local pub. The lights were turned on early, though they hardly penetrated the gloom hovering beneath the lowhanging clouds and fog.

title: CowboysRams Bears Watching
description: National television coverage of the Dallas CowboysLos Angeles Rams game from Los Angeles tomorrow night (Channel 2 in New York 10 o'clock) highlights the National Football About League's weekend schedule of Pro 14 exhibition Football games. This is the second of six weekends of preseason play for the 28 teams before the start of the regular campaign on Sept. 12.

title: Take the B Train to Nostalgia St.
description: Until recently, weekend sightseers have been able to explore New York City by land, sea and airby bus, boat and helicopter. But only recently, when the Transit Authority began its Nostalgia Special, has there been a subterranean excursion into a subway museum, through the depths of three boroughs and over the waters of Jamaica Bay.

title: Teamster Aide Resigning After Refusal to Testify
description: One of the most Powerful trustees of the largest pension fund of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters is resigning after taking the Fifth Amendment before Labor Department investigators, wellplaced sources said yesterday.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A man who the police said once kept a diary of his crimesincluding 30 muggings in five monthswas sentenced in State Supreme Court in the Bronx yesterday to at least eight years and four months in prison. Justice Fred W. Eggert Jr. sentenced Alexander B. Jackson, 21 years old; a Bronx resident, for firstdegree robbery in a holdup that netted him 45 cents.

title: Scientist Says Iron in Martian Soil Would Turn an Earth Desert Red
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 5About 14 percent of the atoms in the red Martian soil being studied by the Viking I lander's inorganic chemistry instrument are iron, a scientist announced here today.

title: People and Business
description: Henry Kaufman, general partner of Salomon Brothers, declared yesterday that the current economic recovery in the United States had a long way to go before it began to wane. The recovery, he told a meeting of the School for Bank Administration at the University of Wisconsin, Madison, Wis., will not terminate in 1978 as some have concluded.

title: Federal Disease Center Studies Victims Tissues
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 5As they have every day since Sunday, couriers arrived in Atlanta today carrying icepacked samples of human tissues, clues to the mysterious outbreak of illness in Pennsylvania that has tilled 23 persons so far.

title: TEST TRAIN SKIDS ON GREASED RAILS
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Aug. 5Brake tests along the greasecovered stretch of track here where a crowded commuter train crashed on July 13 produced 34 skids in 10 tries, the factfinding hearing here was told today.

title: U.S. Initials Reactor Pacts With Egypt and Israelis
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (Reuters)The United States has initialed agreements with Israel and Egypt to provide each with two nuclear reactors, the State Department announced today.

title: Antiques
description: SINCE ANCIENT EGYPT, artists and craftsmen have accepted the challenges paper offered, and they have explored iteven exploited itas a medium of expression. But only since World War II have conservators seriously studied paper, intent on the complexities of restoring everything from Rembrandt drawings to baseball cards.

title: The Van Vooren Sound Is a Treat for the Eyes
description: Monique Van Vooren has come to the Rainbow Grill with an act that lacks for nothing in the way of slick surface qualities. She has four singers who go doowah, doowah behind her. Tile accompanying quintet also includes a tuba to provide an oompah beat when she flounces around in black feather boa.

title: WORLD OIL DEMAND GROWS, RENEWING OPEC'S STRENGTH
description: PARIS, Aug, 5The world is moving into a new phase of oilprice politics. Once again, as during the final months of 1973 when prices quadrupled, market power is shifting dramatically to the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries.

title: Unifying of Court System Presented Legislators With a Complicated Task
description: ALBANY, Aug. 5As a practical matter, New York State has two vastly different court systems, each with its own administrative practices, employee salary structures, priorities and work loads.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: Watching the Olympic Games last week, witnessing a succession of athletes straining to outperform one another, the 5  year  old turned from the television set to her father and asked, Why is there so much fuss over winning? Why can't they all just enjoy playing the games?

title: Four Mothers Charge BeechNut With  False Ads on Baby Food
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 5A class action suit was filed in Superior Court here today Charging the Baker/BeechNut Corporation, Canajoharie, N. Y., a manufacturer of commercial baby foods, with false adertising.

title: Philharmonic to End Park Finale With a Bank
description: When the New York Philharmonic comes to the end of its concert in Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx tomorrow night. there will be a fireworks display. This has become traditional with the first program in the orchestra's annual summer parks concerts, which opened this week. Normally, the fireworks coincide with the final pages of Tchaikovsky's 1812 Overture, but this year they are being set off to the last strains of Rossini's William Tell Overture.

title: Man Guilty in Boy's Death
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 5 (UPI) An admitted heroin addict faces sentencing for manslaughter in the beating death of a 5yearold boy who was the subject of a false kidnaping report last year. Frank Wasilowski, 29 years old, of Jersey City was convicted yesterday on charges of killing Stephen Freitas and dumping his body in a marsh near the New Jersey T???rnpike.

title: Nominee for Chief of Staff Vows To Protect Lawyers for Cadets
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (UPI) Gen. Bernard W. Rogers, President Ford's choice as Army Chief of Staff, promised Congress today that he would take appropriate action against any Army officers harassing the defense of West Point military cadets accused of violating the cadet honor code.

title: Beer Drivers End Strike
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 5 (UPI) Beer truck drivers who went on strike more than a month ago ratified contracts today with the Winner, Terminal and Schlitz distributing companies. Threeyear pacts were ratified shortly after settlements were reached this morning and afternoon. Under the new contract, drivers will be getting a halfcent to one cent more per case delivered.

title: For Children
description: TEATOWN LAKE RESERVATION, 306acre wildlife and conservation preserve, owned and operated by the Brooklyn Botanic Garden, includes forests, meadows, hemlock and laurel gloves, a scenic gorge, a 33acre lake, Yearround outdoor exhibits and nature education programs for youngsters, with picnicking near the lake. Reservation is one mile west of the Taconic Parkway on Spring Valley Road in Ossining, N.Y. Trails always oven. building open from 9 A.M. to 5 P.M. on Friday and Saturday (also Tuesday through Thursday); tree. (914) 7622912.

title: Report Says That U.S. Cannot Account For 2 Tons of Atomic Bomb Material
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Government nuclear facilities are unable to account for well over two tons of plutonium and uranium that could be fashioned into scores of atomic bombs, according to several Federal officials who have read, a classified report by the General Accounting Office.

title: When a Troupe Is a Dance Collection
description: We had all experienced being lowmanonthetotempole or someone else's tool, subject to the whims of a company, the dancerchoreographer Rodney Griffin said. None of us looked like Peter Martins or Suzanne Farrell. was short and rat and bald. Lynn Simonson's hair was the wrong color. We were disenchanted with everything, but we loved theater and dance.

title: HARRISES LAWYER HEARTENED BY JURY
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 5The chief defense lawyer for William and Emily Harris eaid today that, regardless of the verdict in the case, the jury had demonstrated by deliberating six days thus far that revolutionaries can be treated fairly by an American jury.

title: Koreans Exchange Fire Along the Truce Front
description: PANMUNJOM, Korea, Aug. 5 (UPI)South and North Korean soldiers exchanged gunfire today along the eastern sector of their 151mile truce front, No casualties were reported

title: Trunks packed, the G.O. P. is straining to get to Kansas City. Meanwhile, the drama unfolds:
description: Ford claims 1,145 delegates. Reagan says he would appoint Rockefeller Secretary of State, claims 1,150 delegates. The New York Times estimates 1,122 for Ford, 1,077 for Reagan, 60 uncommitted.

title: In Memoriam
description: FABRICANTEsther and Hyman. Cherished memories of our dearly beloved Mother and Father. You live in our hearts forever.

title: Art People
description: ALEXANDER CALDER is a lot of people's favorite American; and every one of those people will want to be around in October, when Calder will be in town for the opening of his retrospective exhibition at the Whitney Museum. Even to shake Calder by the hand is to think better of the world.

title: Beame Orders Cutback In Phone Equipment
description: Commissioners, agency executives and other city, officials were told yesterday they have to get along without that extra telephone at their conference table or, that shiny telephone console at their secretary's desk.

title: FRANKLIN SIMON, OTHER RETAILERS SAY IS FOR SALE
description: Franklin Simon, the 65store women's apparel specialty chain based in New York, is being offered for sale by its parent company, the City Stores Company, which has suffered continuing losses since 1972, authoritative trade sources indicated yesterday.

title: Ecumenical Group Cites Progress on Communion
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 5An ecumenical group of scholars and church leaders, citing the astonishing progress in efforts to agree on the nature of Lord's Supper, predicted todayl that a longawaited goal, the interfaith receiving of communion, might be achieved in the near future.

title: How to Get There
description: The R113 bus leaves from the Staten Island Ferry Terminal in St. George on the hour and halfhour. Ask the driver to let you off at Lighthouse Avenue, then walk up the hill. You may also take the train to New Dorp and then go by taxi (about $1.25) to the center.

title: Market Place
description: On Aug. 23, shares of Varo Inc., a Garland, Tex. electronics manufacturer, will be listed on the New York Stock Exchange while retaining its current listing on the American Stock Exchanee.

title: East German Border Guards Shoot and Kill an Italian
description: East German Border Guards Shoot and Kill an Italian

title: Alleged Auto Thief Finds a Helicopter Is Only Way to Fly
description: A car thief took four young companions on a wild joy ride through the reaches of Brooklyn's Marine Park yesterday afternoon, but discovered that a 967 Plymouth cannot outmaneuver a police helicopter.

title: Dance: A Nikolais Season For All Men and Women
description: THE Nikolais Dance Theater is having a very happy season at the Beacon Theater. Popcorn is sold in the lobby, the audience is obviously delighted with what it is seeing, the young company is dancing with special polish and Alwin Nikolais's new works, with carefully selected older pieces, make for some nicely balanced programs.

title: CORRECTION
description: In a statebystate listing of delegate preferences for the Republican Presidential nomination that appeared in The Times yesterday, South Dakota was inadvertently omitted. The tally there is nine delegates for President Ford and 11 for Ronald Reagan.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (UPI)Americans increased their debts significantly in June, but the expansion in consumer credit was not so large as in the previous month, the Federal Reserve Board said today. The nation's central bank said consumer credit rose $1.33 billion in June, somewhat lower than May's revised $1.47 billion. The May increase was the largest expansion in consumer debt since October 1973.

title: 'Coalition Stressed
description: In a contest where even a single delegate is important, Ronald Reagan picked up six delegates in New York and New Jersey yesterday in his first foray into the Northeast with his liberal Republican running mate, Senator Richard S. Schweiker.

title: Business Trends
description: PORT EDWARDS, Wis.The contrast startling. Last spring, the paper mill that straddles the Wisconsin River here hungered for customers; the giant paper machines operated on a reduced schedule; the pulpmaking department shut down altogether for a time, and 175 workers were laid off.

title: Big Board Plans Action as Amex Lifts Bars
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges took further steps toward dual listing of stocks.

title: BBC, Citing Restraint, Closing Office in India
description: LONDON, Aug. 5 (AP)The British Broadcasting Corporation announced today that with reluctance it was closing its office in New Delhi because of censorship, by the Indian Government.

title: Connors Advances In Volvo
description: NORTH CONWAY, N.H., (AP) Aug. 5Jimmy Connors, shrewdly mixing his shots, advanced to the quarterfinals of the $100,000 Volvo tennis tournament today with a 76, 60 victory over Argentina's Ricardo Cano.

title: Alleged Auto Thief Finds a Helicopter Is Only Way to Fly
description: A car thief took four young companicins on a wild joy ride through the reaches Of Brooklyn's Marine Park yesterday afternoon, but discovered that a 1967 Plymouth cannot out, maneuver a police helicopter.

title: 8 Professors at Post Reported Under Inquiry on False Credits
description: GREENVALE, L. I., Aug. 5 (AP)At least eight professors at Long Island University's C. W. Post. Center have been told they are under a university investigation of participating in a scheme that allegedly gave faculty members credit for courses they never took, sources close to the investigation have told The Associated Press.

title: CANADIANS REPORT SOVIET PLANE CRASH
description: HALIFAX, Nova Scotia, Aug. 5 (UPI)A longrange Soviet military plane apparently has crashed off. the, coast of Newfoundland, Canada's maritime command announced today.

title: Ballet:Canadians Unveil A Dated Monument
description: ALTHOUGH Rudi van Dantzig's ballet Monument for a Dead Boy has been seen many times in New York with various American companies, it was given for the first time locally Wednesday night by the National ballet of Canada at the Metronolitan Opera House.

title: Perennials of the Folk Blues Circuit
description: Sonny Terry and Brownie McGhee, who are performing at the Other End this weekend, practically invented the folk blues circuit in the 1950's. They are the hardiest perennials still playing in the city's folk clubs, and they have become so familiar that they are often taken for granted.

title: Big Ben Iialts Briefly; Chimes Need Repair
description: LONDON, Aug. 5 (Reuters) The clock in the tower above Parliament rattled, banged and stopped early today.

title: Boonton Station Reopeningas Shopping Mall
description: BOONTON, Aug. 5A lot of people were ready to let the 1904 Erie Lackawanna Railway station here be torn down and turned into a parking lot. Joseph Marcello was not. Through his efforts, it has been turned into an unusual shopping mall instead.

title: CORRECTION
description: In a statebystate listing of delegate preferences for the Republican Presidential nomination that appeared in The Times yesterday, South Dakota was inadvertently omitted. The tally there is nine delegates for President Ford and 11 for Ronald Reagan.

title: Knicks Draft Denton, Center, As Barnes Is Taken by Pistons
description: Disappointed at not having been able to get a power frontcourt man, the Knicks picked up Randy Denton, a 6  foot 10  inch center, in yesterday's dispersal draft of American Basketball Association players.

title: Issues in Hospital Strike
description: PARTICIPANTS: About 18,000 nonprofessional hospital workers, members of Local 420, American Federation State, County and Municipal Employees, are on strike against New York City's Health and Hospitals Corporation, which runs the 16 municipal hospitals. Most of the employees are nurses aides and dietary and janitorial workers.

title: ShangriLa on Staten Island
description: It is quiet, so quiet that each bird peep and insect chirp resounds in the silence. It is as remote as so many New Yorkers believe Staten Island to be. It is on a steep hill, where if you could see through the leafy trees, you would look south for a vista of Lower New York Harbor.

title: KneeJerk View Barred By Reagan and Schweiker
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., Aug. 5You know, Ronald Reagan told Richard S, Schweiker after the two men met in the living room of the Reagan home in California 12 days ago, I have a strange feeling that I'm looking at myself some years ago.

title: Hospital Pickets Tell Of Their Bitterness
description: James Parker has been a janitor at the Bronx Municipal Hospital for 21 years and is not really worried that he will be laid off. Audrey Thompson, on the other hand, has been a nurse's aide there for only a little more than two yearsand received word of her layoff last week.

title: Country Flourishes in City at Back Home Music Jamborees
description: August is a month in which many New Yorkers go to the country for their yearly ration of fresh air, exercise and privacy. But the country is also coming to New York this weekend, including several versions of country music not always available here.

title: David's Lemonade Helps Identify
description: Any executive who is contemplating, or has been through, a corporate identity program should enjoy a Corporate Identity Manual created by Fulton & Partners for the nonexistent David's Lemonade stand. Although it seems to he a delightful spoof, it is actually intended as an educational tool in the use of logotypes and marks.

title: Dollar Up Overseas; Gold Down
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 5 (UPI)The dollar scored a big gain in Paris today and closed higher on most other European money markets except in Milan. In Frankfurt, it dipped to a threemonth low and then rallied higher at the close.

title: Galleria Is Sold to Morgan Guaranty; Reduction of Apartment Prices Is Seen
description: The spectacular but largely unoccupied office and apartment skyscraper known as the Galleria. at 115 East 57th Street, has been purchased by the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company.

title: The Last Word In Restaurants From Canaday
description: THIS IS ITthe last roundup, a list of restaurants we will be going back to for our own pleasure after signing off, as of today, from a job we began in January 1974 with a review of Gino's as the quintes sential New York restaurant. Thirtyone months and 579 visits to 364 restaurants later (and four pounds lighter, since you ask), we are now free to go back to Gino's to see if we still feel that way about it.

title: 5 Presidential Candidates To Get $566,561 From U.S
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (UPI) The Federal Election Commission certified today $566,561.87 in matching funds for five Presidential candidates who con?? peted in the final round of spring primaries.

title: Walter L. Schlager Jr., 58, Who Led L.I.R.R., Dead
description: Walter L. Schlager Jr., former president and general manager of the Long Island Rail Road, died Wednesday of cancer at his home in Plandome, L. I. He was 58 years old.

title: President and Shah
description: The United States was not even out of Vietnam in May 1972 when Richard Nixon made an offhand, unpublicized and undebated decision that tied the nation almost as inextricably to Iran, Mr. Nixon ordered the Defense and State Departments to let Iran buy any American weapon it wanted short of nuclear warheads.

title: The Urban News
description: A recent report to The Times from Detroit throws a strange and interesting light on the evolution currently taking place in urban America. It portrays a new and optimistic spirit in Michigan's largest city. It is a spirit of racial and civic pride among black wage earners who have recently come to recognize that their city has become preponderantly black and that no matter how troubled it has been, or still is, it is theirs to revive.

title: U.S. Disturbed by Soviet Nuclear Tests
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 5The Ford Administration has undertaken an intelligence review to determine whether the Soviet Union violated the spirit of the new treaty on underground nuclear tests by detonating two devices last month that may each have exceeded the 150kiloton limit.

title: Some Peking Residents Returning to Their Homes
description: PEKING, Friday, Aug. 6As dusk fell last night in China's capital, a man and two boys were carrying parts of a bed across the road from a line of tent shelters toward an apartment block.

title: Communist Leader in Portugal Opens Attack on Socialist Plan
description: LISBON, Aug. 5 Alvaro Cunhal, the Portuguese Communist leader, said in Parliament today that the Socialist Government of Prime Minister Miirio Soares and its program do not correspond to the needs of the present situation.

title: Indian Mounds Searched for Hints on How to Help Urban Centers Survive
description: COLLLNSVILLE, Ill.In an area cluttered by gasoline stations, discount stores and fast food restaurants, the dominant feature on the landscape here is an ancient manmade mound of earth that rises over 100 feet from its massive base of 14 acres.

title: Cabby Nets Unexpected Tip
description: The taxi driver had had enough of Billie Jean King's backseat driving. Look, I don't teach you how to play tennis, he yelled at his passenger, so don't teach me how to drive a cab!

title: Mystery Disease Called Not Contagious
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 5The Federal eral government's chief epidemiologist told a Senate hearing today that the number of new cases of the mysterious flulike disease that has killed 23 persons in Pennsylvania was diminishing rapidly and that the ailment did not seem to be contagious.

title: Pop Life
description: REGGAE, the sinuously lilting Jamaican pop music that Bob Marley and the Wailers have been popularizing in the United States, is finally becoming a commercially viable presence in the metropolitan New York area after years of predictions that a reggae fad was just around the corner. Its progress has been painfully slow, and Island records, which has the Wailers, Toots and the. Maytals, and most of the other big reggae groups signed to exclusive contracts, has followed a restrained course, releasing albums one at a time and trying to build the careers of the individual performers with tours and merchandising campaigns.

title: Jersey Youth Drowns
description: CLINTON TOWNSHIP, N.J., Aug. 5 (AP)A 17yearold Somerset County boy drowned in the Round Valley Reservoir here today, the police said. The victims name was withheld pending notification of next of kin. The authorities said the youth and a 15yearold companion had launched a boat when it nosedived and sank. The boys tried to swim ashore, but the victim became tangled in seaweed and drowned, the notice said.

title: Roll Calls in Legislature On Change in the Courts
At the Movies
description: How does it feel to be a movie star?

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Aug. 5  A grand jury handed up three indictments today in connection with its investigation of public corruption in Passaic County.

title: Amex Prices Dip as Volume Eases
description: Volume dwindled and so did the market value index on the American Stock Exchange yesterday, after two sessions of higher prices. The volume was 1.5 million shares, compared with 1.8, million the previous day, and the market value index ended at 103.59, off 0,28.

title: Notes on People
description: James A. Beard reported from his Greenwich Village home that he has lost 35 pounds and now weighs 270 pounds for his 6 feet 3 inch height. The 73yearold Oregonborn food writer and gourmet cook was put on a salt  free, 600caloriesaday diet when he entered a San Francisco hospital June 9. suffering from phlebitis and a heart condition. Released month go, he returned here Wednesday but announced that cooking classes in his kitchen, including classes taught by others, would be suspended until further notice.

title: World Team Tennis
description: WEDNESDAY NIGHT'S MATCHES

title: OPEC Insists West Pay 60% of Food Fund's Goal
description: VIENNA, Aug. 5 (AP)The finance ministers of the Organzation of Petroleum Exporting Countries met today to discuss aid to developing countries against a background of controversy with Western industrialized nations over how much aid should be given.

title: Books of The Times
description: TO CHOOSE an unpredictable partner is one of the antidotes to the boredom that so often seems to set in between the sexes. This is not as unpopular a choice as one would imagine: many of us prefer anxiety to boredom. It is a more contemporary feeling.

title: Bear Bryant Yields To Ballet Formation
description: Maybe it was just as well that Bear Bryant never saw what his Alabama football players were doing yesterday.

title: Stones, Confidence Back, Raising the Bar.
description: One world record a week may not satisfy Dwight Stones now.

title: 2D MARCH HALTED BY SOUTH AFRICANS
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 5Policemen fired over the heads of demonstrators in Soweto today, halting a new attempt by students to march out of the township for a protest in front of police headquarters in Johannesburg.

title: Dr. Allan M. Cartter, 54, ExChancellor of N.Y.0
description: Dr. Allan Murray Cartter, a former chancellor of New York University and one of the nation's authorities on academic manpower, died Wednesday of cancer at his home in Beverly Hills, Calif. He was 54 years old.

title: O. E. C. D. Sees New Business Investment Boom in U.S.
description: PARIS, Aug. 5The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said today that financial conditions were favorable for a new business investment boom in the United States, which should help power continuation of significant output and employment growth over the next 12 months.

title: Store Sales Advance
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.10 billion up 8 percent from the yearearlier $1.02 billion. Total retail store sales were about $12.52 billion, up 11 percent from last year's $11.29 billion.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: The halfmile near the East River from Turtle Bay to Sutton Placefrom the upper 40's to the Queensboro Bridge at 59th Streetstill looks as much of Manhattan's Upper East Side once did. It is a stretch still characterized by a pleasant mix of brownstones, small shops and mediumsize apartment buildingsanother kind of city from that of the arrogant whitebrick apartment houses that tower over First, Second and Third Avenues in the 60's, 70's and 80's.

title: Advertising
description: When it comes to being the most discussed TV feature, Mary Hartman. Mary Hartman may be in for some competition in the fall if Sensational Sidney and Fabulous Frances take to the TV airwaves as planned.

title: Consumer Aides Given Powers of Enforcement
description: TRENTON, Aug. 5 The people who investigate local violations of the state's Consumer Fraud Act may still speak softly, but from now on they will carry a big stickthe power to subpoena and impose fines on unscrupulous merchants.

title: Papers Reflect Bias of Bygone Era
description: Sex and sensationalism with strong touches of bigotrywere major ingredients of New York City newspapers of the early and middle 19th century, as shown in a newly opened exhibition of old newspapers at the Queens College library.

title: Utah Democratic Leaders Urge Howe To Drop Reelection Bid
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 5 (AP)Democratic Party officials from Representative Allan T. Howe's Congressional District voted 253 to 186 last night to ask him to stop seeking reelection. Mr. Howe, who is appealing a conviction on a misdemeanor charge of soliciting sex for pay from two police decoy prostitutes, said he would reject the request.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A request by Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis that they be granted public funds in preparing their defense on triplemurder charges was rejected by Judge William Marchese of Passaic County. He ruled that the defendants had waived their rights to public aid by obtaining private lawyers. Defense attorneys, who are working without fees, said the funds were vital for investigations and research.

title: Newcomer Elected to Run Against Brock
description: NASHVILLE. Aug. 5James R. Sasser, a former Tennessee Democratic chairman, won his party's nomination for the United States Senate today and a chance to run against Senator Bill Brock, the Republican incumbent, in November.

title: Business in Malaysia
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia Malaysia is pressing a variety of price stabilization schemes for commodities that are its principal sources of national income and the foundation of the nation's future development.

title: Shipping /Mails
description: Shipping /Mails

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: One of New York City's current dilemmas is highlighted by the juxtaposition in theJuly 31 issue of The Times of the story on Cotati, California's disillusionment with nogrowth policies (Town Finds NoGrowth Plan Leads to NotEnough Funds) with Councilperson Miriam Friedlander's letter opposing the use of M.A.C. resources for a convention center (Of M.A.C. Bonds and City Priorities).

title: Crime Figure Who Aided Plot on Castro Is Missing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5John Roselli, the organized crime figure who last year acknowledged his role in the Central Intelligence Agency's plots against the life of Prime Minister Fidel Castro of Cuba, has disappeared from his home in the Miami area.

title: Cyprus, Oil and the Aegean
description: With luck, the Turkish research ship Sismik I will complete its seismic studies in the Aegean Sea without provoking a military confrontation between Greece and Turkey. An informal understanding has evidently been reached by the two governments, under pressure from their NATO allies, that will allow the vessel to carry out modest explorations even in disputed waters without precipitating the clash both sides have been threatening ever since the Sismik's voyage was nroiected.

title: A Bastion of Bialys
description: A bagel is not a bialy, just in case some of you thought that. Bagels are round, have holes, are slightly shiny and are not easily digestible except with lox. Bialys are also round, baked, a bit chewy, dusty with flour, pushed downbut not throughthe center, seasoned with onions or garlic, and are even less digestible when eaten with cream cheese. But so what. So many good things are.

title: chemical Pollution of Wells in Dover Said to Spread
description: DOVER. Aug. 5The intrution of petrochemical pollutants into wells that provide drinkingf water hero m??? be appreading: Mayor Robert W. Brune said today.

title: Stretch Jersey Is Nikolais's Bag
description: The best advice on how to look at Alwin Nikolais's mixedmedia dance productions this weekend at the Beacon Theater, Broadway and 74th Street, comes from a member of the Nikolais Dance Theater itself.

title: Putting Suggestions to Work
description: Phyllis Recchia, who works on the marketing staff of the General Motors Corporation in New York, was given $3,000 by her company not too long ago. The reason was that she had come up with an idea for eliminating the reproduction of certain reports that G.M. figured would save it about $9,000 a year.

title: Allin, on 8UnderPar 63, Leads B.C. Golf by 2 Shots
description: ENDICOTT, N. Y., Aug. 5 (AP)Buddy Allin, who won $40,000 and his first golf tournament in two years at Sutton, Mass., last Sunday, shot a courserecord, eightunderpar 63 today and took the firstround lead in the B.C. open.

title: British Legislator Who Faked Death Guilty on 4 Counts
description: LONDON, Aug. 5  John Stonehouse, the former Labor Government Minister who faked death so that he could start a new life in Australia, was found guilty at the Old Bailey tonight of 4 of the 21 charges against him.

title: A FEDERAL COURT ON L.I. IS URGED
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I., Aug. 5A citizens task force that feels it is unfair that some Long Island residents have to travel up to 100 miles to get to the Federal District Court of jurisdiction, renewed a drive today to establish separate Federal court facilities on the Island.

title: Room Where Apostle of Russia Died Rededicated by Cardinal From Poland
description: PASSAIC, Aug. 5Karol Cardinal Wojtyla of Poland placed a red and white wreath on the door of a room in St. Mary's Hospital this morning. In that room, a Polish archbishop who had fought a ban on Roman Catholicsm in the Soviet Union, died 50 years ago while visiting the United States.

title: Visit to a Realm of Madness
description: Better than any other document I know, Clancy Sigal's Going Away (1962) identified, embodied and recreated the postwar American radical experience. It was as if On the Road had been written by somebody with brains. It ended with the nameless narratora sort of last Wobbly, having crossed the country by car, finding everywhere accommodation and betrayal on his way to England and a nervous breakdown. He would reappear briefly, as Saul Green in Doris Lessing's Golden Notebook, falling apart and with a writer's block as well. Then there were 14 years of silence during which the nursery school took over the American Left.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates fur Thursday.

title: A Puzzled Town Buries Its Dead
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Pa., Aug. 5In Fairview Cemetery today, an elderly caretaker tamped the dark earth of a new grave.

title: Business Records
description: Business Records

title: Acting on Energy
description: Congress has now brought to the verge of enactment a set of farreaching energy conservation measures, providing tangible financial inducements for householders and businessmen who take positive steps to save energy.

title: Sohio Unit Seeks Notes To Cover Pipeline Costs
description: The Standard Oil Company (Ohio) said yesterday that negotiations had begun for a private placement of as much as $500 million to help finance increased costs in the transAlaska pipeline project.

title: Doctors Doubt Flu Virus Caused Mystery Deaths
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 5Influenza virus is probably not the cause of an outbreak of a mysterious flulike illness that has now claimed its 23d victim among Pennsylvania American Legion convention??? Gov. Milton J. Shapp said here today.

title: Basic Money Supply Drops
description: The nation's basic money supply declined sharply in the latest statement week and business loans at leading New York City banks moved up in one of their rare increases so far this year, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: Army Nomination Approved
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (AP) The Senate Armed Services Committee approved today the nomination of Gen. Bernard W. Rogers to be Army Chief of Staff. If approved by the full Senate, General Rogers will succeed gen. Fred Weyand, who is retiring Oct. 1. The committee also approved the nomination of Fred P. Wacker to be Assistant Secretary of DefenseComptroller, in effect the Pentagon's budget chief.

title: YONKERS PARENTS STAGE A PROTEST
description: YONKERS, Aug. 5About 50 parents blocked the entrance to their neighborhood elementary school this morning and preivented workmen from removing desks and equipment from the building, which has been scheduled for closing.

title: Chrysler Dividend
description: The Chrysler Corporation's board of directors announced yesterday a quarterly dividend of 15 cents a common share to be paid on Sept. 10, to shareholders of record Aug. 16. This is the first dividend Chrysler has paid since the fourth quarter of 1974. Page D8.

title: I.R.S. Given Names Of Alleged Pushers In New Drug Fight
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 5 (AP) The names of 200 suspected narcotics dealers have been turned over to the Internal Revenue Service for special audits under a major new Federal drive against illegal drug traffickers, Commissioner Donald C. Alexander said today.

title: Medical Society Sues to Block New Medicaid Surgery Curbs
description: The Medical Society of the State of New York asked a Federal judge yesterday to declare unconstitutional provisions of a new state law that limit elective surgery for Medicaid patients.

title: Amid Systems Good and Bad, World Is Hooked on Telephone
description: LONDON, Aug. 4The telephone: it is an instrument of priceless variety.

title: About Real Estate
description: A development of attached condominiums that is rising on the Staten Island end of the Verrazano Bridge may be the ripple of the future in forsale housing in the city.

title: Inmont Says Units Abroad Made Dubious Payments
description: The Inmont Corporation said yesterday that its subsidiaries in unidentified foreign countries had made questionable payments totaling approximately $7 million from Jan. 1, 1971 to date.

title: Reynolds Metals Raises Prices for Ingots
description: The Reynolds Metals Company decided yesterday to fol low the nation's top aluminum producer, the Aluminum Company of America, in raising its price for primary unalloyed aluminum ingot by 4 cents to 48 cents Price a pound. Alcoa's Changes new pricing became effective yesterday, while Reynolds will cover all new orders as of today.

title: Blumenfeld Wins Met Medal
description: PLAINFIELD, N.J., Aug. 5  Jay Blumenfeld, often a runnerup in recent area golf tournaments, said today, Plainfield's the roughest course in New Jersey. In fact, it's got to be one of the best courses in the world.

title: Former F.B.I. Aide Said to Have Invested With Man Now Facing Fraud Trial
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5The Justice Department's internal inspection team is investigating a reported financial relationship between John P. Mohr, a,former top official of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, and a Virginia real estate developer accused of defrauding the Small Business Administration, according to department sources.

title: CEMETERIES
description: MT. PLEASAST CEMETERY???. N.Y. 2 plots for ???. In Jewish section of cemetery. Purchased 12 years ago for $327,50. Asking $220 firm. X 7891 TIMES.

title: A Magical Day for Children
description: The portrait of Doug Henning, the magician, that hangs in his dressing room at the Cort Theater was done liy a 10yearold who had seen Mr. Henning in The Magic Show. It is not the kind of portrait many performers would find flattering. Mr. Tlenning's mouth is open, his byes are wide. He looks dumbfounded. He looks amolzed.

title: Mets Defeat Pirates, 74, On 17 Hits
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 5Jon Matlack survived both the shock of Willie Stargell's grandslam home run and the shock of seeing the Mets get 17 hits in one game, to record his first victory in a month, 74, against the Pirates at Three Rivers Stadium tonight.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Another attempt by black South African students to march the nine miles from the township of Soweto to hold a protest in front of Johannesburg police headquarters was halted yesterday when policemen fired over the heads of the marchers. Many adults joined in the march. One student was reportedly carried from the scene after the shots were fired, but the police denied that there had been casualties. Earlier, they confirmed reports that three blacks were killed during the disturbances in Soweto on Wednesday. [Page A1, Column 1.]

title: Dow Off 5.60 on Volume of 15.5 Million Shares
description: The stock market dropped in much slower trading yesterday after two consecutive sessions of advances. At the close, the widelywatched Dow. Jones industrial average was off 5.60 points at 986.68, its, low for the day.

title: TransitFare Rise For Pupils Weighed By New York City
description: New transportation rates that would affect nearly 400,000 public and private school students and save New York City more than $18 million are being considered by the Board of Education, officials confirmed last night.

title: Mikhail K. Lukonin Dies, Soviet Poet and Official
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 5(Reuters) Mikhail K. Lukonin, a poet, has died less than three months after he was elected first secretary of the Moscow branch of the Union of Writers, the Tess press agency reported today.

title: Grant, Busch Call  Secret N. L. Parley
description: M. Donald Grant of the Mets and August A. Busch Jr. of the St. Louis Cardinals, disturbed by recent baseball developments. have arranged a private meeting of National League club owners in Phoenix, Ariz., next Wednesday. Its purpose will be to scrutinize the work of certain of fidais and to discuss, in the words of one owner, what we've been doing wrong.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: Dick Shawn and Jack Gilford are such proven comedy performers that no one could doubt the ability of either to carry a weekly comedy series on television. Yet both had made pilots for CBS that were rejected for the fall schedule. What went wrong may be demonstrated on CBS tonight when the pilots are aired backtoback at 10 and 10:30 P.M., as specials, to relieve the tedium of summer reruns.

title: Breck P. McAllister Dead at 74; Was Specialist in Antitrust Law
description: Breck Parkman McAllister, a member of the Wall Street firm of Donovan Leisure Newton & Irvine from 1943 to 1974, died Wednesday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 1088 Park Avenue.

title: State Pares Hospital Aid; Effect on Strike Is Feared
description: New York State set new Medicaid reimbursement rates for the city's municipal hospitals yesterday that officials in the city said would cut the total state payments and require 2,500 to 3,000 more layoffs. They warned that the action would further aggravate the dispute with nonmedical employees who were striking against the city's 16 public hospitals.

title: Five Slain in Attack By Gang in Ethiopia On a Tourist Hotel
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 5 (UPI)A gang of heavily armed desert bandits stormed a tourist hotel near the KenyanEthiopian border, killing five persons and taking a Frenchman hostage, Kenyan officials said today.

title: Metropolitan Gardens of Delight
description: Despite a popular conception of New York City and environs as little more than a wasteland of cement and suburbia, the metropolitan area has a surprisingly lush and varied sprinkling of public gardens that offer relief from both city streets and summer heat.

title: Lebanese Truce Hopes Dashed Again
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 5Hopes for an immediate ceasefire in Lebanon, which had sprung up overnight, were dashed today when Interior Minister Camille Chamoun, one of the main right wing Christian leaders, accused Iraq of having sent troops into Beirut to fight on the side of the Palestinians.

title: $7.6 BILLION SALE OF NOTES IS MADE BY U.S. TREASURY
description: The Treasury announced yesteraay that it had sold $7.6 billion of its new 8 percent 10years notes after it received an outpouring of orders for the new securities. As a result of the heavy demand for the notes, the Treasury awarded no more than $300,000 to any one buyer. The notes, trading on a whenissued basis, moved to a premium yesterday afternoon, reducing the yield to buyers to 7.81 percent.

title: Sudan Executes 17
description: Seventeen persons accused of involvement in a coup attempt against the President of the Sudan were executed yesterday, bringing the total to 98 in two days. Page A3.

title: Open Interest
description: In bushels, 000 omitted.) Wed.

title: Bridge
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 5  The Spingold knockout team championship continued here this afternoon at the American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals with 32 teams surviving from an original entry of 118. Five of these consist substantially of New York experts, and all of them have good prospects of advancing.

title: ENERGY AGENCY BILL ADOPTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (AP) The Senate passed today a compromise bill extending the Federal Energy Administration and authorizing a broad range of new programs for energy conservation.

title: Massapequa Hospital Ends 3Week Strike With Pact
description: MASSAPEOUA, L. I., Aug. 6 (UPI)A threeweek strike by 222 nonmedical employees at Massapequa (L.I.) General Hospital ended today with the acceptance of a new twoyear contract, according to Alan Kelsky, hospital administrator.

title: Sniping at Wounded Halts Evacuation at Beirut Camp
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 6The International Committee of the Red Cross broke off its evacuation of the wounded from the Tell Zaatar Palestinian camp today after some of the wounded had been shot from rightist Christian positions.

title: Zambia Frees 15 Students
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Aug. 6 (Reuters)Fifteen students who were detained in January after antiGovernment demonstrations at the University of Zambia were freed two days ago, Home Affairs Minister Aaron Milner told Parliament yesterday.

title: Bridge:
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 6 Two old New York rivals clashed in the Spingold knockout team championship at the American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals here this afternoon.

title: MAJOR CANDIDATES MAY DEBATE ON TV
description: ABC and NBC have said they will televise a series of four debates between the Democratic and Republican candidates for President and Vice President, which the League of Women Voters will arrange this fall if the candidates agree to participate.

title: U.S. WEIGHS ACTION AGAINST EXMARSHAL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP) The Justice Department is considering prosecuting Frank Hayes, the former town marshal of Castroville, Tex., in connection with the shooting death of Richard Morales, it was announced today.

title: State's Cuts in Hospital Medicaid Reflect 3Pronged Fiscal Problem
description: A disagreement over Me dicaid reimbursement rates is catching Mayor Beanie, Governor Carey and the city's municipal hospitals in a threeway tugofwar revealing entirely different fiscal and political approaches to healthcare delivery here. The dispute has now become major obstacle to ending the threedayold municipal hospital strike, much as a similar dispute in June kept the City University of New York shut down while the state and city bickered over who was going to pay for its deficit.

title: 4 to 5 Years Given Slayer Of Suspect in Knight Death
description: CAMDEN, N.J., Aug. 6 (AP) A Philadelphia man was sentenced to four to five years imprisonment today for manslaughter in the death of a suspect in the December slaying of John Knight 3rd, a newspaper heir.

title: British M.P. Is Given 7Year Sentence
description: LONDON, Aug. 6 John Stonehouse, a Member of Parliament and a minister in a former Labor Party Administration, was sentenced here today to seven years imprisonment for theft, forgery and fraud.

title: Consumer Notes
description: The Consumer League of New Jersey is urging that mopedsmotorized pedal bicyclesbe restricted to use on roadways with speed limits under 40 miles an hour end that moped operators, owners and renters, be required to carry liability insurance.

title: 37 Injured in Austria
description: SALZBURG, Austria, Aug. 6 (AP)  Thirtyseven tourists, mostly West Germans, were injured today when the mechanism of cable cars at Mount. Kitzsteinborn south of hero failed and two cars ran into terminating bumpers.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Aug. 6New York State, which expected a $22 million windfall from enactment of New Jersey's personalincome tax because of a provision repealing commuter taxes on New York State residents who work in New Jersey, will not gel the extra money after all.

title: A Struck Hospital Finds Life Goes On
description: A group of 40 gypsies, some crying, some praying and some talking emotionally, stood outside the emergency room at the Bronx Municipal Hospital Center early yesterday while surgeons performed an emergency operation on a 5yearold boy who had suffered a skull fracture in an auto accident.

title: MRS. ABZUG GETS BUFFALO SUPPORT
description: Representative Bella S. Abzug, one of five candidates for the New York Democratic nomination for the United States Senate, was endorsed by two unions yesterday while campaigning in Buffalo, marking what her aides described as her first support from labor unions.

title: Jets Choose Buttle to Start
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 6Is Greg Buttle my No. 1 middle linebacker? asked Walt Michaels today. Weil, we're starting him against the Giants, aren't we?

title: SHAH CAUTIONS U.S. AGAINST ARMS CUT
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 6Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi denied today that Iran was having difficulties in handling a vast number of modern weapons from the United States, and told American reporters that Washington must continue to sell arms to his country or risk instability and war in his area.

title: Savings Banks Add Checking Accounts
description: The savings banks of New York State have opened 255,245 checking accounts with $89.7 million in deposits since checking account powers for thrift institutions were legalized in the state last May, according to the Saving Banks Association of New York State.

title: Year Is Added to Sentence In Abuse of Mental Patients
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Aug. 6 (UPI)Martha Garris, who has served one year of a oneto10year sentence for mistreating former mental patients who lodged at her boarding houses was given an additional oneyear sentence today, which is to run concurrently with her present sentence.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: LONDON, Aug. 6 (Reuters) The British High Court today issued an interim injunction restraining the Eastman Kodak Company from manufacturing or selling its new instant camera and film in Britain.

title: Rabin Says Lebanon War Impedes Mideast Talks
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 6Prime Mitlister Yitzhak Rabin said today that the fighting in Lebanon had impeded the chances for renewed negotiations between Israel and the Arabs. But at the same time, he added, it has lessened the prospects of a united Arab clash with Israel.

title: U.S. GIVES MOSCOW LIST FOR EMIGRATION
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 6 (AP)The United States has presented to Soviet authorities a list of 315 Soviet citizens who have been trying unsuccessfully, some for many years, to emigrate to America.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Assoclaled Press

title: SUGAR FUTURES CONTINUE DOWN
description: Sugar futures prices continued to decline yesterday and coffee prices continued to rise, traveling with old news, according to one commodity expert.

title: Remote Security Device For Autos Is Developed
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 6A motor vehicle fitted with new security system cannot be operated until the owner reaches into a pocket or purse and presses a button Remote Security Device For Autos Is Developed on a wireless miPaten ts cro  transmitter about the size of of the a cigarette lightWeek er. The coded electronic message releases the ignition and engine for full operation.

title: Attendance at State Parks. Off 10% From Last Year
description: TRENTON, Aug. 6Attendance at New Jersey's 23 state parks is running 10 percent behind last year, and state officials are wondering whether the weather or higher admission fees are to blame.

title: Quake in Nicaragua
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Aug. 6 (Reuters)A moderate earth tremor shook parts of Nicaragua early today, but officials said there were no reports of casualties or damage.

title: Cairo Paper Reports Arrest Of Islamic Revolutionaries
description: CAIRO, Aug. 6 (AP)The Egyptian security police have arrested a group of young revolutionaries who allegedly want to turn Egypt into a strict Moslem state, the newspaper Al Ahram reported today.

title: Tracy Nelson Puts Bit of Mother Earth In the Bottom Line
description: Survival is impressive, and Tracy Nelson, who is singing at the Bottom Line this weekend, is a survivor of more trends than most pop musicians will ever have to grapple with. As a young folk singer in Madison, Wis., in the mid1960's, she lived through protest and the first stirrings of the blues revival. As lead vocalist with the first edition of Mother Earth, she rode the seismic shock waves of rock music that emanated from San Francisco during the heyday of HaightAshbury. She sang with as much power as Janis Joplin, but unlike her betterknown contemporary, she did not burn herself out.

title: Riddick,Foster,Roberts Regain Pride in Track
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Aug. 6  Steve Riddick, Charles Foster, and Dave Roberts won individual gold medals todayone week too late.

title: Mrs. Higuchi, 210, In 5Stroke Lead
description: SUNNINGDALE, England, Aug. 6 (UPI)The pacesetting Chako Higuchi of Japan shot a sixunderpar 68 today for a 54hole total of 210, 12 under par, and a fivestroke lead over Sandra Palmer in the $90,000 European women's golf championship.

title: 2 Soviet Astronauts Log A Month in Space Station
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 6 (Reuters) Two Soviet astronauts, Boris Volynov and Vitali Zholobov, logged one month in space today with no sign that they were about to leave the orbiting Salyut 5 space station and return to earth.

title: Court Bars Physician From Giving Injections
description: CAMDEN, Aug. 6 (UPI)A New Jersey Superior Court judge told a physician today that he could not give his patients injections until he changed his procedures to guard against infecting people with serum henatitis.

title: EDWIN H. DOWNES, 78, DELAWARE TEACHER
description: Edwin Hall Downes, an educator in Delaware who also was a commander of the United States Naval Training Station in Hampton, Va., in World War II, where training was provided for black naval officers, died Tuesday in Dover, Del. He was 78 years old.

title: LITTON AND FAMILY BURIED IN MISSOURI
description: CHILLICOTHE, Mo., Aug. (AP)Representative Jerry Litton; killed in a plane crash the night he won the Democratic senatorial nomination, was buried today after services attended by Congressional leaders, state officials and hundreds of friends.

title: Yesterday's Results at Saratoga
description: FIRST$8,000, cl. ??? 3YO and up, 6f.

title: STOCKS WEAKEN ON JOBLESS DATA
description: A largerthanexpected increase in the nation's unemployment rate sent stock prices down slightly in slower trading yesterday.

title: Senate Votes an Extension Of Cuts in Taxes, 4922
description: WASHINGTON, August 6The Senate passed tonight the longest and most complicated tax bill in two decades. Among its major provisions, the bill continues all the 1975 tax cuts for both individuals and businesses, reduces the estate tax and provides a tax credit against a small portion of the cost of higher education.

title: RECYCLED BOMBER KILLS 2 IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 6 (AP)A World War II B25 bomber, converted for civilian use, caught fire today after takeoff and crashed into three houses, killing two persons and injuring three others, the authorities said.

title: FUND MISUSE LAID TO RAIL OFFICIALS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6A Treasury Department audit of the Governmentfinanced United States Railway Association has found what it considers to be widespread misuse of Federal funds, ranging from golf club memberships to lucrative consulting contracts for former officials.

title: Peter C. L. Hodgson, Marketer Of Silly Putty, Dies at Age 64
description: Peter C. L. Hodgson Sr., an edvertising and marketing executive who turned a seeminqlv useless silicone substance into an international craze called Silly Putty, died of a heart attack yesterday at his home in Madison, Conn. He was 64 years old.

title: Connors Extended In Defeating Dibbs
description: NORTH CONWAY, N.H., Aug. 6  Jimmy Connors waved expansively this morning toward the acres of pine trees and the gentle slope of the White Mountains that frame this resort community.

title: Mystery Disease Claims 2 More, Putting Toll at 25
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 6The death toll in the outbreak of the mysterious respiratory disease in Pennsylvania rose by two to 25 as medical detectives accelerated efforts today to seek a chemical or poison as the possible cause.

title: Hassler Puts End To 18GamoSkein
description: Better late than never has become Andy Hassler's philosophy in the major leagues.

title: People in Sports
description: John Naber, who won four gold medals and one silver medal as a swimmer for the United States Olympic team at Montreal, has no intention of cashing in on his success this year.

title: Allin 4Shot Leader
description: ENDICOTT, N.Y., Aug. 6 (AP)Buddy Allin mastered a narrow fairway course today for the second consecutive day and led after two rounds of the B.C. golf tournament with a 36hole total of 130, 12 under par.

title: New York Improving Subways, But Still Trails Foreign Cities
description: More amenities needed in this subway? Amen, says everyone including the Transit. Authority.

title: Epidemic Specialists Rush To Tangshan Quake Zone
description: PEKING, Saturday, Aug. 7Specialists in preventing and combating epidemic disease are being rushed into the Tangshan area, which was devastated by an earthquake more than 10 days ago.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in The Times yesterday said Agudath Israel sponsored a number of daycare centers. A spokesman for the organization said it was active in centers for the elderly and in education, but not in day care.

title: British Swimmer Takes First Gold
description: OSLO, Aug. 6 (AP)John Edwin Cotton, 15 years old, won Britain's first gold medal ever in the European junior swimming and diving championships today in an upset victory in the boys 200meter individual medley in 2:16.41.

title: ALVAN C. HADLEY 81, THEATRICAL ARTIST
description: Alvan C. Hadley, who used the name Hap in his career as a newspaper cartoonist and theatrical artist, died in New York City on Tuesday. He was 81 years old.

title: SHAH CAUTIONS U.S. AGAINST ARMS CUT
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 6Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi denied today that Iran was having difficulties in handling a vast number of modern weapons from the United States, and told American reporters that Washington must continue to sell arms to his country or risk instability and war in his area.

title: REV. JAMES E. DIXON
description: The Rev. James E. Dixon, who served for many years at St. Paul the Apostle Roman Catholic Church at 59th Street and Columbus Avenue, died Thursday in Lincoln City, Ore., where he had lived in retirement since 1970. He was 67 years old.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTrIERN DISTRICT Friday, Aug. 6, 7976 Pchtion tiled by:

title: Means, Militant Indian Leader, Cleared in South Dakota Killing
description: RAPID CITY, S. D., Aug. 6 (AP)Russell C. Means, the American Indian Movement leader, was acquitted by a jury today of a charge of murder in a 1975 barroom killing.

title: No Mail, Phone Calls or Visits For Sequestered Harris Jurors
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 6The sequestered jurors in the trial of William and Emily Harris, who ended one week of deliberations today, dine on hotel food and watch closedcircuit movies on a communal television set but are denied some of the usual amenities of life.

title: Maj. H. E. Garrison Killed While Training Saudi Pilots
description: WASHINGTON, August 6 (Reuters)Maj. Harry E. Garrison of Bridgeton, N.J., has been killed while serving as an instructor of pilots in Saudi Arabia, the Air Force said today.

title: LYDIA B. COWELL
description: Lydia B. Cowell, who was active in the affairs of Trinity Baptist Church in Brooklyn and later with the United Presbyterian Church in Garden City, L. I. died Wednesday in Hamilton, N. Y., after a long illness. Her age was 88.

title: Chile ExAide Freed
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 6 (Reuters) The former Economy Minister of Chile, Fernando Flores Labra, was flown to the United States last night after being held in jail for almost three years. Mr. Flores, who served under the late President, Salvador Allende Gossens, was released after a civilian court cleared him of charges of misuse of public funds while in office.

title: SHOTS AGAIN ROUT SOWETO'S BLACKS
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 6Police riot squads opened fire in Soweto today to disperse crowds of youths who roamed the black township attacking cars, buses and trains in a continuing effort to keep black workers from their jobs in Johannesburg.

title: Radio
description: 69 A.M., WQXR. Violin Concerto No. 2, Paganini; Symphony No. 75, Haydn; Overture to Ariodante. Handel; Adagio and Pastorale from The Creatures of Prometheus, Beethoven; Flagstaff, Elgar; La Peri, Dukas; Allegro from Serenade for Strings, Suk; Evening Reverie from Suite Algerienne, SaintSaens; Queen from The England of Elizabeth, Williams.

title: Changing Auto Industry
description: DETROIT, Aug. 6The decision of the Federal Trade Commission and the Justice Department to take the first indepth look at the automobile industry in many years comes at a time when the four major producers are undergoing the first major restructuring of their products and corporations since World War If. Except for periodic economic downturns, the years since the war have been marked largely by compla ency.

title: Mets Rained Out; Play Two Tonight
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 6Though he had just won his first game in more than a month, Jon Matlack of the Mets was far from pleased with his performance.

title: Mary Josephine Shelly, 74; Educator and a Navy Aide
description: Mary Josephine Shelly, former Bennington College administrator who took charge of the Navy's education for womlen in World War II and commanded the Women in the Air Force in the Korean War, died yesterday at New York Hospital. She was 74 years old and resided at 10 Mitchell Place.

title: Today's Entries at Saratoga
description: Today's Entries at Saratoga

title: Union Picket Killed Outside Warehouse By Truck on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 6Norman Ray Lewis, a striking member of the International Longshoremen and Warehousemen's Union, was struck and killed by a truck and trailer while picketing this morning at the Handyman of California warehouse in Tracy, 70 miles from here, according to the Tracy police.

title: Japan's Scandal Sears Tanaka Hometown
description: NISHIYAMA, Japan, Aug. 4Home, former Prime Minister Kakuel Tanaka once wrote, was the place where your stern father and gentle mother lived, where you could always find Your childhood friends, and whose green fields, rolling hills and fresh streams remained with you forever.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: HIS DAY Every dog has itand tomorrow will mark Canine Cleanup Carnival, a free outdoor action seminar in Central Park at which pets and owners will undergo a fourhour howto program that should prove both instructive and invigorating.

title: Books of The Times
description: We read and hear much about how the changing society is affecting the thinking and behavior of young women, but far less attention is given to the effects that the same shifting mores are having on men.

title: Shetland Is Best At Spa
description: BALLSTON SPA, N.Y., Aug. 6A Shetland sheepdog, who answers to the name of Thunder, thundered to his fifth best in show award today at the Mohawk Valley Kennel Club fixture at the fairgrounds.

title: Notes on People
description: Shirley Schlanger Abrahamson, who was graduated from Hunter High School and in 1953 from New York University, was named yesterday as the first woman Justice of the Wisconsin Supreme Court. The appointment was announced by Gov. Patrick J. Lucey.

title: Colts Stifle Redskins And Triumph, 20 to 3
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 6 (AP) Kim Jones scored two touchdowns and the Baltimore defense stifled the Washington Redskins running game as the Colts scored a 203 National. Football League preseason victory tonight.

title: Post Faculty Panel To Weigh. Charges Of Falsified Credits
description: GREENVALE, L. I., Aug. 6The president of the C. W. Post Center of Long Island University said today that a faculty review committee would be convened within a week to 10 days to decide how to deal with an alleged scheme in which faculty members were given credit for courses that they had never taken.

title: F.T.C, SCORES ADS OF EGG INDUSTRY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commission ruled today that the egg industry had engaged in patently false and misleading advertising by telling American consumers there was no evidence to link the eating of eggs, which are high in cholesterol, to heart attacks.

title: Events Today
description: MOSTLY MOZART FESTIVAL, Alice Tully Hall, Lincoln Center, 8.

title: Issues in Hospital Strike
description: PARTICIPANTS: About 18,000 nonprofessional hospital workers, members of Local 420, American Federation State, County and Municipal Employees, are on strike against New York City's Health and Hospitals Corporation, which runs the 16 municipal hospitals. Most of the employees are nurses aides and dietary and janitorial workers.

title: Dog Leads Customs Agents To Cocaine on Banana Boat
description: MIAMI, Aug. 6 (UPI)Thirty United States customs officers were waiting with a drugsniffing dog when the Colombian banana boat Cubahama tied up late yesterday after a voyage from Turbo, Colombia.

title: 16 in Contempt in Canada
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Aug, 6 (Reuters) Sixteen air traffic controllers who walked off their jobs in June during a nationwide pilots strike were found guilty of contempt of court. However, the judge imposed no sentences on the men, saying he was willing to let bygones be bygones.

title: Tonight's Entries at Yonkers
description: MRS1$5.500, ears, Class C2, mile.

title: Senate Confirms Rogers
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP) The Senate today contirmeo the nomination of Gen, Bernard W. Rogers to be Army chief of staff. He will succeed Gen. Frederick C. Weyand, who re. tires Oct. 1. The Senate also confirmed Juanita. Ashcroft of San Francisco as Assistant Sec. rotary of the Air Force for personnel.

title: Woody Allen, in Making A Film, Pays for Laughs
description: Woody Allen, a man accustomed to getting a lot of money to have people laugh at him, bought his laughs this week at the Fashion Institute of Technology.

title: The Enchanted Frog
description: At the bottom of the cornfield two mulberry trees and a maple grow In a triangle, leaning toward one another so that their heads touch and their leaves and branches intermingle. Multiflora roses and greenbriers with wicked thorns grow thickly about their bases, and rampant honeysuckle fills any space the briers leave unoccupied.

title: Youth Band at City Hall After a Change of Plans
description: Thirtysix members of the Summer Youth Band of Berlin, N.H., whose concert in Philadelphia was canceled because of an oubreak of mysterious flu  like illness there, played instead in front of New York's City Half yesterday.and attracted a large, enthusiastic noon  hour throng.

title: FLU IS RULED OUT IN MYSTERY CASES
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 6 The director of the Federal Government's main center for public health investigations said today that the mysterious disease outbreak in Pennsylvania appeared to be subsiding and to pose no apparent threat. to the health of the nation in general.

title: Poles Face Sugar Shortage After Balking on Price Rise
description: WARSAW, Aug. 6 (Reuters) Poles were urged today to stop hoarding sugar and to prevent waste in cafes and restaurants as the country's monthlong sugar shortage worsened.

title: Pacific Rower Sighted
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 6 (UPI)Pat Quesnel, 27 years old, a Seattlearea fisherman trying to row a 22foot dory to Hawaii, has been sighted about 100 miles offshore of Crescent City, Calif. The Coast Guard reported today that the tanker San Sinena Two got within shouting distance of Mr. Quesnel, who saki that he was in good condition and hoped to be in Hawaii between Nov. 10 and 20. He left La Push, Wash.. July 14, and has no communication radio on board.

title: SHOTS AGAIN ROUT SOWETO'S BLACKS
