description: WHAT can summer be like in the Midwest, without a seemingly endless supply of bluefish fresh from the sea? Large 3 to 5pound choppers to stuff and bake or split and grill; baby snappers to flour and fry are one of the Island's particular delights.

title: Muslims to Sell Businesses
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 7  The Black Muslims, who established a business empire in the black communities of the nation's cities, have decided to dismantle their commercial holdings.

title: Notes: Are You Ready for More Commercials?
description: Viewers who feel that there are now too many commercials on television are apt'to find the situation worsening rather than Improving. A move is underway to add an extra minute of advertising in every halfhour of network prime time. That really means two commercials per halfhoura total of 12 more for a single eveningbecause most commercials today are in the halfminute form.

title: Suit Sinks Boat Course
description: THE free basic boating course that the United States Power Squadrons offers twice a year will begin again next month in virtually every state but New Jersey. It is the first year that Jersey residents will be unable to register for the 10week program that 100,000 neophyte boatmen around the country take annually.

title: On to Kansas City
description: Ronald Reagan's big gamble in selecting a Republican on the left as a prospective running mate has achieved what Mr. Reagan probably hoped it would: He has probably eliminated the possibility that he will lose the Presidential nomination to Gerald Ford before the Republican convention begins in Kansas City eight days from now. In doing so, the former California Governor has also increased the possibilitystill not a probabilitythat he can defeat Mr. Ford on the floor of the convention.

title: The Atlantic: Nature's Champagne
description: SANDY HOOK THIS is where the Atlantic Ocean, moved by unseen forces from wind, stars and planets, relentlessly pounds, roars, crashes or quietly laps away, shaping and reshaping the northernmost tip of New Jersey's ocean coastline as has been doing for millions of years.

title: CONTESTS CLOSE IN BRIDGE MATCH
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 7The quarterfinal stage of the Spingold knockout at the American Contract Bridge League's summer nationals team championship began here this afternoon Saturday with three of the eight surviving teams still feeling the effects of desperately close struggles last night.

title: Redskins Show Problems, Offensively and Defensively
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 7A problem about National Football League summertime exhibitions is perception. How much of what we perceive can we believe? Take last nieht's game here

title: Official Black Leaders Have Little Real Power
description: JOHANNESBURG  The overwhelming majority of the 100,000 homes in Soweto are tiny governmentbuilt houses not much bigger than a garden shed. But here and there in the sprawling township there are larger, ownerbuilt homes, some of them with lawns and television aerials and car ports. One such home, belonging to the township's Mayor, T. J. Makhaya, was attacked with stones and gasoline bombs last week by angry youths hitting out at symbols of the systemapartheidthat holds them in conditions degrading inferiority.

title: Tisha
description: This book is as fresh as springtime, but though the style is artless and easy, the reader should not be put off by a prepublication reviewer who labeled it nice. It is anything but nice, dealing as it does with rampant race prejudice. In the Alaska of 1927 this prejudice was leveled at the Indians

title: The Roots of the Malpractice Mess
description: MEDICAL malpractice is a sociological phenomenona symptom of a disease that involves our entire society.

title: U.S. Generalissimo?
description: The House Armed Services Committee, apparently acting in the bicentennial spirit, has decided to grant relief for what it considers an injustice committed 1799. A majority voted to give General Washington sixth star to allow him to outrank the First and Second World Wars fivestar Generals.

title: Controversial figure, explosive issues
description: Thirtyone years ago last Friday the world was introduced to the nuclear age. For as long as historians believe that people influence history, the architects of this age, the atomic scientists will remain important subjects for our attention. Edward Teller is among the most significant. Aggressive and engaging, he has lectured tirelessly in public and lobbied tenaciously in private for better bombs, more tests, deeper shelters and fewer arms agreements with the Soviets.

title: ...And What Is the F.C.C. Advocating?
description: The following remarks are excerpted from the decision of David I. Kraushaar, rederat Communications Commission administrative law judge, in the A.T.&T. case.

title: Real writers who wrote movies
description: Tom Dardis first got interested in the screen credits of screenwriters during his high school years when he worked as an usher in a movie theater and saw countless films over and over. That adolescent interest of his has now culminated in Some Time in the

title: Some Afterthoughts on a National Political Convention
description: THE streets of New York were paved with friendship contrary to the bloodcurdling stories we had heard. As a delegate to the Democratic Convention, the overriding feeling I had was of how frail our way of life and political system really are. For on the floor of Madison Square Garden were the powerful and the familiar faces that one sees on television, and they were all mortals. And throughout I kept thinking that these are the people who make the ultimate decisions and they're just like me.

title: If You Have to Ask the Price, You Can't Afford
description: Learning to live with inflationa fact of business lift is coming a little harder for American ship operators.

title: Friday's Fight
description: LOS ANGELESDanny (Little Red) Lopez, 125 pounds, Los Angeles, knocked out Art Hafey, 126, San Diego, 7 rounds.

title: TROPIC STORM BELLE BECOMES HURRICANE
description: MIAMI, Aug. 7 (UPI)Tropical storm Belle increased to hurricane strength today off the southeastern Florida coast. The National Weather Service issued a hurricane watch extending from southern Georgia to Cane Hatteras. N.O

title: New York City Is Reexamining Its Anticrime Policies
description: The Beame administration is reexamining several fundamental anticrime policies, including whether to rely less on police radio car patrols and more on special anticrime units comloosed of officers disguised in (civilian clothes.

title: U.S Ship Defense System Said to Hold Lead on Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) The F14APhoenix weapon system, which is designed to defend the United States fleet against attacks by antiship misslies can effectively counter current Soviet weapons, the General Accounting Office said today.

title: Atlantic Richfield Settles Suit in 9 Deaths From Gas
description: LUBBOCK. Tex., Aug. 7 (UPI)Relatives of nine per sons killed in their sleep by, poisonous gas that seeped from an Atlantic Richfield well have terminated their $20 million suit against the company, ac:epting an outofcourt settle ment for an undisclosed sum.

title: War on Scofflaws Pays Off
description: NEW JERSEY car owners contributed a record $8 million to New York City's depleted treasury in the past year, and yielded a red RollsRoyce for good measure. Not that they wanted to, however.

title: New &
description: The Brink

title: STAMPS
description: To give the news impartially, without fear or favor, regardless of party, sect or interest involved. With this credo, Adolph S. Ochs took over the dying New York Times and In his lifetime made it one of the world's leading newspapers, this year marking its 125th anniversary.

title: StageStruck Kids Take on Pretzels With a Twist
description: THEY come downstage and perch on the apron, looking like refugees from those old GarlandRooney movies in which the inevitable gang of neighborhood kids choruses: Let's get together and do a show!

title: A New Role Is in Offing For Retired Bishop
description: WHEN Bishop Prince Albert Taylor Jr. relinquished his episcopal duties last month as spiritual and administrative leader of New Jersey's nearly 200,000 United Methodists, he capped a career in religion seldom if ever equalled.

title: Notes: Directories Aid TollFree Calling
description: The tollfree telephone number looms ever larger in the travel business. The latest figures: close to 200 hotels and motels, 150 travel agencies, 70 scheduled airlines, 20 car and truck rental agencies, 16 cruise ship lines and as many golf resorts, 15 charter tour operators and at least 9 ski lodgc3. The nationwide total of tollfree lines is 85,000and it's growing at the rate of 25 percent a year.

title: Untied Prez internation CONTAMINATED TOWN REMAINS SEALED OFF: In Seveso, Italy leaking gas from a chemical plant polluted the atmosphere, health department workers collect the bodies of animals killed by the poisonous fumes. No humans have died from the accident, which took place on July 10. The entire town was evacuated.
CAMERA VIEW
description: ELINOR STECH

title: Marian Flood Becomes Bride
description: Marian Virginia Flood, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Francis Flood of Larchmont, N.Y., was married last evening to John Louis Dorazio son o fMr. and Mrs. Leopold Joseph Dorazio of New Rochelle, N.Y. The Rev. John Scully performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of SS. John and Paul in Larchmont. N.Y:

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock market last week mostly marked time as an absence of favorable economic news kept many investors on the sidelines. At the close of trading on Friday, the Dow Jones industrial average was ahead 1.32 points to 986.00. Volume on the New York Stock Exchange, although hit by the summer doldrums, managed to hit 82.42 million shares last week, up from 73.27 million shares in the preceding week.

title: 6 California G.O.P. Legislators Tell Delegates Reagan Distorted His Record as Governor
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 7Six prominent Republican members of the California Legislature have sent letters to uncommitted or wavering delegates in three crucial states charging that Ronald Reagan, in speeches around the country, has distorted his record as Governor of the state.

title: Larsen Is Winner in Chess
description: BIEM, Switzerland, Aug. 7  Ber. Larsen of Denmark won the Interzonal Tournament hire last night with a score of 12 6. He outmaneuvered Jan Smejkal of Czechoslovakia in a tricky rookandknight ending in the 13th round and then put away first prize with careful draw with Robert Huebner of West Germany in the final round.

title: Listen! I'm Tryin
description: The indefatigable Ruth Gordon is perhaps best remembered for her portrayal of Dolly Levi in Thornton Wilder's The Matchmaker in 1954. Later, she won an Academy Award for her zaney performance as the witch in Rosemary's Baby.

title: The greatest single force for good in the imaginative life of Western Europe
description: JOHN RUSSELL

title: A Rustle of Hope Along Seventh Avenue
description: When Yves Saint Laurent, the Paris designer, propounded his puffy silhouette 10 days agoa silhouette that could either be the biggest boon to the fashion business since Christian Dior's New Look of 1947 or its biggest disaster since the midi of 1970Seventh Avenue was ready with its special brand of gallows humor.

title: White South Africans Seem Untouched by Black Strife
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 7This city was a study in relaxation today. Its suburban shopping malls were packed, its golf courses and tennis clubs as busy as ever, and its freeways humming with BMW's and Mercedes.

title: Grocery Pricing by TV
description: LIKE horseracing enthusiasts engaged in serious study of The Daily Racing Form, economyminded shoppers all over the island sit down each Wednesday with their newspapers to pore over the pages and pages of supermarket advertisements.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: ARCHIE STRUHL
description: Archie Struhl, president of the importing firm of Morris Struhl Inc. of Allendale, N. J., died Thursday in Englewood Hospital, Englewood, N. J. His age was 66.

title: Iranians Planning to Spend $10 Billion on U.S. Arms
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 7The United States and Iran announced today that Iran planned to spend $10 billion for military purchases from the United States as part of mounting trade between the two countries that would total about $50 billion from last year through 1980.

title: INVESTING
description: Options trading hps berome the hottest game in townjust about any townsince the Chicago Board Options Exchange kicked it off with the first formal market for selling and buying calls. in 1973.

title: DINING OUT
description: LIKE Dorothy who stepped from her tornadotossed house into the magical Land of Oz, when you enter Truman's you arc immediately whisked from the cozy village of Roslyn to a chic, supersophisticated urban setting. Stone, polished wood, dark walls and glassedin interior paces create the effect in the informal groundfloor eatery and bar. In the small dining rooms upstairs, the windows have been hung with metal beads, the background is brown and the dinnerware the Arabia stoneware used by Julia Child.

title: Half of Laid Off Policemen Will Be Rehired in Detroit
description: DETROIT, Aug. 7 (UPI) Nearly half the 913 Detroit policemen laid off July 1 because of a budget problem will be back in uniform Sept. 1.

title: Cornell MinorityGroup Housing Investigated at Regents Hearing
description: A panel of the State Board of Regents conducted two days of hearings last week into the continued maintenance by Cornell University of an allminoritygroup residence hall after the Regents had already called the practice a violation of state regulations against segregation by race or color.

title: Roberts and Lemon Will Be Enshrined
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y., Aug. 7 (AP)Robin Roberts and Bob Lemon, standout righthanded pitchers during the 1950's, and four others will be formally inducted into baseball's Hall of Fame Monday in this scenic villa2e.

title: Gregg's B.M.W. Takes Barna 200
description: TALLADEGA, Ala., Aug. 7 (AP)Peter Gregg drove steadily through a driving rainstorm and went on to victory in today's shortened Bama 200 for International Motor Sports Association Grand Touring sports cars.

title: Guest Observer
description: In 1960, I published a novel that had the sentence: He looked him up and down from his niggerbrown shoes to his spinsterishly tightset lips and then said quietly:  off In the new edition of 1975, the shoes and the lips are more generally and less offensively characterized, and the dirty word is set out in full. One semantic area has been freed from taboo; two others have begin freshly enslaved by it. There is a lesson here: Human history does not depict the progressive throwing off of chains, merely the exchange of one set of chains for another, or two others.

title: Parent and Child
description: Every year at least half a million Americans marry someone who is a parent already. When people go into a second or subsequent marriage, they are full of great hopes of improving on the past. Unfortunately, these do not always turn out to be realisticespecially when children are involved.

title: Court Orders Rikers to Speed Paroles of ShortTerm Inmates
description: A Federal judge has ordered new parole procedures lo expedite the, release of prisoners serving short sentences in the New York City Correctional Inistitution on Rikers Island.

title: Two Persistent Critics Expelled by Chile
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 7 President Augusto Pinochet of Chile has exiled two of his persistent critics.

title: SHOP TALK
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR

title: The Innocent Also May Die
description: FREDDIE PITTS and Wilbert Lee, two black men from Florida, spent 12 years in prison. The jury said they should have been executed. The judge sentenced them to deathfor a crime they did not commit. Mr. Pitts and Mr. Lee were lucky. Their execution date was stayed because the question of the constitutionality of capital punishment was being heard in the United States Supreme Court. While they were in prison, a white man confessed to committing the crime for which they had been convicted. The confession was disregarded. After 12 years of legal battle, Mr. Pitts and Mr. Lee were pardoned.

title: RICHARD STEIN
description: Richard Stcin a former senior partner of Stein, Stein, Hughes & McGuire, an Elizabeth, N.J., law firm died yesterday at his home in Livingston, N.J. He was 62 years old.

title: U.S. RESTUDIES AID TO CUBA REFUGEES
description: MIAMI, Aug. 7The Ford Administration, apparently stung by criticism from Cuban leaders here and by Congress, is reexamining the operations and usefulness of the 15yearold. United States Cuban refugee program.

title: SURVEY CLASSIFIES G.O.P. DELEGATES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) President Ford's delegates to the Republican National Convention are better educated and earn more than the delegates backing his challenger, Ronald Reagan, an Associated Press survey shows.

title: The American People Are Disgusted
description: CHINO, Calif.One thing that has emerged clearly so far in the 1976 voting pattern is that millions, of Americans are antiWashington. Jimmy Carter's triumph over a field of Washingtonbased luminaries, and the strong support given Ronald Reagan in his challenge to an incumbent President point to this trend.

title: PAY ABUSE IS DENIED AT L.I.U.'S POST UNIT
description: The president of the C. W. Post Center of Long Island University denied yesterday a published report that an associate professor at the school had earned more than $50,000 in the past year by claiming to have taught numerous extra courses.

title: Copter Search for Victims Of Canyon Flood Is Ended
description: LOVELAND, Colo., Aug. 8 (UPI)The authorities today ended the helicopter search for victims of the Big Thompson Canyon flood, turning the operation over to ground crews.

title: 100,000 at World
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug, 8At once damp and fervent, loud and pious, more than 100,000 worshipers gathered in and around John F. Kennedy Stadium here today after a morning rain and heard Pope Paul VI and President Ford affirm the importance of Christian values.

title: Poland's Leaders Say Riots in June Over Food Prices May Have Set Wide Changes in Motion
description: WARSAW, Aug. 8The rioting and strikes that swept parts of Poland six weeks ago resulted from a grave miscalculation by Communist planners but left the whole nation wiser, leading Communists here assert. In fact, they say, farreaching reforms of the entire system may result.

title: It's a Case of No Honor Among Alleged Thieves
description: The robber was located through the cooperation of the burglar, the Suffolk County police report said yesterday. And this, according to the duty officer, Sgt. Raymond Wolfe, was why:

title: Woman Lawyer Installed
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 8 (AP)A Washington, D.C., lawyer, Lee Burger Anderson, has been installed as president of the National Association of Women Lawyers. She succeeded Kathlen Ryan Dacey of Boston. Other new officers include Eleanore Iannone of Binghamton, N.Y., presidentelect, and Mary Alice Duffey of Philadelphia, vice president. The association met over the weekend in conjunction with the annual meeting of the American Bar Asoelation.

title: Jets vs. Giants on Neutral
description: In their 17th season, and in their 308th game, the New York Jets will make their first appearance at Yankee Stadium tonight when they thumb their noses at history and play host to the Giants.

title: Amateur Crown to Britton
description: PLAINFIELD, N.J., Aug. 8Bill Britton, who became the first publiclinks player to win the Metropolitan Golf Association's amateur championship when he took that title last year, repeated as champion today in a heavy rain that fell through most of the final of the 74th M.G.A. tourney.

title: Boat Reported Foundering, But Search Fails to Find It
description: The Coast Guard searched late yesterday for a foundering 30foot bat with eight persons aboard in the Atlantic coastal water near Ambrose Light after receiving a distress call, but found no trace of the vessel or survivors.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Television
description: Stanley Baker is the star of Zulu, on The 4:30 Movie, shown today and tomorrow on Ch. 7.

title: New Athletics at Old
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 8Diving, looping, dogfighting kites have seized command of the skies over Yale University this summer, and if Will H. Yolen has his way, Old Eli will field an ascendant intercollegiate kiteflying team in the coming school year.

title: Judith Rabinowitz Married in Capital
description: Judith Leah Rabinowitz, daughter of Rabbi and Mrs. Stanley Rabinowitz of Washington, was married there at noon yesterday to Amnon Argaman, son of Mrs. Zalman Argaman of JeKusalem and the late Mr. Argaman.

title: Hurricane Watches Are Posted In New York and New England
description: Meteorologists of the National Weather Service advised residents of the New York metropolitan area last night to keep watch on a hurricane moving northward off the Atlantic coast that could drench the city and suburbs with torrential rains some time today or tonight.

title: Theodore Eisenberg Weds Karen Rogoff
description: Karen Sue Rogoff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Solomon Rogoff of Cedar Grove, N.J., was married yesterday evening in Temple Beth Shalom in Livingston, N.J., to Theodore Mark Eisenberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Eisenberg of West Orange, N.J. Rabbi Harold Mozeson performed the ceremony.

title: Box Scores of Major League Games
description: Monday, August 9, 1976

title: 9 DIE AS TRAIN HITS SUNDAY SCHOOL BUS
description: STRATTON, Neb., Aug. 8 (AP)A freight train traveling 60 miles an hour struck a Sunday school bus today, killing a minister, his wife and seven children.

title: New Head of Yeshiva U. Norman Lamm
description: Dr. Norman Lamma philosopher, author, teacher and chemist who became a rabbi is not one to quail before an academic or a religious controversey. Although an articulate spokesman man for Orthoin the dox Judaism, he was in the foreNews ground in his demand that Orthodox synagogue groups cooperate with bodies of Reform and Conservative Judaism in problems confronting the American Jewish community.

title: Yankee Atom Plant Back
description: VERNON, Vt., Aug. 8 (AP)The Vermont Yankee nuclear power plant resumed operations today after having been shut down seven weeks for refueling and routine maintenance. Meanwhile, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission has asked a federal court for two more weeks, time to answer questions about the plant's operating license.

title: KISSINGER MEETS PAKISTANI LEADER ON NUCLEAR ISSUE
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, Aug. 8Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger arrived here tonight for talks with Prime Minister Zulfikar All Bhutto aimed at averting a crisis caused by Pakistan's refusal to drop plans to develop its own nuclear reprocessing plant despite intense American nressure.

title: U. S. SEES A ROLE IN INDIA'S ABLAST
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger has acknowledged that it is highly probable that material supplied by the United States was used by India to become the sixth nation in the world to explode a nuclear device.

title: Redman Wins
description: LEXINGTON, Ohio, Aug. 8 (AP)Brian Redman shrugged off the mechanical problems that had plagued him in the last three races of the Formula 5000 series and sped to a 28.9second victory over a fellow Briton, Jackie Oliver, at MidOhio Sports Car Course today.

title: Washington and Business
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8When it comes to speaking out on politicsor even to speaking in whisperscaptains of American business and industry seem not to be acting much like captains courageous these days.

title: World Team Tennis
description: SATURDAY NIGHT'S MATCHES New Ycrk 24, Indiana 21 (overtime). Hawaii 29, Cleveland 23.

title: Sanitation Men on Overtime
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 8 (UPI)  Sanitation employees will work overtime again tomorrow to clean up trash that accumulated during a 37day work slowdown. The city said it reached a tentative agreement Friday night with the union representing nonuniformed employees. Trash collectors worked overtime shifts yesterday and today.

title: Libyan Denial
description: CAIRO, Aug. 8 (AP)In the Libyan capital, the Government press agency denied today that Libya had had anything to do with the blasts in the Egyptian capital. It has become a routine practice for Sadat's regime to blame the Libyan Arab Re1 public for all his internal problems, the agency said in a commentary from Tripoli.

title: M.D.'s for Everyone
description: In all the continuing furor about the admission of minority and other disadvantaged students to medical school, there is a pervasive moral and social irrelevance.

title: The Dance
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Aug. 8The American Dance Festival ended its season at Connecticut College last night with a premiere by the Murray Louis Dance Company set to a commissioned score by Dave Brubeck. The composer's son Darius Brubeck and his musicians played the score live before making the recording that will be used in the future for the new work, Glances.

title: Man Killed After 2 Are Shot
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Aug.8 (AP)The police shot and killed an Agawam man today after his former wife and another man were wounded at her home. The police said they arrived to investigate a shooting report and found Charles Jones, 31 years old, holding a semiautomatic rifle. They said he opened fire at them, and they shot him. His recently divorced wife, Mary Jones, 28, and Raymond Gallus, 28, were in critical condition.

title: People Come
description: The opening of Let My People. Come at the Morosco theater has been postponed until further notice. The show was to have had its. Broadway premiere Wednesday, but the producers announced yesterday the need for extra sets and choreographed numbers, Previews will continue.

title: Yorkie Named Best For 2d Day in Row
description: MANCHESTER CENTER, Vt. Aug. 8In shadow of :majestic Mount Equinox, a tiny toy loomed large today when he was named best in show for the second day in a row at the Bennington County event at the Fair Grounds. He was Ch. Trivar's Suds Sipper, a 2yearold Yorkshire terrier owned by Johnny Robinson and Morris Howard of Potomac, Md.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, AUGUST 9, 1976

title: Amy Ruth Reisen Wed to Lawyer
description: Amy Ruth Reisen and Lawrence Jay Freundlich, were married yesterday afternoon at the home of her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Clarence Reisen of South Orange, N.J. The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Jackson Freundlich also of South Orange. Rabbi Alexander Shapiro performed the ceremony.

title: Crime Figure, Linked to Plot on Castro, Found Slain
description: MIAMI, Aug. 8 (AP)The body of John Roselli, a key figure with San Giancana, the slain Chicago mobster. in a Central Intelligence Agency plan to assassinate Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba, has been found in a chainwrapped 55gallon drum floating in Biscayne Bay.

title: REPORT SAYS ISRAEL ARMS SOUTH AFRICA
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 8 (AP) Israel is building two longrange gunboats armed with seatosea missiles for the South African Navy, according to the state radio.

title: DOWNWARD TREND FOR RATES LIKELY
description: Now that the credit markets have dispatched the Treasury's $10.8 billion August refunding with the greatest of ease, there is little to keep interest rates from moving downward for several weeks. That, at least, seems to be the outlook that dominated the credit markets late last week. The volume of Government and corporate financing to be done between now and Labor Day shbuld be easily handled, investment bankers said.

title: COAL GASIFICATION  IS FOUGHT IN UTAH
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 8Conservationists, who sometimes apply their birdwatching talents to legal documents, are moving to head off a possible revival in modified form of the controversial coalfired power plant project once planned for the scenic Kaiparowits Plateau in southern Utah.

title: SCOOP ON VIKING I BACK IN OPERATION
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 8A balky soilsampling boom aboard the Viking 1 Lander on Mars was put back into operation yesterday, project officials reported today.

title: New River Rescue
description: The famed New River of North Carolina comes up for a new lease on life today as the House of Representatives votes on legislation to protect that remarkable pordon of the nation's scenic river system. By an unexpectedly strong margin, the House Rules Committee voted 10 to 6 last week to send the measure to the House floor; utility and labor lobbyists were thwarted in their maneuvers to keep the item bottled up, and thus let construction of a massive hydroelectric storage project run its ruinous course.

title: Life for the Soviet Woman Is All Hard Work and Little Status
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 6Soviet women are bulldozer drivers and ditch diggers, doctors and judges, and occasionally even jet pilots and ship captains. But are they liberated?

title: 2 Killed in Paris Subway
description: PARIS, Aug. 8 (AP)  A plainclothes subway agent and a uniformed policeman died in an exchange of bullets in a subway station near the Eiffel Tower early today.

title: TIRED HARRIS JURY TAKES SUNDAY OFF
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 8The jurors in the trial of William and Emily Harris suddenly canceled their scheduled ninth clay of deliberations today after informing the court bailiff that they were tired and exhausted from eight days of work on the case.

title: General Motors Plans Big Newspaper Splash
description: The General Motors Corporation, which will be introducing more model changes this fall than any of the other automobile manufacturers, is going to make a big advertising splash in newspapers in hopes of convincing consumers that its changes are in the right direction.

title: British Soldier Is Killed By Booby Trap in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug 8 (AP)A 19yearold (British soldier was killed in South Armagh today when boobytrapped bicycle ho was inspecting blew up. The police said that the bicycle frame had been packed with exolosives.

title: Miss Epstein Is Bride
description: Barbara Joan Epstein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Morris Epstein of the Bronx, was married last evening to Thomas Alan Wieder, son of Mrs. Morris Salzberg of Garden City, L. I., and the late Hardy Wieder. The Rev. William R. Spence, pastor of Emanuel Baptist Church in the Bronx, performed the ceremony at the Roslyn (L.I.) Country Club.

title: Arab League and O.A.U. to Investigate Sudan's Charge of Libyan Invasion
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan Aug. 8The Arab League and the Organization of African Unity disclosed today that they were contacting member countries to form a joint commission to investigate the Sudan's charge that it was invaded by Libya last month.

title: Rain Hits B.C. Golf; Windup Set Today
description: ENDICOTT, N.Y., Aug. 8 (AP)A late afternoon downpour forced suspension of play in the fourth round of the B.C. open golf tournament with the leaders, Bob Gilder and Bob Wynn, stranded at the 17th tee.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: KELLEY DECEIVED ON F.B.I. BREAKINS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Clarence M. Kelley, director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, said today that he had been deliberately deceived by aides who withheld from him knowledge of a number of illegal burglaries carried out by the bureau's agents in recent years.

title: Japan's Economy Rebounding As Exports to U.S. Increase; But Capital Outlays Have Not Risen, Causing Worry
description: TOKYO Aug. 8 Japan's powerful economy, after two years of the worst recession in almost a quarter century, appears well on the way to recovery nowthanks to, among other things, American drivers and television viewers.

title: Wilbur
description: AUGUSTA, N. J., Aug. 8Just Plain Wilbur was in a class by himself today and won the $5,000 added Sussex County open jumper classic with two clean rounds at the concluding session of the week  long Sussex County Horse Show.

title: Soweto Is Calm With Police on Guard
description: JOHANNESBURG. Aug. 9Large police contingents were on guard in the black township of Soweto early today against any move by youths to renew the attacks on transportation systems that kept large numbers of black workers away from their jobs in this South African city last week.

title: Connors Advances to Final
description: NORTH CONWAY, N.H., Aug. 8The experts here had today's tennis match all sketched out before k started: Jimmy Connors would jauntily stride into the gem of a stadium that is carved into the base of Mount Cranmore, play a few brisk games with Zeljko Franulovic, win easily, then rest for the remainder of the day in preparation for tomorrow's final against Raul Ramirez in the $100,000 Volvo international tennis tournament.

title: ABORTION DEBATE HEATS UP IN ITALY
description: ROME, Aug. 8The theological and legal questions surrounding abortion have become a major issue here following the escape last month of ,highly poisonous chemical from a factory near the northern city of Milan.

title: 100,000 at World
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 8At once damp and fervent, loud and pious, more than 100,000 worshipers gathered in and around John F. Kennedy Stadium here today after a morning rain and heard Pope Paul VI and President Ford affirm the importance of Christian values.

title: French Bishop in Clash With. Vatican
description: PARIS, Aug. 8The case of Bishop Marcel Lefebvre, the French churchman suspended by Pope Paul VI for offering mass in Latin in defiance of Vatican orders to use the local language, has been stirring heated discussion across France.

title: Doubts About Swine Flu
description: In a letter published today, Prof. Edwin D. Kilbourne of Mount Sinai School of Medicine rebukes this newspaper for its skeptical view of the Ford Administration's projected swine flu vaccination program. He raises the specter of a swine flu pandemic next winter and asks whether, if this occurs, will The Times be proud of its role in stimulating public doubt about the vaccination program and the motives of those sponsoring it. The simple answer to his question is yes. Having no power of command, our function is to stimulate thought and discussion.

title: Jill S. Bernstein Married to Student
description: The marriage of Jill Susan Bernstein .to Richard John Lesko took place yesterday at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Bruce P. Bernstein of New Rochelle, N.Y. Mr. Lesko is a son of Lieut. dol. John P. Lesko; retired Air Force chaplain, and Mrs. Lesko *of Allentown, Pa. Rabbi Samuel Silver and the Rev. Donald Wisse, pastor of the Christian Reformed Church in Midland Park, N.J., officiated.

title: White Sox Barely

This was revealed yesterday when Bill Veeck's team appeared in short pants, accompanied by wolfwhistles from the stands in the opening game of a doubleheader against the Kansas City Royals in Chicago.

title: Mets Top Pirates, 74, As Lolich Notches 7th
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 8The Mets completed a highly successful visit to this drizzly city today. defeating the Pirates, 74, to win three of four games against the team just ahead of them in the standinz.

title: Books of The Times
description: One of the Gerhardt's children of the title of Jerrold Mundis's novel finds himself being subsumed into his inlaws clan and, in the grip of nostalgia and tribal reaffirmation, starts a family newsletter. His father, Gerhardt Sproul, is now nearsenile and packed away in a nursing home; his grandmother, Idalla, is dead and the once solidly clannish Sprouls, whom their iron bands of authority held together, are now scattered. This is a commonenough condition among American families of the third or fourth generation; we seem to approximate the last chapters of Buddenbrooks rather than the Adams chronicles. The founding generation dies off, the younger generation moves away and loses touch; funerals become the only reunions, where once holidays filled houses to overflowing. Thus the Sproul newsletter reminded me that in my own family there were two cousins who announced their intention of writing family histories of their respective branches; it was the same kind of tribal reaffirmation in the midst of dispersal.

title: On Horsing Around With Nature
description: Phil Bieber read about Del Miller's mare, Meadow Bright, racing in the recent International Trot at Roosevelt Raceway while carrying a foal by Speedy Count, and this set him thinking about sex.

title: HardHat Moderation
description: No industry was harder hit by the recession than construction. None is recovering more slowly. An important part of the explanation for the industry's depressed state lies in the inflationary wage standards and restrictive work rules enforced by the monopolistic building trades unions, especially in the big urban centers. Nowhere has this pressure been more suffocating than in New York City, where high labor costs have combined with high land and financing charges and high taxes to make both residential and commercial construction almost insupportably expensive.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Federal report indicating the presence of cancercausing agents around five North Jersey industrial plants has prompted the State Department of Environmental Protection to increase airmonitoring operations throughout the state. The report by the Federal Environmental Protection Agency was the initial study into reasons why New Jersey has the highest rate of cancer deaths in the country. The state's airmonitoring efforts will seek to determine the extent of any connection between industrial chemicals and cancer deaths.

title: Britain in Transition: II

Without a written constitution to expound as higher law, they have a duty to enforce whatever Parliament enactsto the letter. If statute deprives a citizen of fundamental rights, the courts cannot help him. Nor, usually, will they consider whether an administrator has acted fairly.

title: RIOTING SPREADS IN SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 9Police officers shot and killed two black youths today as unrest spread from Soweto to at least I 1 other black areas, but Prime Minister John Vorster insisted that the Government of South Africa would not be railroaded into panic action by the upheaval.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Rioting in. South Africa spread yesterday from Soweto, where it recently originated, to at least 11 other black areas. There were attacks on schools, Government offices and commuter buses. The police opened fire in at least three townships and in Alexandra they killed two youths who, the police said, had attacked a police vehicle. The worst of the trouble was in Soweto and in Alexandra, where gangs of youths renewed their attempts to stop blacks from going to work for white employers in Johannesburg. The gangs set up roadblocks to halt commuter buses and stoned the buses. In the meantime, Prime Minister John Vorster, in a South African magazine interview, said the country was in a serious situation, but that it was not critical, as South African opponents of apartheid have suggested. He said the Government would listen to black protests, but would not permit an insurrection. [Page 1, Column 5.]

title: Books of The Times
description: An endless pubcrawl would afford the best lesson in England's heritage and history. What other country has painted its story in the streets, hung the pictures at every corner, avery roadside and village, like a continuous tapestry, and captioned them with wit, rhyme and comment? From the ubiquitous Green Man (preChristian) to the unique Dog and Trumpet (1970's), England's every square mile is a vast openair museum, detailing its own geography, topography, military history, heraldry; its personalities, birds and beasts, occupations and snorts.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A judge in Paterson said yesterday that Rubin (Hurricane) Carter violated a gag order last month when pickets from an organization supporting him in his retrial on triple murder charges paraded in front of the Passaic County Courthouse. But Judge William J. Marchese of Passaic County Court also said in his opinion that he would not penalize Mr. Carter because he did not think the demonstration, three months before the Sept. 27 trial date, would influence a possible jury. Judge Marchese also concluded that Passaic County Prosecutor Burrell I. Humphreys did not violate the same gag order by speculating to one reporter that a mail bomb sent to a former investigator might have something to do with the Carter case.

title: Steve Cady
description: It couldn't have happened at a better time. The Yankees lose again to the Orioles, see their lead slashed below 10 gamesand fire off a petulant telegram to the American League president complaining about certain umpires being assigned to such a crucial series. Crucial series? It almost seems like a normal August. As any baseball fan worth his bubblegum knows, August means pennant races. This is the time of year when pitchers should be reaching back for that little extra something, when one crucial series should be following another, a time for baseball heroes to stand Sports up and be counted. Since 1969, when the of majors divided their two leagues into four the Time. divisions to avoid boring runaways and double the fun, it has usually worked out that way. Few summers have passed without at least one or two good pennant races. But four times nothing equals nothing, and that's what has been worrying baseball executives this summer. With the Yankees, Reds, Royals and Phillies rolling like Jimmy Carter, beachgoing fans have been paying more attention to bikinis than to the latest baseball chatter pouring from the nearest radio.

title: WILLIAM GORMAN OF GIMBELS DIES
description: William B. Gorman, former general manager of Gimbels New York and assistant secretary of Gimbel Brothers, parent company of the department store group, died Saturday in the Miami Heart Institute. He was 75 years old and had been living in Tequesta. Fla., for several years.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, AUGUST 10, 1976

title: Are Given a Stay of Sentence in Yonkers Attack
description: Lawyers for five young men1 convicted of conspiracy and as1 sault in a baseballbat attack on another youth in Yonkers five years ago won a stay of execution yesterday of the sentences the youths were to have begun serving today, pending !decisions in two separate apioeals.

title: Youths Pitching In to Save Parks
description: In Morningside Park, teenagers who have no gardens of their own have learned that weeds steal nourishment from desirable plants. In Astoria Park in Queens, adults have stopped throwing trash into the pool because they watched the teenagers working so hard to clean it out.

title: HURRICANE SWEEPS ACROSS L. I., GOES ON TO POUND CONNECTICUT; JERSEY ESCAPES BRUNT OF STORM
description: Hurricane Belle smashed across Long Island into Connecticut early this morning, as its winds of mere than 100 miles an hour uprooted trees, knocked out electricity and drove thousands of residents from flooded homes.

title: Many Businesses Are Taking a Plunge Into the Van Pool
description: SOUTH PLAINFIELD, N.J., Aug. 3Van pool, son of car pool, is packing them in here at the Prudential Insurance Company and a growing list of other locations around the country.

title: Terms Seton LubrizolMarine Merger
description: The Lubrizol Corporation of Cleveland, Ohio, announced yesterday that terms have been set for its previous announced acquisition of Marine Colloids Inc.

title: Team Canada Looks to Summer Game
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 9The acrid smell of fresh paint filled the Montreal Forum today where workmen were hastily brightening the rouge, blanc and bleu seats. The paint will barely have time to lose its stickiness when hockey's zealous fans settle in every available seat to cheer on Team Canada.

title: Communists
description: ROME, Aug. 9 (AP)A professor of art history who ran on the Communist ticket was selected Rome's mayor tonight by the City Council, completing a Marxist takeover of the major city halls in Italy.

title: Steinfeldt Wins At Horseshoes
description: BRISTOL, Pa., Aug. 9 (AP) Carl Steinfeldt of Rochester, N.Y., came back to take the final two matches of a twoofthree playoff against Curt Day of Frankfort, Ind., late yesterday to win the world horseshoe pitching tournament.

title: Rocket Firing Helps Viking 2 Ad just Orbit for Landing Photos
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 9 A sixsecond rocket firing today trimmed the orbital course of Viking 2 around Mars so that the craft could begin taking, within a few days, the photo, graphs and infrared measurements needed to help select its landing site on the planet.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: A $42 million demonstration project, which sponsoring organizations said could lead to the introduction of commercial fuel cell power plants within 10 years, was announced yesterday in Palo Alto, Calif., by the Electric Power Research Institute.

title: Pianist Klien's Mozart Is Clear and Controlled
description: There are at least a dozen pianists appearing during the Mostly Mozart Festival this summer, which means at least.12 different approaches to the composer's keyboard music. Mozart's writing for the piano is so clear, so open, so precisely balanced that no two musicians ever weigh all the elements and arrive at exactly the same proportions. At his recital Sunday night in Tully Hall, Walter Klien presented his view of the composer and, given the basically lightweight manner of his approach, this was marvelous Mozart playing with neither one note out of place nor one musical idea misjudged. Mr. Klien's technical control is immaculate, his articulation of staccato or legato passages is impeccable, his tone is invariably sweet.

title: Hospital NonSolution
description: The weekend agreement that ended the fourday municipal hospital strike postpones but cannot avert and may ultimately aggravate a sorry day of reckoning for the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation and many of its employees.

title: Stever Is Confirmed as Head of Science Office and Ford Adviser
description: Dr. H. Guyford Stever, head of the National Science Foundation, was confirmed by the Senate yesterday as director of the new Office of Science and Technology Policy. In that role he will serve as science adviser to President Ford.

title: Citibank Sues ExIm Bank And Agent on Zaire Loan
description: Citibank said yesterday that it was suing the ExportImport Bank and its agent, the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, for attempting to arrange a preferential repayment facility for ExIm Bank loans to Zaire. Citibank filed the suit in the United States District court.

title: Tonight's Entries at Yonkers
description: Horses listed In order of cost positions Letter Designates OTB listing

title: CORRECTION
description: The Arts and Leisure Guide in The New York Times on Sunday incorrectly listed Skitch Henderson as appearing at Michael's Pub this week.

title: BANKRUPTCY AID FOR ABERCROMBIE
description: Chapter XI Petition Granted to SportingGoods Retailer

title: Spain Signs Accord For $1 Billion Loan
description: MADRID, Aug. 9 (Reuters)Spain signed an agreement tonight for a loan of $1 billion from major foreign and Spanish banks to bolster its sagging economy.

title: Guns and People
description: The gun lobby is fond of proclaiming that guns don't kill people; people kill people.

title: Morton Favors Connally As Ford's Campaign Head
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9President Ford may appoint John B. Connally as chairman of his election campaign if he chooses someone other than the former Texas Governor as a running mate, wellplaced officials said today.

title: Partying in Saratoga, Whitney Style
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS. N.Y. Give Mary Lou Whitney a reason for a partyany old reason  and she'll stage something spectacular. Give her two reasonssay her daughter's 21st birthday and her country's 200th anniversarvwell. you can imaeine!

title: Yankees
description: BATTING

title: Carter Is Rebuffed in House on Voter Registration
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Jimmy Carter visited Capitol Hill seeking Congressional support today, and members of the House of Representatives promptly handed him his first legislative defeat.

title: Hayes vs. Recruit Charge
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 9 (AP)The National Collegiate Athletic Association and Big Ten officials say they will investigate charges of recruiting violations against Ohio State that have been made by the student newspaper at Michigan State University.

title: Officials at Prison And Young Inmates Scored in Slayings
description: WASHINGTON, AUG. 9 (AP) Haphazard management and a growing proportion of hardened young criminals contributed to a series of murders and assaults at one of the most dangerous Federal prisons in the (nation, a board of inquiry reported today.

title: FRANK MARIANO, 45; ABC CORRESPONDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP)  Frank Mariano, a Vietnam war correspondent for ABC News, died last night of complications following heart surgery. He was 45 years old.

title: France Is Critical of U.S.
description: PARIS, Aug. 9The Foreign Ministry called in the United States Embassy here today to express surprise and displeasure at American efforts to block the sale of a uranium reprocessing plant to Pakistan, an embassy spokesman said.

title: Morton Favors Connally As Ford's Campaign Head
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 9President Ford may appoint John B. Connally as chairman of his election campaign if he chooses someone other than the former Texas Governor as a running mate, wellplaced officials said today.

title: Thousands Evacuated From Fire Island
description: BAY SHORE, L.I., Aug. 9Thousands of residents of Fire Island, the barrier beach along the South Shore of Suffolk County, stepped off ferries today, carrying cats, dogs, babies and luggage and leaving the 35milelong island to hurricane Belle.

title: Senate Passes $104 Billion Defense Bill But Delays Money to Buy Three B1's
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) The Senate passed a $104billion defense appropriation bill today, deferring $1 billion for the purchase of the first three B1 bombers until after Feb. 1.

title: Van Pools Are Replacing Car Pools for Many Companies
description: SOUTH PLAINFIELD, N.J., Aug. 3Van pool, son of car pool, is packing them in here at the Prudential Insurance Company and a growing list of other locations around the country.

title: Gales and Rain Strike South Jersey Shore
French  Music Festival Seeks Informality
description: VENCE, FranceThe truck pulled into the tiny Place Godeau in the middle of the sonata, and the young men jumped out. Some of them began stringing long wires and installing microphones and loudspeakers, while others passed around a handbill advertising Operation Rhino. an itinerant summer festival of improvised music to take place at 11 P.M. in front of the town hall.

title: Head of State Arts Council Resigns
description: Less than a week after declaring that she would absolutely not resign as chairman of the State Council on the Arts. Joan K. Davidson left the post yesterday, saying that she did so at the request of Governor Carey.

title: Teamsters Fund Sues 2 Concerns, Alleging Fraud
description: The Principal Pension Fund of the international Brotherhood of Teamsters filed an $18million suit in Federal District Court in Chicago yesterday against an Oklahoma insurance company and its wholly owned subsidiary:

title: Computer Will Save Fuel On G.M.'s 77 Toronado
description: DETROIT, Aug. 9  The General Motors Corporation announced today its 1977 model Oldsmobile Toronado cars would use an onboard digital computer to provide electronic control of the sparkplug firings in the engine and thus improve fuel economy.

title: 3M Replaces Anaconda On Dow Jones Average
description: The makeup of the Dow Jones average of 30 industrial stocks was changed yesterday to substitute the Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Company for the Anaconda Company, Dow Jones & Company announced.

title: New Layoff Fears Confront Hospitals
description: Officials from the city and state governments and the municipal hospital system warned yesterday that more layoffs of hospital employees would be necessary in less than five months unless the system could achieve savings in its operations or produce new revlenues from outside sources.

title: Brazilian Oil Imports Rise
description: RIO DE JANEIRO. Aug. 9 (UPI)  Brazilian oil imports during the first half of 1976 increased 8.4 percent from the first half of 1975, according to government statistics. Import increased in volume to 151.8 million barrels in the first six months of 1976 from 127.4 million barrels in the yearearlier level.

title: Space 1999
description: One of the threats to the network program schedules last year was a syndicated British sciencefiction series called Space: 1999, about a group of earth explorers trapped on the Moon as it hurtles out of the Earth's orbit and travels endlessly through outer space.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 9 (UPI)The dollar was mixed on European money markets today, with a rally by the French franc the main interest in a quiet market. The price of gold was virtually unchanged. It closed at $112.85 in Zurich, the same as Friday, and rose 20 cents to $112.875 in London.

title: Pro Transactions
description: ATIANTA (NL)Placed Bift Pocoroba, catcncr, on disabled list for season with les injury.
