description: BASEBALL

title: People and Business
description: Prime Minister James Callaghan raised the possibility in a weekend interview that Britain, which must repay standby credits of $5.3 billion to major industrial countries by Dec. 9, might have to seek a loan from the International Monetary Fund.

title: Helping New York
description: Voice of the Tenants Is Making Itself Felt

title: Lemon and Roberts Among Six Inducted Into Hall of Fame
description: COOPERSTOWN, N. Y., Aug. 9I was waiting for the day Bob Lemon would receive this recognition, said Bob Feller, the onetime fastball pitcher for the Cleveland Indians, after Lemon, four other former players and a former umpire had been inducted into baseball's Hall of Fame today.

title: Notes on People
description: State Energy Post Is Given to Sawhill

title: Steelers Beat Eagles, 14 to 7
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. (AP)A pair of rookie running backs, Jack Deloplaine and Tommy Reamon, led 72yard, fourthperiod touchdown drive that carried the Pittsburgh Steelers to a 147 victory over the Philadelphia Eagles tonight. The National Football League exhibition game was played before 16823 in a driving rain and strong wind from Hurricane Belle.

title: Some Areas in Connecticut Evacuated
description: The advance winds and heavy rains of Hurricane Belle began lashing the Connecticut shoreline this morning as the heart of the storm was still pushing across Long Island. Thousands of families had evacuated coastal areas in advance of the hurricane and had taken shelter in schools, churches and community centers.

title: Ford vs. Carter On Jobs
description: President Ford said the other day that the major accomplishment of his Administration had been a turnaround in the economy, with both inflation and unemployment having been reduced.

title: Aeronutronic Expected to Win Satellite Bid
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 9 The Aeronutronic Ford Corporation, based chiefly on the West Coast, is expected to win a contract of about $250 million to build the next, largercapacity generation of global communications satellites.

title: Dibbs Vanquishes Gullikson, 75, 63
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 9 (AP)  Fifthseeded Eddie Dibbs fell behind early in both sets today but rallied to beat Tim Gullikson, 75, 63, in the first round of the $157,000 United States claycourt tennis tournament.

title: Coop City Guard Indicted In Hand cuffed Man's Death
description: A private guard at the Coop City housing project in the Bronx was indicted for manslaughter yesterday in what authorities called the accidental shooting death of a handcuffed and unresisting 20  year  old prisoner the guard was trying to impress with his gun.

title: House Majority Leader Backs Abzug Candidacy
description: Representative Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., Democrat of Massachusetts, the House majority leader, said yesterday that he would be out there working and voting for Bella Abzug for the United States Senate if he were a resident of New York State.

title: Jews Boycotting an ArabOwned London Hotet,
description: LONDON, Aug. 9The Dorchester Hotel, which was bought a few weeks ago by wealthy Arabs, is losing some of its Jewish clients, a spokesman said today.

title: Private Universities and Private Enterprise
description: PRINCETON, N.J.In recent years, several prominent Americans have complained that leading private universities are hostile to free enterprise, and have advised their colleagues not to make gifts to institutions that do not support our economic system. These remarks have bred unhealthy tensions between groups that in fact have much in common.

title: U.S. Asks Figures On Costs and Profit Of 77 Car Models
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UPI) The Government asked the big four auto manufacturers today to provide projected cost, profit and sales figures for their 1977 model cars.

title: Turks Alert Army After Neut Protest By Greece on Ship
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Aug. 9 (AP)Several units of Turkey's military forces were put in a state of advanced preparedness today after Greece pro1 tested for the second time the activities of a Turkish survey ship in the Aegean Sea, reliable sources said.

title: DR. H.H. LONG DIES; HEAD OF COLLEGE
description: Dr. Herman H. Long, president of Talladega College in Talladega, Ala., whose pioneering studies in race relations have significantly influenced intergroup relations in much of the United States, died Sunday night at the Citizens Hospital in Talladega afer an illness of several weeks. He was 64 years old.

title: Ohio Plant to Build Tanks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) The Army announced today that it planned to reopen a Governmentowned Plant in Lima, Ohio, for the first production of its advanced XM1 tank. Officials estimated that the Lima plant would employ from 1,200 to 1,500 workers.

title: Island Damage in Millions; Thousands Are Evacuated
description: Thousands of Long Islanders from lowlying shore areas left their homes and spent the night With relatives and friends or in public shelters as Hurricane Belle cut its soggy swath across the islandthe first hurricane to do so in IQ years.

title: In Memoriam
description: BIRDOFFCharles, dear Dad, why did YOU leave me? Miss you so much.

title: Bonds Sidelined After Surgery
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Aug. 9 (AP)Bobby Bonds, a California Angels outfielder, underwent successful surgery on his right hand today, an Angels spokesman said.

title: Outlook for Food Export Dims
description: Despite the devastating drought in Europe this year and the continuing hunger that afflicts much of the rest of the globe, the outlook for exports of basic foodstuffs has dimmed in recent weeks. This was indicated by the latest weekly Government exnort

title: Bring Back the Bombs
description: Three decades after Hiroshima, only the five countries that are permanent members of the United Nations Security Council have become atomic weapons powers; but a great divide was crossed in May 1974.

title: IronOre Contract Planned
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 9 (UPI)  Brazil and Japan are expected to sign a contract for the supply of 300 million tons of iron ore, over a 20year period, when President Ernesto Geisel of Brazil visits Japan in September. the Jornal do Brasil reported. The newspaper said the contract was valued at $3.6 billion.

title: Carter Tells Consumers He Hopes to Rival Nader
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Jimmy Carter told a luncheon, forum today that he hoped toi challenge Ralph Nader soon, for the title of top consumer advocate in the country.

title: Nonprofit Mail Permit Used For Britannica Advertising
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) For the second time this year, the Encyclopaedia Britannica has sent out thousands of advertising brochures under a private group's nonprofit mail permit, the Postal Service says.

title: Jose Lezama Dies at 65; Cuban Author and Poet
description: HAVANA, Aug. 9 (Reuters)  The Cuban author and poet, Jose Lezama Lima, author of Paradise, died here today. He was 65.

title: Woman Slain in Montclair
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J., Aug 9 (AP)A 23yearold woman was shot twice in the cast and killed last night, the police said. name of the victim was withheld pending notification or next of kin. The police said they found a man at the scent, ail apartment at 7 Oxford Street, but he was incoherent and was hospitalized. They said the man, whose identity they cljd not release, would be questioned later.

title: Residents of Sea Bright Pull Out
description: SEA BRIGHT, N.J., Aug. 9 We have people who say, If my house goes I want to go with it, but they leave when the water gets up to here, said Cyril Smack, holding his index finger under his nose.

title: U.S. ORDERS CHECK ON COMMODITIES
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 9 (AP)United States Attorney Samuel K. Skinner announced today the appointment of a special unit to investigate allegations of market fixing by traders at the Chicago Board of Trade and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange.

title: Sir Winston Scott Is Dead; Barbados Governor General
description: BRIDGETOWN, Barbados, Aug. 9 (AP)The Governor General, Sir Winston Scott, of Barbados collapsed and died today at Government House, officials said. He was 76.

title: Tomahawk Missile Fired
description: POINT MUGU, Calif., Aug. (UPI)The Navy's Tomahawk cruise missile made its eighth successful test flight yesterday, the Navy announced today. The missile was launched by an A6 jet plane and covered 380 miles on a 44minute flight over the Pacific Missile Test Center.

title: Chess
description: MALAGA, Spain, Aug. 8The irregular progress of Mikhail Tal of the Soviet Union through the Interzonal Tournament in Biel, Switzerland, shows most clearly how morale affects a player's results.

title: SOVIET COUP ROLE HINTED BY SUDAN
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Aug. 9President Gaafar alNimeiry indicated today that he thought the Soviet Union was behind an attempt last month, sponsored by Libya, to overthrow his Government.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Aug. 9State environmental officials said today that there is no cause for alarm at recent disclosures that cancercausing air near seven chemicalagents had been found in the industrial plants in North Jersey.

title: Wynn Takes Golf by Shot After Delay
description: ENDICOTT, N.Y., Aug. 9 (UPI)Bob Wynn, drawing on the experience gained during six years on the pro circuit, won the raindelayed $200,000 B.C. open golf tournament today by a stroke from a rookie, Bob Gilder, and registered his first tour victory.

title: Baker to Ask F.B.I. and C.I.A. For Data on Murder of Roselli
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UPI) Senator Howard H. Baker. Republican of Tennessee, said today he would ask the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agency to provide any information they had regarding the murder of John Roselli, an underworld figure who had testified he made several attempts under the direction of the C.I.A. to assassinate Cuban Premier Fidel Castro.

title: Long Islanders Pull Out From Vulnerable Areas
description: Thousands of Long Islanders were evacuated from vulnerable shore areas as the first hurricane in 16 years struck the island last night.

title: Silvery White DelectableAnd Cheap
description: Silvery whitings with their delicately flavored, snowwhite flesh, are among the few genuine bargains Still to be found in fish markets.

title: Few Complaints Follow Riviera Theft
description: NICE, France, Aug. 5Fewer than half the people whose safe deposit boxes were emptied in the big bank breakin here July 18 have filed complaints, accordine to the police.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: Article 11  No Title

title: Pennsylvania Bans Shipment of Swine
description: TRENTON, Aug. 10 (AP)The State Department of Agriculture announced today that an embargo on the ship merit or sale of all New Jersey swine except those destined for slaughter has been declared by Pennsylvaia.

title: Ford Is Backed on EarlyBallot Switches
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. IC Supporters of President Ford won an easy preliminary victory today by persuading a Republican committee to adopt a new party rule barring early ballot switches from one candidate to another by tielegate bound by state law.

title: Congress Votes Flu Vaccine Liability Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10On the eve of its recess for the Republican National Convention Congress passed legislation today to end the impasse over liability insurance that has caused serious delays in the national immunization program against swine type influenza.

title: A Pacific Hurricane Whirls To Northwest Off Mexico
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 10 (UPI) A hurricane whirled toward the northwest off the Pacific coast of Mexico today, carrying 115mileanhour winds, the National Weather Service said.

title: Annexation by Richmond Of White Suburbs Upheld
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (AP) A threejudge Federal court today upheld the annexation of 23 square miles of largely white suburbs by Richmond, Va., six years ago. Blacks had challenged the move on the groundg that it violated the Voting Rights Act by diluting the votes of the city's blacks.

title: Air Canada Cites Walkout In a Loss of $47.5 Million
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 10 (UPI)Air Canada lost $47.5 million during the six months ended June 30, Claude Taylor, president said today. The beforetax loss was $17.2 million higher than a year ago.

title: Connecticut Apple Crop Hard Hit
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 10Close to 20 percent of the $3.5 million apple crop in Connecticut was lost when the hurricane swept northward through the state and deep into New England today, spending its force.

title: Paul Lucke Is Dead at 61; Held 3 Bonn Cabinet Posts
description: BONN, Aug. 10 (AP)Paul Lucke, who was interior minister in the cabinet of Chancellor Ludwig Erhard, died today following surgery, the Christian Democratic Party said. He was 61 Years old.

title: Bangladeshi Aide Reports Execution of Rebel Leader
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Aug. 10 (Reuters)Col. Abu Taher a onelegged hero of Bangladesh's fight for independence from Pakistan, died on the gallows in Dacca jail last month, the Bangladesh army chief, Maj. Ziaur Rahman said here today.

title: Murder Defense Obtains Kallinger Mental Studies
description: PHILADEPHIA, Aug. 10Judge Ethan Allen Doty of the Court of Common Pleas ordered the court's custodian of psychidtric records today to make some 1972 studies of Joseph Kallinger available to Mr. Kallinger's lawyers in Hackensack, N.J.

title: Payments Bill Termed Effective
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 10Secretary of Commerce Elliot L. Richardson contended today that contrary to the criticisms by Jimmy Carter and others the Ford Administration approach to dealing with the problem of improper corporate payments overseas was an effective approach that could help deter illegal payments.

title: MIRIAM ALBERT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10Miriam Albert, executive director of B'nai B'rith Women, died here today at George Washington Hospital after a brief illness. She was 55 years old. A native of Chicago, where she attended the University of Chicago and Northwestern University, Miss Albert had served since 1959 as the top professional staff member of the 150,000member Jewish women's organization, which has headquarters here. The date of her death marked her 30th anniversary on the staff. She is survived by her mother, Blanche Albert, of Washington, and a sister.

title: Intruder Named Belle Fails to Disturb Good Times at Westhampton Beach
description: WESTHAMPTON BEACH L.I., Aug. 10When the lights went out and the trees came down here, the volunteer firemen in the back room at the firehouse kept playing blackjack, drinking beer and eating what they all agreed were cardboard sandwiches.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Auto insurance premiums for many New Yorkers are doubling this year, but there are ways to cut your premium if you are willing to take some reasonable risks.

title: U.S. Aides Still Lack Access To Priest Held in Argentina
description: WASHINGTON, Aug.10 (Reuters)  The State Department said today that the United States Embassy. In Argentina had still not been able to communicate with the Rev. James M. Weeks, an American Roman Catholic priest arrested a week ago by Argentine soldiers on charges of subversive activity.

title: Grits: Moving North to Appear on Some Very Chic Menus
description: Grits, the cereal that creptswept is more like it into the public consciousness when a Southerner won the Democratic Presidential nomination, are no joke, despite an unfortunate name that lends itself to humor. The name incidentally, is not the lackluster invention of a dimwitted backwoodsman. It stems, rather, according to scholarly sources, from a Middle English word gryt meaning bran and from the Old English grytt. Ditto groats.

title: GRAIN PROSPECTS IMPROVE SOVIET
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10A team of United States observers reported today that they had found better than normal conditions and improved grainproduction prospects while on a threeweek tour of the frequently arid newlands area of The,Soviet Union.

title: EDWARD O'BRIEN PUBLICITY MAN, 58
description: Edward V. O'Brien, public relations executive who publitized the 196465 New York World's Fair, the 1965 visit of Pope Paul VI to the United Nations and other major events in New York City, died yesterday of cancer at St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 58 years old.

title: Official Guilty in Kepone Case
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 10 (UPI)Virgil A. Hundtofte, an executive of Life Science Products Company Inc., pleaded guilty today to a charge of conspiring to violate Federal antipollution laws in the Kepone pesticide poisoning case. Mr. Hundtofte now a resident of Carlsbad N.M., was the first person to plead guilty in the Kepone case brought after the pesticide sickened scores of former Life Science workers and contaminated fish in part of Chesapeake Bay and some of its tributaries.

title: Palmer Notches 15th on 1Hitter
description: Jim Palmer, the American League's Cy Young Award winner twice in the last three seasons, gave up just one hit in hurling the Orioles to a 20 victory over the Minnesota Twins in Baltimore's Memorial Stadium last night.

title: Goldin Scores Awarding Of Pension Job to Lechner
description: Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin said yesterday that he would attempt to block the award of $57,360 worth of city pensionfund consulting contracts to former Budget Director Melvin N. Lechner, who was eased out of office last spring.

title: Mets Are Set to Go to Eat For IncentiveType Pacts
description: The New York Mets opened a sixgame home stand last night by beating the San Diego Padres in soggy Shea Stadium. But their corporate strength was aimed at Phoenix, Ariz., where they will open a major fight tomorrow to change the baseball rules in order to validate Tom Seaver's illegal contract.

title: A.B.A, URGES CURB ON GAG PROCEDURE
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 10  The American Bar Association adopted a controversial resolution today that would require judges to give the press and ;AA public warning before they conduct secret court hearings, seal documents or issue orders restricting lawyers and court personnel from talking to the press.

title: Highly Toxic Chemical Is Being Tested In Mysterious Disease in Pennsylvania
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 10  Scientists investigating the mysterious disease that has killed 27 persons in Pennsylvania began intensive tests today to determine whether a highly toxic chemicalnickel carbonylwas a cause of the outbreak.

title: After Belle
description: Hurricane Belle has left its costly tracks across a wide area of New York, New Jersey and Connecticut but the region has been fortunate in weathering the storm without the extensive loss of life its early fury had threatened.

title: HOTEL FIRE IN PARIS KILLS 11, INJURES 9
description: PARIS, Wednesday, Aug 11 (UPI)Fire roared through a small hotel early today causing panicstricken North African residents to jump screaming into the street. The police said that 11 people were killed possibly including one British touristand nine injured, four critically.

title: Betty Ford Tells Ailey's Dancers She Still Practices
description: Looking resplendent in a Chinesestyle pink gown Betty Ford put her arm around the waist of Judith lamison looking like no slouch herself in a bright red bareback dress that she wears as the lead dancer in Alvin Ailey's ballet, The Mooche.

title: C.A.B. Approves 2% Rise In Domestic Airline Fares
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board approved a 2 percent increase in air fares today for travel within the continental United States, effective next mnoth.

title: New England Spared Fury Of Hurricane's Full Force
description: BOSTON, Aug. 10New En gland watched, waited and prepared for the worst last night, but most of the region was spared the ravages of the hurricane.

title: Ireland Plans Stronger Curbs
description: DUBLIN, Aug. 10 (Reuters)Ireland's Parliiament is to be recalled from its summer recess on Aug. 31 to consider stronger antiterrorist measures.

title: Business Briefs
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 10 (UPI)  A French oil company, Total Indonesie, and a Japanese company, Japex today signed new productionsharing contracts with the Indonesian Government, bringing to five the number companies accepting contract revisions. Three American concernsthe Union Oil Company of California, the Atlantic Richfield Company and the Natomas Company's Independent Indonesian American Petroleum Companyearlier acceded to the Indonesian order, designed to raise the Government's revenues from foreign oil companies operating in Indonesia.

title: IRAN AND BRITAIN PLAN ARMS DEAL
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 10Iran is negotiating with Britain to barter Iranian oil for as much as $600 million in BritishMade arms, according to wellplaced Iranian and Western officials.

title: Meri Sonnett Bride Of Zvi Sharf on L.I.
description: Meri Sonnett and Zvi Sharf were married yesterday evening at the Glen Oaks Club Old Westbury, L. I., by Rabbi Melvin Libman.

title: Family Mourns Lone Victim of Storm
description: FRANKLIN SQUARE, L.I. Aug. 10It was dark in the home of Karen Ann Mayer's parents today.

title: 150 Die in Pakistan Floods; 140,000 Houses Damaged
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug. 10 Flood waters from rainswollen rivers in northern Pakistan have killed more than 150 people and damaged about 140.000 homes, a Government spokesman said tonight.

title: RIOT AREAS CALM IN SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 10Most of the black communities caught up in the upheaval of the past week returned to a normal routine today as the Cabinet met in Pretoria to debate what the Government should do to prevent the unrest from becoming endemic.

title: Powell, as a Justice, Misses Old Friends
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 9  He smiles when he hears the question; the answer is so obyious. Yes, it is a rarefied life. Yes, it is strange.

title: Britons Defer Voyage To U.S. in Leather Boat
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Aug. 10 (AP)The skipper of a leather boat who is trying to prove that an Irish saint discovered America said today he was postponing his voyage across the Atlantic until next spring because of bad weather.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX ADVANCE BY 0.63
description: Stocks on the Americas Stock Exchange scored the big gest gain in almost a month yesterday, with the marke value index closing at 103.86 up 0.63.

title: CLASH OF INTEREST LAID TO U. S. AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10An investigation of the Commerce Department has uncovered scores of officials with financial interests in companies that do business with the agency or are subject to its regulation.

title: Cosmos Rout Toros
description: Giorgio Chinaglia danced headed and kicked on the Yankee Stadium infield last night, scoring five goals and leading the New York Cosmos to an 82 rout of the Miami Toros.

title: New York State Aims 1Shot Ads at Business
description: A oneshot ad campaign by the New York State Department of Commerce to promote the theme, New York Means Business, will appear tomorrow in many major newspapers in New York City and upstate

title: ADY ROSNER,67,DIES; WAS JAZZ MUSICIAN
description: The death in West Berlin Sunday of Ady Rosner, a jazz trumpeter who had been widely acclaimed in the Soviet Union until he was imprisoned there was reported here yesterday. He was 67 years old and had suffered a heart attack.

title: Archbishop Says Inquiry Clears Pallottines on Prayer Charges
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 10 (AP)The Pallottine Fathers hnvei been cleared of accusations that they ignored requests for prayer dedications when the requests contained less than $10.1 the Archbishop of Baltimore says.

title: Backers of Oil Bill Request TV Time To Offset Ad Blitz
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (AP) Backers of a bill to force the breakup of'the nation's 18 largest oil companies asked the Government today to order broadcasters to give them television time to counter what they called an oil industry advertising blitz on television.

title: Giants Vs. Jets Tonight
description: The Giants and Jets will play em one at a time, but starting tonight they'll be playing em one at a time unusally often this week.

title: Goldin Calls for Changes In Bonding of Employees.
description: Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin said yesterday he would ask the Board of Estimate to change the haphazard, overcostly bonding insurance program against losses from theft and negligence by city employees.

title: HURRICANE LEAVES PROPERTY DAMAGE IN THE MILLIONS
description: Hurricane Belle blew into history over New England yesterday, leaving millions of dollars worth of property darriage in the New York metropolitan region but less than had been expected.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEW JERSEY

title: City Calls Cartons Of Juice Better Buy Than Frozen Form
description: City shoppers were advised to save money by the City's Department of Consumer Affairs by buying orange juice and lemonade by the carton rather than in frozen form.

title: Briton Takes 5,000 Race
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 10 (UPI)Brendan Foster of Britain won the 5,000meter run in 13 minutes 26.34 seconds today at the Finnish International Track and Field Games awthe Olympic champion, Lasse head suffering from a head cold, finished seventh in 13:42.1.

title: McCloskey Defends Rigors Of Marine Corps Training;
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (AP) Marine Corps training should be as tough as combat itself, even if some recruits are accidentally injured or killed, Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr. says.

title: L.I. Evacuees Go Back to Homes
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Aug. 10There was a happy calm after the hurricane on Long Island today as thousands returned to their homes and an extensive cleanup began.

title: Williams's Drive Wins; Miller Out
description: BETHESDA, Md., Aug. 10 Evan Williams, a 28yearold club professional from New Jersey, won the national open longdrive championship and a check for $15,000 today with an assist from the touring pro, Hale Irwin.

title: Advice on Filing Claims On Hurricane Damage
description: If Hurricane Belle did not merely whistle by but left a branch through your roof, your car underwater, or soggy steaks in the freezer, your future holds visits with insurance agents and perhaps a barbecue.

title: PAUL LEVINE
description: Paul Levine, an auditor for the United States Accounting Office, died yestordny at Riverside General Hospital, Secaucus, N. J., from injuries received in an automobile accident the day before. He was 32 years old and a resident of Manhattan.

title: Rubber Talks Continue
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (AP)  Negotiators in a 16week rubber strike met with Labor Secretary W. J. Usery Jr. most of today after they had apparently balked at his proposal for settling the dispute. An aide to Mr. Usery still held out hope however, that a settlement could be near. The Secretary frequently demands roundtheclock meetings when he sees a strong possibility for a breakthrough.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Rhodesian forces have killed more than 300 black nationalist guerrillas at a camp in Mozambique used as a base for attacks on Rhodesia, according to a statement from the Rhodesian Government. It said 30 Mozambican soldiers and 10 civilians were also killed in Sunday's raid about 20 miles south of the border town of Umtali, while Rhodesians suffered only slight wounds. It was the first confirmed incursion into Mozambique since Prime Minister Ian D. Smith announced that he had authorized frontier crossing in hot pursuit. [Page 1, Cols. 12.]

title: Orantes and Vilas Gain on Clay
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 10 (UPI)Manuel Orantes of Spain and Guillermo Vilas of Argentina triumphed today in their firstround matches of the $157,000 national claycourt tennis championships.

title: M.A.C. Plans to Bay $10 Million in Bonds
description: The Municipal Assistance Corporation announced yesterday that it might buy up to $10 million of its 8 percent bonds that are scheduled to mature July 1, 1986.

title: Damage in Jersey Called Limited
description: TRENTON, Aug. 10The hurricane forced 200,000 New Jerseyans from their coastal homes, blew down trees and power lines and ripped up boardwalks in several resort towns last night, but it did less damage than had been expected, according to state officials.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Article 7  No Title

title: L.I. Evacuees Go Back to Homes
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Aug. 10There was a happy calm after the hurricane on Long Island today as thousands returned to their homes and an extensive cleanup began.

title: People in Sports
description: The New York Islanders signed Alex McKendry yesterday, the fifth straight year they have signed their No. 1 draft choice. They also signed Mike Kaszycki, their secondround pick. No salaries or terms were announced, but both reportedly signed three  year pacts. McKendry, a 6foot4inch 200pound native of Midland Ontario, is a lefthand shot who plays right wing. He had 43 goals, 59 assists and 121 minutes in penalties for the Sudbury Wolves the Ontario Hockey Association regularseason champion last season.

title: Language Lesson Bill Adopfed by Conferees
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (UPI)A SenateHouse conference committee agreed today to a compromise bill authorizing the, Agriculture Department to pay for foreigd language lessons for departmental employees stationed abroad and for their spouses and children as well.

title: Amin: Africa's Problem
description: The ink was barely dry on the new peace agreements between Kenya and Uganda before Kenya's Foreign Minister was voicing doubts that President Idi Amin of Uganda would carry them out. He has good reasons for skepticism. The erratic General Amin has often threatened war against Kenya, most recently when he alleged complicity of the Nairobi Government in Israel's commando raid that rescued hostages from a hijacked airliner in Uganda last month.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: Panel Proposes 8Hour Tours for New York's Police
description: A three  member impasse panel recommended yesterday that the daily working time of New York City police officers be set at eight hours and 15 minutes so as to make possible additional street patrol time without additional cost.

title: Explanation to French
description: PARIS, Aug. 10The United States charge d'affaires, Sam Gammon, called on the French Foreign Ministry today to explain that the United States did not want a confrontation on the issue of selling a uranium reprocessing plant to Pakistan and hoped additional safeguards could be worked out that would satisfy the three countries.

title: Congress Votes Flu Vaccine Liability Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10On the eve of its recess for the Republican National Convention Congress passed legislation today to end the impasse over liability insurance that has caused serious delays in the national immunization program against swineflu influenza.

title: 28 Perished in Bombings During First Half of Year
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (UPI) A total of 28 persons were killed in 763 bombing incidents during the first six months of 1976 and $6.9 million in property was damaged, according to the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Storybook New Yorker
description: Kitty Carlisle Hart is a real New yorker, She is not an avearage New yorker, the storybook type. She is an actress and a singer a partgiver a benefactor of things she believes in and a mainstay in the city's cultural life. She is also rich, and, appearing as a regular performer on the television shows To Tell the Truth and Woman on the Move, she earned a reputation for, among other things being charming.

title: Pilot Lands Biplane Safely Despite an Engine Failure
description: ROCKAWAY TOWNSHIP N. J., Aug. 10 (AP)A pilot returning from an experimental aircraft convention in Oshkosh Wisc., landed his biplane on the grassy median of Route 80 Monday afternoon when its engine failed.

title: Six Children and Man, 25 Shot in a Dispute in Bronx
description: Seven persons, including six children were injured last night when a man carrying a shotgun fired at them in the hallway of a South Bronx housing project apparently during a dispute.

title: McDonald Sets 5,000 Mark
description: STOCKHOLM, Aug. 10 (AP) Duncan McDonald set an American record in the 5,000 meters of 13:19.40 today at Olympic Stadium.

title: Appropriations Bill Signed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (AP) President Ford signed an appropriations bill today that provides $43.2 billion for the fiscal year 1977 for the Department of Housing and Urban Development, the. Veterans Administration, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, the Environmental Protection Agency and the Nation Science Foundation. H.U.D. will receive $19.4 billion, the V.A. $18.3 billion the space agency $3.6. billion E.P.A. $973 million and the science foundation $774 million.

title: The U.S. Must Fish Or Cut Bait
description: ATHENSThe current GreekTurkish crisis over rights to explore the eastern Aegean continental shelf is the most heated and dangerous since Tukkey invaded Cyprus two years ago.

title: Clark Calls for Quick Action on Bill To Curb Concerns Aiding Arab Boycott
description: Ramsey Clark a candidate for the Democratic nomination for United States Senate, yesterday called for quick passage of legislation now before Congress that would penalize businesses cooperating with the Aral boycott.

title: S. E. C. Violations Charged To Barwick and 6 Others
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged E. T. Barwick Industries, a Georgia carpet manufacturer, and six former officials with numerous securities violations, including fraudulent inflation of earnings destruction of documents and concealment of loan defaults.

title: SOVIET PRODS WEST ON EXOTIC WEAPONS
description: GENEVA, Aug. 10 (Reuters) The Soviet Union today called on the West to start work on a treaty outlawing new exotic weapons of mass destruction such as those that could wipe out selected ethnic groups, cause sterilization or damage internal organs with infrausound waves.

title: Bank Head Denies Zaire Loan Charge
description: TOKYO, Aug. 10 (AP)The president of the United States Export  Import Bank today denied a charge that repayment arrangements on a loan to Zaire intrude on other credits to the country.

title: INDIA PARLIAMENT OPENS TO BOYCOTT
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 10With most of the opposition parties staging a protest boycott, the Indian Parliament convened today for a session at which it is expected to enact constitutional amendments further enhancing the power of Prime Mtnister Indira Gandhi.

title: Soviet Jews From Here Urge U.S. to Admit Kin
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (AP)Fifty Soviet Jews from New York gathered at the Capitol today to urge the Government to admit relatives living in Italy.

title: Palestinian Detained
description: CAIRO, Aug. 10 (Reuters)The police detained Salat Mohammed alAmri, a member of the Palestinian commando moveent, today in connection with last Friday's attempt to as sassinate former Primer Minisr ter of South Yemen, Mohammed All Haithan, the Middle East News Agency reported.

title: HOUSE VOTE BACKS RISE IN OIL PRICES
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 10The House today passed and sent to President Ford the longdelayed energy bill allowing in creases in domestic oil prices that will cost consumers an estimated $1 billion a year in higher charges for home heating oil and gasoline.

title: Jagjit Singh Dead; Longtime Backer Of IndiaU.S. Ties
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 10Jagji Singh, a longtime backer of In dianAmerican friendship, died here Saturday after a prolonged illness. He was 76 years old.

title: Peyser Can Challenge Buckley for Senate, Elections Board Says
description: Representative Peter A. Peyser won the right yesterday to challenge Senator James L. Buckley for the Republican nomination for United States Senator and thus cleared the way for the first statewide (way primary fight in more than 50 years.

title: Irresponsible Selection Of Our Leaders
description: MANCHESTER, N. H.By now there is no mysteryas to the reasons for former Gov. Jimmy, Carter's success in achieving the Democratic Party nomination, or former Gov. Ronald Reagan's surprisingly strong challenge to President Ford.

title: Hunt for Evidence of Life On Mars Is Still a Puzzle
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 10  So far, the Viking search for evidence of life processes on Mars in stirring up a cloud of ambiguities, scientists agreed here today.

title: Bills to Help New York City Improve Its Tax Collections Gaining in Council
description: Legislation designed to accelerate the collection of millions of dollars in delinquent real estate taxes in New York City and to increase penalties on unpaid real estate, water and sewer taxes was voted out yesterday by the City Council's Charter and Governmental Operations Committee.

title: Faulty Radar Cited In Delayed Warning On Colorado Flood
description: DENVER, Aug. 10 (AP)Faulty equipment and misinterpretation of data caused the National Weather Service to issue its first flashflood warning almost two hours after a flood devastated the Big. Thompson Canyon, a spokesman for the service said today.

title: BUCKLEY REPORTS A PRESIDENCY BID
description: Senator James L. Buckley said Yesterday that he had been urged by several conservative Republican senators and representatives to consider becoming a compromise Presidential candidate in the event of a deadlock between President Ford and Ronald Reagan at the Republican National Convention next week.

title: Visit to 72 Harlem Slaying Site Assailed
description: The defense in the Harlemmosqueshooting trial yesterday protested a courtsanctioned search of the mosque on Monday afternoonfour and a half years after the crimefor unspent bullets that have never been found.

title: Voiding of Repeal of Commuter Tax Faces Threat of New York Challenge
description: TRENTON, Aug. 10James U. Tully, the New York State Tax Commissioner, said today that a bill approved recently by the New Jersey Legislature that would rescind the repeal of commuter taxes on outofstate residents who worked in New Jersey discriminated against New Yorkers and that he would seek to have it declared unconstitutional if it became law.

title: Fence Touches a Nerve With West Bank Arabs
description: BEIT JALA, IsraeliOccupied West Bank, Aug. 9From the narrow, serpentine road not really wide enough to accommodate its careening auto traffic, the barbedwire fence encircling 100 rocky ochercolored acres high on a hilltop is barely visible.

title: Karl SchmidtRottluff Dead; German Expressionist Artisi
description: BERLIN, Aug. 10 (UPI)Karl SchmidtRottluff, a founder of the German Experssionist school of painting, died today in a West Berlin hospital at the age of 92.

title: Subtitle in Chinatown: Great White Shark
description: The other afternoon there was a full house in the Chung Kou Theater, at 202 Canal Street, at the corner of Mott. The movie was Jaws and you couldn't hear a word of the dialogue for the noise in the audience, but you could as everyone was doing, read the subtitles on the bottom of the film.

title: A.M.A. SAID TO FILE FALSE MAIL DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (AP) The American Medical Association submitted false reports to the Postal Service for four and a half years, allowing it to underpay postage bills by as much as $450,000, an A.M.A. lawyer says.

title: My Fair Maid, $19, Is Victor
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, Aug. 10 (AP)Louis F. Fox Aitkens My Fair Maid, ridden by Jean Cruguet, defeated a field of eight 3yearold fillies in the $15,000 feature race at Saratoga Race Track today. The daughter of Crimson Satan finished

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES IN WIDE. CHANGES,
description: Soybean prices fluctuated yesterday as traders responded to a series of news items, looking for a reason to buy or sell. The November contract, after moving as high as $6.39 a bushel, and as low as $6.16; closed at $6.20, off 6 cents a bushel from Monday's level.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Article 8  No Title

title: Yank Protest Backfires
description: The Yankees were fined $1,000 and reprimanded by the American League yesterday for using their instant replay scoreboard at Yankee Stadium to show close plays and produce fan reaction against the umpires.

title: Lilco Burns Midnight Oil And Tuins the Lights On
description: SYOSSET, LI, Aug. 10It was 6 P.M. yesterday and George Wurzberg, a Long Island Lighting Company lineman, had been on the job since 6 A.M., working to restore electric power to this section of Nassau County.

title: British Patrol Vessel Sinks
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Aug. 10 (AP)The Reward, a Royal Navy patrol vessel, collided tonight with a Germanowned 7,000ton freighter off Scotland's east coast and sank, the navy announced. It said the Reward went down in less than 15 minutes, but all 40 crewmen were picked up by the freighter, the Singaporeregistered Plainsman.

title: Highs and Lows
description: NEW HIGHSSS

title: About New York
description: Harry McLaughlin used to be a housewatcher.

title: The Tag Sale Was a Victim of Its Own Success
description: UPPER BROOKVILLE, LI. Aug. 9Huntington Hartford doesn't live here. Never did. Even so, a tag sale on what was billed as the former Huntington Hartford estate this past weekend attracted thousands, including members of the Old Brookville Police Department.

title: Loans to Taipei by ExIm Bank And Others Show Confidence
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Aug. 10The chairman of the ExportImport Bank of the United States, Stephen M. Dubrul Jr. on a recent visit to Taiwan signed an agreement to lend Taiwan $21.6 million to help finance expansion of telecommunications facilities. The ExIm Bank will also guarantee onethird of an additional $32.4 million being provided to the project by the Chase Manhattan Bank.

title: Plane Crash of Rep. Litton Linked to Engine Failure
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (UPI)The Missouri crash of a twinengine airplane that killed Representative Jerry Litton and five other persons last Tuesday followed the failure of one of is engines, the National Transportation Safety Board said today.

title: About Education
description: A new analysis of existing data on blacks in higher education has found that while major gains have been made in recent years, the changes have tended to be irregular and inadequate.

title: Vienna Bridge Fault Traced
description: VIENNA, Aug. 10 (AP)The collapse Of Vienna's main Danube bridge on Aug. 1 was caused by a defective pier and by technical shortcomings in the construction completed in 1937, an expert commission said in a report published today.

title: LEBANESE RIGHT OPENS NEW DRIVE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 10Right  wing Christian forces today began a new attack against the Palestinian camp of Tell Zaatar, which has beer under siege for 49 days.

title: Italy Allocates Funds for Gassed Region
description: ROME, Aug. 10 (UPI)The Government approved a $48.41 million emergency fund today to carry out decontamination and health measures in the region of northern Italy affected by a poison gas cloud a month ago.

title: Home of Edward VIII Is Bought by an Arab
description: LONDON, Aug. 10A royal residence on which the eyes of the world were focused in 1936 has been sold to an Arab businessman.

title: Greeks Call on U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Aug. 10Greece requested the Security council today to hold an urgent meeting to consider the activities of a Turkish survey vessel in the Aegean Sea.

title: 25 Years Ago, Giants Kindled Flames of Miracle
description: Twenty  five years ago today, the Brooklyn Dodgers won the first game of a doubleheader at Ebbets Field temporarily extending their lead over the secondplace New York Giants to 13 games, and thereby set the stage for probably the most dramatic and certainly the most famous pennant race in baseball's first century.

title: LEWIS M. MULLARKEY
description: Lewis M. Mullarkey, a lawyer, died Sunday at St. Mary's Hospital, Amsterdam, N. Y. He was 67 years old and a resident la Amsterdam.

title: U.M.W. Leadership Balked on Strike
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug. 10The president and the 21man executive board of the United Mine Workers union failed at a tumultuous meeting of the rank and file here today to stop the wildcat strike of West Virginia coal miners, now in its fourth week.

title: The Schomburg Library Is Accused of Race Bias
description: A former librarian for Harliem's Schomburg Collection said to be the largest repository of works on black history, has charged the New York Public Library system with racial discrimination following his dismissal.

title: THE FUNNIEST COMEDY IN 50 YEARS. Vernon Scott, UPI
description: 50 YEARS. Vernon Scott, UPI

title: Bridge:
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 10 A quintet headed by Dr. George Rosenkranz of Mexico City completed a rare double in the early hours of this morning, winning the Spingold knockout teams title which ended the Summer National of the American Contract Bridge League.

title: REAGAN MEN SEEK WAY TO DEAL FORD A DAMAGING BLOW
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 10 Ronald Reagan's managers probed today for weaknesses in the defenses of President Ford, searching for some way to inflict an early and psychologically damaging defeat on the incumbent.

title: Two Israelis Face Trials In Slayings on West Bank
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 10 (UPI)The Israeli Government made an aboutface today and announced plans to courtmartial a soldier involved in the slaying of a teenage Arab girl during unrest on the west bank.

title: Paintings by Millet Stolen
description: BARBIZON, France, Aug. 10 (Reuters)About 20 paintings valued at $59,000 were stolen last night from the JeanFrancois Millet Museum here, the police said today. The thieves stole paintings by Millet and Theodore Rousseau.

title: G. & W. ZINC DIVISION FOLLOWS PRICE RISE
description: The New Jersey Zinc division of the Gulf and Western Natural Resources Group went along yesterday with other companies 3centsapound increase in the price of slab zinc products. This will increase the prime Western grade to 40 cents a pound, controlled lead to 40.25 cents; controlled lead with aluminum added and spevial high grade to 40.50 cents; a pound.

title: Catch22
description: Alex Wasilewski, a policeman who has been suspended from the East Hampton, L. I., police department is threatened with losing his job because he falsely denied in his application that he had ever suffered from any mental illness. He had, in fact, seen psychiatrists on one occasion and had received a National Guard discharge with medical disability. But it is also evident that Mr. Wasilewski would never have been hired if he had admitted any past psychiatric care.

title: World Team Tennis
description: MONDAY NIGHT'S MATCHES

title: Kissinger in Plea for Peaceful GreekTurkish Solution
description: DEAUVILLE, France, Aug. 10 Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said today that neither Greece nor Turkey would be justified in using force to resolve their dispute over oil rights in the Aegean Sea.

title: Market Place
description: For the last six months the Dow Jones industrial average and the broad list of stocks have been moving in a sideways pattern that has befuddled investors.

title: DOW IS UP BY 9.97 FOR 993.43 CLOSE
description: Strength in some bluechip and glamour issues enabled the stock market yesterday to post its best gain in more than month, with the Dow Jones industrial average finishing ahead 9.97 points at 993.43, its high for the session.

title: Ford May Consult Foes On Picking Running Mate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10President Ford will consult Ronald Reagan and other Republican opponents of the President's candidacy before making a final selection of a campaign running mate, authoritative White House officials said today.

title: House Votes to Bar Dams On Scenic Carolina River
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (AP) The House voted today to save the headwaters of the scenic New River in North Carolina from being inundated by power dams.

title: WINE TALK
description: POMONA, Calif.Last Thursday at precisely 8 A.M., four judges at the Los Angeles County Fair here sat down to taste 43 different bottles of zinfandel wine. It was the largest single group that the four, including this writer, encountered during the threeday judging, but it was small compared with the total of more than 270 red wines.

title: Spinola Returns to Lisbon And Is Taken Into Custody
description: LISBON, Aug. 10  Former President Antonio de Spinola of Portugal returned here today 117 months after he flew into exile in the wake of an abortive rightwing coup attempt.

title: House Eyes Trust Status Of Baseball
description: In a final session before a 12day recessand on the eve of the major league baseball owners meetings in Phoenix, Ariz.,four members of the Select House Committee on Professional Sports proposed in Washington yesterday the expanding of the committee's hearings to include testimony examing baseball's exemption from antitrust legislation. Baseball alone enjoys such exemption among the major professional sports.

title: Mindless Arms Sales
description: The emergence of the United States as the chief arms supplier to the Third World, selling more weapons abroad than all other nations combined, has been attributed primarily to concern over the balance of payments. But critics also have puzzled over the apparently mindless character of this program, which has seen arms sales jump from about $1 billion in 1970 to more than $10 billion in each of the past three years.

title: For the Gardener After the Storm Hits, All Is Not Lost
description: If the Belle epoque in local weather left your trees plants or vegetables looking like advertisements for the horticultural Dark Ages yesterday, the experts say there may still be a chance for a renaissance.

title: Kitty Carlisle Hart To Be Arts Chief
description: Kitty Carlisle Hart, the actress and singer, was named by Governor Carey yesterday as chairman of the State Council on the Arts which has been having trouble trying to disburse $27 million in state funds to arts groups.

title: Business Records
description: EDWARD POLLOCK, 5 Fleetwood Drive Newburgh, N.Y. Liabilities $75,553; asset; $18,200.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Jerry Gray, 61, Band Leader Composer, and Arranger, Dies
description: DALLAS, Aug. 10 (UPI)Jerry Gray, composer of String if Pearls and Pennsylvania 65000 and a band leader, arlanger and performer in the ??? of the popularity of big bands, died today of a heart attack at his home. He was 61 years old.

title: Australian Uranium Sought
description: TEHRAN, Iran, Aug. 10 (AP) The Australian Minister of Natural Resources, J. D. Anthony, said today that Iran and Australia planned a joint venture for uranium development in Australia.

title: Japan's Reds Lead in Funds
description: TOKYO, Aug. 10 (AP)Japan's Communist Party, though weak at the polls, raised more money last year than the governing LiberalDemocrats Or any other Japanese political showed today. The Home Affairs Ministry said the Communist Party's declared 1975 income was $39.86 million, up $6.33 million from 1974.

title: Connecticut Law Is Upheld On Reduction in Jury Size
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 10 (AP)The State Supreme Court today upheld the constitutionality of a law reducing the size of Connecticut juries from 12 to six persons for all crimes except murder.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Two Morris County men were indicted on charges abducting a 20yearold woman in a car and raping her during a sixhour ride through two counties last week. The eight count indictment was returned against David Damiamo, 27, of Parsippany and Joseph F. Dyer, 24, of Madison. They were held in the Morris County Jail in lieu of $120,000 bai leach pending a hearing at a later date.

title: Gallo Ads Stir Campus Press Dispute
description: I A controversy over freedom of the press is brewing in California because of the banning of Gallo wine advertisements from some campus newspapers and decisions on other campuses to give free advertising space to supporters of the United Farm Workers in newspapers that print paid Gallo ads.

title: Severity of China's Quake Loss Seems Verified by New Reports
description: PEKING, Wednesday, Aug. 1  Chinese press reports and the accounts of foreigners who were traveling in the area when a severe earthquake struck China two weeks ago seem to verify that Tangshan, the mining city of one million people about 100 miles southeast of Peking, has been virtually destroyed and will have to be completely rebuilt.

title: POLICE SAY CABBY STRUCK 2 FIREMEN
description: Two firemen were injured yesterday afternoon when they were run over in front of their East 29th Street firehouse by a cab driver who became annoyed When he was stopped while their fire engine was backed into its quarters, the police said.

title: Baby Squirms in Crib And Survives Belle
description: PAXTON, Mass., Aug. 10 (AP)Joshua Mello squirmed in his crib, twisting and turning into an unusual position. It apparently saved his life.

title: CARTER DRIVE FUNDS RETURNED BY CLERGY
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 10 (AP)The Baptist Minister's Union of Oakland and the Mount Zion Missionary District Association have returned the $2,000 they said they had received from Jimmy Cgrter's campaign organization.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TOMORROW KUNGSHOLM (Flagship). Lett Glen Gariff Aug. 5; due 9 A.M. at W. 55th St. QUEEN ELIZABETH 2 (Cunard). Left Southampton Aug. 5; due 9 A.M. at W. 55th St.

title: SON OF COMPOSER DIES IN AUTO CRASH
description: Christopher Beeson, the 25yearold son of Jack Beeson the MacDowell Professor of Music at Columbia University and composer of several modern operas, was killed Monday when his car skidded and struck a tree near Mattituck L.I. He had driven from his parents summer home on Shelter Island.

title: Fire Island Gets a Pleasant Surprise
description: FAIR HARBOR, Fire Island Aug. 10Standing in the doorway of the house she rents here, Barbara Lowenthal smiled and could not contain her joy.

title: TOKYO CUTS TRADE WITH NORTH KOREA
description: TOKYOTrade between Japan and North Korea has declined sharply in 1976 because of Pyongyang's mounting accumulation of unpaid trade bills.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor The Times (July 28) quotes Governor Carter as saying that there is now no possibility of a nuclear first strike without unbelievable destruction on the originator of the attack.

title: East Germany to Free Man
description: BONN, Aug. 10 (AP)East Germany has decided to free a West German janitor who was shot by border guards after he strayed over the frontier 18 days ago, the Bonn Government said today. The East Germans decided not to prosecute Willi Bubbers, 49 years old, for illegally entering their territory, a Bonn spokesman said.

title: Trager Is Appealing Acquittal of Bank Charged With Political Contributions
description: The United States Attorney for the Eastern District, David G. Trager, has taken the unlusual step of appealing a jury's acquittal in a criminal case.

title: FRANCESCO COGSWELL
description: Francesco Heffinger Cogswell, a direct descendant of William Whipple, a signer of the Declaration of Independence, died Friday at Middlesex Hospital, Haddam, Conn. She was 83 years old and a resident of Haddam.

title: London Seeks Role By Rebels in Ruling SouthWest Africa
description: LONDON, Aug. 10  With United States support. Britain has begun a quiet diplomatic initiative to obtain a constitutional settlement and prevent racial warfare in SouthWest Africa.

title: Auto Events
description: 31White Meadow Lake Parade and Display.

title: French Franc Falls To a 27 Month Low
description: LONDON, Aug. 10 (AP)The French franc resumed its downtrend today, falling to a 27month low against the dollar.

title: Article 9  No Title
description: Article 9  No Title

title: Stealing from Children
description: Disclosures of illegal real estate deals in the city's daycare centers illustrate once again the high risk of forprofit operation of socialservice programs. The availability of substantial public funds for such purposes creates an inordinate temptation for unscrupulous operators to inflate costs and to siphon off subsidies intended for the programs beneficiaries.

title: ALFRED A. SCHEFFER
description: Alfred A. Scheffer, an architect who designed a large number of homes in the HamptonAmagansett area of eastern Long Island, died Monday at Southampton, L. I., hospital. He was 82 years old and a resident of Amagansett.

title: In Memoriam
description: GUTMANEllen. One year. Only happy memories, JACK, WALTER, PAUL, ALAN.

title: Rioters Attack British Troops in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland Aug. 10 (AP)Guerrillas attacked British troops and rioters hijacked more than 70 buses, trucks and cars and set fire to most of them in Roman Catholic districts of Belfast today. The outbreaks followed the arrest of a leader of Provisional Sinn Fein, the legal political front for the outlawed Provisional Irish Republican Army.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Ogden Corporation announced yesterday that its subsidiary, Avon Shipyards Inc., of New Orleans, was awarded a $150 million Navy contract to build two auxiliary oil tenders.

title: Whistling Winds Sing A Song of Love for Two
description: People change, it seems when a tragedyor a potential tragedylike Hurricane. Belle strikes the metropolitan area. They become friendlier, they talk to one another, they do things they might not normally do.

title: James D. Cunningham, 76, Dies; Fortner Lawyer and F C. C. Aide
description: James Dewey Cunningham the chief hearing examiner for the Federal Communications Commission until he retired in 1969, died Monday at his home in Washington. He was 76 years old.

title: New Policy Arises In Insurance Field Readable Language
description: Insurance policies may be balm for the afflicted but they are murder on the English language.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. San Diego Padres, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8:05 P.M.

title: REAGAN MEN SEEK WAY TO DEAL FORD A DAMAGING BLOW
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 10 Ronald Reagan's managers probed today for weaknesses in the defenses of President Ford, searching for some way to inflict an early and psychologically damaging defeat on the incumbent.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: One sign of a pianistsinger who knows his business is a good clear rendition of everybody's favorite, As Time Goes By, done out of obvious enjoyment and with no attempt to echo Dooley Wilson in Casablanca.

title: 600 AT A MEMORIAL FOR LORD THOMSON
description: TORONTO, Aug. 10 (Reuters) About 600 friends, relatives and representatives from journalism and public life attended a memorial service here today for Lord Thomson of Fleet, who died Aug. 4 in a London hospital.

title: London Seeks Role By Rebels in Ruling SouthWest Africa
description: LONDON, Aug. 10  With United States support, Britain has begun a quiet diplomatic initiative to obtain a constitutional settlement and prevent racial warfare in SouthWest Africa.

title: Cobalt Radiation Overdoses Bring Government Warning
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (UPI) Hospital and clinics throughout the country have been asked to check the radiation output of cobalt units used in the treatment of cancer patients, the Nuclear Regulatory icommissin said today.

title: Notes on People
description: Senator William Proxmire, who announces golden fleece awards for what he considers waste of taxpayer money, received a variation on the award from Senator Barry Goldwater yesterday. On Monday the Senate voted to pay for the Wisconsin Democrat's legal defense against a $6 million libel and slander suit brought by one of his golden fleece winners.

title: KEITH KYLING, 77 PILOT IN THE R.A.F.
description: Keith Ayling, a Royal Air Force bomber pilot in World War I, a militaryaviation analyst in World War II and a writer of fiction and nonfiction books, died Monday in Freeport, L.I., of a heart attack. He was 77 years old.

title: Going Beyond Viking 1: Touring Mars on Wheels
description: PASADENA, Calif.We have landed on Mars. An aspiration which must be far older than human, history has been fulfilled. And yet, in a development which would have startled our remote ancestors, it is not ourselves who have landed but rathei an exquisitely instrumented, selfrepairing, obedient and intelligent machine, a testament to human ingenuity.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Judge Ethan Allen Doty of the Court of Common Pleas in Philadelphia ordered the court's custodian of psychiatric records to make some 1972 studies on Joseph Kallinger available to Mr. Kallinger's lawyers in Hackensack, N. J. Mr. Kallinger, a 39yearold Philadelphia shoemaker, goes on trial in Hackensack, N. J., Sept. 13 on charges of murdering a 21yearold nurse, Maria Fasching during a robbery in the home of the DeWitt Romaines Leonia, N. J., Jan. 8, 1975.

title: MISS SILLS TO BE HOST OF WNBCTV SHOW
description: Beverly Sills, the Metropolitan Opera Star who has been in high demand on the television talkshow circuit, will have a weekly program of her own this fall on WNBCTV. Entitled Lifestyles with Beverly Sills, the program will be carried Saturdays, 5 to 6 P.M., beginning Oct. 16.

title: Prudential Is Ranked First In Survey of U.S. Investors
description: The largest investor in the United States is the Prudential Insurance Company, with $23.2 billion in assets under management, according to a survey published by Institutional Investor magazine.

title: Connecticut Apple Crop Hard Hit
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 10Close to 20 percent of the $3.5 million apple crop in Connecticut was Most when the hurricane swept northward through the state Viand deep into New England today, spending its force.

title: CHARLES PETERSON JAZZ PHOTOGRAPHER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10Charles Peterson, a former New York jazz guitarist who became the official photographer of jazz artists, died last Wednesday at the Washington Hospital Center here of burns sustained in an accident at his son's home in Chevy Chase Md., on July 26. He was 76 years old.

title: Aluminum Pricing Apt to Expand Capacity
description: The round of aluminum price increases announced last week is expected to spur the industry to add production capacity, a movement that has stagnated in recent years.

title: Interest Rates on Bonds Edge Downward
Suit Accuses White, Weld Of Negligence in Investing
description: Benjamin Goldfarb, a Jersey City trucking executive, filec suit yesterday in Newark Fed eral Court against White, Wele & Company, charging the brokerage house with negligence resulting in substantia investment losses.

title: Antique Auto Fanciers Mark Anniversary
description: WEST ORANGE, Aug. 10They are a familiar sight in parades throughout the state. In a nation that eagerly awaits the latest changes in automobile styling, the antique auto is becoming increasingly popular, particularly in New Jersey.

title: WEST POINTIRY JURY ASKS NEW INQUIRY
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Aug. 10 A board of highranking officers at the United States Military Academy here moved unexpectedly today, somewhat in the manner of a grand jury to recommend a major investigation of widespread cheating.

title: Spasal to The New York Times
description: LONDON, Aug. 10Britain's Rapier missile air defense systems are the keystone of the barter, deal with the Iranian Government. The deal is well advanced, according to a British Aircraft Corporation spokesman.

title: Judge Defends Salary And Rejects an Appeal
description: NEWARK, Aug. 10 (AP)Judge Vincent P.. Biunno of United States District Court here said that his salary may look like small potatoes to a convicted swindler, but that he is satisfied with it.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money market Inflex for Tuesday.

title: Damage in Jersey Called Limited
description: TRENTON, Aug. 10 The hurricane forced 200,000 New Jerseyans from their coastal homes, blew down trees and power lines and ripped up boardwalks in several resort towns last night, but it did less damage than had been expected, according to state officials.

title: Nuclear Proliferation and the Sale of Arms
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10The disclosure that Pakistan's purchase of a nuclear reprocessing plant from France would jeopardize the sale of military jet aircraft the Pakistanis want from the United States shows the increasingly close relationship be tween the problems of nuclear proliferation and conventional arms sales.

title: New York May Challenge Jersey on Commuter Tax
description: TRENTON, Wednesday, Aug. 1James H. Tully, the New York State Tax Commissioner said yesterday that a bill approved recently by the New Jersey Legislature that would rescind the repeal of commuter taxes on outofstate residents who worked in New Jersey discriminated against New Yorkers and that he would seek to hay it declared unconstitutional if it became law.

title: Jones and Padres Lose to Koosman
description: The Mets have been getting so perky lately that they even beat Randy Jones last night as Jerry Koosman outpitched the prodigy of the San Diego Padres, 54, and John Milner sank him with a pinch single in the eighth inning.

title: State Tuition Plan Lagging in Reports On Aid to Students
description: The new agency that administers the state's tuitionassistance program is running about a month behind schedule in notifying the state's college students and their families of how much financial aid they can expect to receive to offset this fall's tuition bills.

title: O.O.P. Panel Backs AntiAbortion Plank
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 10 A subcommittee of the Republican Party's Platform Com mittee approved tonight a plank supporting the efforts of those seeking a constitutional amendment to restore the protection of the right to life fori unborn children.

title: 2 Harris Jurors Change Testimony But Judge Again Rejects Mistrial Plea
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 10An alternate juror in the trial of William and Emily Harris testified in a confusing emergency hearing this evening that she had been mistaken this morning when she identified the youngest member of the jury as the person who constructed a twine noose during jury selection eieht weeks ago.

description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 10Rhodesian forces have crossed into Mozambique and killed more than 300 black nationalist guerrillas at a base camp used for launching attacks on Rhodesia, the Government announced today.

title: CARTER SEES RACE CLOSER THAN IN 72
description: PLAINS, Ga. Aug. 10 (UPI)1 Jimmy Carter, voting in the Georgia primary, predicted today that the November Presidential election would be a much closer race than the 1972 contest and would draw a heavier voter turnout.

description: Article 5  No Title

title: H.E.W. Funds Bill Stalled in House By Abortion Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10Approval of a $56.6 billion appropriations bill for two departments of Government was stalled once again today when the House refused to modify an antiabortion amendment that Senate conferees had rfused to accept.

title: Discord Holds Up Dream Of a Unified North Africa
description: TUNIS, Aug. 4  Across North Africa political and intellectual leaders still talk in hopeful terms of the Maghreb a community of North African nations, but rarely has the ideal been so compromised as now.

title: HOUSE VOTE BACKS RISE IN OIL PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10The House today passed and sent to President Ford the longdelayed energy bill allowing increases in domestic oil prices that will cost consumers an timated $1 billion a year in higher charges for home heating oil and gasoline.

title: ADDICTION COURSE HELD AT RUTGERS
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Aug. 10 New directions in drug uselaws that discriminate against use, community opposition to halfway houses, adequate treatment facilities for women and the psychological processes of addiction are among the topics under discussion here this week.

title: Sch weiker Shift No Surprise in Hometown
description: NORRISTOWN, Pa.  Nobody here in Senator Richard S. Schweiker's birthplace was surprised to hear that he had agreed to serve as Ronald Reagan's running mate if the former California Governor won the Republican Presidential nomination.

title: IRAN AND BRITAIN PLAN ARMS DEAL
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 10 Iran is negotiating with Britain to barter Iranian oil for as much as $600 million in Britishmade arms, according to wellplaced Iranian and Western officials.

description: Article 2  No Title

title: Bhutto Backs Agreement
description: PARIS, Aug. 10 (Reuters)Prime Minister Bhutto said in an interview broadcast here today that Pakistan plans to go ahead with the purchase of French nuclear equipment, despite American concern.
