description: Northern Division

title: Boeing and Japanese Near Agreement On Development of MidRange Jetliner
description: The Boeing Company and Japans official transportdevelopment corporation reported separately yesterday that they were close to agreement on Japanese participation in a billiondollar venture to develop a new mediumrange Boeing ietliner for the 7980's.

title: Red Smith
description: Eleven months have passed since William J. Usery head of the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service talked the New England Patriots into abandoning the preseason strike they had called to protest the absence a collective bargaining contract with the National Football League. The men who own the football had promised submit a new contract offer that would be meaningful and to give at least three days to negotiating its terms in good faith. Usery, who perhaps should have known better, told the players he believed their employers would keep the promise, and the players took him at his word. An offer was submitted the players did not consider it meaningful and the owners didn't give it three days negotiation. But this doesn't mean that no changes have come about in 11 months. Usery became Secretary of Labor. The players union elected a new slate of officers. Seven meetings have been held to negotiate new contract. There is no new contract and not much promise of one before the league season opens four weeks from Sunday. It would be the third straight season with no agreement between the union and the league.

title: Books of The Times
description: It was late when I turned the final page of J. Paul Getty's autobiography. As I closed the book and set it on the ormolu table the clock in the Great Hall chimed two. I took a sip of the Meyers Rum and CocaCola I had mixed (a drink, I was gratified to learn, that the late Mr. Getty also favored as a nightcap), and stared into the fire. The flames sent shadows dancing against the great beams in the vaulted ceiling and cast a ruddy glow on the rich leather bindings of my books. Time passedhow much I cannot say, for I must have dozed off. When I opened my eyes once again, I was astounded to see sitting in the great leather chair next to the fireplace, none other than Mr. J. Paul Getty himself.

title: Sponsors Slash Budgets For FreeFood Program
description: Faced with charges of waste theft and mismanagement sponsors distributing free lunches to needy New York City children have submitted sharply reduced budgets to the state for the month of August.

title: WEST POINT JURY ASKSFBN INQUIRY
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Aug. 10 A board of highranking officers at the United States Military Academy here moved unexpectedly today, somewhat in the manner of a grand jury to recommend a major investigation of widespread cheating.

title: HURRICANE LEAVES PROPERTY DAMAGE IN THE MILLIONS
description: Hurricane Belle blew into history over New England yesterday, leaving millions of dollars worth of property damage in the New York metropolitan region but less than had been expected.

title: Dr. L. I. von Micsky, a Developer Of Ultrasonic Diagnostic Tools
description: Dr. Lajos I. von Micsky pioneer in the development of ultrasonic diagnosis in gynecology and obstetrics, died Friday of a heart ailment in his home in New Rochelle, N.Y. He was 58 years old.

title: Wincenty Krasko Is Dead; Polish Party Aide Was 60
description: WARSAW, Aug. 10 (AP)Wincenty Krasko, a national secretary of the Polish Communist Party, died in Koszalin today, the Polish press agency reported. He was 60 years old.

title: 109 Die in Punjab Rains
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, Aug. 10 (Reuters)At least 109 people ??? died in Monsoon floods in the Punjab, region during the last 10 days, a Government spokesman said today. Official estimates put the number of villages devastated by the rains at 6,000, with 3.5 million people left homeless.

title: Powell, as a Justice, Misses Old Friends
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 9  He smiles when he hears the question; the answer is so ohvious. Yes, it is a rarefied life. Yes, it is strange.

title: Everyone for Tennis Promotions
description: As the tennis boom continues, the number of companies that want to capitalize on their association with the sport increases. And tennis promoters are on the lookout for still more.

title: Ailey Salutes Ellington
description: Ailey celebrates Ellington that is the theme of Alvin Ailey's twoweek season at the New York State Theater and certainly he seems to be celebrating Ellington very well.

title: Hunt for Evidence of Life On Mars Is Still a Puzzle
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 10  So far, the Viking search for evidence of life processes on Mars in stirring up a cloud of ambiguities, scientists agreed here today.

title: Children's. Museum Given Three Grants
description: The Staten Island Children's Museum, which began operating last spring, has received $50,000 in grants from three institutions.

title: About Real Estate
description: The trophies of a small competitive war are on view these days as tenants in a building at 31st Street and Park Avenue South. They are the handful of importers of new Oriental rugs that have been plucked from buildings on Fifth Avenue.

title: July Retail Sales Showed Dip of 1% To $53.21 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10Retail sales fell back again in July after a temporary improvement in June, the commerce Department reported today.

title: View From the Top
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10Judging from both official and private assessments, the United States economy at the time of the Presidential inauguration in January could well be viewed as the least troubled in years. Unemployment will be highabout 7 percent of the labor forcebut it will be declining along with a steady growth of total jobs.

title: Music: Dual Eschenbach
description: From one point of view this summer's Mostly Mozart Festival might appear to be a dark plot to downgrade the virtuoso conductor. The career maestro has been in evidence, but a sizable number of programs have been led by instrumentalists doubling as cuegivers and temposetters, much as was the custom in the time of Mozart, Bach or Handel. Another such roledoubler. Christoph Eschenbach, performed both as piano soloist and conductor in two Mozart concertos at Alice Tully Hall on Monday night.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: THE SHOOTIST, directed by Don Siegel, starring John Wayne and Lauren Bacaii, at Lams Astor Plaza and Cine Theaters.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Rhodesian forces have killed more than 300 black nationalist guerrillas at a camp in Mozambique used as a base for attacks on Rhodesia, according to a statement from the Rhodesian Government. It said 30 Mozambican soldiers and 10 civilians were also killed in Sunday's raid about 20 miles south of the border town of Umtali, while Rhodesians suffered only slight wounds. It was the first confirmed incursion into Mozambique since Prime Minister Ian D. Smith announced that he had authorized frontier crossing in hot pursuit. [Page 1, Cols. 12.]

title: 2 Out of Soapbox Race Over Fiberglass Use
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 10 (AP)Two Soap Box Derby contestants have been disqualified or withdrawn from competition after preliminary examinations revealed that their cars violated rules governing the use of fiberglass.

title: Notes on People
description: A Federal district judge in Oklahoma City dismissed yesterday draft evasion charges against Fritz Efaw who was to have gone on trial there today. Mr. Efaw returned from six years in Britain to attend the Democratic National Convention in New York as an alternate delegate of Democrats Abroad. He was nominated for Vice President so he could speak on universal amnesty.

title: New Chief Reported for Race Board
description: William G. Barry, a former Federal Bureau of Investigation agent who served as Senator Robert F. Kennedy's personal bodyguard, has been selected by Governor Carey to head the New York State Racing and Wagering Board, according to close friends of Barry.

title: Plan for Townhouses Irks Lake Community Residents
description: KINNELON, N. J., Aug. 11 (AP)Residents of the rich private community of Smoke Rise are angry about the plans of its bankrupt developer to build townhouses or condominlsums on the wooded 3,500acre tract.

title: 2 Ailey Program Changes
description: The Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater, now at the New York State Theater through Aug. 22, has announced a program change for two of its performances. At Saturday's matinee Mr. Ailey's new Three Black Kings will replace the previously scheduled Black, Brown and Beige. Next Tuesday Black, Brown and Beige will be replaced by The Road of the Phoebe Snow.

title: Contested Delegate Seated
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. II (UPI)The Republican National Committee voted today to seat Jonathan Barnett, a Alyearold Arkansas delegate pledged to Ronald Reagan. By voice vote the committee rejected a challenge from backers of Ronald Reagan in Arkansas who wanted Mr. Barnett replaced with an alternate:delegate, Glenn Hopkins Jr. Judy Petty, head Of the Reagan.. forces in Arkansas had said she wanted Mr. Barnett replaced because she was not sure he would vote for Mr. Reagan. But neither she nor any other Reagan representative showed up to plead the case.

title: BELL BONDS DROP TO LOW OF 8.25%
description: The yield on new Bell System bonds dropped to 8.25 percent yesterdaythe lowest for such bonds in 2 yearsas the Illinois Bell Telephone Company sold a $175 million issue of 40year securities to an Credit underwriting synMarkets dicate headed by the First Boston Corporation. The debentures sold slowly, however, and were estimated late in the day to be no more than onethird sold.

title: RAYMOND CORRIGAN
description: HARBOR, Ore., Aug. 11 (AP) Raymond Corrigan, a western movie actor who appearedin in 105 films, died here last night apparently of a heart attack. He was 74 years old.

title: HELSTOSKI AGREES TO A NEW PRIMARY
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 11Representative Henry Helstoski agreed today to a new Democratic primary election in the Ninth Congressional District which he has represented for six terms. The East Rutherford Democrat's narrow victory in the June 8 primary had been contested by his opponent Assemblyman Byron M. Baer of Englewood, on charges of voting irregularities and possible fraud.

title: Helstoski Agrees to Rerun Of the Congressional Race
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 11Rcprcscntative Henry Helstoski agreed today to a new Democratic primary election in the Ninth Congressional District which he has represented for six terms. The East Rutherford Democrat's narrow victory in the June 8 primary has been contested by his opponent Assemblyman Byron M. Baer of Englewood, on charges of voting irregularities and possible fraud.

title: Scott Calls Peking Ready To Negotiate With Taipei
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11Chinese officials say they are ready at any time to talk with representatives of Taipei, and to trade with Taiwan, according to a report by the Senate minority leader, Hugh Scott based on his recent conversations with leaders in China.

title: EDWARDS & HOLY TARGET IN COURT
description: An involuntary petition in bankruptcy was filed yesterday against Edwards & Hanly, the brokerage house and former member of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: BROMS ACCUSED IN ARAB BOYCOTT
description: The American Jewish Congress said yesterday that two leading investment banking houses had cooperated in the Arab boycott to deny business to stockbrokers on the Arab boycott list.

title: Music
description: Considering the ocean of repertory from which the planners of Mostly Mozart programs might fish, it would seem unnecessary that they duplicate even one piece in the course of any summer festival. Tuesday night at Alice Tully Hall, however, we once again had Mozart's Piano Quartet in G minor (K. 478), this time performed by members of the Tokyo String Quartet, with Anton Kuerti as pianist.

title: OPEC OIL OUTPUT UP IN FIRST HALF
description: Crude oil production by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries in the first half of 1976 increased, with a sharp surge recorded by Saudi Arabia and Iran in June.

title: Aides Weigh Ford Debate With Carter in Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11President Ford's campaign strategists are debating whether the President ought to debate Jimmy Carter.

title: Decision on Youth's Kidnapping Proved Toughest for Harris Jury
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 11 The jury in the William and Emily Harris trial, in its deliberations, had the most trouble in ?? ?? the couple of kidnanninft 4 young man who testified he lost all fear of the Harrises and Patricia Hearst minutes after he began his night on the run with them on May 16, 1974.

title: Parliament in Italy Gives Andreotti Vote of Confidence
description: ROME, Aug. 11Prime Minister Giulio Andreotti today obtained a vote of confidence for his new Government in the Chamber of Deputies, thus overcoming the final obstacle to its being able to function.

title: Ford, Breaking Tradition, to Go to Convention Early
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11President Ford will fly to the Republican National Convention on Sunday, arriving in Kanas City early, his spokesman said today, to do all he can to promote party unity.

title: Anniston, Ala., Hears the Bard's Voice
description: ANNISTON, Ala., Aug. 10William Shakespeare is gaining on Richard Petty in Alabama.

title: Earth's Path Strewn With Debris of Comet
description: This week the earth is passing through debris apparently left by a disintegrating comet and still in orbit around the sun. The fragments fall into the atmosphere as glowing, meteors or shooting stars.

title: Trenton Votes Tenant Bill; Way Open for Income Tax
description: TRENTON, Atig. 11  The Assembly late tonight approved a bill giving tenants a share of propertytax reductions received by their landlords, thus paving the way for activation of the state's Personal income tax. The vote was 41 to 11, the bare minimuffneeded for passage and ended almost a month of debate.

description: Aug. 12, 1976 SECURITY COUNCIL

title: Jobs Exceed Students at Secretarial Finishing School
description: Suddenly ashamed of her outburst, the younger woman yanked the paper from her machine and inserted a fresh sheet. She knew she would lose a minute from the typing exercise, but it would not do to hand that sheet in Not at Katie Gibbs. Not at one of the most respected secretarial schools in the country. Not at the school that produced the secretaries to Henry A. Kissinger, Barbara Walters, Senators Edward M. Kennedy and Howard H. Baker Jr., F. Lee Bailey and the top administrators of M.I.T. and Lever Brothers.

title: In Room Design, Having It Both Ways
description: How do you achieve a warm, enclosed feeling in a room and at the same time maintain a sense of space? Milo Baughman, a furniture designer, thinks he has an answer in the new line he has designed for Thayer Coggn.

title: Detective in Mosque Killing Trial Says He Saw Suspect Hit Victim
description: The partner of a policeman fatally shot at a Harlem mosque in 1972 took the stand at the murder trial of Lewis 17X Dupree yesterday and testified that he saw Mr. Dupree beat the officer with his fists.

title: Postal Union Backs Carter
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Aug. 11 (AP)  The American Postal Workers Union has endorsed Jimmy Carter for President and his running mate, Walter F. Mondale for Vice President. About 2,900 delegates of the 300,000member union endorsed the two Democrats in a resolution adopted by an overwhelming voice vote yesterday.

title: Storm Leaves a Trail of Tax Questions
description: Hurricane Belle, like most other high winds, left in its wake not only a cat's cradle of twisted utility lines but also a snarl of tax and insurance questions as well.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Newark police smashed what they described one of the biggest heroin rings in the city as they arrested 16 persons, including a Linden couple believed to have run the $4,000aday operation out of their restaurant in the heart of Newark's Central Ward.

title: Mobil Scores Critics Asking Time on TV
description: Groups seeking free time on television to reply to oil industry commercials that oppose legislation for a breakup of large oil companies were accused by the Mobil Oil Corporation yesterday of trying to muzzle the industry.

title: ISSUE AND DEBATE
description: To look at, the universal product code Is a small series of vertical bars and numbers printed on labels of grocery products. When the U.P.C.labeled product is passed by an electronic scanner at a checkout counter, it triggers a computer to record a price for the item automatically without a checker ever pushing a cash register key.

title: New Pennsylvania Death Prompts Additional Tests

title: Shirley N. Siebert, 53, Dies; Wife of a Realty Operator
description: Shirley Newman Siebert, the wife of Jerome Siebert, a real estate operator, died Tuesday at her Fairfield, Conn., home. She was 53 years old.

title: Richard A. Ulrey, 55, Dies; Pharmaceutical Executive
description: Richard A. Ulrey, vice president of communications for Organon Inc., a West Orange N.J., manufacturer of pharmaceutical products, died Monday at his summer home in Poland Springs, Me. He was 55 years iold and a resident of Verona N.J.

title: G.O.P. PANEL BACKS RULE AIDING FORD
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 11  The outgoing Republican National Committee, as a farewell gift to President Ford, approved unanimously today a revised set of party rules, including one rule designed to help Mr. Ford defeat Ronald Reagan for the Presidential nomination next week.

description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York said yeserday that one of the causes of a prolonged weakness in business loans at the nation's major banks was an unusual lack of strength in inventory investment early in the recovery.

title: DE FACTO DIVISION BEGUN IN LEBANON
description: JUNIEH, Lebanon, Aug. 8The Christians and Moslems of Lebanon have begun in effect to partition the country by setting up state administrations in their respective territories.

title: CARTER SAYS FORD LAGS AS REFORMER
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 11  Jimmy Carter accused the Ford Administration today of failing to restore public confidence in the Government in the aftermath of the Watergate scandals.

title: E.R.A. Action Stuns Betty Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (UPI) Betty Ford said today that she found it incredible that the Republican Platform Committee turned down its plank in favor of the Equal Rights Amendment.

title: Long Island Show Gets Under Way
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I., Aug. 11After being postponed for a day because of the hurricane, the Southampton horse show got under way today and Hollandia Farm's Dutch Crown moved to the front in the preliminary jumper division.

title: Congressional Aide Sees Lower Unemployment Rate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (UPI) The Congressional Budget Office director, Alice M. Rivlin said today that unemployment would not fall below 6 percent within the next 18 months, despite potential fiscal policy changes.

title: CORRECTION
description: An Item in the Corporate Affairs column in The Times yesterday incorrectly referred to the American Telephone and Telegraph Company's digital service as its Dictaphone digital service. The correct name is Dataphone digital service.

title: Rosalie R. Garcia Is Wed in Madrid
description: Rosalie Rodriguez Garcia daughter of Luis Rodriguez Rubio and Eva Garcia Blanco of Madrid, was married in the Spanish capital yesterday to John Peter Williams, son of Mr. and Mrs. John S. Williams Jr. of Cincinnati. The Rev. Amadeo Saguar performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at the Basilica Real de NuestraSenora de Atocha.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: Formation of a special group to develop new technologies was announced yesterday by the Allied Chemical Corporation. The new unit known as the technology venture group, has been set up at the company's Morris Township, N.J., headquarters. It will seek new technologies outside the company's present operations and develop them as new business activities.

title: Retailers Growing Wary of Trend in Sales
description: Retailers, after enjoying a sales uptrend since early 1975, are deciding whether to follow a more cautious approach as a result of disappointing sates in May, June and July.

title: Foreign Ministers Of Neutral Nations Begin Conference
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Aug. 11 (AP)A conference of foreign ministers of nonaligned countries began here today with a veiled attack by the host country, Sri Lanka, on the United States and Britain.

title: N. A. A. C. P. Loses $1.2 Million Lawsuit For 1966 Boycott in Mississippi Town
description: A Mississippi court awarded 12 white merchants in the town of Port Gibson a $1.250,599 settlement against the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People Monday because of the organization's successful boycott of local shops in 1966.

title: EXCESS PAYMENTS FOUND IN CLINICS
description: As much as $18 million in overpayments for Medicaid patients may have gone to privatel nonprofit clinics here last year according to a preliminary audit released yesterday by the New York City Health Department.

title: Elton John in a Smooth Show at Garden
description: Those of us who write about the arts are used to dealing with popular performers, who aren't particularly popular with us. We treat them as fairly as we can delineating their strengths and weaknesses as we see them; report on the crowd's reaction and call it a day.

description: FIRST$12,800, mdn 2Y0, 5 f.

title: Quick Shooters Put to the Test
description: Topiltzen (Piggy) Martinez and his younger brother, Alphonso, didn't have their best day yesterday at the Pepsi Cola/NBA Hotshot Competition at Annunciation Playground, 135th Street and Amsterdam Avenue, but so far they still hold the highest scores in their age categories at the park.

title: U.S. Is Not Raising Estimate on Output Of Grain in Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11A team of analysts at the Agriculture Department said today they were leaving their projection on total grain production in the Soviet Union unchanged at 195 million tons despite improved crop conditions in the Soviet newlands areas.

title: Church Sues Security Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (AP)  The Founding Church of Scientology sued the National Security Agency, today, seeking release under the Freedom of Information Act of intiligence files the agency concedes it holds on the church group. The suit was filed in Federal District Court.

title: Lockwood Rescues Mets in 21 Triumph
description: Skip Lockwood, the scholarly shortrelief man of the Met's bull pen, got tough last night at Shea Stadium against San Diego, saving Jon Matlack's 12th victory of the season and giving the Padres a 21 defeat.

title: Police in Mexico Report Death Of Guerrilla Leader in Attack
description: MEXICO, CITY, Aug. 11 (AP) The leader of one of Mexico's most active guerrilla groups was Idled today in an attack on the sister of Presidentelect Jose Lopez Portillo, the police reported.

title: AllSibelius Program Set At Carnegie Halt Sept. 26
description: An allSibelius program will be given in Carnegie Hall on the afternoon of Sept. 26 under the sponsorship of the Finnish Government as a tribute to the Bicentennial. Collaborating on the concert will be the Yale University School of Music.

title: Radio
description: 7:30.8:55 A.M., WNYCFM. Concertino No. 2, Ricciotti; Suite iot Harpsichord No. 4, Handel; Romance, Dvorak; Sonata for Trumpet and Organ in F, Albinoni; Trio Sonata in F, Telemann; The Ugly. Duckling. Prokofiev.

title: Suffolk Seeks Designation As Federal Disaster Area
description: The Suffolk County Executive, John V. N. Klein, yesterday formally asked for Federal designation of the county as a disaster area because of estimated agricultural damage of more than $10 million resulting from Hurricane Belle.

title: Farmers Exposed to a Pollutant Face Medical Study in Michigan
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich.In October, after farmers in this dairy country have gathered their harvest, Kent Community Hospital will become the scene of an extensive health survey of the effects of an environmental contaminant.

title: SCHMIDT'S MOVES RUFFLING ALLIES
description: BONN, Aug. 9Chancellor Helmut Schmidt gambled last spring that he could win reelection in October by telling the West Germans that their society was superior to any other in Europe, without losing the respect and prestige that he and his country had won internationally.

title: AMVETS Convention Opened in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 11 (AP)The AMVETS opened their national convention here today with 2,000 persons expected to attend the fiveday event.

title: India's Heritage Shown in Dance By Ritha Devi
description: Rare is the artist who takes all of Indian dance as her hetitap and can effectively present the correct accent of each school. Ritha Devi both can and does, and it was, no doubt out of consideration for her audience that she confined herSelf to four of the eight major traditions. As it was, her program of solos at American Theater Laboratory Tuesday evening, lasted nearly three hours and was a demonstration of unflagging energy and gestural expertise.

title: Screen:Shootist Misses the Mark
description: After the climactic shootout the lone survivor marches out of the cafe into the sun's Slanting light. It is a beauti??? shot, hazy and golden but it is all wrong. The shootout, we are told, takes place just before noon.

description: By The Associated Press

title: 4 Senate Hopefuls Speak At Forum in White Plains
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 11Four contenders for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator from New York touched lightly on a variety of issues during a candidates forum here tonight, which showed few differences in their positions.

title: 11 A.D.B Loans Approved
description: MANILA, Aug. 11 (UPI) The Asian Development Bank in its quarterly review issued today said it had approved 11 loans totaling $305.1 million during the second quarter of 1976.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 11 (UPI)The last American fainAly known to be in Saigon flew to the United States today via Hong Kong today. Richard M. Mielke, 37 years old, of Richland, N.J., who left with his wife and daughter, had been a volunteer worker who remained in Vietnam through the Communist takeover in April 1975 to search for missing Americans.

title: Market Place
description: A Manhattan stockbroker called one of his more important customers yesterday morning and delivered this message: Telephone just hit 60.

title: FUTURES PRICES FOR SUGAR CLIMB
description: Sugar futures prices on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange closed higher yesterday bolstered by a rumor, later denied, that the Soviet Union might have bought a substantial amount of sugar through a London dealer.

title: Books of The Times
description: Every good novel is implicitly ideological, a subtle, even ambivalent interpretation of the way things are. The direction of modern fiction has been toward an ever greater implicitness. One might go so far as to say that the tendency of much contemporary fiction is simply to satirize explicitness, to ironize every conviction until all we have left is what Jung called the terrible ambiguity of an immediate experience.

title: Rhodesian Charge
description: Rhodesia has accused Mozambique's regular forces of firing mortar rounds on the border city of Umtali and a police post. Details on Page 7.

title: PublishorPerishI'm Out, and Glad
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark.I resigned recently from, the English department of a large state university. A part of my reason for quitting was that I wanted to work with a friend having some real success in state politics. The idea of a job with new faces and duties is appealing, even to one late in his 30's who has a family and according to custom, ought to stay put.

title: Israelis in Sweden Charged With Possession of Weapolis
description: NORRKOPING, Sweden, Aug. 11 (AP)Three officials of a visiting Israeli soccer team have been charged with illegal possession of weapons, police sources reported taday.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FINGERTIPS Three new pocketsized publications are handy guides to going out and about in the metropolitan area. An three are 5by8 inches and fit conveniently in a coat pocket.

title: Yippies Hope fo Share Ford Water Fountain
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 11 (UPI)Yippies sweltering in 100degree heat are unhappy about the lack of water at the park in which they are staying and plan to use the drinking fountains at the hotel where President Ford will stay next week during the Itepublican National Convention.

title: Soviet Union Denies Setting Off Large Nuclear Blasts
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 11  The Soviet press agency Tass today characterized as a hostile slanderous campaign recent allegations in the United States that the Soviet Union might have violated the spirit of a treaty on underground nuclear tests by detonating two devices last month possibly exceeding the 150kiloton limit. Yesterday it was announced that the Soviet Government had sent the agreement to the Supreme Soviet, the nominal parliamentary body, for ratification. Since neither country has ratified the accord, it is not yet legally binding. But, at least in Washington's view, the spirit of such a pact would be violated by any excessive explosions before ratification.

title: Coghlan Posts 1,500 Upset
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 11 (UPI)Eamonn Coghlan of Ireland and Villanova University defeated a field that included John Walker of New Zealand, the Olympic gold medal winner in winning the 1,500meter race today at the Finnish international track and field meet. Only 92100ths of a second separated the top four finishers.

title: ]Rockefeller Center Restaurant Woes Vex Workers
description: A company that owns four restaurants in Rockefeller Center apparently had decided to close them, but has not told its employees about the shutdowns because management felt the employes will steal from the company.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. San Diego Padres, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 2:05 P.M. (RadioWNYCAM, 2 P.M.)

title: Xerox Discloses Payments Abroad
description: The Xerox Corporation anmounced yesterday that it had made questionable payments of slightly over $100,000 between 1971 and 1975.

title: Many in Connecticut Without Power
description: HIGGANUM, CONN., AUG. 11 You want to eat, and you can't eat. You want a cup of coffee, you can't have it, said Helen Mannetho, who lives with her husband. Henry, in retirement in this rustic town in the steep, rocky hills by the Connecticut River. She was among thousands of residents in Connecticut today who were still without electricity because of the hurricane.

title: Mine Union Local Chiefs Vote to End Wildcat Strike
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va. Aug. 11The fourweek wildcat strike of most of the nation's 150,000 union coal miners appeared to be running down today. As leaders of the United Mine Workers union finally began to regain control, there was widespread rankandfile commitments to return to work no later than this weekend.

title: Army Releases Spinola From a Military Jail
description: LISBON, Thursday Aug. 12 (Reuters)Antonio de Spinola, the former Portugese president, was released today from the military jail where he had been held since returning from exile on Tuesday.

title: El Al Passengers at Istanbul Attacked; Guprrillas Seized
description: ISTANBUL. Turkey, Aug. 11 ProPalestinian guerrillas exploded grenades and fired submachine guns through a line of passengers waiting to board a Tel Avivbound Israeli jetliner tonight but were thwarted by the police in an apparent attempt to attack the aircraft.

title: Assembly Fails Again on a Bill to Pass Cuts in Property Tax on to Tenants
description: TRENTON, Aug. 11The Assembly failed again to approve a bill giving tenants a share of property tax reductions received by their landlords, coming within one vote of the 41 needed for passage.

title: Streets Official in Jersey Admits Larceny Charges
description: SOMERVILLE, N.J. Aug. 11 (UPI)Philip Petrone, streets superintendent of Manville, has pleaded guilty to 144 counts of larceny and misconduct in connection with a phony voucher scheme that cost the Somerset County community $57,000.

title: DR. H. R. LEAYELL DEAD IN VIRGINIA
description: Dr. Hugh Rodman Leavell died Saturday at McGuire Veterans Hospital in Richmond Va., after a long illness. He was 73 years old.

title: Bustin Endorses Badillo In His Race Against Velez
description: Bayard Rustin, president of the A. Philip Randolph Institute, praised Representative Herman Badillo yesterday for fighting for civil rights and endorsed him for reelection in the 21st District in the Bronx.

description: MIAMI BEACHTom Prater. 200 pounds, indidnapolis outpointed Randy Stephens, 203 Warren, Ohio, 10 rounds.

title: Pro Hockey Tryout Camp Hasa Made in U.S.A.'Cast
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Aug. 11 The first team ever of United States professional hockey players has assembled here.

title: Wounded German Returned
description: HAMBURG, West Germany Aug. 11 (Reuters)  A West German vacationer wounded by East German border guards 18 days ago returned home to his family today, his wife said here.. The vacationer, Will Bubbers, 50 years old, was treated in an East German hospital after having been wounded when guards fired at him on July 24 after he strayed across the border near Ratzeburg in SchleswigHolstein while on a camping trip.

title: Driving. Violations to Increase New York State's License Fees
description: Drivers with speeding convictions or other moving violations on their records will be charged double or triple the regular fee to renew their licenses, beginning next month the State Department of Motor Vehicles announced yesterday.

title: Europe Is Viewing U.S. Election Calmly
description: PARIS, Aug. 11Western Europe has been eyeing the Presidential campaign in the United States with unusual calm and unconcern, with no sign of thej qistomary electionyear jittersj over the continuity of American foreign policy. Senior European and American officials here see two basic reasons for the absence of the customary nailbiting and breathholding while the United States turns away from the world for the election.

title: Unemployment Claims Drop
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (UPI) About 5.4 million Americans received unemployment insurance benefits in the week ended July 24, a decrease of 35,000 from the previous week, the Labor Department said today. The number wa salso down from the 6.5 million total of year earlier. The Labor Department said that 452,400 initial claims for unemployment insurance were filed the week ended July 31, a 22,900 drop from the week earlier.

title: U.S. Five Gains Split
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 11 (UPI)A student basketball team from Kentucky on tour of the Soviet Union split a doubleheader with the junior team of the Ukraine at Simferopol Tass, the Soviet press agency, said today. The Americans won the first game 7167, and lost the second 9076.

title: Law for California
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (UPI)  With strong objections. President Ford signed into law today a bill permitting California to provide direct financial assistance rather than food stamps to persons on welfare under certain conditions.

title: Gonzales Upset
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 11 (AP)Mike Oransky of Miami upset topseeded Francisco Gonzales of Puerto Rico, 76 61, to advance to the quarterfinal round of the United States Tennis Association's 21 and under tournament today. Gonzeles recently won the United States amateur claycourt title.

title: State Phasing Out Drug Center Stormed by Brooklyn Residents
description: The stateoperated center for drug addicts in the Fort Greene section of Brooklyn that was stormed last month by area residents protesting the addicts behavior will be shut down.

title: DAYCARE COSTS SCORED IN REPORT
description: Excessive costs and high rents on leases for daycare centers are producing an $8 million deficit for the troubled New York City program this year, one of the city's fiscal monitors reported yesterday.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Aug. 11Stanley Van Ness, the State Public Advocate, said today that his department should be expanded to include representation for about 880,000 intrastate rail and bus riders whose fares are regulated by the State Commuter Operating Agency.

title: Right City, Wrong Airport
description: PARIS, Aug, 11 (AP)The pilot of an Iraqi Airways Boeing 747 with 350 passengers aboard landed at the wrong airport here todayLe Bourget instead of Orly.

title: Business Unit Asks 5% Jobless Ceiling
description: The Government should not permit more than 5 percent unemployment for any significant period, a group of national business leaders from the Committee for Economic Development urged yesterday in a policy statement on Fighting Inflaition and Promoting Growth.

title: VISITS TO VIETNAM BY EXILES REPORTED
description: PARIS, Aug. 11 (Reuters)Vietnam is permitting members of Vietnamese communities abroad to visit their families in the area that was formerly South Vietnam for the first time since the transfer of power there more than a year ago informed sources said today.

description: Incoming

description: STOCKHOLM, Aug. 11 (UPI)  Mustard Seed, the only American entrant, won the third race in the European StarClass yachting championship today and advanced to fourth place behind three Swedish boats in the overall standing. Mustard Seed was piloted by James Allsopp and Herman Weiler.

description: THE HAGUE, Aug. 11Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger was asked at an impromptu news conference last night whether he thought President Ford would defeat Ronald Reagan next week and Jimmy Carter in November.

title: CRUDE OIL IMPORTS DECLINED IN WEEK
description: Crude oil imports into the United States dipped to 4.85 million barrels a day in the latest week from the record level of 6.29 million barrels a day in the preceeding week statistics issued yesterday by the American Petroleum Institute showed.

title: Arson Suspected in Death Of 12 in French Hotel Fire
description: PARIS, Aug. 11 (Reuters)A Paris fire chief said today that arsonists might be responsible for a hotel blaze early this morning in which 12 people died in the Pigalle nightclub district of northern Pails.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (UPI)Republicans will nominate Representative John J. Rhodes of Arizona as speaker of the House of Representatives at their national convention next week. The purpose is to draw attention to Congressional races in November.

title: Farmer's Wife Wept Over Dying Calves Because There Was Nothing I Could Do
description: HASTINGS, Mich.  Robert Wellman, a former county Young Farmer of the Year, and his wife, Margaret, have lived on dairy farms all their lives. Three years ago, just about the time that Firemaster was inadvertently substituted for Nutrimaster in dairy feed they bought their own 860acre farm here with 250 head of good Holstein milking and breeding stock.

title: NEW YORK DROPPING BABYSALE INQUIRY
description: ALBANY, Aug. 11 (UPI)State officials abandoned hope today of breaking up, a black market in babies in New York City and Illinois because witnesses will not testify.

title: Joe Williams Sings at Hopper's With Ellis Larkins on the Piano
description: Joe Williams is singing in happy circumstances at Hopper's, Avenue of the Americas at 11th Street, where he is being reunited this week and next with his former piano accompanist, the impeccable Ellis Larkins, with the additional backing of Bob Cranshaw on bass and David Lee on drums.

title: IRAN SAID TO PUT STRESS ON BARTER
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 11The Iranian Government, which is short of cash, has indicated privately that the only way it would contemplate making major new acquisitions of United States armaments in the near future would be through barter deals involving Iranian oil, wellplaced informants said here today.

title: Court to Rule on Leases For Offshore Oil Drilling
description: A Federal judge questioned yesterday whether Secretary of the Interior Thomas S. Kieppe had acted precipitously in ordering a sale of leases here next Tuesday for oil drilling off New Jersey.

description: In a garden of Turtle Bay grows an old, muchcherished Willow tree whose fate has been linked in the literature of New York to the fate of the city itself.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 11 (UPI)The California Court of Appeal has reinstated an explosives charge against Wendy Yoshimura, 33 years old companioninhiding of Patricia Hearst, which had been dismissed as too vague.

Two years ago, a survey by the bar group showed that onethird of Americans had never consulted a lawyer and another third had consulted a lawyer only once.

description: Every August, many of the nation's major toymakers trumpet their advertising plans for the preChristmas selling season. And since the bulk of all tyo sales occur in the SeptemberDecember period, advertising of these products is naturally also at peak levels during these months.

title: Britain in Transition III
description: GLASGOW, Aug. 11A dozen years ago, Scottish nationalism was for poets and dreamers and cranks a subject of romance, not politics. Today it is the most dangerous issue in British politics, one that could easily bring down the present Labor Government and might actually lead to the breakup of the United Kingdom.

title: Congressmen Ask Pentagon to Delay Ouster of Cheating Cadets
description: Members of the Senate and House of Representatives have asked the Secretary of the Army, Martin R. Hoffmann, to delay or prevent expulsion of those found guilty of cheating at the United States Military Academy at West Point.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Supreme Court Justice George L. Cobb of Albany County has ruled that the New York State Education Department must make public information on the dropout and placement rates of private vocational schools and certain other records about the schools operations. Reports of abuses by private vocational schools have been dominated by charges that the schools dropout and placement rates indicate a failure to live up to the promises of training and employment that the schools hold out to prospective students. The freedomofinformation suit for the records was filed by another state agency, the New York State Consumer Protection Board. A spokesman for the Education Department said that the decision would be appealed.

title: We Ran Away to Hide A Passen ger Recollects
description: TEL AVIV. Aug. 11 (AP)I heard a bomb. The roof fell down and there was shooting, Clara Mizrahi said after being treated here for wounds suffered in the terrorist attack at Istanbul airport tonight. I heard so much shooting and then we ran away.

title: Bigger Election Fund Role Seen in Specialized Units
description: WASHINGTON, AUG. 11Special interest groups have greatly increased the collection and distribution of campaign funds this year, with more than 1,000 private political action committees including 500 maintained by business corporations contributing money to Congressional candidates.

title: World's Population in 1975 Up 57% Over 1950 Total
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11(Reuters)The world's population at the end of last year was nearly four billion an increase of about 57 percent over the 1950 population, a Commerce Department report says.

title: Crenshaw Good P.G.A. Bet
description: BETHESDA, Md., Aug. 11 When the railbirds suddenly handicapped Ben Crenshaw today as one of the favorites to win the 58th Professional Golfers Association championship, it came as a pleasant surprise to Gentle Ben.

title: Court Restores Beds To Jersey Firehouse
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J. Aug. 11 (AP)  Thirtyfive beds that were removed from New Brunswick firehouses by order of Mayor Richard J. Mulligan must be returned to their places by order of the courts.

title: F.B.I. CHIEF CURBS INTELLIGENCEARM IN COMMAND SHIFT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11Responding to criticism of, his agency's domestic intelligence operations, Clarence M. Kelley announced today the most extensive internal reorganization of the Federal Bureau of Investigation since the beginning of World War II.

title: Spanish Influx Felt in Washington Heights
description: It would appear that what was poison to Fidel Castro has become prime filet for Washington Heights.

title: Spanish Premier Meets Socialists for First Time
description: MADRID, Aug 11 (Reuters) Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez of Spain has conferred with the head of the nation's main Socialist group in the first such meeting since the 193639 civil war, Socialist sources said today.

title: Security Council Meets
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Aug. 11The Security Council met behind closed doors this afternoon to consider the dispute between Greece and Turkey over geological surveys in the Aegean Sea. A United Nations source said that the 15nation Council would hold a public meeting on the issue tomorrow afternoon or Friday.

title: FOOD STAMPS USE IS LED BY BLACKS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (AP) About one in five black households purchased food stamps in a onemonth survey period last year, the Goverment reported today.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BALTIMORE (AL)Recalled Mike Ftanager pitcher, from Rochester farm club and optioned Andres Mora, outfielder, there.

title: Clifford Myers, 78, Dies; Served as a FundRaiser
description: Clifford L. Myers, a former fundraiser and public relations executive, died Tuesday at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 78 years old and liyed at 267 West 89th Street.

title: A NEWCOMER WINS RULING ON BALLOT
description: Joseph Mulholland, a college dean making his first try for political office, will be on the ballot in the Democratic primary in the 25th Assembly District as a result of a ruling yesterday by a State Supreme Court justice in Queens.

title: Connors Joins Vilas In Advancing on Clay
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 11 (AP)  Guillermo Vilas and Manuel Orantes registered straightset victories today to lead the advance of seeded men players into the third round of the $175,000 United States open claycourt tennis championships.

title: ISRAEL INTERCEPTS SHIPS FOR LEBANON
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 11 warships for the fourth time in three weeks yesterday seized:a freighter sailing to or from southern Lebanese Ports that serve Moslem leftist and Palestinian forces as supply gateways.

title: Singapore Envoy to U.S.
description: SINGAPORE, Aug. 11 (AP)Punch Coomaraswamy, a lawyer and diplomat, has been appointed Ambassador to the United States, the Government announced today.

title: New Peril to Egyptian Antiquities Traced to High Dam
description: CAIRO, Aug. 9Drainage problems caused by the Aswan High Dam have begun to endanger the huge statues known as the Colossi of Memnon and other antiquities in southern Egypt, officials of the Government's Antiquities Organization have reported.

title: Flood Damage Reduced
description: ESTES PARK, Colo., Aug. 11 (UPI)  Federal officials reduced to $29 million yesterday their estimate of damage caused by the Big Thompson flood which drowned scores of vacationers and campers. Last week, the Department of Housing and Urban Development estimated that damage from the July 31 flood would be $50 million.

title: DE FACTO DIVISION BEGUN IN LEBANON
description: JUNIEH, Lebanon, Aug. 8The Christians and Moslems of Lebanon have begun in effect to partition the country by setting up state administrations in their respective territories.

title: French Officials Visiting New York To Seek Guidance on Running a City
description: The first mayor of Paris died on the guillotine.

title: Official Note to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (UPI)The Soviet Union has denied officially that its two nuclear test explosions last month exceeded limits agreed to in the treaty, the State Department said today.

title: Rambling Willie Favored
description: YONKERS, Aug. 11Rambling Willie drew the pole position today and has been rated the 52 morningline favorite in Saturday's feature, a $35,000 freeforall pace at 1 miles. Bob Farrington will drive the top aged pacer of 1975.

title: Georgie G. Kistner, 55 Wellesley Civic Leader,
description: Georgie Golde Kistner, a community leader in Wellesley Mass., died at her home Tuesday. She was 55 years old.

title: Dodgers Rhoden Beats Pirates, 20
description: According to Manager Walter Alston of the Los Angeles Dodgers, When Ron Cey and Steve Garvey hit, we usually get enough runs to win most ball games.

title: Mrs. Boglioli Betters Record
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 11 (AP)Wendy Boglioli, who broke the meet mark in the qualifying trials, bettered the mark again in the women's 100meter butterfly at the Amateur Athletic Union national swimming championships tonight with a time of 1 minute 1.76 seconds.

title: Shift in Post Sought
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Aug. 11Seven of the 12 National League teams, including the Mets, Cards and Dodgers will propose at the owners meeting opening here tomorrow that the league's headquarters be moved from San Francisco to New York.

title: Lottery Earns $57 Million
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 11 (UPI)The Pennsylvania lottery earned $57.3 million for programs for the elderly in the fiscal year ended last June 30. The Lotteries Bureau said ticket sales hit a record $136.9 million.

title: 38,000 Asian Refugees Reported on Welfare Lists
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (AP)  Of nearly 130,600 Indochinese refugees resettled in this country since the fall of Saigon to the Communists about 30 percent were receiving cash assistance from welfare agencies as of June 30.

title: Shift of Miss Saxe Denied
description: BOSTON, Aug. 11, (AP)A Federal district judge today rejected a suit to have Susan Saxe, now jailed in New York returned to Massachusetts where she will be tried for the 1970 shooting death of a Boston patrolman. Judge W. Arthur Garrity Jr. turned down a request by Miss Saxe's lawyers, who said they had not been able to see their client enough to prepare a proper case. She was taken to New York June 2 because of a dispute over which government would pay her bills. She faces state charges, but is in Federal custody because of a bail technicality.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 Responding to criticism of his agency's domestic intelligence operations, Clarence M. Kelley announced today the most extensive internal reorganization of the Federal Bureau of Investigation since the beginning of World War II.

title: G.O.P. Platform UnitVotes 87, Not to Take Stand on Equal Rights
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 11 As supporters of Ronald Reagan continued to press the Republicans to take a conservative road in writing the party's platform, a sharply divided subcommittee voted today to take no position on endorsing the equal rights amendment for women.

title: Injuring Health Services
description: WASHINGTON  In 1965, a group of citizens in Denver got together with local healthdepartment officials and with the support of several Federal grants, launched a new program to provide better and more accessible health services. In the first five years the infant mortality rate in the areas served by the program fell 47 percent.

title: GEORGE G. MORROW
description: The Rev. George G. Morrow pastor emeritus of St. Teresa's Roman Catholic Church in Woodside, Queens, died Monday at Ozanam Hall of Queens Nursing Home in Bayside. He was 77 years old and a resident of the home.

title: F.B.I. Out of Control
description: Personal as well as professional pathos marks the plight of Clarence M. Kelley, Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, as he admitted yesterday that he could not flatly deny that F.B.I. agents were engaging in illegal burglaries or other unlawful conduct. Mr. Kelley had made such denials before, but yesterday he confessed I know that I was lied to. He also said, I wish I could say categorically, unquestionably, that this is not going on  I can no longer make categorical sweeping statements.

title: Africa: Time Runs Out
description: The threat to international peace and the menace of catastrophic racial war in southern Africa have been dramatized in a particularly gruesome way by Rhodesia's attack on Mozambique. Rhodesia's white minority Government claims that its forces, in a lightning thrust across the border, killed not only 300 black Rhodesian guerrillas but 40 Mozambiquan soldiers and civilians. Mozambique's army has now evidently retaliated by shelling a Rhodesian town near the frontier.

title: Suffolk Seeks Designation As Federal Disaster Area
description: The Suffolk County Executive, John V. N. Klein, yesterday formally asked for Federal designation of the county as a disaster area because of estimated agricultural damage of more than $10 million resulting from Hurricane Belle.

title: Egypt Accuses Syria
description: CAIRO. Aug. 11 (AP)Egypt blamed Syria again today for the continuing bloodshed in Lebanon because of its military intervention their and likened it to Israel in its efforts to annihilate the Palestinians.

title: Israelis Said to Halt Trade Across the Jordan River
description: NABLUS, Israeli Occupied Jordan, Aug. 11 (Reuters)The Israeli military authorities have retaliated against a 10day strike by Arab traders in the occupied West Bank by restricting trade across the Jordan River, the Mayor of Nablus said today.

title: People and Business
description: Rumors about the possible resignation of Roderick M. Hills as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission have arisen in the aftermath of the nomination by President Ford last month of Patrick Delaney, a man Mr. Hills opposed, to fill a commission vacancy.

title: Giants Conquer Jets by 1614 On Field Goal in Last Seconds
description: Returning to those thrilling days of yesteryear, the Giants last night did the sort of thing that made Sundays bearable for a generation of football fans an improbable lostsecond victory.

title: An Actor in Montclair Charged With Murder
description: MONTCLAIR, Aug. 11A Montclair actor was charged today with the murder of former girlfriend in his apartment on Sunday.

title: Draw for Rich Pace
description: MEADOW LAND, Pa., Aug. 11 (A.P)  Ambro Ranger and Keystone Ore were favored in the draw today for post positions in the $125,141 Adios Pace on Saturday night at the Meadows.

title: Mondale to Try to Speed Action on Voter Signup Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (UPI)  The Democratic VicePresidential nominee, Senator Walter F. Mondale, said today that he was trying to get quick Senate action on a Housepassed bill that would establish a nationwide postcard voter registration system.

title: People in Sports
description: In a move aimed at achieving dollar parity with the men in tennis competition Chris Evert, Wimbledon champion and president of the Women's Tennis Association announced yesterday a new tournament series that lists $600,000 in purse money richest ever for women.

title: I.T.T. Quarterly Earnings Are Up by 12%
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, the diversified telecommunications equipment producer, reported yesterday a 12 percent gain in earnings for the second quarter as well as the first half.

description: VIENNA, Aug. 11 (Reuters) OPEC today signed a lease for a new headquarters here to replace the offices where 10 oil ministers were taken hostage last December.

title: Catching Lightning in a Bottle
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 11Ordinary gamblers indulge their fantasies by buying a $2 ticket on a triple or even a daily double.

title: CARTER SAYS FORD LAGS AS REFORMER
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 11  Jimmy Carter accused the Ford Administration today of failing to restore public confidence in the Government in the aftermath of the Watergate scandals.

title: LOU STRONG DEAD; HEADED PRO GOLF
description: Lou Strong, a former president of the Professional Golfers Association, died of cancer yesterday at West Palm Beach, Fla. lie was 64 years old.

title: Csonka Receives A Warm Welcome
description: Larry Csonka was sitting in the visitors clubhouse but the crowd at Yankee Stadium last night let him know he was home.

title: Schippers Conducts The Philharmonic In Central Park Bill
description: It is not easy for a conductbr to make a strong interpretive impact in an amplified outdoor concert, but Thomas Schippers did so in his appearance with the New York Philharmonic at the Sheep Meadow in Central Park on Tuesday night. And he did it with Brahms's thricefamiliar Symphony No. 4, the concluding work in a program that also offered the Overture to Bernstein's Candide and Bartok's Concerto for Orchestra.

title: 17 Blacks Killed, 50 Hurt In Riots Near Cape Town
description: CAPE TOWN, Aug. 11At least 17 blacks were killed and 50 injured late today, the police said, in racial disturbances that erupted in the black towns around Cape Town.

description: It would appear that what was poison, to Fidel Castro has become prithe filet for Washington Heights.

title: Soviet Five in Final
description: SANTIAGO DE COMPOSTELA, Spain, Aug. 11 (AP) The Soviet Union and Yugoslavia will meet in tomorrow's final of the seventh European junior basketball championship after scoring victories in the semifinals today. The Soviet five beat Bulgaria, 10761, and Yugoslavia beat Spain, 7868.

title: Powell Finds High Court Showing Sounder Balance
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 11Justice Lewis F. Powell Jr. defended today the current thrust of the Supreme Court's decisions in criminal cases, saying that there was now a sounder balance between the rights of defendants and the rights of society.

title: Soviet Space Menu Grows
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 11 (AP)Two Astronauts who have been orbiting the earth for more than a month are eating better than any previous Soviet astronauts, the pressagency Tass said today. Teck nological advances have alLowed the Russians to work out a menu for Salyut 5 that repeats itself only every six days, rather than every three days as on previous manned flights, Tass said. The astronauts are Boris Volynov and Vitali Zholobov.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The American Stock Exchange issued yesterday its latest report on changes in stock ownership by leading stockholders, directors, and officers of its listed companies. The New York Stock Exchange did not make such a report available yesterday.

title: MISSISSIPPI G. O. P. IS CALLED READY TO DROP UNIT VOTE
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 11 The Mississippi delegation to the Republican National Convention the largest uncommitted bloc left, was reported today to be preparing to abandon the unit rule under which it has been operating.

title: Chess:
description: MALAGA, Spain, Aug. 10There are very few systems these days in which it is reasonable to play for the bishop pair at the expense of a fractured pawn structure. This was a favorite theme of Mikhail Botvinnik who had a powerful influence on theory and practice during his reign as world champion in the 1950's, but even this strong advocate had to change his thinking later.

description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing FIRST56,500, pace, ci., mile.

description: Five persons, including two children, were badly burned last night when a gallon can of benzine being used to fuel a charcoal fire exploded in the Cambria Heights section of Queens, according to the police.

description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange ended slightly lower yesterday as measured by the market value index, which closed at 103.80, down 0.06. In the overthecounter market the NASDAQ industrial index moved down to close at 95.51 off 0.38.

title: Group Will Help Build A Hospital at My Lai
description: A group of American church and civic organizations announced a plan yesterday to help build a hospital at My Lai, Vietnam where almost 350 civilians were killed by United States soldiers in 1968.

title: FOE SAID TO ENTER PALESTINIAN CAMP
description: BEIRUT. Lebanon, Aug. 11 Rightwing Christian forces kept up military pressure today against the Palestinian camp of Tell Zaatar, on the outskirts of Beirut. A rightwing radio station reported that the Christian forces had advanced into the camp to help civilians who wanted to leave to reach safety. It said the camp was totally besieged.

title: News Summary and Index
description: A grenade explosion among passengers at Istanbul's airport preparing to board an Israeli jetliner for Tel Aviv killed four persons and wounded 10 to 15, the Turkish radio said. The Turkish police shot it out with terrorists apparently trying to attack the aircraft. The semiofficial Anatolia news agency said two were captured and identified themselves as Palestinians. The plane was undamaged and flew on to Israel, where a passenger told reporters the terrorists were in line with other passengers at the baggage check station when one of their suitcases blew up. [Page 1, Columns 13.]

title: Bridge:
description: The victory of the team headed by Dr. George Rosenkranz of Mexico City in the Spingold knockout team championship earlier this week in Salt Lake City carries two clear messages.

title: $1.2 Million Sardinian Theft
description: PORTO CERVO, Sardinia Aug. 11 (AP)Thieves looted the villa of a Swiss industrialist, Jacques Drapier, and made off with jewels and cash reported to be worth $1.2 million while the owner was out with friends, the police said today.

title: A New Radar Unit On L.I. Parkway Shows Its Worth
description: BABYLON, L. I., Aug. 11In its first day of operation yesterday, a special radar unit of the Long Island State Parkway Police issued about 10 times the number of summonses usually given out for speeding on the Meadowbrook Parkway, the police said today.

description: LAMMDr. George C. Profoundly missed & loved always. Your devoted family. MILLERJONATHAN IRA. Yahrzelt 1st. Wantonly murdered last year. So kind & gentle with a smile & helping hand 10 all. Our hearts are emote, our home is empty. Mom, Dad & Sis.

title: Favored Girls Gain
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 11 (AP)Topseeded Lynn Epstein of Miami and secondseeded Maureen Louie of San Francisco won two matches apiece today to advance to the third round of the United States girls 18andunder championships.

title: Steel Union Editorial Attacks Victor Reuther As a Meddler
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 11In a 1,400 word, editorial, the United Steelworkers Union newspaper has accused Victor G. Reuther, brother of the late leader of the United Automobile Workers, Walter Reuther for meddling in the internal affairs of the steel union.

title: Many in Connecticut Still Without Power
description: HIGGANUM, CONN., AUG. 11 "You want to eat, and you can't eat. You want a cup of coffee, you can't have it, said Helen Mannetho, who lives with her husband, Henry, in retirement in this rustic town in the steep, rocky hills by the Connecticut River. She was among thousands of residents in Connecticut today who were still without electricity because of the hurricane.

title: Arrives in Israel
description: JERUSALEM. Aug. 11  The Israeli El Al passenger plane that was attacked by terrorists in Istanbul landed safely at Ben Gurion Airport tonight with 82 passengers aboard.

title: 5 Blacks filled, 50 Hurt In Riots Near Cape Town
description: CAPE TOWN, Aug. 11At least 15 blacks were killed and 50 injured late today, the police said, in racial disturbances that erupted in the black towns around Cape Town.

title: Arather Reluctant Delegate Ponders His Role as One of the Uncommitted
description: CALUMET CITY, III. When William F. Scannell filed last December for election as a delegate to the Republican National Convention, he insists, It never crossed his mind that he would have any very weighty decisions to make in Kansas City next week as to who his party's candidate for President would be.

title: The Ritz
description: THE RITZ, directed by Richard Lester screenplay by Terrence McNally, based upon his play; produced by Denis O'Dell; photographed by Paul Wilson; music by Ken Thorne At the Cinema I. Running time: 91 minutes. This movie has been rated R.

title: Screen: An Unfunny Thing Happened to 'The Ritz'
description: WHEN TERRENCE McNally's. "The Ritz," opened on Broadway early last year, the critics and public liked it well enough to give it more than a year's run. It was a farce that laid claim to roughly the same patch of mania the Marx Brothers used to tear up: a scramble of mistaken identities, non sequiturs and people not so much in the wrong beds as under them.It was hung upon a gimmicka man takes refuge from his murderous brother-in-law inside a bathhouse full of homosexuals in full orgyand the gimmick was the occasion for most of the jokes. As a farce though, despite the bumps and caperings, it had an essentially abstract spirit. It didn't dwell on the homosexuality, either the sentiment or the mechanics, any more than a sex farce actually dwells on sex.In making a movie out of "The Ritz," Mr. McNally and his director, Richard Lester, have succumbed to the failing that has tended to go with screen adaptations of stage comedies ever since the 1930's, when they knew how to do such things. The bubbles don't disappear; on the contrary, they refuse to disappear as proper bubbles should. They are plotted, fixed, sprayed with lacquer.Still, there are a lot of funny jokes. Most of the principal performers are the same as in the Broadway show, and they are at least serviceably amusing. Rita Moreno, as the female singing star at the bathhouse Saturday night entertainments, is comically incandescent. "The Ritz," which opened yesterday at the Cinema I, might have been a cheerfully lumpy affair. A fallen souffl can still taste reasonably good, especially if you're hungry and eat it with bread.And in this sense it does work to some degree. But if the farce suffers mainly from wearing lead shoes, the homosexual gimmick suffers from something more serious.To have a tolerance, or even an acceptance of homosexuality doesn't rule out having an underlying physical distaste for it. Inevitably perhaps, the camera emphasizes the physical element far more than it was emphasized on the stage. To put it bluntly, it shoves up too closefor most of us, I thinktoo much pale flesh organized around unshared intentions. There are simply too many male homosexual stomachs, arms and faces at too short a range.It spoils the picture. But it is only fair to point out a number of good things that remain in it. There are, as I have said, the jokes. The lineup of weird characters checking into the baths, the fugitive son-in-law among them, is lively and amusing. I particularly like the son-in-law's assumptionhe is from out of townthat at such a sleazy establishment he can pay by check. And the fact thatas tends to happen in New Yorksuch an outrageous assumption works.The acting is often more energetic than funny; particularly in the case of Jack Weston as the fat, puffing son-in-law. On the other hand, Treat Williams is good as a shrill-voiced detective, and F. Murray Abraham manages some comic depth as one of the bathhouse regulars.

title: Italians Have a Way With Updating the Past
description: The same Milanbased innovators who reshaped modem furnishings throughout the world in the 1960's and made 50year old Bauhaus designs look definitely dated have returned with updated concepts in typewriters cookware, chairs, desks and shelving systems.

title: Stage: A Measure to Test The Mettle of Actors
description: OTO VEX ME contraries meet in one. In the program for Measure for Measure, which opened Wednesday at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park, the director John Pasquin, quotes John Donne. Mr. Pasquin seems to take that quotation personallyas he probably should. Measure for Measure is an obstacle course for directors.

title: City Is in the Rough On 17th Green on S.I.
description: Golfers on the South Shore Golf Course in the Huguenot section of Staten Island are encroaching on private property when they get to the 17th green, and have been for years, although nobody, including the Parks Department which owns and operates the course, knew it until recently.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: LIONAIRE IN NOTHER MILDUTCHESS that was the headline in The Poughkeepsie Sunday Courier of May 12 1895, over a story reporting that Frederick William Vanderbilt, the grandson of Commodore Vanderbilt; had bought an estate overlooking the Hudson river at Hyde Park in Dutchess County. The influx of men of great wealth joining the landed gentry already in residence along the river had an unpredictable side effect: Their drive to build grandiose parttime mansions with extensive grounds, gardens and farms served to preserve and protect the scenic beauty of the Hudson Valley from commercial and residential develop.

title: How to Get There
description: By car from New York Citythere is no other practical way to tour Hyde Parktake the Saw Mill River Parkway to the Taconic State Parkway. Exit at Hibernia Road and go 1.8 miles to the Salt Point Turnpike, then folow the Hyde Park sign on a winding country road nine miles to Hyde Park center.
