title: Carter Accelerating His All Out Effort To Broaden His Support Among Blacks
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 11Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson of Newark came calling yesterday at thel new CarterMondale national campaign headquarters in the Cotony Square shopping complex.

title: People and Business
description: Timothy C. Leader, managing director of Babcock & Wilcox Ltd. of London, said yesterday that he and trade union leaders were making joint appeal to the Government for financial aid for manufacturers of power station equipment. Time is running out, he said in a London radio interview.

title: PEYSER'S PETITIONS OPPOSED IN COURT
description: ALBANY, Aug. 13  State Supreme Court Justice Roger J. Miner reserved decision today in the first round of another challenge to the nominating petitions of Representative) Peter A. Peyser, who is contesting Senator James L. Buckley for the Republican nomination for Senator in the Sept. 14 nrimary election.

title: Red Reformation?
description: Santiago Carrillo, leader of the Spanish Communist Party, recently compared the situation in world Communism to that in Christianity at the time of the Protestant Reformation. In the past, he argued, he and his fellow Communists had our Pope, our. Vatican Moscow; but now he sees himself and other dissident Western European Communists as a sort of collective Martin Luther demanding radical change.

title: FORD AIDES OFFER DELEGATE TOTALS RIMING VICTORY
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 13  President Ford's managers issued today a statebystate delegate count showing Mr. Ford with enough votes for, a firstballot victory at the Republican National Convention but it was immediately challenged by Ronald Reagan's principal strategist.

title: PRODUCTION RISE SLOWED IN JULY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Industrial production is continuing to increase, but at a much slower pace, new figures from the Federal Reserve Board disclosed today.

title: Panamanian Ship Is Seized
description: MIAMI, Aug. 13 (Reuters)United States customs officials said today they had seized a Panamanianregistered banana boat on suspicion of trying to smuggle cocaine into the United States on seven occasions. The vessel, the 1,459ton Cubahama was seized yesterday in Jacksonville, Fla.

title: Renewal of New Brunswick Outlined to State Officials
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Aug. 13 Plans for a major facelift of the busy downtown commercial area of this city and the presi ervation of its residential neighborhoods were presented today to state officials.

title: Early Arrivals for V.F.W. Convention Buzz With Talk About Legion Disease
description: Members of the Veterans of Foreign Wars began arriving in New York City yesterday for their 77th national convention which is expected to attract a total of 40,000 delegates, family members and friends next week. Those who showed up early were abuzz with talk of the socalled Legion disease.

title: The Enemy Within Our Gates
description: ATHENSIn a provocative interview to be published shortly by the London magazine Encounter, George F. Kennan, American diplomat and historian, laments the inadequacy of the United States political system, the concepts and methods of its foreign policy, and the frequent lack of quality in Presidential candidates presented to the people of the United States.

title: U.S. STEEL RAISES PRICES A 2D TIME WITHIN 3 MONTHS
description: The United States Steel Con poration announced price im creases yesterday on its major product linesheet and strip It was the second major steel price increase in three months.

title: Books of The Times
description: When Bishop George Berkeley wrote his celebrated Verses on the Prospect of Planting Arts and Learning in Americathe date was 1726he was reflecting the common view when he said Westward the course of empire takes its way. This view held as an article of faith that arts sciences and empire traveled west. It was thus inevitable that the arts, which were supposed to have begun in Greece picked up by Rome and then moved to England would be translated to America, However.

title: Old Spanish Foes Test Tentative Harmony
description: MADRID, Aug. 13Representatives of the two Spainsthe victors and the vanquished of the Civil Warare starting to talk with each other again after almost 40 years of struggle and hate.

title: Jets Fall 4117, to Raiders
description: Fate was kinder than the schedulemaker to the Jets last night. For none of them crashed into the leftfield wall at Yankee Stadium.

title: CENTRAL BANKS ACT TO AID FLOAT
description: LONDON, Aug. 13 (AP)Continental central banks intervened massively in money mar. kets today to prevent the joint European float from breaking up as the strong West German mark strained the ceiling. The dollar was at a fourmonth low against the mark but mixed against other currencies.

title: Optimistic Gal Choice At Saratoga
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS N.Y., Aug. 13Can Eddie Maple make a winner of Optimistic Galagain?

title: The Mandate of Heaven.
description: HONG KONG  The four Chinese characters traditionally used to describe an earthquake are tien peng pi liehliterally, heaven crashes earth cracks.

title: Excerpts From South African's Address
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Following are excerpts from the text of a speech by South Africa's Minister of Foreign Affairs, Dr. Hilgard Muller made today in Durban, South Africa, on Rhodesia and SouthWest Africa. The text was provided by the South African Embassy.

title: Some Shellfishing Regions On L.I. Closed by the State
description: KINGS PARK, L.I., Aug. 13Thirty  six square miles of waters off Long Island's North Shore were ordered closed to shellfishing today because of an electrical failure at a sewage treatment plant here caused by Hurricane Belle.

title: Some Jersey Beaches Closed
description: TRENTON, Aug. 13 (AP)State environmental officials ordered the closing today of beaches in Cape May City and Cape May Point where raw sewage has floated ashore.

title: Hungary, Soviet Union Split
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 13 (Reuters)Hungary and the Soviet Union divided the first day's singles matches in the European Zone A Davis Cup final in Tbilisi today, the Soviet news agency Tass reported.

title: Preminger Shares Role With Some Great Art
description: At the F.B.I. building at 201 East 69th Street yesterday the film director walked into a conference room ablaze with television lights and filled with reporters and F.B.I. agents to claim a painting that had been stolen from his New York offices last Dec. 14.

title: Jersey Moves to Restrict Chemical Waste Disposal
description: TRENTON, Aug. 13  The New Jersey Legislature has taken a major step toward protecting the state's drinkingwater supplies by approving a bill imposing strict regulations on companies that accept hazardous chemical wastes and radioactive materials for disposal.

title: Kissinger Presses for Ocean Agreement
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Aug. 13Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger warned today that the United States might unilaterally permit American companies to go ahead with proposed oceanbed mining ventures unless an international consensus on the issue was reached soon.

title: Memorial Seruices
description: SHELLYMary J. Memorial services will be held on the grounds of the Stonecutter's Cottage, Block Island, Rhode Island, at 2:15, August 19th.

title: About New York
description: You are leaving your apartment. It is not the apartment's fault that you are leaving. It is a good, if not noble, apartment, in a brave, if not luxurious building, on surprisingly untrafficked West 79th Street not far away from the blue whale at the American Museum of Natural History.

title: Mozambique Reports 618 Died In Rhodesia Raid on Guerrillas
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 13 (AP)The Mozambique Government said today that at least 618 persons were killed in a Rhodesian raid on guerrilla camps inside Mozambique earlier this week, double the figure reported by Rhodesia.

title: FORD AIDES OFFER DELEGATE TOTALS SHOWING VICTORY
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 13  President Ford's managers issued today a statebystate delegate count showing Mr. Ford with enough votes for a firstballot victory at the Republican National Convention but it was immediately challenged by Ronald Reagan's principal strategist.

title: F.B.I. to Investigate Murder of Roselli
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Attorney General Edward H. Levi today ordered the Federal Bureau of Investigation to try to determine whether John Roselli, the crime figure, was murdered as a result of his Senate committee testimony on assassination plots of the Central Intelligence Agency against Prime Minister Fidel Castro of Cuba.

title: Newark Policeman Shot to Death During Holdup
description: KEARNY, N. J., Aug. 13A Newark policeman was shot to death this morning during holdup of a checkcashing company in this west Hudson County community.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: HAVANA, Aug. 13 (Reuters) Prime Minister Fidel Castro of Cuba will not attend the meeting of nonaligned countries in Colombo. The Cuban delegation will be headed by Carlos Rafael Rodriguez, Deputy Prime Minister in charge of foreign affairs, who left here tonight after telling reporters that he would explain in Colombo why Mr. Castro would not attend.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Syria put tight controls on its border with Lebanon yesterday, stirring speculation that Damascus was sending reinforcements to back up the 20,000 Syrian troops already in Lebanon. Arab diplomats in Beirut said the move could be in anticipation of more trouble in Lebanon following the capture of the Palestinian camp of Tell Zaatar by rightist Christians on Thursday. [Page 1, Column 4.]

title: Israel Sets Mail Deadline
description: WASHINGTON, Aug.13 (UPI) The Postal Service today said that the Israeli postal administration had set, deadlines for receiving mail for delivery in Israel in time for the Jewish New Year celebration Sept. 25. Israeli officials said that parcels sent by surface mail should reach Israel by Aug. 25, surface mail cards by Sept. 5, airmail parcels by Sept. 17 and airmail letters and cards by Sept. 20.

title: HISPANIC ACTORS STAGE FESTIVAL
description: Joseito Tirado leaves a rustic life working on his father's sugarcane field in Puerto Rico for the land of plenty, New York City. Here he has trouble finding his friends, trouble getting a job and finally trouble with the police. He ends up wishing he were back in the sun on his father's farm.

title: New Way to a Job Skip Hiring Office Just Start Working
description: DETROIT, Aug. 13 (UPI)The three young men had been turned down so many times they did not even bother applying for Chrysler Corporation assembly line jobs at the Mack Avenue stamping plant. They lust went to work.

title: What Is It? Anything Your Little Heart Desires
description: In one corner of the East Yard of St. Mark's ChurchintheBouwerie, beneath the cool shade of trees and near some old, flat gravestones half buried in the sand, is a strangelooking sculpture.

title: A Stoic Pat Nixon Is Recalled by Aide
description: LONDON, Aug. 13The key point is that they never understood Washington never figured out how to cultivate friends or negotiate with enemies. They simply couldn't reach out, and thus they built a fortress.

title: Robbers in Italy Get Paintings by Titian Rubens and Tiepolo
description: MONZA, Italy, Aug. 13 (AP) Art thieves carried off 21 paintings, attributed to such masters as Titian, Rubens and Tiepolo last night, after quietly raiding the almost  deserted villa of an Italian industrialist and anesthetizing two watchdogs, the police reported today.

title: THOMAS J. THOMPSON
description: Thomas J. Thompson, a retired stock broker, died Thursday at Riverview Hospital, Red Bank, N.J. He was 71 years old and lived in Highlands, N.J.

title: F.B.1. to Investigate Murder of Roselli
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Attorney General Edward H. Levi today ordered the Federal Bureau of Investigation to try to determine whether John Rosen the crime figure, was murdered as a result of his Senate committee testimony on assassination plots of the Central Intelligence Agency against Prime Minister Fidel Castro of Cuba.

title: Triskaidekaphobes Are You One of Them?
description: The Friday the 13th Club gathered on its big day yesterday to hear a New York University professor speaknot always seriouslyabout triskaidekaphobia, the irrational fear of the number'13.

title: Fear Ripples in Quiet Section of Brooklki
description: Except for the pinball machines in some stores and the occasionally boisterous youths they attract during the evenings, there has been little in recent years to disturb the calm of the Bay RidgeBorough Park area.

title: Popularity Surge of U.S. Open Tennis Leaves Some Longtime Fans onthe Outside Looking In
description: The tennis explosion is producing unexpected fireworks over ticket demands for the United States Open championships.

title: Quarrie Is Victor In London Sprint
description: LONDON, Aug. 13 (AP)Don Quarrie, Jamaica's 200meter Olympic gold medalist won the 100 meters in 10.42 seconds at the British Amateur Athletics Association championships tonight at Crystal Palace. One of Britain's promising young sprinters, Alan Wells of Scotland was second in 10.62, and Mike McFarlane, the 17yearold English schools champion, was third.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: SATELLITE PLAN IS GIVEN TO F.C.C.
description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting yesterday submitted to the Federal Communications Commission the details of its plan to distribute public television programs by the Western Union satellite instead of by the land lines of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company.

title: Platform Panel Supports Ford Foreign Policy View
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 13The Republican Platform Committee approved tonight a party document generally supporting President Ford's foreign policies and containing conservative planks aimed at pleasing his rival, Ronald Reagan.

title: Yanks Rout Twins For Figueroa, 93
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn. Aug. 13  Some call him Figgy, others call him Figaro. But Ed Figueroa was neither growing fruit nor singing opera tonight. He was demonstrating that the Yankees most effective pitching arm was healthy again.

title: HAYS WITHDRAWS FROM HOUSE RACE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Representative Wayne L. Hays with his Congressional power shattered by scandal, withdrew today as a Democratic candidate for the House seat from Ohio that he has held for 28 years.

title: Panel Won't Censure Government Immorality
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 13The Republican Platform Committee quickly killed tonight a proposed plank that would have denounced immorality in government, such as the Watergate scandal, as unpardonable.

title: Morgan Cards a 68 for 134 in P.G.A. To Lead by Four. Strokes Over Kite
description: BETHESDA, Md., Aug. 13In a motel room near this Washington suburb, a red tabby cat named Claude, who travels 60,000 miles a year will dine better than usual this weekend. The reason is that Claude is helping his owner celebrate an unaccustomed success. His owner is Dr. Gilmer Bryan Morgan 2d a sometime optometrist who took a fourstroke lead today in the second round of the Professional Golfers Association championship.

title: PRICES UP A BIT IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices inched ahead on slightly lower volume yesterday on the American Stock Exchange.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Muhammad All and Joe Frazier, whose boxing talents me excited the sports world and Red Smith of The New York Times, who writes about their skills, were among the major award winners at the 51st Boxing Writers Association dinner at the Downtown Athletic Club last night.

title: U.N. to Investigate
description: GENEVA, Aug. 13 (Reuters)The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees asked his representative in Mozambique today to, investigate reports that refugees may have been among victims of a Rhodesian attack inside the country last Sunday.

title: MISS BOW DEN OFFERS A HUMOROUS DANCE
description: The development of modern dance has been a collection of personal sagas, great and small. Each has contributed something to the serious theaterdance form that agrees mainly on the principal of fierce individuality. Sallie Bowden is one of the lighterhearted spirits in the crusade snd Thursday evening she presented her latest contribution ironically titled. The Wonderful World of Modern Dance or the Amazing Story of the Pil, Part II at the Construction Company Studio.

title: THURSDAY'S FIGHT
description: LOS ANGELESAlberto Sandoval, Pomona, Calif., knocked out John Mesa, Tucson, Ariz. 2 rounds, bantamweights.

title: Notes on People
description: Navy surgeons have a high degree of confidence that a growth removed from Secretary of Defense Donald H. Rumsfeld's thyroid gland yesterday was not cancerous. A Pentagon spokesman said that the right lobe of the gland with a related tube called the isthmus was taken out.

title: ORDER BY SYRIANS VIRTUALLY 5111115 LEBANON BORDER
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 13Syria virtually closed its border with Lebanon today amid speculation that Damascus was sending reinforcements to back up the 20,000 Syrian troops already in this country.

title: F.B.I. AGENT GUILTY IN CRIMINAL CASE
description: John P. Dunphy, a 47yearold executive with the Federal Bureau of Investigation, pleaded guilty yesterday to a charge that he had converted Government property to his own use in his job. He was forced to resign.

title: Today's Entries at Monmouth
description: Horses listed In order of past Positions

title: Reagan's Shift to Left
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 13Everyone used to know why Ronald Reagan sought the Presidency.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Newark's experiment with staggered work hours for a number of the city's offices and plants has met with overwhelming approval, according to a spokesman for the Newark Chamber of Commerce.

title: Letters to the. Editor
description: To the Editor In your recent editorial. Competing for Shares, you suggest that tangible benefits of cost and efficiency could accrue to securities customers by replacing stock exchange specialists and floor brokers with a computer. As a dataprocessing technician who has spent a considerable amount of time studying this question, I must take issue with the view that a computer can perform all the functions and activities of the present professional participants.

title: U.S. Signs Lisbon Accord Giving $25 Million in Aid
description: LISBON, Aug. 13The United States signed a series of accords with Portugal here today for an additional $25 million in economic and social aid.

title: Carter Terms Staff Disclosures Of G.O.F. Job List a Mistake
description: PLAINS, Ga., Aug. 13 Jimmy Carter disavowed today what he described as an intrastaff memorandum listing 19 unsuccessful Republicans placed in high Government positions by President Ford. He said that its release had been a serious mistake by a staff member.

title: Hanover Sees an Increase In Prime Rate in Autumn
description: NEW YORK, Aug. 13 (Reuters)United States bank loan dentand and bank prime rates should begin rising in the fall the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company said today in its financial digest.

title: Political Exiles Are Living in Fear in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 14The assassination of prominent Latin American political exiles and the kidnapping or disappearance of many refugees have dramatized the insecurity of the 15,000 people who have fled here in recent years to seek asylum from military regimes in Chile, Uruguay, Bolivia and Paraguay.

title: Highlights & Index to Listings
description: WALLACH & JACKSONA revival of John Guare's The House of Blue Leaves enters the summer circuit this week and seems to be tacking toward Broadway. With Eli Wallach and Anne Jackson at the helm, it will open tomorrow at the Westport Playhouse in Westport, Conn., sail on to the Falmouth Playhouse on the Cape the following week, and then proceed to Bucks County. When the play ran on Off Broadway in 1971, it won the Critics Award and the Oble Award with its wackiness about the adventuresof an employee of the Central Park Zoo, whose wife sometimes takes him for a member of the Animal Kingdom.

title: In Defense of Nassau's Arts Program
description: AS a taxpayer and a 20year resident of Nassau County, I am rather proud that during the past five years, through the efforts of both Ralph G. Caso, the County Executive, and John W. Maerhofer, the director of the county's office of Development, the O.C.D. has brought all forms of cultural activity to vast number of residents of Nassau Ccumty. This is contrary to the image portrayed by Laszlo Halasz article. Opinion Page, July 18].

title: A master and a master's master
description: Well, the news from Fresno is excellent. William Saroyan  memoirist, light spirit, bold trapezist of the 1930's, who went from pedalling bicycle for Western Union to thumbing his nose at the Pulitzer Prizeis now

title: If Tennis Pros Could Only Understand the Hackers
description: Every year, when my game falls apart and I start yelling and hitting myself on the head with my racquet, I decide maybe I need a little help, and I go to some professional or other for a couple of lessons. Last summer I even opted for major surgery and signed up for my first tennis camp.

title: GARDENING
description: GARDENERS who like pansies and are accustomed to set out purchased plants each spring should try raising their own pansies from seed. If you have never done so, begin now. It's fun, it's simple, and you will be very successful without a mulch in a northern New Jersey gardenif you have a protected southfacing area close to the house foundation.

title: NEW BERME CUTS TROUBLING BOARD
description: Staff auditors for the State Emergency Financial Control Board are raising objections over the efficacy of Mayor Beanie's latest proposal for budget sayings, particularly the $85 million in standby spending cuts designed for use if the initial reductions are not enough.

title: How to Repair Ceramic Tile
description: Although ceramic tile normally needs little or no maintenance, even after years of scrubbing and hard wear, there are times when repairs are required. This may happen when individual tiles work loose, when grout Joints crack or become so badly stained that regrouting is required, when soap dishes or toothbrush holdqrs break loose, or when joints between tub and tile walls pop open and need refilling.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: No Love, No Soul and No Graciousness From Nadia
description: To The Sports Editor: As one who is glad that human beings are imperfect, I would like to speak about Nadia Comaneci.

title: Jill Casner Is Married to James Lotto
description: Jill Regan Casner and James George Lotto, graduates of Johns Hopkins University, were married yesterday morning in Millbrook, N.Y. where the Rev. Dr. Peter Samson of the White Plains Community Unitarian Fellowship performed the ceremony at the Altamont Inn.

title: LeDoux Is Stopped By Foreman in 3d
description: UTICA, N.Y., Aug. 14 (AP)  George Foreman, the former heavyweight charivion, battered littleknown Scott LeDoux mercilessly and knocked him out in 2 minutes 58 seconds of the third round of their scheduled 10round fight today on national television.

title: KANSAS CITY YIELDS TO DEMONSTRATORS
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 14 (UPI)City officials have given in to demands of demonstrators and supplied portable toilets and a water faucet in Penn Valley Park.

title: EGYPTIANS ALLOW ELECTION CONTEST
description: CAIRO, Aug. 13  For the first time since the 1952 revolution, Egyptians will choose from opposing candidates in elections for the People's Assembly.

title: ART
description: TRENTON EVER since museums were founded in this country a century ago, they have become increasingly complex organizations. They have dramatically expanded their cojlections, acquiring many more and different kinds of objects, and they also have broadened their educational programs and noticeably stepped up their exhibition schedules.

title: Miss Tomasetti Is Wed
description: Lillian Tomasetti, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Dominick G. Tomasetti of Bayside, Queens, was married there yesterday afternoon to James S. Ditucci, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Ditucci of New York City. The ceremony was performed in the Roman Catholic Church of the Sacred Heart by the Rev. John J. Cuff. Patricia A. Tomasetti was her sister's maid of honor and James T. Moore was best man. The bride is a legal secratary in the law department of Este Lauder Inc.

title: A Lot of Public Business Is at a Standstill
description: WASHINGTONElection years are popularly regarded as times of intense activity, when the leaders and candidates of the two parties, emboldened by beckoning political prospects, increase their efforts to impress the electorate with their achievements and govern with exhibitionist vigor.

title: Foyt Wins the Pole Position For Today's Trenton Race
description: TRENTON, Aug. 14Despite a fever of 102 degrees, 41yearold A. J. Foyt of Houston won the pole position today for tomorrow's 200mile Trenton Times Auto Classic.

title: TURKS ASK TALKS WITH THE GREEKS
description: Turkey offered yesterday to resume talks with Greece at the highest level to seek a peaceful solution to their dispute over offshore oil prospecting in the Aegean Sea.

title: Tornadoes Targeting in on the State, Too
description: OFFICE workers gazing toward New Jersey from their Lower Manhattan skyscrapers on July 7 might have felt, for a fleeting few moments, that they were bystanders in a Middle Western cornfield. What they saw was a long, black, twisting cone of air veering crazily toward Bayonne.

title: Shafer Earns Pole
description: BRAINERD, Minn., Aug. 14 (AP)Carl Shafer won the pole position today for tomorrow's TransAm road race as he sped around the threemile track in his Camaro at an average speed of 108 miles per hour.

title: New Jersey/This Week
description: DREW UNIVERSITY, 36 Madison Avenue. MadisonEdgar Allen Poe: A Condition of Shadow, oneman show with Jerry Rockwood. Tomorrow, 8 P.M. $4.5046.50. (201) 3774467. Repertory theater productions of Henry V today. 7 P.M.. and Thursday. The Best Man (Tuesday, and Friday, 8 P.M.) and The Devil's ??? (Wednesday. 8 P.M. and Saturday, 6 and 9:30 P.M.). (201) 3773000.

title: SOME NUTRITIONISTS ASSAILED IN REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (UPI) Some university professors of nutrition have sold out to the food industry, leaving consumers without the independent advice and criticism they need, it was charged in a report released today.

title: Towing Law Ruled Illegal
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 14 (UPI)A Federal judge has ruled that the city's method of towing away illegally parked cars is unconstitutional. United States District Judge Morey L. Scar ruled Tuesday that the towing law was unconstitutional because drivers whose cars were towed were deprived of their property without a hearing, He held that the law violates the 14th Amandment to the Constitution.

title: Need for Second New York State Women's Prison Debated at Bedford Hills Facility by Inmates and Official
description: BEDFORD HILLS, N.Y., Aug. 14The state's only prison for women is almost completely full, and there has been talk of opening a second facility, but several inmates of the prison, the Bedford Hills Correctional Facility in Westchester County, say that overcrowding is not a problem.

title: Miss Carpenter, 19, Wins Bicycle Race
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 14 (AP)  Helen Carpenter, a 19yearold from Madison, Wis., pedaled 36.9 miles in 1 hour 36.3 minutes today to win the women's event in the United States national bicycle roadracing championships here.

title: Newspaper Mulch, a Simple Solution for An Old Problem
description: Our formal education having included certain courses in logic and philosophy, we have always liked to think tbat there exists in the universe a natural system of checks and balances; that for every reaction, there is an action. When we laid out our first vegetable garden, we tilled, we fertilized, we marked on our calendar certain dates taken from last year's collection of gardening pages. We made what we hoped would be a happy home for two praying mantises ordered from a catalog. Then, confident that we had done our part, we left the second stage to Mother Nature.

title: GARDENING
description: ARE good gardeners born with green thumbs or do they acquire them? There may be strong arguments both ways, but, as with any activity requiring knowledge and skills, it helps to develop an interest in childhood.

title: A Test for Gourmands: Rhode Island's Mammoth Shore Dinner
description: It's a festive scene of medieval gluttony3,000 men, women and children slurping, chomping, crunching, whacking open lobster claws, dipping steamed clams into drawn butter, shuttling ears of hot corn back and forth past clacking teeth and spitting out hundreds of thousands of watermelon seeds onto their plates. The crowd ladles down 600 gallons of clam chowder every hour. In a single day five tons of clamcakes, all shot out of a special cannon invented for the purpose, and each deepfried for seven minutes, will disappear down the gullets of these selfmade eating champions in the world's largest shore dinner hall at Rocky Point on Narragansett Bay, 10 miles south of Providence, R.L

title: Sarah Liberman Married to Mark Ash
description: Sarah Ivy Liberman, daughter of Prof and Mrs. Alvin M. Liberman of Mansfield Center, Conn., was married yesterday afternoon to Mark Alan Ash, son of Martha C. Ash of Louisville, Ky.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock market wound up the week with a small gain as investor concern over the economy dulled interest. The widelywatched Dow Jones industrial average closed on Friday at 990.19, up 4.19 points for the week.

title: Food
description: One of our earliest memories of food and rhyme consists of the following lines of nonsense: I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream. We still go wild for ice cream, but we go absolutely bananas for any pure fruit ice, the kind known in French as a granite and in Italian as a granita. Our tribute to these frozen desserts is a generous sampling of recipes.

title: Novels and stories
description: During a recent visit to a major Hollywood studio, I beard of a movie project with the same name as this novel and, based on the same flimsy premise: a great epicure assassinates his favorite chefs, one by one, so that he will be able to diet in peace. The

title: Meredith Uhl Becomes Bride
description: Meredith Louise Uhl, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Henry Stephen Magraw Uhl of Asheville, N. C., was married yesterday evening to Richard William Conley, son of Shirley Conley of Denver and Dr. Francis William Conley of Clarksburg, W. Va.

title: Peruvian in Air Crash
description: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 14 (UPI)A military helicopter crashed near the southern city of Moquegua today, seriously injuring the Peruvian Transportation and Communications Minister, Gen. Artemio Garcia Vargas. An official communiqu said Mr. Garcia was in delicate condition.

title: Libya Blamed This Time
description: KHARTOUM, the SudanOn July 4.after two days of vicious street fighting, the forces of President Gaafar alNimeiry beat back an insurrection that, it is now clear, was fomented by neighboring Libya. The rebels were a wellarmed but ragtag troop of exiles, zealots and mercenaries that somehow managed to trek 1,000 miles across the desert undetected.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: I you were ever young, which is probable, and the armed forces, which is possible, you wrote letters home. If you have been particularly fortunate, they were lost or discreetly mislaid. Few experiences in this life are more mortifying than coming across one of the maundering notes that you wrote while in the grip of military indoctrination. ('The Jerries came over again last night. I can hardly wait to finish them off so we can get at the dirty Japs.') Did we actually write such things? Or has someone craftily forged our handwriting?

title: LOCKHEED INQUIRY IN ITALY STALLED
description: ROME, Aug. 14On its cover this week, the magazine II Settimanale ran this headline: Japan: The ExPrime Minister in JailItaly: The Antelope Running Free.

title: 1940: June 10 to June 16
description: The World War II book has become a genre, like the Western and the detective story, and the explanation is simple: it's still the story of the century. Publishers know when they're on to a hardy perennial. Nothing has come along since to equal it in terms of history as drama, and one shudders to think what It would take. There is no point complaining that the story of the fall of France has been told over and over. The subject was built to last, and can always bear another retelling.

title: She Sells Sea Ships by the Seashore
description: What is a young girl like you doing in this kind of business, they ask Cathy (Catherine) Pierot.

title: FOOD
description: SEVENTYFIVE years ago, a Polish immigrant family arriving to till the Island's fertile soil might have settled in an area of Riverhead called Polish Town, The threads of daily life could be picked up much as they were in Poland. Not a word of English was needed in order to attend to shopping, schooling, churchgoing, social life or medical care. Polish was spoken here.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: Just nine days to gonine days until hordes of collectors descend on the Americana Hotel for the 85th Anniversary convention of the American Numismatic Association, the first to be held in New York City in 25 years. It will run from Tuesday, Aug. 24, through Sunday, Aug. 29. Since approximately one  third of the A.N.A.'s more than 30,000 members live in the New York Metropolitan area, and since this densely populated region also holds countless thousands of non  member collectors, A.N.A. officials are anticipating a recordsetting turnout. Admission is free, to members and nonmembers alike.

title: Letters: Calling Home From Hotels
description: To the Editor: raving recently returned from 45 days of travel in Western Europe, I would like to bring to the attention of your readers a ripoff which appears to be frequent among hotel managements over there.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: WHOLESALE PRICES ROSE 0.3 PERCENT In July, matching the May increase and just under. the 0.4 percent gain in June, the Labor Department reported. The July rise was led by a 0.7 percent increase in industrial commodities, but was kept down by a 0.9 percent decline in processed foods and feed  Firestone Tire & Rubber and the United Rubber Workers reached agreement on a 36 percent wage increase over three years, ending a 16week strike in the rubber industry  Manufacturing and trade inventories rose $3.3 billion in June to a seasonally adjusted $275.87 billion, the sharpest rise since the end of 1974.

title: Hannah Tillich's live ranch
description: EAST HAMPTON IN 1973, eight years after her husband, the Protestant theologian Tillich, died, Hannah Tillich published her memoirs. The book, From Time to Time, was a candid account of her life that detailed her husband's infidelities and graphically described her own sexual adventures with both men and women, and it created a furor. A favorable review by a Tillich disciple. Harvey Cox, the Harvard theologian, stemmed the tide of pornography charges, but the book alienated some of her husband's colleagues and many relatives, including their daughter.

title: Robert Evans's Rise From GradeB Actor to APlus Producer
description: Half a dozen sample ads for Marathon Man, the movie version of William Goldman's novel about a former Nazi dentist tracking down a cache of diamonds in New York, are spread out on the floor of producer Rob ert Evans's office at paramount Studios. Evans scrutinizes them carefully, decides that Laurence Olivier's eyes are too prominent and Dustin Hoffman's figure too static, and he instructs the artists on how to revise the drawings.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Editor: Hilton Kramer's attitude in his article Our Museums Are Flooded with Counterfeit Art [July 25] typifies the arrogance with which the museumgoing public is treated by art critics. Reproductions help us recreate in our imaginations the spirit, the anguish and the beauty of an original work. To insinuate that a 10cent reproduction sates our appetites for beauty is to imply that the public lacks all esthetic and emotional sensibilities.

title: Toll Now Five in Florida Illness, But Official Sees an Abatement
description: BOYNTON BEACH, Fla., Aug. 14 (UPI)Health officials reported today a fifth death among 25 elderly patients who were stricken with an undiagnosed highfever illness that swept through a nursing home earlier this week.

title: African Drought Effects
description: BAMAKO, Mall, Aug. 14 (Agence FrancePresse)  Africa's droughtplagued subSaharan region still faces acute problems of water supplies for agriculture, the Transport and Public Works Minister of Niger, Moussa Bako, has said.

title: Tax Aide Goes Public
description: TRENTON SIDNEY GLASER, who has earned a reputation as a knowledgeable tax adviser to Governors and legislatcirs during his 30 years in state government, is about to go public.

title: The Boycott PaceSetter
description: The patternsetter for the unionproclaimed consumer boycott against J. P. Stevens & Company was the boycott the Amalgamated Clothing Workers directed against the Farah Manufacturing Company during a 22monthlong strike. The company. one of the country's biggest pants makers, with plants in El Paso and San Antonio, was headed by Willie Farah, a rugged individualist, who warned that he would let his machinery rust before he surrendered to unionization.

title: BRIDGE
description: Dick Frey is apt to feel disappointed whenever he's introduced to an audience. His hosts tend to dwell on his more obvious attributes: President of the International Bridge Press Association; Chairman of the Goren Editorial Board; dean of American bridge writers; longtime editor of The Contract Bridge Bulletin. published by the American Contract Bridge League; and author of several books.

title: Yugoslav Contradictions
description: The public attack by President Tito on Ambassador Laurence H. Silberman dramatized the recent deterioration of AmericanYugoslav relations. Marshal Tito accused the Ambassador of launching a campaign against Yugoslavia and of interfering in its internal affairs. The most noteworthy fact about Ambassador Silberman's recent activity, however, is his successful effort to gain the release of an American citizen, Laszlo Toth, who had spent a year in a Yugoslav jail after conviction on dubious charges.

title: Hundreds on L.I. Still Lack Power Cut Off by Hurricane
description: Electrical power and telephone service were still out in several hundred homes on Long Island yesterday in the aftermath of Hurricane Belle, which struck Monday night and early Tuesday.

title: A Bad Teacher Is Hard to Define or Fire
description: Almost every parent of a school child knows the problem: The child has a teacher who, the parent is sure, is obviously incompetent, but is allowed to continue teaching. Why is it so difficult to get rid of bad teacher?

title: 2 Party Platforms Show Sharp Contrast on Issues
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 14 The platform proposed for the Republican Party's national convention next week smooths over some of the mayor differences between its Presidential candidates but contrasts sharply with the platform approved last month by the Democrats.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: How Government Is Pushing Up the Cost of Housing (July 18) quotes home builder Jerry Degan's angry remarks concerning government restriction and interference during construction of Lark Haven homes in San Diego.

title: Nancy Ditz Is Married To R. Bruce Mosbacher
description: Nancy Jane Ditz and R. Bruce Mosbacher, who graduated with the class of 76 from Stanford University, were married in Atherton, Calif., yesterday afternoon.

title: J. M. Croop Weds Miss Van Sciver
description: Kathryn Thalia Van Sciver, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Alan Edwin Van Sciver of Larchmont, N. Y., was married there yesterday in St. John's Episcopal Church to James Merrill Croop, son of Dr. and Mrs. Edward Croop of Pittsburgh. The Rev. John Covington performed the ceremony.

title: POLITICS
description: MORE than anything else, New Jersey Republicans want a winner this November, or at least a Presidential candidate who can hold his own against Jimmy Carter. As a consequence, Republican delegates to the G.O.P. National Convention, which opens tomorrow in Kansas City, face a critical choice that promises to have a major political impact this year and on succeeding New Jersey elections as well.

title: A Chronicle Of Inflation:
description: GREENWICH, Conn.If walls had ears, oh what stories they could tell. Of life and love and death, of course, and also of another imponderable: the rising price of suburban real estate.

title: Few Friends Among the Arabs
description: What is the world to do about Col. Muammar elQaddafi? More to the point, what are the Arabs to do?

title: Headliners
description: Dr. H. Guyford Stever, an aeronautical engineer, has been confirmed by the Senate as director of the new Office of Science and Technology Policy. His appointment brings a member of the scientific community back to the White House staff for the first time since President Richard Nixon abolished the science advisor post in early 1973. The responsibility of Dr. Stever's office is to advise the President on all aspects of national science policy, both short and long term.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: Article 12 No Title

title: Showing by Todd Eases Jets Loss
description: The New York Jets have seen their future  and he works.

title: Soviet Naval Buildup Worries Norway
description: OSLO, Aug. 13Norway and its superpower neighbor, the Soviet Union, face increasing possibilities of conflict in the hostile Arctic waters they both now share, according to Norway's Foreign Minister, Knut Ervdenlund.

title: Kate Underhill Is Wed to Publisher
description: Kate Howell Underhill was married yesterday morning to James W. Kerwin, publisher of Sports Car News magazine.

title: One customer dreamed he walked into Brooks in a borrowed Burberry raincoat with nothing underneath, opened up and said: Dress me.
description: When Brooks Brothers announced recently that after 158 years, it would no longer run up suits to order (this is known as bespoke tailoring), the announcement was carried (quite properly) on the front page of this newspaper and my reaction (I will try not to exaggerate) was one of disjointure: a slight dizziness, a sense of being in Cleveland, a feeling of malaise of the kind induced by discovering that one has left borne in one blue sock and one black. Yes, the reaction was not dissimilar to that experienced when I first saw a gentile friend of mine put mayonnaise on a pastrami sandwich or when the Vatican decreed that the mass would no longer be celebrated in Latin. Someone had plucked at the world again with clumsy fingers and, again, the result was anomie.

title: Tour Earnings
description: P.B.A. BOWLING

title: The World
description: After a murderous sevenweek siege, the Palestinian Tell Zaatar camp in Beirut has fallen to rightwing Christian forces, removing the last Palestinianleftist enclave in Christianheld territory and moving Lebanon a decisive step toward de facto partition or even more deadly civil war.

title: Patchwork Artistry
description: THE osprey hovers close to its nest with what appears to be a bluefish clutched tightly in its talonsbut it took about 60 hours of painstaking stitchery by Nancy Cardozo of Orient Point to get the bird into position. Rebecca Morey of East Marion meticulously executed a commercial fisherman emptying a fish trap and had to do it all over again when her brother objected that it was technically inaccurate.

title: Ford Signs Rise in War Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (UPI)  President Ford has signed into law legislation increasing to $150 from $60 a month the payments to civilians interned in Southeast Asia in the Vietnam war. This increase will bring civilian payments in line with compensation to military personnel imprisoned in the war. The measure, signed on Thursday, applies to any American held as a prisoner, internee or hostage or anyone who went into hiding after the beginning of the Vietnam conflict on Feb. 27, 1961.

title: Joan Mussler Married
description: The marriage of Joan Mussler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George F. Mussler of Valley Stream, L. I., to Richard Hoencke Spaw, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis D. Spaw Jr. of Houston, took place yesterday morning In Houston.

title: The Hidden Dangers of the L.I.R.R.'s Defoliation Program
description: SONETIME around the first of June, a contractor hired by the Long Island Rail Road sprayed defoliating herbicides along the Port Washington line rightofway.

title: Barbara Gibson Wed To Samuel Robinson
description: Barbara Crafton Gibson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Edwin Gibson of Waycross, Ga., was married yesterday afternoon to Samuel Shoemaker Robinson, son of Dr. and Mrs. J. Courtland Robinson of Stevenson, Md.

title: South Africa Threatens Restraints on the Press
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 14The South African Government, embittered by local newspaper, coverage of the unrest in black townships, has threatened to impose new restraints on the press.

title: The Circuitous Route to Kansas City
description: THE 17 Long Island delegates will arrive at the Republican National Convention tomorrow committed to President Ford. But they were not always in the Ford column.

title: Bahamas Gambling Interest Is Pressing Las VegasType Casinos in Atlantic City
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 14A corporation with gambling interests in the Bahamas and a history of business practices and personal associations that has attracted government scrutiny is buying property and contemplating Las Vegasscale gambling operations here.

title: INVESTING
description: The Republicans are setting out to have a lively time in Kansas City this week, picking their Presidential candidate amid hurrahs and promising victory at the polls on Nov. 2.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: POINT OF VIEW

title: The Latest Investigations Involve Day Care Centers
description: Once again, or still, the headlines recite the dreary litany of waste, inefficiency and alleged corruption in the antipoverty programs that were the proudest achievement of recent administrations.

title: A Goose Liver Debate Ruffling the Feathers of the French and the British
description: LONDON. Aug. 14 The illdisguised suspicion the French have of the British end the British of the French has erupted here in a dispute involving a prominent Member of Parliament and a former French Government minister. The issue is goose liver.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THE old saying about an ounce of prevention being worth more than a pound of cure was never more accurate than when used to describe the value of caulking compound for protecting the outside of a home. A few minutes work sealing cracks or open joints with a caulking gun may involve only a few cents worth of caulking compound, but it can, in many cases, save many dollars in painting and other maintenance costs later onas well as helping to cut down considerably on airconditioning costs in the summer and fuel bills during the winter.

title: Delegate Selection Rules Are Providing Reagan With Key Advantages Over Ford
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 14 Republicans choose delegates to their national conventions under rules that are very different from those the Democrats have developed, and the differences have provided Ronald Reagan major advantages over President Ford in 1976.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: An international convention to deal with terrorism has been suggested by the Federal Republic of Germany, and the United States has apparently agreed on the utility of such a convention. But it is difficult to understand what such a convention would contain that could be useful.

title: Street Peddlers Stage a Protest Against a Crackdown by Police
description: Several dozen peddlers took to New York City's streets yesterdayto protest the new city crackdown on sidewalk vendors.

title: Real Thirst Quencher
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich. (AP)Thirsty University of Michigan football players can thank Kirk Lewis for the drinks they get during practice this year.

title: What Makes WGBH Crackle With Creativity?
description: BOSTON The young Englishman spoke calmly yet assertively: Michael, I wish to commission the design of an atomic weapon, and then take it to Sweden to have it tested.

title: I'm not coming down!
description: Clad in sneakers, cutoff jeans and an orange crash helmet, Jim Aronson stood calmly about 4 feet from the edge of the 790foot cliff that overlooks the Catskill resort town of Ellenville, N.Y. harness under his shoulders and around his stomach attached him to his Pacific Gull Alpine, a high performance kite whose 34foot Dacron sail luffed impatiently in the 5knot breeze. Directly below him, a pile of jagged rocks ran down into a forest of pine and hardwood stretching as far as his intended landing site, a young cornfield, about a half mile away. Aronson took hold of the aluminum trapeze bar connected to the kite frame, walked two and a half steps on the balls of his feet  and dropped off the edge.

title: 6 Drown in Azores
description: ANGRA DO HEROISMO, Azores, Aug. 14 (Reuters)At least six people were drowned when a ferryboat carrying about 79 passengers capsized near the Azores island of Sao Jorge last night, officials said today.

title: PHONE TOLL PLAN IS TAKEN TO P.S.C.
description: A proposal by the New York Telephone Company to begin charging for uncompleted calls to ontheair shows that give away free gifts is being challenged by six New York City radio stations.

title: Dr. Janice Axelrod, Medical Student Wed
description: Dr. Janice H. Axelrod daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Axelrod of Bayside, Queens, was married there yesterday evening, to Yisrael Isaacson, son of Rabbi and Mrs. Irwin Isaacson, also of Bayside. The bridegroom's father performed the ceremony in the Oakland Jewish Center, where he is the spiritual leader.

title: NEW YORK PLANS FIVE NEW PRISONS
description: The state plans to open five new prison facilities and hire 183 new correction officers by October as part of a $6.7 millionayear effort to ease overcrowding at its 28 penal institutions.

title: Rockefeller Backed as No. 2
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 14 (AP)Melvin R. Laird, a close friend and adviser to his former colleague in the Hogse of Representatives, Gerald R. Ford, said today that he thought Vice President Rockefeller would be President Ford's best choice for a running mate. Mr. Laird also said at a news conference that he did not think Mr. Ford had made his choice. However, as Mr. Rockefeller prepared to fly to Kansas City for the Republican National Convention, he reaffirmed that he did not want to be considered for a full term as Vice President.

title: Search Raises Death Toll In Colorado Flood to 103
description: LOVELAND, Colo., Aug. 14 (UPI)  A search of smashed cars and trailers, many buried under mud and debris left by the Big Thompson Canyon flood two weeks ago, has turned up four more bodies and raised the death toll to 103.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: AUSTRAL ENDURANCE (Farrell). Sydney Sept. 11; sells from Pt. Newark, N.J.

title: Rhodesia Stand Qualified
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 14 (AP)Foreign Minister Hilgard Muller was not endorsing black majority rule in Rhodesia in his policy speech yesterday, a government official said today.

title: Byrne Requests Federal Aid In StormDamaged Counties
description: TRENTON, Aug. 14 (AP) Governor Byrne sought Federal disaster aid today for four New Jersey seashore counties hit by winds and rain from Hurricane Belle.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: Why is it that an approach to picture making condemned as conservative if not reactionary in painting is praised as progressive if not avantgarde in photography? I am thinking of the works of the PhotoSecessionists whose pictures were reproduced by Alfred Stlegiltz in his celebrated publication, Camera Work, along with drawings, paintings and sculptures by such French modernists as Picasso, Matisse and Brancusi. I am thinking particularly of the photographs of Gertrude Kasebier and Clarence White, currently on view at Helios Gallery.

title: DINING OUT
description: JOHN FOY grew up in Philadelphia, served in the Peace Corps in Jamaica, went to culinary school in Minneapolis, worked as a saucier at 21 for a year and, seven weeks ago, in conjunction with his brother, Dennis, opened The Tarragon Tree, one of the most attractive new restaurants to appear in New Jersey in quite a while.

title: For Young Readers: A Fact of Life
description: In Colonial times, parents mistakenly treated their children as little adults. We, just as mistakenly, used to treat them as if they would never have to grow up; children's books, accordingly, almost never dealt with such uncomfortable realities as divorce, social injustice, sexual deviation, or illness. But a dramatic change has been under way for several years: children's books now deal with all these subjects and an even grimmer one, as witness this batch of new books about death.

title: Policeman Tickets Himself
description: COPPERAS COVE, Tex., Aug. 14 (UPI)Patrolman Johnny Smith lost control of his car and it crashed into a ditch. He said he was going too fast and so he gave himself a ticket. The policeman told Chief Bob McDonald that he was hurrying across town Tuesday to help other officers transport some prisoners when a dog ran out in front of him. He said he swerved and ended in a ditch.

title: Library of the Future Is Running Out of Time
description: UNIONDALE LITERATURE is full of stories about rich young bluebloods who grew up smug and secure until they learned their inheritance had dwindled to nothing.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: Today  Monmouth County; County Showgrounds, East Freehold, Road, Freehold, N.J. Regular, green and nonthoroughbred working hunters; equitation. 8:30

title: Convention reading
description: Twentyseven years ago political scientist V.O. Key wrote in his classic Southern Politics: In the State and Nation that whatever phase of the Southern political process one seeks to understand, sooner or later the trail of inquiry leads to the Negro.

title: The Day America Came to S. Orange
description: IN the Village of South Orange in the year 5736 (about last October), I was asked to join with Msgr. William Field in cochairing the local celebration of America's 200th birthday.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Says That India Has Freed Many Detainees
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 14 (Reuters)Prime Minister Indira Gandhi said today that many of the thousands of people detained under India's June 1975 emergency laws had been released.

title: RECORDINGS VIEW
description: Ancient musical instruments are a mystery to most music lovers. Even so erudite a music critic as George Bernard Shaw failed to catch a veiled musicological insult when he once received an unflattering letter addressed to Mr. G. B. Shawm. (His wife enlightened hima shawm, she informed the great man, is an obsolete wind instrument.)

title: Rain Suspends Play in P.G. A.; Two Are Challenging Morgan
description: BETHESDA, Md., Aug. 14 The third round of the Professional Golfers Association championship was suspended today by lightning and heavy rain, and perhaps it was a break for Gil Morgan, whose shaky lead appeared to be floating away on the halfinch rainfall.

title: Affairs of the heart and praise for technology
description: Heart disease is responsible for more deaths in people over 35, women as well as men, than any other condition and has reached epidemic proportions in the United States. Arteriosclerotic disease of the coronary arteries accounts for most of the deaths; every year, 1.4 million of us have our first heart attacks, and for 600,000 the first attack is fatal.

title: TV VIEW
description: We were sitting around the other night with our thumbs bleeding because of tabtop beer cans and our minds uneasy because of Richard Pryor. We were listening, you see, to Richard Pryor on a longplaying record. Mr. Pryor, as anybody who has seen such movies as Uptown Saturday Night and Bingo Long and the Traveling AllStars and Motor Kings will tell you, is a very funny man. He also used to be a very scary man, a black Lenny Bruce, before television made him clean up his act. His career is doing nicely now in the movies, although not on television. He was, not lost on television, at least misplaced: his flow was cut up into bits"; his languagethe dirty words and the multiple sexual referenceswas taken away from him, and so the street itself was gone. There is simply no way a routine like the one we listened to on the longplaying recorda conversation between a wino and a junkie, with Mr. Pryor taking both partswould have been tolerated on television. And yet the routine was an amazing piece of craft, a short story in sound, wry and painful with a subtext of anger; we were laughing at a tragedy.

title: A True Story
description: It was about a year ago that I figured out what was wrong with writing novels. It came to me suddenly, around the time that Spiro Agnew announced that he had written oneand explained why. He said he'd decided to write fiction because he couldn't bear the thought of writing anything serious at a time like this.

title: Ready for an Unwelcome Visitor
description: MINEOLA AMONG the reasons the Island weathered Monday's Hurricane Belle as well as it did were the early and frequent hurricane advisories from the National Weather Setvice, the storm's late arrival and years of planning.

title: Wood, Field & Stream: Maps Offer Wider Paths for Public
description: The United States Geological Survey's new, folded pocket sized topographic maps should win broad public acceptance.

title: Miss Minor Bride Of Bruce Maisch
description: Lesley Karen Minor and Bruce Arthur Maisch, graduates of Hiram (Ohio) College, were married last evening in the Princeton University Chapel by the Rev. Frederic Fox of the United Church of Christ. He was assisted by the Rev. Charles Weiser, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: Canadian Strength Is Awesome to Team USA
description: MONTREAL The Team USA players groaned in unison when they heard the news. Bobby Hull, Gil Perreault and Jean Pronovost? said Curt Bennett. Why, that's more than 150 goals a year right there.

title: Malta to Vote Next Month For New Representatives
description: VALLETTA, Malta, Aug. 14 (Reuters)  General elections are to be held in Malta next month to choose an enlarged House of Representatives, the Government gazette announced today.

title: Bear
description: We meet Lou, protagonist of this spare, wry and altogether extraordinary novel by the Canadian writer Marian Engel, on her way in late spring to do some research on Cary Island in Northern Ontario. Lou is a bibliographer who has worked for five years for one Historical Institute. She is a lonely, stillyoung woman whose grey life seems to her to have a grudge against her, and whose contacts with men have been haphazard and unrewarding; weekly, passionless sex on her desk with the Director of the Institute has been her recent lot.

title: Fred Smith, Radio Pioneer, Dies; Helped Create March of Time
description: Fred Smith, a pioneer broadcaster and one of the creators of The March of Time, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital after a brief illness. He was 88 years old and lived at 545 West 111th Street.

title: They Tell Others Where It Hurts
description: THE nine women sat in a circle in an at??? living room in suburban East Brunswick. They could have been there to plan the next Republican dinnerdance. discuss P.T.A. projects or study a League or Women Voters proposal.

title: Miss Altamore Wed To Ricardo J. Davila
description: Annette Altamore and Ricardo J. Davila, graduates of Georgetown University, were married yesterday afternoon in St. Patrick's Cathedral, where the Rev. Charles Mahoney performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: In Bergen, It's Filles and Fillies
description: WHEN Olympian Pride goes through his paces at the Rainbow's End Horse Farm in Paramus, the stately thoroughbred bears on his back neither a craggyfeatured heman in a 10gallon hat nor a wellheeled sportsman in shiny boots and riding breeches.

title: CARTER AIDE SEES A DEEPER SUPPORT
description: PLAINS, Ga., Aug. 14Jimmy Carter's pollster, without giving details or statistics, said today that polls taken since the Democratic convention show Mr. Carter basically even or ahead throughout the country and with a greater depth to the support for him among voters.

title: SouthWest Africa, an Orphan Pretoria Can No Longer Keep
description: JOHANNESBURGLike a balloonist whose craft is sinking fast. Prime Minister John B. Vorster moved last week to toss the deadweights of Rhodesia and SouthWest Africa overboard in the hope of keeping apartheid South Africa aloft.

title: It's an Uncertain Eden For the Artists at Westbeth
description: Today they reminisce at Westbeth about the way it used to be. The housing complex for artists on the river rim of Greenwich Village has undergone a jarring identity crisis since it opened just six years ago, and no one is quite sure any longer whether its dual mission as housing development and artist community can be achieved.

title: Doberman Puppy Attains Rare Distinction in Jersey
description: When Lieut. Col. Wallace Pede selected a Doberman pinscher as his best in show at the recent Burlington County Kennel Club fixture at Fort Dix, it was a bomb shell for the ringsiders. The black and rust was an 11  month  old puppy that never had earned a point.

title: Life With Godfather: Carlo Gambino and His Neighbors
description: CLUB DRIVE in Massapequa is a horseshoeshaped slip of land that thrusts gently into the waters of South Oyster Bay. A dozen ranch houses form an elegant are on the street side; in the rear, individual doors provide residents with easy access to the ocean. With its blossoming fruit trees and sculptured lawns, the area is not the sort of place to arouse attention, but over the years one man's presence has given this quiet street a. notoriety not quite in keeping with its manicured appearance.

title: A Razor for Ecologists
description: There's nothing like it under the American sunand very few elsewhere.

title: Vexed U.S.T.A. Orders Sex Test for Women
description: Martina Navratilova's voice was filled with laughter as she recounted the latest chitchat surrounding the case of Dr. Renee Richards.

title: East Side Treasure Cache
description: A century ago it was not unusual for the city's wealthy to store their goods for the summer while they vacationed out of town. When they returned, they would move into a new apartment.

title: Ali Oop Sapling Winner
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., Aug. 14Larry Saumell, an 18yearold jockey seeking his first victory in a major stakes, took a chance in the $141,060 Sapling today at Monmouth Park, gambling that he would find room along the rail with with a dark gray colt named Ali Oov. He did.

title: Radio
description: ??? A.M., WABC: Message of Israel. A Different Kind of Day.

title: FILM VIEW
description: Amovie is such a tangled entitydirection. writing, camerawork, acting, editingthat there are limits to useful critical dissection. It's possible to be aware of superior photography in an otherwise leaden movie, but often it simply adds to the pain: visual magnificence draped over a dwarf.

title: Nixon's Economic Policies Return to Haunt the G. O. P.
description: WASHINGTONJust five years ago today, Richard M. Nixon reversed the Republican Party's traditional commitment to a free market economy and tore up the postwar international money system with his economic thunderbolts.

title: Guest Observer
description: We live in a place called Spanish Valley. not too far from the ghost town of Wolf Hole, Ariz. Spanish Valley was known formerly (and is still known informally) as Poverty Flat. However, times change. the local realtors got onto the Chamber of Commerce here and had the name changed. The new name sounds better, they believe, and I'm inclined to agree. But Spanish Valley by any name still looks like Poverty Flat. I don't know what we can do about that problem.

title: ART VIEW
description: What's so special about German art? Why don't the Germans let more of it out? Are we missing something really great, or needn't we care? These questions are raised by the arrival the Metropolitan Museum of four early German paintings from the Alte Pinakothek, in Munich (They will stay here for two years, as part of an agreement by which the Alte Pinakothek plays host to three French Impressionist paintings from the Met.)

title: C.R.C.'s Boss And the Law
description: The public hunger for a superbargain has spawned a breed of entrepreneur eager to feed it. Raymond D. Anderson, president of Columbia Research Corp., is such a man. His career suggests some of the dangers the bargainhunter facesand some of the difficulties law enforcement and consumer organizations face in seeking to police the field.

title: Seewagen Defeated
description: STRATTON MOUNTAIN, V., Aug. 14.  Butch See wagent the Columbia UniverSity tennis coach, lost the match today that would have made him the No. 1 candidate to compete in a $5,000 WinnerTakeAll match slated for Forest Hills Sept. 2.

title: R. C. Kemper 3d Weds Kate B. Gill
description: Kate Bowen Gill, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Brendan Gill of Bronxville, N. Y., and Norfolk, Conn., was married yesterday afternoon to Rufus Crosby Kemper 3d, son of Mr. Kemper Jr. of Kansas City, Mo., and Cynthia Warrick Kemper of Malibu, Calif.

title: On Paying the Bill
description: WASHINGTONThe center of the Democratic Party has held, and that is no mean feat. But what is at the center? Or, to put it differently, what Is at the core of Jimmy Carter?

title: Janice M. Fahey Married to Banker
description: Janice Marie Fahey, daughter of Mr. and. Mrs. Joseph F. Fahey Jr., and Michael Stapleton Cavanaugh, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter Paul Cavanaugh, were married yesterday afternoon in Stamford, Conn., where both families live.

title: Area Delegations Lacking Women and Minorities
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 14 The movement for greater representation for women, minorities and youths was not reflected in the New York, New Jersey and Connecticut delegations as they began arriving here today for the Republican National Convention.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: NELLIE FORBUSH was understandably giddy when she first sang a generation ago that she was as corny as Kansas in August. Kansas is the largest producer of wheat, not corn (that's Iowa). But everybody knows there is a lot of wheat and corn somewhere out there in the American heartland. This week, the Republicans are there too and the corn is indeed as high as an elephant's eye (that's Oklahoma!). In short, it's another great agricultural summer in America, and that's a matter of worldwide importance.

title: Republicans Are Together In Fear of Big Government
description: Despite the fact that they are almost evenly divided over a Presidential nominee, almost all the Republicans who are gathering in Kansas City this week do, in fact, share a philosophic position that makes it possible to answer the question: What is the Republican Party?

title: No to a Village Challenge
description: A STATE SUPREME COURT JUSTICE has dismissed and declared ill advised a taxpayers lawsuit brought against 17 present and former Garden City officials.

title: Volkswagen's Problem Is Bigger Than Pennsylvania
description: Even building its little Rabbit car in Pennsylvania won't solve it no matter how big a tax break the state gives the German auto maker.

title: Goldin Finds Errors
description: Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin reported that his auditors had discovered a number of costly mistakes in the collection of water bills by the city. Among instances of erroneous billing, he cited a 40story apartment house that reportedly owed the city $193,753. A city park was billed instead. Details, page 32.

title: Wardlaw Wins by Nose
description: CORNWELLS HEIGHTS, Pa., Aug. 14 (AP)  Dan Lasater's Wardlaw, whose last victory was in, the $100,000 Hawthorne Derby on May 22, won the $34,900 Keystone Handicap today.

title: France and Sherwood Anderson
description: Sherwood Anderson influenced the earliest writing of William Faulkner and Ernest Hemingway. That alone might entitle him to something like immortality. At the age of 45, in 1921, he visited Paris and was influenced by Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Twillery Gardens (as he spelled it), people in the streets, and Gertrude Stein.

title: Not Likely, Despite Its Use in Some Recent Cases
description: These things have happened recently:  Franklin Edward Ray, the driver of the bus containing 26 children kidnapped last month in Chowchilla, Calif., was able, under hypnosis, to recall the license number of the kidnappers van.

title: In This Corner, Olin Stephens
description: About this time next summer, two 12Meter sloops will square off at Newport, R.I., in a showdown to decide which one defends the America's Cup against Sweden, France or Australia.

title: Sports Today
description: Trenton Times Auto Classic, 200mile race, at Trenton International Raceway, Trenton, N.J., 1 and 4 P.M.

title: Miss Allen and S. E. Carlson Are Married in New Haven
description: Trinity Episcopal ChurchontheGreen was the setting in New Haven at noon yesterday for the marriage of Catherine Ann Allen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Marshall Allen of Woodbridge, Conn., to Steven Edward Carlson, son of Mr. and Mrs. M. Edward Carlson of Sumner, Md. The Rev. Andrew Fiddler performed the ceremony. A reception was held in the President's Room at Woolsey Hall, Yale University.

title: G.O.P. Rules Panel Delays Decisions on Key Issues
description: KANSAS CITY. Mo., Aug. 14 Supporters of President Ford and Ronald Reagan traded minor tactical victories today as the Rules Committee of the Republican National. Convention postponed decisions on most of the controversial issues separating the two candidates.

title: Deborah Rose Becomes Bride
description: Deborah Jean Rose, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Chester A. Rose Jr. of New Canaan, Conn., was married yesterday afternoon to Peter Charles Butt, son of Mr. and Mrs. George F. F. Butt of Georgetown, Ontario. The Rev. Carl F. W. Kohn performed the ceremony in Zion's Hill United Methodist Church in Wilton, Conn.

title: Riddick Captures 100 Meters in 10.27 at Meet in Italy
description: VIAREGGIO, Italy, Aug. 14 (AP)Steve Riddiek won the 100meter dash, beating Pietro Mennea of Italy and a fellow American, Houston McTear, at an international track and field meet tonight.

title: It Is Using Its Oil Wealth to Back Its Policies
description: CARACAS, VenezuelaAfter decades as a silent walkon In the theater of international affairs, Venezuela in the last two years has transformed Itself into a leading actor. Venezuela's new stature in international organizations such as the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries and the International Monetary Fund has partially overshadowed the traditional prominence of Mexico, Argentina and Brazil in Latin American affairs.

title: 11 OFFICERS HURT IN BROOKLYN FIGHT
description: Fifteen persons, including 11 police officers, were hurt early yesterday in a melee that broke out when officers on patrol in the East New York section of Brooklyn tried to arrest four burglary suspects, the police reported.

title: The Ghost At The Party
description: The most interesting ghost in the wings of the Republican convention is still Big JohnSilver JohnConnally of Texas. Ford and Reagan may wreck the party temporarily with their factional wrangling, but regardless of who wins the nomination, Connally will still be around to inherit the wreckage.

title: England Cuts West Indies Margin
description: LONDON, Aug. 14 (Reuters)Dennis Amiss reestablished his future as an international cricketer today with magnificent 176 not out as England battled to deny West Indies a victory in the fifth and final test at the Oval. Although his effort came too late to salvage the seriesWest Indies already holds a winning 20 lead his big innings left England with a fair chance of saving the match. At the close of the third day's play England was 304 runs for five wickets in reply to the West Indies firstinnings total of 687 for eight declared.

title: Jane Willis Taylor Is Married To Richard Salem, a Siudent
description: In the Larchmont (N.Y.) Yacht Club yesterday afternoon Jane Willis Taylor, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John C. Taylor 3d of Mamaroneck, N. Y., became the bride of Richard Mark Salem, son of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene L. Salem of West Newton, Mass.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THE reports are beginning to filter back from vacationers who leave inner Long Island and points west to bake in the sun of outer Long Island. Weekend stints in the Hamptons and on both shores. that sort of thing.

title: Move to Jersey? Me?
description: ON the eve of my emigration from Manhattan to take up residence in New Jersey, my friends, who would sooner fall into an open manhole than pass up the chance to make a joke, weighed in with predictable wit.

title: CANADA ENDS POLICY ON NONJEWISHNESS
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 14 (UPI)The External Affairs Department has announced the cancellation of an inappropriate policy under which its High Commission in London had been certifying the nonJewishness of Canadians traveling to Saudi Arabia.

title: Design
description: Versatility is the key to the popularity of track lighting. Four basic types of lamps attached to a metal strip with one or more electric channels can produce a variety of effects.

title: Home Clinic
description: Q: We put an addition on our house and when we removed the shingles and building paper from the old walls we found a large infestation of carpenter ants. We treated the wall with chlordane, but find they are still with us. We see them in the kitchens near where the old shingles were removed and we find a white powder coming down from between the ceiling trim and door trim. We tried spraying in areas we can reach, but with little success in getting rid of them. Can you recommend anything we can do?D.N., Ridgewood, N.J.

title: Marie deVenoge, E. M. Ceccarelli Wed
description: Marie Dorina deVenoge, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Vincent P. deVenoge of Manhasset, L. I., was married yesterday afternoon to Edwin M. Ceccarelli, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Ceccarelli of Orchard Park, N. Y.

title: Soviet Mime Performing Despite Ban
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 14The furniture had been cleared from the apartment's living room to accommodate all the friends and neighbors who were squeezing in to watch the show. About three dozen of them sat on the bare floor, cradling restless children, lofting a few bright balloons and sharing apple juice and homemade cookies.

title: How to survive in Harlem
description: By Claude Brown. 224 pp. New York Stein and Day. $10.If your drunken father had locked you in a room where there was a huge rat hole knowing that you were deathly afraid of rats; or if by age 12 you had the physical development of a grown woman, but your mother had died five years before and there was no one to protect you from the men waiting anxiously for you to ripen. Or if your mother had run a shooting gallery for heroin addicts and one of them died of an overdose in your apartment but your mother didn't want to panic the other junkies and ruin business so she hid the corpse in the bed with your younger brother and sister until she could sneak it out of the apartment under cover of darkness; or if your younger brother spilled orange juice all over a quarter kilo of cocaine stored in the refrigerator, and your mother's boyfriend beat him so savagely that you grabbed a knife to try and kill the boyfriend to stop him.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: It was with a mixture of enthusiasm and apprehension that I read of the final report of the New Jersey MentalHealth Planning Committee.

title: The Nation
description: Congress has finally passed an energy bill, designed to reduce slightly the nation's increasing reliance orr oil imports by deregulating the price of about 13 percent of the crude produced domestically. The very limited nature of the compromise legislation seems to insure that its inflationary impact will be virtually nil this year. President Ford is expected to sign the bill.

title: The Search Has Been Brisk in New York and New Jersey
description: KANSAS CITYNational convention delegates are usually dealt with like sheepin flocks rather than as individuals. Convince the shepherd (a governor, a senator, a county leader) and invariably the sheep will follow.

title: Use of Charter Revisions Worries Some on Council
description: Some members of the City Council are attempting to block one of the charter revisions passed by the voters in a referendum here last November and to reshape the implementation of another such charter revision. The Councilmen see them as a threat to their power and perhaps to some members survival in office.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THE old saying about an ounce of prevention being worth a pound of cure was never more accurate than when used to describe the value of caulking compound for protecting the outside of a typical New Jersey home.

title: A Start in Portugal
description: Gen. Antonio de Spinola had every right to return to Portugal to face his accusers in court and elsewhere'but his arrival in Lisbon at this time only adds to the heavy burdens of a fledgling minority GovernmentPortugal's first freely elected one in half a centuryiust as it takes its tentative first steps.

title: Miss Dorado Wins Final
description: MODESTO, Calif., Aug. 14 (AP)Pilar Dorado of Hayward, Calif., defeated Kellie Doherty of Buena Park, 3 and 2, today to win the 28th annual United States Golf Association girls junior championship at the Del Rio course.

title: Alice Morris Wed To Pierre Tariot
description: The marriage of Alice Debra Morris, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Robert B. Morris of Great Neck, L. I., to Pierre Nelson Tariot, son of Mr. and Mrs. JeanNoel Tariot of Weston, Mass., took place yesterday evening at the home of the bride's parents. Rabbi Eugene Lipsey of Manhasset, L. I., performed the ceremony.

title: Shifting Aegean Winds
description: ATHENSThe external dangers of the persistently ugly TurkishGreek quarrel are blatantly obvious: a threat to world peace and to NATO unity as well as to the complex of United States relationships with the volatile East Mediterranean. But there is also something inherently sad about the fact that this problem, which is in truth so needless and, stripped of emotional aspects, so capable of solution, should be hampering democracy's impressive progress here.
