description: August is an unusual month for a high school graduation, but 57 young men and women who seemed headed for certain scholastic failure three years ago marched across the stage of Columbia University's Wollman Auditorium last night to receive their diplomas.

title: Klan Marches in Kentucky
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 15 (UPI)  Several hundred Ku Klux Klansmen, led by three masked horsemen, marched a mile through a suburb south of Louisville without incident last evening. The suburb of Okolona has been a hotbed of resistance to courtordered busing to desegregate schools in metropolitan Louisville, but Sherman Adams, Kentucky Grand Dragon of the United Klans of America, said the march was to show support for the United States Constitudon and our law enforcement agencies.

title: Bridge:
description: The expert engaged in a pairs contest must take into account a dimension unknown to the rubber bridge player. In determining his strategy he may need to consider what may happen on the same deal at other tables.

title: Benefit Softball Game, 54 Hours, Sets Record
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Aug. 15What is believed to be the longest softball game ever played, ended at 4 P.M. today after 54 hours. and 365 innings.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Leaders of the more than 80 nonaligned nations gathered over the weekend in Colombo, Sri Lanka, for the opening today of fourday conference. Many of the hundreds of delegates said that this was a time of transition for the 20yearold movement. chief topic will be a new international economic order that would seek to narrow the gap between poor and rich nations. Among the heads of state attending the conference are President Tito of Yugoslavia and Prime Minister Indira Gandhi of India. Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations has been invited as a special guest. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Fresca Adds a Phrase And Stops a Challenge
description: Seventeen challenges to national advertising last month were resolved by the National Advertising Division of the Council of Better Business Bureaus, including two concerning advertising for children.

title: Theater: The Collector
description: John Fowles wrote The Collector, his psychological study of entrapment, in English, but the dramatized version now at the Greenwich Mews Theater sounds like a bad translation. It resembles one of those efforts to be colloquial with a classic: O.K., Fyodor Pavlovitch, see you on the Nevsky Prospect around 3:30.

title: Coast Dig Focuses on Man's Move to New World
description: LA JOLLA, Calif.On a grassy bluff 325 feet above the Pacific Ocean beach a team of scientists and students is digging up evidence of what life was like for a people who are believed to have lived here 40,000 to 50,000 years ago.

title: U.S. PRELATE TELLS OF ECUADOR ARREST
description: MIAMI, Aug. 15 (UPI)Two American prelates say they are mystified why the Ecuadorean police burst into a Roman Catholic conference last week with guns drawn and arrested them and 41 other church officials.

title: Kansas City Dazzles the Chic
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 15The residentdiamond brigade spent the weekend before the Republican National Convention upgrading the visiting metropolitan sophisticates image of Kansas City, and they seem to have succeeded. Jerry Zipkin was happily surprised. Betsy Bloomingdale was impressed and Barbara Walters was downright dazzled.

title: Student Loans Harder to Get in Jersey
description: Though rising tuition costs and the tight summer job market have combined to Create brisk demand for college loans, state officials in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut say there is enough money to go around. A spot check of lenaing institutions suggests that is indeed the case everywhere except in New Jersey, where some commercial banks have put a limit on the number of new loans they will make and have adopted a policy of dealing only with depositors.

title: Wait of 8,000 Lemongello Fans For Records to Be Ended Soon
description: Some 8,000 fans of Peter Lemongello, the pop singer, who sent in money for records but never got them will finally be able to listen to Do I Love You? in a week or so. Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz, whose office conducted an investigation after a number of complaints, has obtained a commitment from Lemongello Enterprises Ltd. to fill all outstanding mail orders for the records by Aug. 20.

title: Restoring Police Time
description: The Temporary Commission on City Finances estimated last spring that New York City police officers work fewer than 1,700 hours a yearroughly the equivalent of a 35hour week with four weeks vacationat a cost to the city, when all fringe benefits are considered, of more than $21 per hour.

title: Chicano's Death Stirs a Texas Region
description: CASTROVILLE, Tex., Aug, 13  Eleven months ago, on a moonlit gravel road five miles west of town, Frank Hayes, the 52yearold Castroville Police Chief, put the barrel of a sawedoff 12gauge shotgun under the left armpit of Richard Morales and pulled the trigger.

title: Guadeloupe Volcano Expected to Erupt; 72,000 Evacuated
description: POINTEAPITRE, Guadeloupe, Aug. 15French authorities ordered the evacuation of the 72,000 people living in the area around La Soufriere volcano today after experts said, that it could erupt within hours.

title: Economy Unharmed by Mine Strike; Coal Industry Faces Investment Lag
description: Production in the coal mines that had been struck for four weeks is expected to return to normal this week. Aside from lost wages and lost production, the stoppage is not likely to harm the nation's economy, coal analysts believe.

title: Chicano's Death Stirs a Texas Region
description: CASTROVILLE, Tex., Aug. 13  Eleven months ago, on a moonlit gravel road five miles west of town, Frank Hayes, the 52yearold Castroville Police Chief, put the barrel of a sawedoff 12gauge shotgun under the left armpit of Richard Morales and pulled the trigger.

title: OPTIMISM IS FELT BY BOND TRADERS
description: The atmosphere in the credit markets is still optimistic, and most bond dealers seem to think that interest rates, which have been declining all summer, still have not reached bottom.

title: Rumsfeld Is Recovering
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (UPI)  Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld was still making satisfactory progress after surgery for removal of a noncancerous lump on the thyroid gland of his neck, a Pentagon spokesman said today.

title: James Hall Weds Peggy Bramwell
description: The marriage of Peggy Ann Dramwell to James Hall, a vice president of Loeb Rhoades & Company, investment bankers, took place at the Brown Palace Hotel in Denver yesterday afternoon. District Court Judge Edward J. Byrne performed the ceremony.

title: Socialist Workers To Remain Subject To F.B.I. Scrutiny
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15The Federal Bureau of Investigation intends to continue its investigation of the Socialist Workers Party under classified Justice Department guidelines that apply to radical organizations with foreign political connections, according to wellplaced department sources.

title: Student Aid
description: Deputy Budget Director Robert J. Bott has shown laudable imagination and, initiative in recruiting Baruch College accounting majors to clear up a backlog of claims by the city for state and Federal aid for childcare agencies and in circumventing bureaucratic obstacles to the project at the City University.

title: LIBYA ASKS PARLEY ON EGYPT'S BUILDUP
description: Contacts are being made to arrange the meeting, a League official said, but it will have to be delayed because many Arab ministers are attending a conference of leaders of the nonaligned nations in Sri Lanka.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. on application for admission of Seychelles.

title: White Youths Terrorize Black Family in S.I. Home
description: Two carloads of white youths armed with baseball bats, an ax, knives and tree limbs battered their way into a black family's home on Staten Island late Saturday night and slashed clothing and art works while a woman, her four children and two teenaged neighbors quailed behind a locked door.

title: Claire Gutkin Is Married to Edra Spilman
description: Claire Gutkin, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Morton L. Gutkin of Brooklyn, was married yesterday morning to Edra Shawn Spilman, a consulting engineer for the Datavantage Corporation of Burlington, Mass. Rabbi Richard Schachet performed the ceremony in the Windows on the World restaurant at the World Trade Center. The bride, a research associate in the social gerontological department of the Hebrew Rehabilitation Center for the Aged in Boston, is an alumna of Jackson College of Tufts University where she also received a master's degree in environmental health from the College of Engineering. She also has a master's degree from Columbia University's School of Public Health.

title: Member of Manson Family Escapes From Coast Prison
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Aug. 15 (AP)The authorities searched today for Susan Murphy, a member of the Charles Manson family, who clubbed a woman guard in escaping from a Federal prison with another inmate.

title: History Will Offer the Delegates Little Guidance
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 15The uncommitted delegates here are going to get very little guidance from the historians, for while there has been a factional struggle between moderates and conservatives in most Republican Presidential conventions since 1940, none has been precisely like this year's tussle between President Ford and former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California.

title: Catholics Bid Argentina Ban Nazi Tracts
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 15Argentina's leading Roman Catholic publication called upon the military Government today to prohibit the circulation of Nazi publications that are flourishing here with attacks on both Jews and the Vatican.

title: Kemper Arena: Ordinary Inside, Unique Outside
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 15The 1976 Republican National Convention will be held in Kansas City's Kemper Memorial Arena, a twoyearold, $23 million structure that defies ready architectural description but nevertheless has won major design awards.

title: New Argentine Law Is Designed To Attract Capital From Abroad
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 15Argentina has issued a new foreign investment law designed to attract international capital and technology, rather than restrict access by investors as was the case under the previous law.

title: Javits Aide Killed in Turkey Is Buried in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 15 (AP) Harold W. Rosenthal, the aide to Senator Jacob K. Javits who died in a Palestinian guerrilla attack at Istanbul airport, was buried here today. Mr. Rosenthal's parents live in Philadelphia.

title: 97 Stout Family Descendants Turn Out for Reunion
description: HOPEWELL, Aug. 15 Their ancestors were prominent in the Crusades, or so some of their escutcheons would suggest. But the name that meant most to the 97 Stouts, gathered here yesterday for their 48th annual family reunion, was Penelope.

title: Iowan Finds Kingmaking Role Hard
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 15By almost any objective standard, Thomas Joseph Tauke is an unlikely kingmaker at the Republican National Convention that opens here tomorrow.

title: French Saint Is Honored At a Festival in Elizabeth
description: ELIZABETH, Aug. 15Thousands flocked to the O'Brien Playfield in the heart of this city's predominantly Italian Peterstown section today to take part in festivities honoring a Frenchman who was canonized for helping Italian victims of the bubonic plague in the 13th century.

title: Peruvian Official Killed
description: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 15 (Reuters)The Transport and Communlcations Minister, Gen. Artemio Garcia Vargas, has been killed in a helicopter crash, it was announced today. A ??? communique said that the minister's helicopter crashed yesterday as It was about to land at a town 720 miles south of Lima.

title: Korea's DMZ 23 Years Later: Still the Watch Goes On
description: PANMUNJOM, KoreaThe demilitarized zone here is many things, but being demilitarized is not one of them.

title: INDOCHINA REFUGEES BOUND FOR THE U.S.
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 15 (AP)About 3,000 refugees from Indochina will be flown here from Thailand to the United States this month 512 of them in the next three days, a senior refugee official said today.

title: Gene Stuart, Radio Announcer For Hockey Games, Dies at 47
description: Gene Stuart, who made an artand a livelihoodout of painting word pictures of hockey games for radio listeners, died of cancer Saturday in Orange, Conn. He was 47 years old.

title: ProMarijuana Group Gets Unexpected Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP)The National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws got a mysterious windfall today.

title: Zulu Chief in South Africa Warns of Renewed Violence
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 15 (UPI)  Racial violence, which has taken more than 200 lives, in South Africa since June, will increase until the nation's blacks are recognized as full Citizens, the leader of four million Zulu tribesmen said today.

title: Excerpts From Transcripts of Speeches by Rockefeller, Goldwater and Baker
description: Following are excerpts from the transcripts of speeches to the Republican National Convention by Vice President Rockefeller, Senator Barry Goldwater of Arizona and Senator Howard H. Baker Jr. of Tennessee, the keynoter, as recorded by The New York Times:Unaccustomed as I am to being a noncandidate, I greet you tonight as the only noncandidate I know on this program. This is a strange role for me. I've tried to get your nomination for 16 years. I've waged primary fights, platform battles, and convention contests, and I've enjoyed it.

title: CATHOLICS POLLED ON COMATOSE CASES
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 16 (Reuters) A poll of readers of the national magazine U.S. Catholic has found strong sentiment against the use of extraordinary medical measures in hopeless cases.

title: A Confident Ford Presses Battle for the Nomination
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16  President Ford stepped eagerly and confidently today into the thick of the battle for his party's nomination.

title: Stern Plays Rochberg, A Tanglewood Success
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 16There is an uneasy feeling among some contemporary composers and other musicians that their art may have taken a wrong turning somewhere around World War II. A few, of course, would discern the turning point earlier, around World War I. And a few other radical conservatives might want to place it even further back in time, around, say the Crusadcs.

title: INDIA SAYS IT HOLDS ABOUT 7,000 PEOPLE
description: NEW DELHI, Aug 16 (Reuters)Home Minister Brahmananda Reddy indicated today that about 7,000 people were stiil being detained without trial throughout the country under the emergency laws.

title: Car Explosion in Ulster Kills 2 and Injures 17
description: KEADY, Northern Ireland, Tuesday, Aug. 17 (Reuters)Two people died and 17 were injured here last night when a car loaded with 200 pounds of explosives blew up outside a bar in a strongly Roman Catholic area, the police reported.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: OUT IN FORCE AT KANSAS CITY:

title: Liberty Torch Troupe Back After a Long Run
description: The Liberty Torch, a group combining religion and running, ended their 8,800mile crosscountry trek yesterday at Federal Memorial Hall at 26 Wall Street.

title: Japanese Stress Ways to Cope With Earthquakes
description: TOKYO, Aug. 16The house begins to move. Boards creak. Cups rattle. The ground rumbles. Bouquets wave. A picture or a glass slips to the floor. Dogs bark. And about 12 million hearts beat a little faster.

title: Stockton Wins P.G.A. Title by Stroke
description: BETHESDA, Md., Aug. 16Although the weather cleared today for the final round of the 58th Professional Golfers' Association championship, the tournament picture remained cloudy until Dave Stockton dropped a 12foot putt on the 18th green to win by a stroke.

title: Rituals in Kansas City
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 16Delegates who have always wanted to see a bigtime newsman up close can get an eyeful almost anytime, day or night, by wandering around the lobby of the Muehlebach Hotel, says a story in the Delegate Special, which is being published here by the President Ford Committee.

title: Intense Pressure Being Exerted On Vital Uncommitted Delegates
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16 If the Mississippi delegation to the Republican National Convention was looking for political power when it came to Kansas City with its 30 delegates bound to be uncommitted under a unit rule, that goal has been accomplished.

title: Syrian Forces on the Move in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 16Syrian troops were on the move again in Lebanon today, entering the mountain town of Hammana 18 miles east of here, according to leftist and rightist sources.

title: Advertising
description: William Bernbach, an advertising man who needs no introduction, stepped aside yesterday as chief executive officer of Doyle Dane Bernbach Inc. He was succeeded in the top post of the nation's 11th largest agency by Joseph R. Daly, 58, who will continue as chairman.

title: Getty Refund to Sohio Sought by F.E.A.
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 16 (AP) Buyers of petroleum products from Standard Oil of Ohio could save $35 million over the next few months as the result of an action by the Federal Energy Administration, a spokesman or the agency said today.

title: Ford Is Reported Seeking A Vigorous Running Male
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16  President Ford has already greatly narrowed his list of possible VicePresidential running mates, and he is expected to name a skillful and Ognrous campaigner who could bear much of the burden of a fall election race, sources close to him said today.

title: The Yunich Shuffle
description: Several weeks ago, David L. Yunick, chairinan of the deficitridden Metropolitan Transportation Authority, startled students of transit finance by predicting that the 50cent fare could be maintained through the end of 1977. The prediction was surprising because only last April the M.T.A. chairman was warning that the fare would have to be raised to 65 cents by next spring unless alternative financing were found to make up for $125 million in Federal subsidies formerly advanced under the abandoned Beanie shuffle.

title: ALLEN E. WOLIN, 62, A RADIO EXECUTIVE
description: Allen Eli Wolin, president of Key Communications Inc., operator of radio station KATZ in St. Louis, died Sunday of a heart attack at his home in Great Neck, L. I. He was 62 years old.

title: Gen. Walker's Trial Set
description: DALLAS, Aug. 16 (UPI) Maj. Gen. Edwin A. Walker. retired, onetime leader and favorite of ultraconservative causes, goes on trial Sept. 14 on a misdemeanor charge of public lewdness for allegedly fondling a plainclothes officer in a city park restroom, court. officials said today. General Walker. 66 years old, will be tried in the Dallas County criminal court of Judge F. Harold Entz.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The Times on Aug. 12 incorrectly reported the projected cost of a hospital to be built in My Lai, Vietnam, by Friendshipment, a group of church and civic organizations. The correct figure is $140,000. As a result of a typographical error the same article said $175 million had been raised to aid in the reconstruction of Vietnam. It should have said $1.75 million.

title: Armed Forcet Advertising
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 18 (AP) The Defense Department gave the armed services permission today to use paid broadcast advertising in seeking recruits. The services had been able to use only public service announcements on television and radio.

title: Israeli Grocers Strike
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 16 (UPI) Angered grocers closed more than 8,000 stores in Tel Aviv, Jerusalem and Haifa today as a protest against bookkeeping, involving a new sales tax that they say only professional accountants can cope with.

title: Cadets Lawyers Call for Return Of Men Held Guilty of Cheating
description: Civilian and military lawyers representing cadets accused of cheating at the United States Military Academy at West Point urged the United States Court of Military Appeals in Washington yesterday to reinstate those cadets who had been found guilty of violating the honor code.

title: Kohl Says He'd Bring Sounder Policy in Bonn
description: ST. GILGEN, Austria Helmut Kohl, taking a breather in the Alps from his campaign for the West German Chancellorship, put on his hiking boots the other day and climbed one of the high mountains he can see from the terrace of his spacious vacation cottage.

title: 2 Top Women Gain Amateur Golf Field
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 16 (AP)Beth Daniel of Charleston, S.C., who won the event last year, and Donna Horton of Jacksonville, Fla., last year's runnerup, breezed through qualifying today to gain the field for the 76th United States women's amateur golf championship.

title: Net Event Draws Fire On S. Africa
description: The tournament director of the Federation Cup said yesterday that her office had received two cables from the South African NonRacial Olympic Committee, a sports activist group with headquarters in London, protesting the presence of the South African national team in the tennis tournament, which, begins Sunday in Philadelphia.

title: Sunday Traffic Found Lightening
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Aug. 15There's some good six traffic, said Tom Koebele, maneuvering the little red and white Cessna Skyhawk a thousand feet over a thickening stream of traffic on the Garden State Parkway.

title: Minneapolis Paper Pact
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 15 (UPI)Settlements of contract dispute between the Minneapolis Star and Tribune Company and two unions representing 565 of the company's employees were reached over the weekend.

title: Hudson and Bergen Election Officials Meet Crabiel on HelstoskiBaer Race
description: TRENTON, Aug. 16Election officials from Hudson and Bergen Counties met today with J. Edward Crabiel, the Secretary of State. to establish guidelines for the Sept. 21 special primary election in the Ninth Congressional District.

title: People in Sports
description: Dave Buckey, the quarterback who led the North Carolina State football team to four bowl appearances under Coach Lou Holtz, was cut yesterday by the New York Jets. The man who did the cutting was Holtz, now coach of the Jets.

title: Christoph Eschenbach at Piano at Mostly Mozart
description: Christoph Eschenbach, the German pianist, appended a Mostly Mozart recital Sunday night at Alice Tully Hall to his previous week's four appearances as soloist and conductor there. It was an always interesting if not always emotionally winning affair.

title: Reagan Wooing Delegates And Arguing Rule Change
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16 In a round of meetings with state delegations and a group of black Republicans, Ronald Reagan pressed his search today for latehour support in his struggle to capture his party's Presidential nomination.

title: industrial Poison Experts Join Philadelphia Search
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 16Health officials hunting the cause of the mysterious disease that has killed 25 people in Pennsylvania have broadened their investigation to include a search of Philadelphia by experts in industrial poisons.

title: INTEGRATION ORDER IN DETROIT OPPOSED
description: LANSING, Mich., Aug. 16 (UPI)The Michigan Attorney General, Frank J. Kelley, today asked the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit to delay implementation of Its order for an expanded school desegregation plan in Detroit pending a Supreme Court review of its decision.

title: Mystery Disease Investigators Turn Bellevue Stratford Hotel Into Research Area
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 16On a high ledge above the registration desk at the Bellevue Stratford Hotel, a medical epidemiologist stands, peering into a dark ventilation shaft. He leans in, carefully scrapes out black dust and puts it into a plastic bag. Then he photographs the gaping hole in the wall where the grille has been removed.

title: PRICES ON AMEX INCREASE BY 0.09
description: Prices were little changed yesterday in quiet trading on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market.

title: ARTHUR GRAYSON
description: Arthur Grayson, a retired management consultant, died Thursday night at North Shore Hospital of a heart.attack. He was 58 years old and lived in Kings Point, L.I.

title: Tonight's Entries at Yonkers
description: Horses listed in order of not positions Letter ??? OTB listing

title: Israel Broadcast Tells Of Lebanon Blockade
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 16 (AP)  Israeli patrol boats are blockading the Lebanese coast and seizing weapons headed for leftist Moslems and Palestinians battling rightwing Christians in Lebanon's civil war, the state television said today.

title: Carol Pomerantz Wed To Dr. Seymour Cohen
description: Carol Joyce Pomerantz, an English teacher at Jane Addams Vocational High School, and Dr. Seymour M. Cohen, an oncologist, were married yesterday evening at the Greentree Country Club in New Rochelle, N. Y. Rabbi Harry D. Silver performed the ceremony.

title: Detroit Recalling Police in Crime Wave
description: DETROIT, Aug. 16City officials recalled 450 laidoff police officers today after several hundred youths and adults descended on a rock concert last night and disrupted the event by snatching purses and wallets from members of the audience.

title: 5 Men Begin Jail Sentences in 1971 Beating of Yonkers Immigrantl
description: Five and a half years ago, Chester Ozerowski, who was 14 years old, struck a 19yearold Jordanian immigrant over the head with a baseball bat at a Yonkers restaurant, fracturing the busboy's skull and leaving him partially paralyzed. The assailant served five months in a juvenile reformatory and was released.

title: EAST BLOC MONEY MYSTIFIES MANY
description: WARSAW, Aug. 9Communist money, whose value can be changed at the stroke of a pen by a minor official, continues to mystify Western businessmen, infuriate foreign trav elers and frustrate local citizens who would like to go abroad.

title: Connors Trounces Fibak For 2d U.S. Clay Crown
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 16 (UPI)  Jimmy Connors, regaining the form that made him the world's No. 1 tennis player only two years ago, crushed Poland's Wojtek Fibak, 62, 64, tonight and won his second national clay ewirt title.

title: Playoffs to Open for Sets With Triangles Tonight
description: The New York Sets, with the best regularseason record, face the resurging Pittsburgh Triangles tonight in Pittsburgh in the opening game of the World Team Tennis Eastern Division playoffs.

title: Guilty in Ford Threat
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., Aug. 16 (UPI)A Federal court jury found Marion J. Mattie guilty today of threatening to kill President Ford. The former prison inmate faces up to five years in jail and a $10,000 fine.

title: Japanese Fans Go Banzai Over First N.F.L. Contest
description: The tournament director of the Federation Cup said yesterday that her office had received two cables from the South African NonRacial Olympic Committee, a sports activist group with headquarters in London, protesting the presence of the South African national team in the tennis tournament, which, begins Sunday in Philadelphia.

title: Buckley Abandons Presidential Effort After Support Lags
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16 Senator James L. Buckley punctured his Presidential trial balloon today after it failed to get off the ground.

title: New FliEhts Are Planned
description: CHICOPEE, Mass., Aug. 16 (AP)Daily commuter flights from Westover Air Force base to Boston and New York are expected to begin about Oct. 1, Mayor Howard W. Redfern 3f. of Chicopee said today. The flights will be the first regularly scheduled civilian use of the dormant air base since the Air Force closed most of its operations here three years ago.

title: El Pardo A Museum To Franco
description: EL PARDO,.Spain, Aug. 16 This quiet town 10 miles northwest of Madrid was for more than 35 years the center of political power in Spain. A creamcolored 16thcentury palace was occupied.by Generalissimo Franco and his family from March 1940 until he died last November. At the beginning of this month, on orders of King. Juan Carlos, it was opened to the public as a museum.

title: Convention Erupts With Arrival of Candidates Wives
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16The Republican National Convention suddenly erupted into a raucous battle of cheerin and chanting tonight when the two candidates sent their wives as surrogate warriors.

title: 22 FOOD SPOTS FAIL HEALTH INSPECTIONS
description: The Health Department has released the names of 22 food establishments held to have violated the city's health code, and the names of 10 other establishments that had their final inspection with the following results:

title: Major League Box Scores and Standings
description: Tuesday, August 17, 1976

title: Erosion by the Ocean Is Threatening Homes on California Bluffs
description: LA JOLLA, Calif.Some of the country's Most expensive real estate, valued at millions of dollars. is disappearing into the Pacific Ocean along the Southern California coast at a pace that is alarming geologists as well as residents.

title: Tally of G.O.P. Delegates
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16Following is the latest statebystate delegate count for the Republican Presidential nomination, as compiled by The New York Times: Needed for nomination: 1,130

title: Today's Entries at Saratoga
description: Today's Entries at Saratoga

title: Victory at 72, Is Jeered in Nice
description: NICE. France, Aug. 16 (Reuters)  Dwight Stones. the American worldrecord holder, was booed and hissed by ??? in a crowd of 10,000 after winning the high jump at an international track and field meet tonight.

title: Coats: The Romance Goes On
description: The design of a winter coat was once strictly prescribed. The garment was cut straight in a boxy shape or it had a small indentation at the waistline and a bit of flare through the skirt. About the only acceptable alternative was the coat with a ripple at the back.

title: Commodity Trading Surges
description: The continuing surge in commodity futures trading volume this year is bringing less cheer to brokerage houses than would have been the case in the past because negotiated commission rates are gradually lowering fees paid by traders.

title: Court Allows U.S. to Sell Atlantic Oil Leases Today
description: A decision permitting the Federal Government to go ahead today with the first sale of oil and naturalgas leases in the Atlantic Ocean was issued yesterday by a Federal appeals court.

title: The Designated Gimmick
description: Now. why would a straitlaced guy like Bowie Kuhn suddenly decide that they should play the World Series with 10 men on a side this year and nine on a side next year?

title: Kissinger Orders a Study Of Charges of Favoritism
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP) Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger has ordered an investigation into charges of official favoritism in the awarding of construction and real estate contracts for American diplomatic facilities abroad.

title: Yesterday's Results at Saratoga
description: By The Associated Press

title: Wood, Field & Stream
description: There will be no bear hunting in the Catskills this year, in order to increase the population of the animals in that region, according to Peter A. A. Berle, Commissioner of Environmental Conservation for New York State.

title: Justice Dept. Finds No Proof of Fraud In Rep. Young Case
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (UPI) The Justice Department confirmed today published reports that Federal prosecutors have found no evidence of fraud by Representative John Young, Democrat of Texas, whose secretary accused him of demanding sexual favors in exchange for an inflated salary.

title: Company Pleads Not Guilty In Kepone Contamination
description: RICHMOND, Va. Aug. 16 (UPI)Life Science Products Company pleaded not guilty today to charges of conspiring to violate Federal pollution laws in connection with the contamination of the James River by the pesticide Kepone.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BRAINERD, Minn., Aug. 16 (AP)Carl Shafer Wyoming, Ill., captured the 1976 Brainerd International TransAm road race yesterday, driving his Camaro 454 an average speed of 102.3 miles an hour over the 99mile layout.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The Times on Aug. 12 incorrectly reported the projected cost of a hospital to be built in My Lai, Vietnam, by Friendshipment, a group of church and civic organikations. The correct figure is $140,000. As a result of a typographical error the same article said $175 million had been raised to aid in the reconstruction of Vietnam. It Ehould have said $1.75 million.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The New York Times

title: Judge Is Asked to Lift His Gag Order
description: A defense lawyer at the mur der trial of a member of a Harlem mosque yesterday asked the presiding judge to vacate his order prohibiting attorneys from discussing the case with the press.

title: Campo Entry Runs 1,2,3 at Saratoga
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 16 (AP)Elmendorf's Harvest Girl led a parade of Johnny Campotrained fillies in the 837,575 Adirondack Stakes today as the triple entry finished one, two, three at Saratoga before a crowd of 17,282.

title: TANAKA INDICED ON BRIBE CHARGE IN LOCKHEED CASE
description: TOKYO, Aug. 16  Kakuei Tanaka, former Prime Minister of Japan, was charged today with having accepted $1.6 million in bribes to arrange the purchase of Lockheed aircraft by Japan's largest airline.

title: O'Dwyer Spurring Effort To Gain Jewish Support
description: Paul O'Dwyer, the City Council President, received the endorsement of two former commanders of Jewish veterans groups yesterday in his bid for the Democatic nomination for the Senate.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (UPI)The rate of inflation continued to expand moderately on the homebuying front in the second quarter with the average price of a new house rising $2,000, the Government said today.

title: TANAKA INDICTED ON BRIBE CHARGE IN LOCKHEED CASE
description: TOKYO, Aug. 16 Kakuei Tanaka, former Prime Minister of Japan, was charged today with having accepted $1.6 million in bribes to arrange the purchase of Lockheed aircraft by Japan's largest airline.

title: Freeman Lewis Is Dead at 68; Had Long Career in Publishing
description: Freeman Lewis, who retired in 1969 as executive vice president of Pocket Books, died Sunday at St. Francis Hspital, Roslyn, L.I. He was 68 years old and lived in Upper Brookville, L. I.

title: V.F.W. Cheers Attack on Disarmament
description: Gen. Daniel James Jr. of the United States Air Force told more than 3,000 cheering delegates to the 77th annual convention of the Veterans of Foreign Wars yesterday that the greatest form of international suicide would be unilateral, disarmament.

title: Deaths
description: ADAMMs Barbara Mercer, on Agust 15 at Phelps Memorial Hospital, North Tarrytown, N.Y. after a short illness. Resident of Victoria Home for Aged British Men and Women, Ossining, N.Y. Beloved sister of Mrs. Ralph Coate, Sarasota, Florida. Memorial service to be announced later at St. James Church, New York City.

title: Dismissal of Charges Against Cunningham Sought
description: Councilman Stephen Kaufnian of the Bronx moved in Bronx Supreme Court yesterday to dismiss a conspiracy and attempted coercion indictment against himself, Patrick Cunningham, the Bronx Democratic leader, and Jerome Glanzrock, former Bronx Democratic district leader.

title: Bracelets, for a Dainty Ankle or Weighty Boot
description: Just the other day, it seems, multiple pierced earrings and nose studs were the latest thing In personal adornment. Now it's the anklet's turn to make the fashion scene.

title: MONDALE DERIDES REPUBLICAN FIGHT
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Aug. 16Senator Walter F. Mondale said today that the controversy between President Ford and Ronald Reagan was futile because the Democrats would win in November.

title: Battle for Hughes Estate Delayed Pending Will Ruling
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 16 (UPI) The battle in California over the estate of the late Howard R. Hughes will be delayed pending the outcome of court proceedings in Nevada over the authenticity of a purported 1968 will of Mr. Hughes, a Los Angeles judge ruled today.

title: FORD'S COMMITMENTS REACH GOAL ON FIRST DAY OF THE CONVENTION, BUT REAGAN PRESSES VOTE BATTLE
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16 President Ford won enough public commitments in the first hours of the 31st Republican National Convention tonight to assure him of a majority of delegates, but the outcome Of the nominating rollcall remained in doubt.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on Elimination of Racial Discrimination10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: The Struggle for Control of the Republican Party
description: KANSAS CITYThe struggle between Gerald Ford and Ronald Reagan has revived a fundamental division between the liberal and conservative wings of the Republican Party which has characterized every G.O.P. nomination battle for the last 25 years. What lies behind the dogged persistence of the conservative challenge to an incumbent President, even in the face of likely defeat, is the party's history of ideological warfare, the regional coalitions which intensify such rivalries, and the absence of the mechanisms which might moderate them.

title: Fire Losses Up Slightly
description: Fire losses in the United States were up only 1.2 percent during the first six months of 1976 while the average annual increases from 1972 to 1975 had been nearly 16 percent, the Insurance Information Institute has reported, according to the Associated Press. Total fire losses for the first half of this year were $1.869 billion, according to the industry organization.

title: Reagan's Plank Criticizes Ford Kissinger Policies
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16 Setting up a probable floor fight for tomorrow night, strategists for Ronald Reagan proposed today a platform plank implicitly criticizing the foreign policies of President Ford and Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger.

title: Notes on People
description: Gen. Richard G. Stilwell said in Seoul yesterday that he would give up his United Nations Command in Korea the first week in October, and retire soon afterward. The command, formed in 1950 in the Korean War, now includes 40,000 Americans and 6000 000 South Koreans.

title: BUCKLEY DROPS PRESIDENTIAL MD
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16 Senator James L. Buckley punctured his Presidential trial balloon today after it failed to get off the ground.

title: KORVETTES CALLS SUNDAY PACE GOOD
description: Korvettes reported yesterday that sales for the IS stores it opened in the metropolitan area on Sunday were the best on an hourlybasis of any day of the week except Saturday.

title: REGENTS BID STATE, MEET 80% OF COSTS OF CITY U. BY 1980
description: The State Board of Regents yesterday proposed a financial plan calling for a substantial increase of the state's share of the City University senior college operating budgets by 197980.

title: Issue and Debate
description: The Museum of Modern Art's plan to erect a condominium apartment tower atop an expansion of its galleries looked lost in June, when, after sharp debate during the closing days of the State Legislature's session, enabling legislation was defeated. A massive lobbying effort involving city politiclans, state officials, museum aides and, it was rumored out denied, an associate of Vice President Rockefeller, managed to reverse the vote two days later.

title: Foreign Banks in the U.S.
description: In attempting to equalize competition between American and foreign banks operating in the United States, a bill recently passed by the House of Representatives could provoke reprisals on United States banks operating overseas. The issue for the Senate to consider is whether a seemingly tidy administrative reform might stir up more problems than it solves.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: DART EUROPE ???. ??? Aug. 26, Southampton 28. ??? 29 and Dublin 30; ??? from Global Marine Terminal, N.J.

title: National Distillers Rebuffed by France On Vineyard Bid
description: The French Government appeared yesterday to have blocked efforts of the National Distillers and Chemical Corporation to buy Chateau Margaux, one of the best known vineyards in France. A spokesman for National Distillers maintained, however, that the company, which also owns 80 percent of the Almaden Vineyards of California, had no official notification of the Government move.

title: Uncommitted Delegates Under Intense Pressure
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16 If the Mississippi delegation to the Republican National Convention, was looking for political power when it came to Kansas City with its 30 delegates bound to be uncommitted under a unit rule, that goal has been accomplished.

title: Adversity Hits Packers and Patriots
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Aug. 16  Last night's exhibition game here between the Green Bay Packers and the New England Patriots, ostensibly won by the. Packers, 1614, will not be long remembered except for the adversities experienced and exposed both sides. The list was long, in

title: Sunday Traffic Found Lightening
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Aug. 15There's some good six traffic, said Tom Koebele, maneuvering the little red and white Cessna Skyhawk a thousand feet over a thickening stream of traffic on the. Garden State Parkway.

title: Ailey's Salute to Ellington Blends the Old and New
description: Ailey (Alvin) has been celebrating Ellington (Duke) from the very start of his choreographic career but has capped it with this past week, devoted exclusively to dances set on Ellington's music. The celebration has been the culmination of a long love affair that Mr. Ailey has had with the music of this modern master. His company presented a selection of old and newly minted dances on Sunday at the State Theater.

title: Moral Substitute
description: Although there are differences in style and emphasis between President Ford and Ronald Reagan, their shared conservatism enabled their adherents to reach agreement on the domestic planks of the platform. Only the deep hostility of some Reagan supporters toward the Equal Rights. Amendment; is likely, to produce a serious floor fight on a domestic issue.

title: ROBERT CAREY, 55, OF FOREIGN SERVICE
description: Robert V. Carey, who retired last December after 30 years as an administrative and fiscal officer in the State Department's Foreign Service, died last Thursday of cancer at his home in Lake City, Colo. He was 55 years old.

title: Essex County Is Pressing A Drive on Child Abuse
description: 'Child abitse and neglect in Essex County will be the target of a comprehensive new county wide remedial program with an annual budget of $856,800, Ann Klein, the state's Commissioner of Institutions and Agencies, said today.

title: Business Records
description: Chapter XI Petition for an Arrangement by: NEW CITY LAWN, GARDEN AND OUTDOORS INC., 40 First St., New City, N.Y. signed by William DI Eduardo, secretarytreasurer. Liabilities $36,786: assets 550,000.

title: Town in Italy's Toxic Area Misses Children It Sent Away
description: MEDA SUD, Italy, Aug. 14 The children have left Meda Sud. The health officials came a few days ago and put them on buses, and everyone cried as they rode away.

title: TURKEY'S VESSEL TO STAY IN AEGEAN
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 16A Turkish spokesman said today that there was no question that the research vessel Sismik I would continue its activities in the Aegean Sea.

title: Music: Firkusny Plays Rare Mozart
description: Two of the less familiar piano concertos by Mozart were played last night in Alice Tully Hall by Rudolf Firkusny. The occasion was, of course, the annual Mostly Mozart Festival, that indispensable summer series that helps New Yorkers maintain sanity and proportion during the hot summer months.

title: 4 Democrats to Compete Today In Primary in North Carolina
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Aug. 16Even before winning a place on the fall ticket, Democratic candidates in North Carolina have begun clutching at Jimmy Carter's coattails.

title: Elder Statesman of Party Barry Morris Goldwater
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16Elder statesman (a term, his friends say, that he detests) of a party that once was seized by his supporters in a classic display of partisan political warfare, Senator Barry. Morris Goldwater of Arizona has changed less in personal style than in public perception.

title: Normally Proper G.O.P. Women Come Out Fighting Over E.R.A.
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16 Republician politicians who happen to be women observe a special political etiquette of their own. They never wag their fingers at Republican politicians who happen to be men, nor do they issue manifestos listing demands.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The State Health Department said yesterday that 51 patients of Dr. Peter T. DeMarco of Pine Hill in Camden County had been stricken with hepatitis. Commissioner Joanne E. Finley said about 44 percent of Dr. DeMarco's known patients had reported for blood sampling, but she estimated that some 500 had not been tested. In addition, she said, it appeared that records were not kept on many patients. The State Board of Medical Examiners is weighing a report from Mrs. Finley's agency in which the physician is accused of alleged unsanitary practice in his inoculation of patients.

title: Ohio Democrats Pick Hays's Replacement
description: LISBON, Ohio, Aug. 16 (AP)  Democratic leaders named State Senator Douglas Applegate tonight to replace Representative Wayne L. Hays on the ballot in November.

title: ROBERT STOPFORD, AN ANGLICAN BISHOP
description: LONDON, Aug. 16 (AP) Dr. Robert Wright Stopford, Anglican Bishop of Bermuda and former Vicar General of the Episcopal Church in Jerusalem and the Middle East, has died at the age of 75, church authorities said today.

title: The Program For Today
description: Following are highlights from the tentative program for the Republican National Convention today:

title: Nonwhites March Halted In a Suburb of Cape Town
description: CAPE TOWN, Aug. 16 (AP)As shoppers and passersby watched, police chased and clubbed nonwhite students who were marching through a white suburb today to protest the detention of fellow students.

title: Stockton Wins P.G.A.
description: Dave Stockton won the raindelayed Professional Golfers' Association tournament by one stroke yesterday, shooting a 70 for a 72hole total of 281, one over par. Stockton also won the event in 1970. Details, page 39.

title: Disorders in South Africa: Plot, or Spontaneous Ire?
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 16On June 16, 10,000 black students staging a protest march in the black township of Soweto ran into a police cordon. The students jeered, stones were thrown, and a policeman opened fire, killing Hector Peterson, a 13yearold in a school blazer.

title: Wheeling Follows Lead of U.S. Steel In Raising Prices
description: The Wheeling Pittsburgh Steel Corporation announced increases yesterday on its prices for flatrolled steel and some bar products following the lead of the United States Steel Corporation, which announced mice advances Friday.

title: BOARD ACCEPTS CUTS BY BEM
description: The State Emergency Financial Control Board accepted some of Mayor Beame's latest cost reductions yesterday, deferred the acceptance of some others, and pressed him to produce spending plans for the independent agencies outside his jurisdiction.

title: Bridg:
description: If you ask an expert to name the bid or play that gives him most satisfaction you might expect a number of answers: a subtle bidding inference in a competitive auction; the climax of a series of a carefully planned technical bidding sequence; an outrageous psychic that leaves the opponents reeling; a plan of play that saves an apparently hopeless contract; or the execution of a rare and difficult squeeze.

title: Amex Quarterly Net Off
description: The American Stock Exchange reported net income yesterday of $253,000 for the second quarter of 1976, compared with $464,000 for the second quarter of 1975. Revenue for the second quarter totaled $8.43 million, compared with $6.24 million for the comparable period in 1975.

title: Browns Rout Vikings As Pruitt Stars
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 15 (AP) The Cleveland Browns, with Greg Pruitt leading a powerful running attack, moved to three secondquarter touchdowns and went on to a 317 National Football League preseason victory tonight over the Minnesota Vikings.

title: U. S. Banks Raised Investing Overseas In Second Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP)  United States banks increased their loans and investments overseas in the second quarter on the strength of stepped up flows of deposits from abroad, the Government reported today.

title: Mild Quake in Algeria
description: ALGIERS, Aug. 16 (Reuters) An earth tremor was recorded eary today at Hadjadj, a village north of the western Algerian coastal town of Mostaganem, the Algerian Press Agency APS reported. The agency said it was very brief and caused no damage.

title: GEORGE EDGAR, 54, WALL ST. ANALYST
description: George P. Edgar, a securities analyst who was a founding member of the Puerto Rican Traveling Theater Company, died yesterday in New York University Medical Center. He was 54 years old and lived at 141 West 94th Street. His wife, Miriam Colon, the actress, is executive director of the theater.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Ford got enough delegate commitments at the start yesterday of the 31st Republican National Convention in Kansas City, Mo., to assure him the majority of the votes he needs for the Presidential nomination. He has 1,130 votes, according to The New York Times tabulation, but his nomination was threatened by the prospect of divisive floor maneuvers by Ronald Reagan forces. Senator Howard H. Baker Jr. of Tennessee delivered the convention's keynote speech with a rousing attack on Jimmy Carter, in which he was joined by Vice President Rockefeller, Senator Robert Dole of Kansas, who is the convention's temporary chairman, and Senator Barry Goldwater of Arizona. (Page 1, Column 8.]

title: 200 Friends and Neighbors at Services For Elderly Couple Slain in Brooklyn
description: Joseph and Angelina Tucci were buried yesterday, a few miles from the small house in Brooklyn to which they had come frcm Italy 50 years ago in search of a new life, and in which they were beaten to death with a hammer last week.

title: THREE ARRESTED IN BRIBERY CASE
description: Three alleged bookmakers on the East Side who, according to the authorities, refused to believe that police officers could be honest, were arrested yesterday and charged with bribery, conspiracy and gambling.

title: Liechtenstein Women to Vote
description: VADUZ, Lichtenstein, Aug. 16 (UPI)Women in this European principality were given the right to vote today. Prince, Franz Josef II, ruler of the principality on the Rhine between Austria and Switzerland, signed the suffrage bill into Jaw as part of the celebration of his 70th birthday.

title: SALE OF ARAB OIL TO U.S. IS DOUBLED
description: The United States doubled its dependence on direct supplies of Arabproduced crude oil during the first half of 1976. according to a recent survey by The Petroleum Intelligence Weekly, an authoritative trade publication.

title: People and Business
description: Senator Harrison A. Williams, miffed that David Rockefeller, chairman of the Chase Manhattan Bank, did not appear to testify before his securities subcommittee erlier this month, has reinvited Mr. Rockefeller and the bank to provide testimony at a specially scheduled hearing on Sept. 1.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Ford got enough delegate commitments at the start yesterday of the 31st Republican National Convention in Kansas City, Mo., to assure him the majority of the votes he needs for the Presidential nomination. He has 1,130 votes, according to The New York Times tabulation, but his nomination was threatened by the prospect of divisive floor maneuvers by Ronald Reagan forces. Senator Howard H. Baker Jr. of Tennessee delivered the convention's keynote speech with a rousing attack on Jimmy Carter, in which he was joined by Vice President Rockefeller, Senator Robert Dole of Kansas, who is the convention's temporary chairman, and Senator Barry Goldwater of Arizona. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Ford Delegate Reports an Offer To Influence Her Vote on Rule
description: KANSAS CITY. Mo., Aug. 16 A Ford delegate from charged today that a man who identified himself only as someone who worked for Reagan had offered to pay all her convention expenses if she would vote for Rule 16C, which would require the President ??? disclose his choice for vice President before the Presidential nomination is voted on Wednesday.

title: Reagan's Plank Criticizes FordKissinger Policies
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16 Setting up a probable floor fight for tomorrow night, strategists for Ronald Reagan proposed today a platform plank implicitly criticizing the foreign policies of President Ford and Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger.

title: Blood Tests Favorable In Gassed Area in Italy
description: MILAN, Italy, Aug. 16 (AP) Doctors said today that they had found no trace of poisonous dioxin in the blood of seven children from the Seveso area, where a cloud of toxic gas escaped from a chemical plant last month. But they said they must still check the children's livers

title: Csonka Is Listed by Giants As Doubtful for Steelers
description: The main question that hung over the New York Giants camp last night as they reported in following their two exhilarating victories in four days was: Will Larry Csonka's neck injury prevent him from playing against the Steelers on Friday night in Pittsburgh?

title: CARTER IS BRIEFED BY 16 SPECIALISTS
description: PLAINS, Ga., Aug. 16As the Republicans battled in Kansas City, Jimmy Carter held an afternoon seminar on domestic programs here today with a group of 16 experts in areas ranging from higher education to Social Security.

title: 75 Die in Philippine Quake; Another Erupts in China
description: MANILA, Tuesday, Aug. 17A major earthquake struck the southern Philippines early today, killing at least 75 persons, injuring 62, and leaving more than 100 families homeless, rescue officials said.

title: Events Today
description: NEW YORK PHILHARMONIC IN THE PARKS, Sheep Meadow, Central Park, 8:30.

title: Elizabeth Bixler Torrey, 75, Led Yale School of Nursing
description: Elizabeth Bixler Torrey, who retired in 1959 as dean of the Yale School of Nursing, died Saturday in a hospital in Peterboro, N. H. She lived in Jaffrey Center, N. H., and was 75 years old.

title: Orioles Conquer Twins, 84, And Keep Rolling to No Avail
description: The Baltimore Orioles are on a treadmill. They keep winning without making any progress in the American League's Eastern Division.

title: Jersey City Gets a Black Woman as Municipal Judge
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 16Shirley Ann Tolentino was sworn in today as a municipal court judge, the first black woman in the state to serve on a municipal bench on a fulltime basis.

title: Detroit Recalling Police In Wave of Youth Crime
description: DETROIT, Aug. 16City officials recalled 450 laidoff police officers today after several hundred youths and adults descended on a rock concert last night and disrupted the event by snatching purses and wallets from members of the audience.

title: Talks Are Held On Music Hall
description: The chairman of the State Mediation Board met yesterday with representatives of Local 802 of the American Federation of Musicians and the management of Radio City Music Hall in an effort to reach a contract agreement that would avert a threatened Sept. 8 shutdown of the 6,000seat theater.

title: Colombo Rhetoric
description: It would be easy to be cynical about the fifth summit meeting of socalled nonaligned nations in Colombo this week. As usual, the nonaligned will include Fidel Castro's Cuba and Kim Il Sung's North Korea, among other dubious claimants. The rhetoric and resolutions are likely to be excessive, onesided, all too familiar. The demands on the richer nations will be the same as those made at every meeting of the poorer countries, whether they convene as the nonaligned, the Group of 77 (now 112) or the third world.

title: Publisher's Hearing Reset
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 16 (UPI) Today's scheduled court hearing on obscenity charges against Larry Flynt of Columbus, publisher of Hustler magazine, was reset for Sept. 7. Judge William J. Morrissey of Hamilton County Common Pleas Court accepted the request of Mr. Flynt's lawyers to delay arguments on defense motions.

title: In WalkieTalkie Code, Ford Is Tarzan and Mrs. Ford, lane
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16President and Mrs. Ford's code names on the political walkietalkie network may have been inspired by the jungle of flowers and vines in their headquarters here at the Crown Center Hotel. Mr. Ford is Tarzan. Mrs. Ford is Jane. And Richard B. Cheney, the White House chief of staff, is Chimpanzee.

title: Close Fight Puts Spotlight on Alternates
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16 Being an alternate delegate has usually meant little more than paying your way to the national convention and standing by, in relative obscurity, while the regular delegates play their roles in nominating a candidate.

title: MARGARET CUNEO
description: Margaret Watson Cuneo, wife of Ernest Cuneo, lawyer, columnist and former chairrrian of the North American Newspaper Alliance, died yesterday of cancer at Georgetown University hospital in Washington. She was 62 years old.

title: Moderate Alternative
description: It may be fashionable to deprecate the importance of party platforms. True, if a platform is regarded either a contract between a party and the electorate or as a dependable forecast of immediate Government policy, such skepticism is well based.

title: Estroen After Menopause Held No Bar to Cancer
description: A study of 1,891 women who took estrogen drugs after menopause has shown that, counter to some contentions, the hormone therapy does not protect against breast cancer.

title: Libyans on Trial in Egypt
description: CAIRO, Aug. 16 (UPI)Two Libyans accused of planning an armed coup against the Government of President Anwar elSadat have been arrested and put on trial, an official of the Egyptian Interior Ministry said today.

title: Gold
description: Selected world gold prices Manor.

title: Hughes Aircraft Receives Army and Navy Contracts
description: The Hughes Aircraft Company announced yesterday receipt of Army and Navy contracts totaling $16.5 million for a positionlocation reporting system and for development work on a missile fire control system for the F14 fighter plane.

title: Portugal Calm Over Spinola's Return
description: LISBON, Aug. 16One of the legends of the Portuguese revolution; Gen. Antonio de Spinola, returned. here last week after 17 months of selfexile but the impact has been minimal.

title: HAROLD A. IDDLES, 80, OF NEW HAMPSHIRE U.
description: Harold A. Iddles, professor emeritus of chemistry at the University of New Hampshire in Durham, died Sunday at the WestworthDouglass Hospital in Dover, N.H. He was 80 years old and lived in Dover.

title: REV. LOUIS A. FEY, 72, ST. JOHN'S EXECUTIVE
description: The Rev. Louis A. Fey, a former treasurer and vice president of St. John's University in Queens, died last Saturday. He was 72 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: D. H. Lawrence is quoted as having once observed, Let there be a parliament of men and women for the careful and gradual unmaking of laws.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BLOOM PARADE Response to Rockefeller Center's series of informal, afterwork concerts, Music for a City. Evening, which provide some of the coolest, freejazz interludes in town, has prompted a twoweek continuation with six more programs. The place is the samethe Center's Channel Gardens, the walkway from Fifth Avenue to the Lower Plaza, between 49th and 50th Streets. The time is 4:30 to 6 P.M., on Tuesdays and Wednesdays.

title: Yesterday's Results at Monmouth
description: By The Associated Press

title: Treasury Bill Yields Off at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: This Time, Hadassah Meeting Talks of Politics and U.S. Goals
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The primary business of Hadassah and its 350,000 members is a fusion of social and health services in Israel. But that has not kept the 2,500 delegates attending its 52d annual convention here from political activism in this Presidential election year.

title: JACOB OATH DIES; BANK OFFICIAL, 49
description: Jacob M. Cath, a specialist in corporate finance who played an important part in many major investments by foreign companies in American businesses, died Sunday of cancer at his home, 160 East 65th Street. He was 49 years old.

title: CONVENTION FEELS WATERGATE TOLL
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16 Two years and one week after he resigned the Presidency, Richard M. Nixon was a nonperson at the nominating convention of the Republican Party he had dominated so long before his fall.

title: Even Ads Will Gladden Anglophiles on WORTV
description: It is a long trip to Harrods for New York resideiits, but the famed London department store will be an advertiser on WORTV next month. So will Lopdoh's Strand and Savoy Hotels, British Railways International and Harvey's, the liquor and wine company.

title: Nark and Yen Stronger Against Dollar As Strains in the European Float Ease
description: The West German mark and the Japanese yen, two of the world's strongest currencies, in recent tumultuous foreignexchange trading, gained strength against the dollar yesterday, but strains within the European float eased.

title: Seoul Will Seek Ties
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug,. 10 A high Government official said today that South Korea would seek expanded coopera tion with countries of the third world. He said that South Korea planned to approach the nonaligned bloc with offers of help in what he termed an ideology for development and not. for revolution.

title: Neighbors Decry Attack on Black Family's S.I.Home
description: Neighbors of Russell and Priscilla Warren, a black couple whose Staten Island home was broken into Saturday night by a gang of white youths, stood about in small clusters yesterday morning, expressing their bewilderment and distress over the incident.

title: ICI Research Expansion Set
description: ICI United States Inc., a unit of Imperial Chemical Industries, said yesterday it planned to expand its pharmaceuticals research facilities in suburban Wilmington at a cost exceeding $25 million.

title: Text of Platform Proposal
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 16Following is the text of a proposed amendment to the Republican platform, entitled Morality in Foreign Policy. that will be submitted to the party convention tomorrow night by delegates supporting Ronal Reagan:

title: Dow Up by 2.58 to 992.77; convention Termed Factor
description: The stock market managed to make a small advance yesterday although many investors remained on the sidelines awaiting developments at the Republican National Convention.

title: Purchase by Fed Of Treasury Bills Halts Rate Rise
description: The Federal Reserve moved actively yesterday to keep shortterm interest rates from rising as sonic $6 billion shifted from the commercial banking system, to the Treasury when investors paid for the notes and bonds they purchased during, the first week in August.

title: AUTO WORKERS URGE MORE PAID DAYS OFF
description: DETROIT Aug. 16 (AP)The United Automobile Workers proposed today that employees of the big three auto makers be given a certain number of days off at full pay to reduce working time and create new jobs for laidoff workers.

title: FRI. TO TRANSFER SOCIALIST INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16Clarence M. Kelley, Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, said today that the bureau's investigation of the Socialist Workers Party would be among those cases transferred out of the bureau's intelligence division under the reorganization he announced last week.

title: 100 Faulty Firearms Stolen From National Guard Base
description: DANVERS, Mass. Aug. 16 (AP)More than 100 firearms all inoperablewere stolen from the National Guard armory here, it was discovered today.

title: Paris Journalists Strike
description: PARIS, Aug, 16 (Reuters) Journalists at the newspaper FranceSoir went on strike today over management plans to sell half of the company's shares to the publisher of the daily Le Figaro.

title: Chess: Mecking Takes Manila Event With Loss of Only One Game
description: Henrique Mecking of Brazil won the interzonal tournament in Manila, which, like the Biel interzonal, qualified its top three prizewinners for the candidate matches to determine a challenger for the world championship.

title: Conservatives Deny Plan to Walk Out Of Sessions or Work for Third Party
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug: 16 The threat of a conservative walkout and the report that a third party was germinating in the Republican right wing are among the first casualties of convention week. Wispy notions to begin with, they were repudiated today by conservative spokesmen.

title: VERNON SPENCER, 55, EXHOSPITAL AIDE
description: Vernon F. Spencer, a former administrator of Harlem Hospital, died Saturday at the Veterans Administration Hospital in the Bronx. He was 55 years old and lived at 12 Monroe Place. Brooklyn.

title: 2 Quakes Strike Far East: In China, Off Philippines
description: TOKYO, Tuesday, 4ug. 17Two earthquakes struck the Far East last night and early today, according to seismological reports. One was in China, about 800 miles southwest of the area of the devastating quake in the northern part of the country three weeks ago, and the other was reported off the Philippines.

title: New Trial for Kallinger Sought In a Harrisburg Robbery Case
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 16Joseph Kallinger's attorneys here sought today to obtain a new trial for the Philadelphia shoemaker in a Harrisburg robbery case.

title: Yonkers Raceway Results
description: (OTB payoffs Subject to 5% tax)

title: RIGHT TO CANCEL INSURANCE EASIER
description: Under a little publicized change in New York State law, insurance companies will be able to cancel many fireinsurance and other propertydamage policies on apartment buildings with greater ease than they could before.

title: Cosmos Chief Task: Beat Diplomats Tonight
description: Think Washington, and don't be concerned about Tampa is now urged on the New York Cosmos by their coach.

title: Museum Ends Its Silence On Study of Cat Sex Lives
description: Officials and researchers at the American Museum of Natural History ended yesterday a monthlong silence on their study of the sex lives of cats and denied that their experiments were cruel and without social merit, as critics have charged.

title: Woman and Daughter, 18, Wounded in South Bronx
description: A 40yearold woman and her 18yearold daughter were shot and seriously wounded last night during a disput with a 20yearold man in the women's South Bronx apartment, the police reported.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Shirley Ann Tolentino was sworn in as a Jersey City municipal court judge, becoming the first black woman in New Jersey to serve on a municipal bench on a fulltime basis. One of six municipal judges in Jersey Citythree fulltime and three parttimeJudge Tolentino was appointed as a result of a February ordinance providing for the fulltime magistrates and prohibiting them from outside legal interests. Two other fulltime judges, Edward F. Zampella and Robert Cavanugh, were sworn in by Mayor Paul T. Jordan within the last month.

title: Argentine Stocks Flourish in Wake of Coup
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 15A phenomenal boom on the stock exchange here since the Argentine military took power in March has raised the average price of shares tradea twin the equivalent of 3 cents. before the coup to nearly 50 cents, and volume has expanded.

title: Market Place
description: Most of the customers of the Consolidated Edison Company are in New York City, a metropolis whose financial problems are known the world over, and to some extent Con Ed's troubles mirror those of the city.

title: Coal Miners Return to Work; U. S. Judge Drops Court Action
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug. 16 (AP) Nearly all striking coal miners returned to work today, ending a monthlong wildcat strike that paralyzed coalfields in the East.

title: United and American Increase Earnings for July
description: United Airlines, the nation's largest domestic air carrier, and American Airlines Inc., one of the leading air transport systerns, reported yesterday sharp ly higher earnings for July, reflecting increased revenues from higher passenger traffic and from fare adjustments that went into effect this year and late last year.

title: Executive Director Quits Arts Council
description: Kent Barwick has resigned as executive director of the New York State Council on the Arts. Mr. Barwick was appointed to the position 10 months ago by Joan K. Davidson, who resigned as chairman of the council last week.

title: HARRY C. INGLES, 88, HIGH OFFICER IN WAR
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP) Maj. Gen. Harry C. Ingles, Chief Signal Officer of the Army in World War II, died Saturday in a nursing home in Bethesda, Md. He was 88 years old. Survivors include his wife, the former Grace Salisbury; a daughter, Mary; a son, John S.; six grandchildren and one greatgrandchild.

title: NONALIGNED OPEN HIGHLEVEL PHASE
description: COLOMBO Sri Lanka, Aug. 16The fifth conference of leaders of the world's nonaligned nations opened here today with a burst of colorful pageantry and a barrage of strident rhetoric.

title: Wrigley Divorce Settlement
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 15 (UPI) A divorce court judge ruled today. that the wife of William Wrigley, president of the Wrigley Gum Company, would receive $4,000 a onth in temporary support and maintenance until her divorce suit is heard. Judge Norman N. Eigen of Cook County Circuit Court made the ruling after Mrs. Wrigley's attorney, Samuel A. Rinejla, asked $5,000 a month for her support. Mr. Wringley's attorney, James F. Ashenden said that Mr. Wrigley has been payfing her $2,200 a month and that she had been managing on that.

title: Yanks 13Hit Feast Beats Rangers, 51
description: Many of the 21,621 fans at Yankee Stadium last night were upset because a wildcat strike shut down all the concession stands. About 200 employees of Canteen Corporation walked out just before the game.

title: Books of The Times
description: When Ron Kovic, the author of Born on the Fourth of July, appeared in his wheelchair on the rostrum of the Democratic National Convention this year to nominate an amnesty candidate for the Vice Presidency, the television cameras panned the delegates faces. Some  the younger ones, mostlywere visibly moved, some dutifully attentive. But on the faces of many was barely veiled hostility, as though Mr. Kovic's long hair, his Movement rhetoric had loosed seething memories of Chicago in 1968. But it was not 1968; there was no need of Mayor Richard J. Daley's police, no need to harden themselves against their kids running amok. Yet the appearance of this voice from the past was sufficiently incongruous amid the Jimmy Carter love barbecue to be a little jolting.

title: Stockton Wins P.G.A.
description: Dave Stockton won the rain delayed Professional Golfers Association tournament by one stroke yesterday, shooting a 70 for a 72hole total of 281, one over par. Stockton also won the event in 1970. Details, page 39.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for onday.

title: Queens Woman, 29, Is Held on 2d Case Of Welfare Fraud
description: A 29yearold Queens woman. the mother of four children who has worked as a clerktypist and collected welfare since 1970, was arrested yesterday on a welfarefraud charge similar to one to which she pleaded guilty two years ago.

title: Grain, Soybean and Cattle Futures Drop
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 16 (AP)All farm commodity futures on the nation's major exchanges declined in price today.

title: Atomic Plant Hearings Set
description: MONTAGUE, Mass., Aug. 16 (AP)Preliminary Government consideration of an application to build a $2.3 billion twin nuclear power plant here can go ahead right up to the point of licensing, according to Frank Ingram, spokesman for the Nuclear Regulatory Com; mission. Hearings on licensing Northeast Utilities proposal will go ahead as scheduled, despite the moratorium on actual licensing imposed last Friday by the commission Mr. Ingram said.

title: A Rare Inside Look at Green Haven Prison, Troubled but Innovative State Institution

Rather the talk is about new rules that deny inmates the privilege of growing their own flowers and vegetables or possessing postage stamos.

title: 280,000 New Voters Registered in New York State
description: About 280,000 voters have registered in New York State since the end of last year, mainly as the result of efforts by dozens of churches, labor unions, and political organizations to use the new law allow ing voter registration by mail.

title: Disorders in South Africa: Plot, or Spontaneous Ire?
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 16On June 16, 10,000 black students staging a protest march in the black township of Soweto ran into a police cordon. The students jeered, stones were thrown, and a policeman opened fire, killing Hector Peterson, a 13yearold in school blazer.

title: Black Tympanist Sues on Coast Job
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 16 (UPI)Elayne Jones, a black tympanist denied tenure by the San Francisco Symphony, has filed a $1.5 million suit in Superior Court seeking restoration of her job.

title: Shortages in Natural Gas
description: TULSA, Okla., Aug. 16 (AP) Fourteen states may have naturalgas shortages of up to 60 percent for delivery contracts, The Oil and Gas Journal warned today. Alabama, Louisiana, North Carolina and South Carolina probably will be hit hardest with pipelinetodistributor reduction near 60 percent, The Journal said.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: RCA Global Communications Inc. announced yesterday that it had activated the first of an eventual total of 115 circuits that it is to operate on the newest and largest telephone cables running across the Atlantic Ocean floor. The $196 million cable is known as TAT6.

title: Court Allows U.S. to Sell Atlantic Oil Leases Today
description: A decision permitting the Federal Government to go ahead today with the first sale of oil and naturalgas leases in the Atlantic Ocean was issued yesterday by a Federal appeals court.

title: The Bottom Line Cure
description: A year or so ago a new phrase began to infest American speech. The bottom line. At first it seemed to be used chiefly by the kind of people who do unpleasant things to you, the kind of people who are usually called decision makers.

description: OTTAWA, Aug. 17The young Soviet diver who defected to Canada during the Olympic Games in Montreal has decided to return home, the Federal Department of Immigration announced today.

title: Taxing Delinquents

title: A Team of Young Experts Aids Carter on Foreign Policy Plans
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17Jimmy Carter has named a team of young experts to develop and coordinate his positions on international issues and prepare for a possible Carter administration.

description: GENEVA, Aug. 17 (Reuters)  An antidote has been sound for the poison that Contaminated an area near Milan and field tests will start soon, the Swiss company Givaudan said today.

description: A 23 years old Queens woman has accused the First Women's Bank of sex discrimination because, she says, it dismissed her after she told her superiors she was pregnant.

description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 17 (UPI)Susan Ford, confident of her father's nomination by the Republican National Convention, toured the Kansas City Museum of History and Science today with a' group of delegates and guests.

title: Food Day
description: MONTAUK, L. LMurmurs of approval at the end of a meal or the sound of clapping hands across footlights, it all adds up to the same thing: the sound that says love, to borrow a phrase from a Broadway musical of a few years back.

title: Neva Small Sings With a Folkish Air And Vibrant Voice
description: Although Neva Small's most recent appearance was in the musical Something's Afoot, and her background includes Leonard Bernstein's Mass and the film version of Fiddler on the Roof, she has also put in number of years as a folkish sort of pop singer. The latter aspect is brought out primarily through songs written by her guitar accompanist, Scott Kuhey, but it also flows over into the other material she sings in her current appearance

title: Challenge for G.O.P.
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 17 There are not many political events of which it can be said that the rhetoric may be more important than the votes. But tonight's convention combat notwithstanding, the main issue before the assembled Republicans is not which of them will head the ticket for the next 10 weeks, but whether all 7,500 of them will still have a party to call their own thereafter.

title: Planning Department Proposes a Revitalization of Chinatown
description: The narrow streets of Chinatownperhaps the most vibrant in town but often frustratingly clogged with pedestrians and motor trafficwould be revitahzed under a proposal made yesterday by the New York City Department of City Planning. Street revitalization in.

description: New York City's director of leasing, who handled transactions committing the city to pay $87 million a year in rents, was arrested yesterday on a charge of soliciting and accepting a gratuity of $3,000 from a real estate agent.

title: QUAKE DEAD EXCEED 3,100 INMINDANA0
description: MANILA, Wednesday, Aug. 18The earthquake that struck the southern island of Mindanao early yesterday has lett 3,103 people dead and 2,282 missing and 688 injured, according to the disaster control center here.
