description: Potential New York home buyers unaware of the obligeitions of initial purchase agreements, deposits and documents drafted by real estate brokers may find protection in new regulations proposed yesterday by Secretary of State Mario M. Cuomo.

title: New Truck Route For Queens to Go In Effect on Sept.8
description: A new truckrouting system for Queens, intended to keep large vehicles out of residential areas, will be put into effect Seat. 8.

title: Notes Bought to Help State Bring a Profit for Pensions
description: The major pension fund for New York State employees, which came to the state's rescue earlier this year by buying notes that the private financial market did not want, ar ranged yesterday to resell the notes to an eager financial market that now wants them enough to give the pension fund a profit on them.

title: Looking for Sculptures to Love in New York
description: For a great many years, the first thing people saw when they crossed the Allantid and arrived in New York was a statue. It looked great from, the ship, and it even looked pretty good from Ellis Island, if you were unlucky enough to spend some time there. It looked just what it was meant to be: Liberty Enlightening the World. It has been there since 1886, and everybody loved it.

title: Philadelphia Firebombing
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 19 (UPI)A home into which Mr. and Mrs. Martin Estrada, elderly Puerto Ricans, moved on Monday, Monday was firebombed in a ??? motivated incident, the police said. A soda bottle containing a flammable substance was hurled at the home last night, scorching the front door of the home in the Kensington area, according to the police.

title: RADIO
description: 7:308:55 A.M., WNYCFM. Italian Concerto, Bach; Sonata for Violin and Harpsichord in D, Marcello; Harpsichord Concerto, Falla; Triosieme Concert, Rameau; Divertimento in D, Mozart.

title: 5.3% RISE REPORTED IN EXECUTIVES PAY
description: Top corporate executives pay increased by 5.3 percent last year, the smallest average increase since 1971, a management consulting firm reported today.

title: Nurses Reject Offer
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 19 (UPI)Seattle nurses have overwhelmingly voted to reject an offer that would have ended a strike at 15 hospitals. Pam Knowles, spokesman for the 1,800 registered nurses who voted, said that the issues in the strike, been began July 27, had not been addressed by hospital administrators.

title: REAGAN BLAMES MACHINE STATES
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 Ronald Reagan, a former Hollywood actor who came out of California as a telegenic and articulate spokesman of the conservative cause, bade teary farewell to his campaign workers today and indicated that his active political career was over.

title: Notes on People
description: Lawyers for Golda Meir will move in State Supreme Court in Manhattan today to discontinue her libel suit against Lev Navrozov. In a 1974 article in Commentary magazine, Mr. Navrozov charged that Mrs. Meir, while Israeli minister to the Soviet Union, provided Stalin a list of Soviet Jews who wished to fight in Israeli's war of independencea list later used to persecute those on it.

title: Massengale Leads Golf By 2 Shots
description: WETH'ERSFIELD, Conn., Aug. 19 (AP)Rik Massengale interrupted a march of pro golf's more senior citizens today with a sixunderpar 65 that gave him the first round lead in the $210,000 Sammy Davis Jr.Greater Hartford open golf tourney.

title: MORE CUBANS SEEN BACK FROM ANGOLA
description: HAVANA, Aug. 19 (Reuters) There are indications that somewhat more than the 2,000 Cuban soldiers scheduled to have come home from Angola by now have actually returned, though authorities are issuing no progress reports on the operation.

title: Brazil Press Office Bombed
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 19 (AP)A bomb exploded today in the offices of the Brazilian Press Association here, No one was hurt by the explosion, which tore apart a footthick wall in a lavatory. A group canine itself the Brazilian AntiCommunist Alliance claimed responsibility for the bombing.

title: Rights and Crimes
description: Justice Lewis F. Powell Jr. is more often at the center of the Supreme Court's consensus than any other member of the Court's current majority. It is not surprising, then, that, in an address to the American Bar Association, the Justice defended the positions the Court took in criminal cases during the last term. He argued that the Court has now struck a sounder balance than did the Warren Court between the needs of society and the rights of the accused, and he suggested that those who criticize the Court on this score are alarmists. The record is susceptible of a less sanguine interpretation.

title: Truck Crash Kills 1, Hurts 6
description: SEARSBURG, Vt., Aug. 19 (AP)A New York man was killed and six other persons were injured in a tractortrailer crash at the base of Searsburg Mountain here. The dead man was identified as John McDonough, 30 years old, of Schuylerville, N.Y.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Ford surprised his fellow Republicans with his selection of Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas as his running mate. The delegates at the Republican National Convention ratified the President's choice, a conservative known for his aggressive partisanship. A movement by some Southerners to draft Ronald Reagan fizzled. In his address to the final session of the convention, President Ford pledged to fight with total will to win a great victory. Mr. Ford offered to debate on television with Jimmy Carter, his Democratic rival, and Mr. Carter later accepted. [Page A1, Column 8.]

title: Tapeworm Is Danger In Home Fish Dishes
description: Warnings against the danger of tapeworm from homemade gefilte fish, made front freshwater fish, and also against raw fish used in some Oriental dishes, were issued yesterday by Dr. John S. Marr, director of the Bureau of Preventable Diseases.

title: Management
description: You wouldn't believe the work that's done on Thursday around here!

title: 75 MENTAL PATIENTS WIN MILWAUKEE SUIT
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 19 About 75 patients involuntarily committed to the Milwaukee County Mental Health Center will be released or granted new commitment proceedings under a court order issued here yesterday.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on decolonization3 P.M.

title: Records: Leppard's Bach
description: Raymond Leppard is an English conductor and harpsichordist who first came to international attention with performances of his editions of operas by Cavalli, a 17thcentury composer. At the time he was criticized adversely by some musicologists for the excessive freedom of his editions, but he was also praised for the spirit of his performances, which were marked with extraordinary spontaneity. His conducting and playing brought to life works that might normally have seemed museum pieces. As it was, there grew a strong Cavalli revivalMr. Leppard's enthusiasm and love for the operas proved to be highly infectious.

title: Dow Plunges by 11.13 to 983.88
description: The stock market plunged yesterday, with the Dow Jones industrial average falling 11.13 points to 983.88, its most precipitous decline in almost three months.

title: Permit for Route 18 Bridge Over Raritan River Signed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (UPI) The Coast Guard has signed a permit allowing the construction of the longdelayed Route 18 bridge over the Raritan River at New Brunswick N.J.

title: Carlton Registers 15th Victory, 71
description: Steve Carlton, the 1972 Cy Young Award winner, held the Houston Astros to five hits, Mike Schmidt hit his 32d home run and Jay Johnstone collected four hits to raise his National League leading batting mark to 344 as the Philadelphia Phillies crushed the Houston Astros, 71.

title: South African Police Open Fire On Blacks Storming Factories
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 19Policemen opened fire on a crowd of stonethrowing blacks today when they stormed four factories in an industrial suburb of the coastal city of Port Elizabeth in the second day of antiGovernment unrest. The death toll in the rioting overnight rose to 14 and the number wounded to 28.

title: Julie Holtzman at Summergarden
description: Julie Holtzman, a Canadian pianist who has played internationally in recital and with orchestra, will give informal recitals tonight and tomorrow at 8 o'clock in the weekly Summergarden series at the Museum of Modern Art. Free admission is through the sculpture garden gate at 8 West 54th Street.

title: Revalue the Mark? No
description: BONN, Aug. 19  Nobody seems to believe the West German Finance Minister, Hans Apel, when he insists that the mark will not be be revalued. Day after day in recent weeks, speculation on the European money markets kept pushing the mark up in value against the American dollar, the French franc and every other European currency except the Swiss franc.

title: Fed, by Offering to Buy, Stops Bond Price Decline
description: The Federal Reserve cut short a price decline in the credit markets yesterday as it offered to purchase coupon  bearing Treasury securities for its own account. Bond prices, which had fallen early in the day as this week's slump confilmed, recovered and closed unchanged from Wednesday. This week's increases in the money supply and the latest drop in business loans at commercial banks caused little.if any, reaction in the credit markets late in the afternoon.

title: DEATH OF 5 LAID TO HEAT STROKES
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 19 (AP)Five elderly patients at a Boynton Beach, Fla., nursing home probably died of heat stroke, not a virus or a germ, a spokesman for the Federal Center for Disease Control said.

title: BlockLong Building Burned
description: CHESTER, Pa., Aug. 19 (AP) A general alarm fire destroyed a blocklong building this morning. Orre fireman suffered a back injury, but was in satisfactory condition at a hospital. Residents of 15 rowhouses facing the building were evacuated. Their homes were scorched, but not burned.

title: McCarthy Scores Role Of a Running Mate
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 19 (UPI)Former Democratic Senator Eugene V. McCarthy, running for the Presidency as an independent, had some harsh words today for VicePresidential candidates in general and also for President Ford.

title: Sets Defeat Triangles ForEasternTitle,2826
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Aug. 19 You would have thought Virginia Wade had just won Wimbledon. She leaped in the air, flushed a broad grin and embraced Billie Jean King. And all because of a forehand service return down the line on the 9th point of a tiebreaker that gave the New York Sets the World Team Tennis Eastern Division playoff championship over the Pittsburgh Triangles tonight. The final score was 2826. The Sets next meet Golden Gate Saturday afternoon at Oakland in a threeoffive series.

title: Protest Set OfWomen's Net Event
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 19Edy McGoldrick, the Federation Cup tournament director, and Richard Sorlien, a tournament cochairman, met this afternoon with representatives of a newly formed adhoc committee called Federation Cup Action Group for Justice in South Africa.

title: Demand Up In Soybeans And Grain
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 19 (AP)Mot, muggy weather created strong demand for soybean and grain futures today.

title: COMPANY PROFITS ROSE IN QUARTER AT SLOWER RATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP) The Commerce Department reported today that corporate profits advanced at a slower rate in the second quarter.

title: Bridge:
description: New York players have had no successes in first part of the American Bridge Association's Summer Nationals in Washington this week.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OEF ICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900: WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 9.5300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500: SUF. FOLK CO. (516) 6691800: CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: About Real Estate
description: For all the longstanding problems, there is happiness on the rental front at West Village Houses.

title: Delegates Voice Doubts On FordDole Prospects
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 Their contest ended, President Ford and Ronald Reagan joined today in a traditional attempt to set the tone for a strong and united Republican campaign this fall.

title: Music: Environ Workshop Offers Exciting Jazz
description: Hamlet Bluiett, a baritone saxophonist who used to perform in Charles Mingus's group, is directing a series of big band workshops every Wednesday evening at Environ, 476 Broadway. The workship concept, which was pioneered by Mr. Mingus, entails a mixture of rehearsal and performance, and it can becothe tedious. But Mr. Bluiett has collected an astonishing group of musicians. If this week's session was an accurate indication, one can hear more of the most original and exciting younger jazzsmen at his Environ workshops than at any other single location.s

title: DiMaio Gets Job He Has Been Doing
description: With a caution born of waiting anxiously for more than two and a half years for his appointment as New York City's Chief Medical Examiner to come through, Dr. Dominick J. DiMaio warned a reporter yesterday afternoon:

title: Excerpts From the Address by Dole to the Convention
description: Following are excerpts from the address to the Republican National Convention last night by Senator Robert J. Dole accepting the VicePresidential nomination, as recorded by The New York Times.

title: Publishing: Rona Jaffe
description: CAN IT BE 17 years since Rona Jaffe's first novel, The Best of Everything, appeared? Written under the patronage of the late Hollywood producer Jerry Wald, who was looking for a modern Kitty Foyle,  the book told how three Manhattan career girls named Caroline, April and Gregg fought, clawed and slept their way out of the steno pool. It became a best seller, making its 26yearold, Radcliffeeducated author a nice sum of money by 1959 standards. Career girls by the millionsthose whom, Miss Jaffe said, you see every morning at a quarter to nine, rushing out of the maw of the subway tunnelclutched the paperback version on their ride to glamour jobs in the big East Side communications factories.

title: Doleful Nomination
description: President Ford's choice of Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas reflects a politics of despair, if not of desperation.

title: Norway, a Welfare State, Propelled to Riches by Oil
description: OSLONorway is poised to become the world's richest country, surpassing all except the few Arab sheikdoms that float on oil.

title: General Dynamics Says Competitors Conspire to Balk Burmah Ship Work
description: The General Dynamics Corporation charged yesterday that unidentified competitors, under desperate pressure from financial and other sources, were conspiring to overturn its billiondollar shipbuilding project for the Burmah Oil Company of Britain.

title: U.N. Team Plans Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 19A United Nations team will leave here Saturday for Zambia, Angola and Botswana to consult with African leaders on how to speed the independence of SouthWest Africa.

title: Delegates Voice Doubts On FordDole Prospects
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 Their contest ended, President Ford and Ronald Reagan joined today in a traditional attempt to set the tone for a strong and united Republican ciunoaign this fall.

title: Problem of Youth Gangs Grows as Police Unit Shrinks
description: The Police Department's system of gathering intelligence on youth gangs in New York City is breaking down, resulting in fewer arrests of gang members and in stronger, more violent and more sophisticated operations of the gang.

title: ReaganLosesAgain,ThisTimetoCaryGrant
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 When he was in the movies, Ronald Reagan hardly ever got the girl.

title: The Labor Scene
description: The maritime unions are back at one another's throats, despite a twoandonehalfyear effort by George Meany to end interunion raids and promote mergers.

title: Landslides in Italy Kill Two
description: PESARO, Italy, Aug. 19 (AP) Severe rainstorms along the northern Adriatic coast set off landslides today that killed et least two persons, flooded several towns and disrupted rail and highway traffic.

title: Brezhnev and Honecker Agree on Border Issue
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 19 (Reuters) Leonid I. Brezhnev. the Soviet party leader, and his East German counterpart, Erich Honecker, today jointly condemned what they described as attempts to violaet East German sovereignty, the press agency Tass reported.

title: North Carolina School Unit Dismisses Head of System
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Aug. 19 (AP)Rolland Jones, 51 years old, who led the Charlotte and Mecklenburg County School system through postintegration problems, was dismissed by the board of education last night after four controversial years. He was said to have lost the board's confidence.

title: Chefs Mystery is a Dish That Sours
description: As any food buff learns all too soon, there is many a slip between the promise on a menu and the delivery of the food itself. And so with dust jackets of books and their Contents. Few promise more than this one, hinting at mystery thrills, sex, humor, and as lagniappe, talk of food Complete with recipes. That it misses on all counts makes it consistent which may be this novel's only virtue.

title: BOTH SIDES RAISE KOREA READINESS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 19 Both North Korea and the United States announced steps today to increase the readiness of their military forces on the Korean peninsula in the wake of the killing of two American officers in the demilitarized zone yesterday but there were no overt signs of increased military activity.

title: People and Business
description: James Connolly has been appointed president and chief operating officer of Gimbels New York, which operates the Greater New York area. 10 department stores in He had been vice president and treasurer of Bloomingdale's operated by the Federated Department Stores chain.

title: Transcript of Ford's Speech Accepting the Republican Presidential Nomination
description: Following is a transcript of President Ford's speech at the Republican National Convention last night accepting the party's Presidential nomination, as recorded by the New York Times:

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: When Sea Cliff, a small village on Long Island's North Shore, set in the hills overlooking Hempstead Harbor, was at its peak as a resort the automobile was a rarity. In the years since, the town never really has learned to deal with cars. Some of its hills are too steep, some of its roads too narrow.

title: Kissinger Makes LowKey Appearance
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger made a flying visit today to the Republican National Convention, where the foreign policy over which he presides occasioned some political controversy this week.

title: Quinlans Present Check to Bishop
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J., Aug. 19The parents of Karen Anne Quinlan presented a $10,000 check today to Bishop Lawrence B. Casey of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Paterson, representing part of the $25,000 they will receive for the sale of exclusive interviews to The Ladies Home Journal.

title: Weekend Gardening: Catalogues
description: Now is the time to order spring bulbs, and stretched out relaxing on a late summer day is the perfect time to plan the task. Garden catalogues are easily the most colorful summer reading arounda lot more restful than some current novels, for example.

title: Baseball Playoff on DayNight Basis
description: The American and National League championship series this year will be played on a thynight basis to let more fans see the games.

title: Market Place
description: The date April 20, 1976, marked an important event in both Wall Street and the world of photography. The Eastman Kodak Company, after seven years of development work, entered the instantpicture field and thereby challenged the monopoly held for 28 years by the Polaroid Corporation.

title: 2 Pairs Share Title In BetterBall Play
description: OLD WESTBURY, L.I., Aug. 19Hen Bast, a 23yearold Stanford medical student and a Fresh Meadow clubmate, Jim Greene, tied the Huntington team of Dr. George Gilbert and Fred Winseck at 68, for gilder par, at Old Westhury today in the 45th Long Island Golf Association betterball championship. Both teams championship.

title: Money Supply Climbed $800 Million for Week
description: The nation's basic money supply rose $800 million in the week ended Aug. 11, to a seasonally adjusted average of $306.3 billion, according to figures released yesterday by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

title: Focus on Democratic Aide Seen in Patronage Inquiry
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's investigation into whether patronage  appointments in New York State Supreme Court. Were made in exchange for kickbacks to certain political clubhouses is revolving around Michael. (Mitch). Bloom, a powerful former Democratic leader, Political sources said yesterday.

title: Nonaligned Elude a Definition, But a Trend to Left Is Evident
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Aug. 19A precise definition of nonalignment still proves illusive even in Yugoslavia, one of the founders of the movement currently holding a meeting in Colombo. Sri Lanka.

title: Funeral for Senator's Wife
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 19 (UPI)  Funeral services for Hazel Garn, wife of Senator Jake Garn, Republican of Utah, have been arranged for Saturday. Mrs. Garn, 40 years old, died in a onecar crash in Nebraska Tuesday afternoon.

title: RollCall Strains Computer
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.. Aug. 19 (UPI)Votes were cast for so many people in the vicepresidential rollcall today that the Republican conventian computer could not accommodate them and officials had to revert to writing and arithmetic.

title: RICHMOND CORP. AGREES TO SALE AT HIGHER PRICE
description: The Continental Group Inc. and the Richmond Corporation announced yesterday an agreement in principle for Continental to acquire Richmond, a holding company for insurance companies, for a revised offer of more than $325 million. The Continental Group's offer apparently tops a bid announced by the United States Fidelity and Guaranty Company. The size of that offer was not disclosed, but it apparently would have involved a consideration in excess of that initially offered by Continental Group, formerly the Continental Can Company. In May Continental made an offer estimated to have had a vlue of $250 million to $275 million, but Richmond suggested it was inadequate.

title: Bethlehem Announces Price Rises
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, the secondlargest steel company in the country, announced yesterday that it was following the lead of the United States Steel Corporation, the largest pro ducer, in raising the price of hotrolled, coldrolled steel galvanized sheet, hotrolled carbon bars and alloy bars by 4.5 percent, effective Oct. 1.

title: Israel Will Ignore Demand By Amin for Compensation
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 19 (Reuters)Israel said today that it would ignore the demand by President Idi Amin of Uganda for compensation for the Israeli raid on Entebbe airport last month.

title: Transcript of Reagan's Remarks to the Convention
description: Following is a transcript of remarks to the Republican National Convention by Ronald Reagan, as recorded by The New York Times.

title: The Pop Life
description: ANY critic worth his salt comes to an almost mystical rapport with certain artists, the critic Dave Marsh has written. Critics are half cynical journalists, half sentimental fans, he added.

title: Business Briefs
description: DETROIT, Aug. 19United States auto production estimated at 124.147 units this week, up 22 percent from 101,610 last week but 3.3 percent below the 124,409 cars built in the 1975 week.

title: Green Market At Union Square
description: The second citysponsored Green Market will open tomorrow at the northern end of Union Square, where farmers will truck In fresh fruits and vegetables for sale directly to consumers  a practice almost forgotten by most city dwellers here.

title: Pennsylvania Says Illness No Longer Imperils Hotel
description: HARRISBURG, PA., Aug. 19, The unidentified disease that killed 26 people in Pennsylvania has apparently stopped as mysteriously as it first struck and no danger exists to guests at the Bellevue Stratford Hotel in Philadelphia, the Pennsylvania Secretary of Health said here today.

title: SIX MORE ITALIANS UNDERGO ABORTION
description: MILAN, Italy, Aug. 19 CAP)Six women from the pollutionstricken village of Seveso have undergone abortions and nine more are seeking them under extraordinary exemptions from Italy's stiff antiabortion laws, officials said today.

title: A Tough Infighter Robert Joseph Dole
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19Robert Joseph Dole of Kansas, President Ford's choice for the VicePresidential nomination tonight, sa vors the pleasures and the risks of defending Presidents against Democratic majorities and declining odds. From his first days in the Senate in 1969, he was a oneman Dole Patrol, a fiery jackinthebox on the Senate floor and strong partisan supporter of Richard M. Nixon's Supreme Court appointments, Vietnam initiatives and, eventually, his Watergate defense.

title: In Memoriam
description: GLADSTONENathan, (Norman). In cherished memory. Passed away 7 Years ago today. Beloved husband, father, grandfather, brother of Bernard and friend to all. BESS.

title: Broadway
description: IN A KIND OF reverse migration this season, three top stage directorsArthur Penn, Ulu Grosbard and Mike Nicholsafter a long absence are returning from Hollywood to Broadway. What brings them back, by common agreement, is good plays. Mr. Penn returns with Larry Gelbart's new comedy, Sly Fox Mr. Grosbard with the Broadway version of David Mamet's Off Off Broadway success American Buffalo, and Mr. Nichols with Trevor Griffiths's London hit, Comedians.

title: Marble Falls in London
description: LONDON, Aug. 19 A 12foot section of decorative marble fell about 50 feet this afternoon from a building on Oxford Street, London's busiest shopping street. Eight persons were injured, one seriously.

title: Ann T. Maulsby, 69, Dies; Retired Chappaqua Editor
description: Ann Terwilliger Maulsby, editor of The Chappaqua Sun, a weekly in Chappaqua, N. Y., until she retired in 1969, died Wednesday in a nursing home in Stamford, Conn. She was 69 years old.

title: LAURA T. BROWNSTONE
description: Laura Tarantous Brownstone, mother of Alexander H. Cohen, the Broadway theatrical producer, died yesterday in her home at 250 East 63d Street. She was 78 years old.

title: Judge Allows Introduction Of Abduction Confession
description: KEY WEST, Fla., Aug. 19 (UPI)  A Federal judge permitted the prosecution to introduce into evidence today a confession from William A. H. Williams that he had kidnapped Reg Murphy, a newspaper executive in 1974. The ruling followed arguments heard by the Judge. William C. O'Kelley.

title: Music: Les Paul Is Back
description: Since he retired in the early 60's, Les Paul, a guitarist who had tremendous popular success 25 years ago with recordings made by multidubbing of guitar and voice tracks, has been content to limit his playing, except on rare occasions, to informal jam sessions with neighboring guitarists in Northern New Jersey, where he lives. On Wednesday night, one of his guitarplaying neighbors, Bucky Pizzarelli, lured Mr. Paul into an appearance as part of a threeguiar ensemble, with Mr. Pizzarelli and Wayne Wright, at Storyvillo, Madison Avenue at 58thl Street.

title: Beirut Palestinians Using Soviet Missiles
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 19Palestinian guerrillas fired Sovietmade surfacetosurface missiles today at rightists strongholds in the eastern sector of the city.

title: 2Year Treasury Notes Sold at Average Yield
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19The Treasury today sold $2.50 billion of twoyear notes at an average return of 6.67 percent. The department received $4.29 billion of tenders for the notes, which will carry a coupon interest rate of 6.58 percent. Accepted tenders included 20 percent of the bids at the highest yield.

title: Beame Appoints DiMaio Chief Medical Examiner
description: Mayor Beame formally appointed Dr. Dominick J. DiMaio as Chief Medical Examiner for New York City yesterday, bringing to a conclusion an extensive nationwide search prolonged by a controversy over Dr. DiMaio's qualifications and outside activities; as well as the selection process itself.

title: REBELS BAR PLAN FOR AFRICAN AREA
description: WINDHOEK. South  West Africa, Aug. 19 (Reuters)The SouthWest Africa People's Organization today rejected the announced provisional date of Dec. 31, 1978, for the territory's full independence from South Africa and the planned creation of an interim government.

title: New YorkontheSeine
description: With a touch of noblesse oblige, Paris officials dropped in on Mayor Beame this week for a special lesson on how to run the City of Light from the managers of BaghdadontheSubway. Up to now the French national government has ruled Paris because it is the capital; next year Parisians will elect their own Mayor and take over the municipality.

title: Zoo to Measure Monty Python
description: A python named Monty will be measured at the Bronx Zoo tomorrow afternoon in a ceremony at which children will be invited to guess his lengthand prizes will be awarded to those who come the closest.

title: Massachusetts Law to Curb Arabs Boycott Is Enacted
description: BOSTON, Aug. 19 (UPI) Massachusetts has made it illegal for concerns to participate in Arab boycotts of companies owned by Jews or goods produced by such companies.

title: Big Board Short Interest Down 1.4 Million Shares
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that the short interest in the month ended Aug. 13 decreased 1,415,881 shares to 22,809,707 shares. This was the lowest total since Aug. 15, 1975, when the short interest. was 22,774.466 shares.

title: U S. Embassy Says Jamaica Is Diplomatic Tardship Post
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Aug. 19 (UPI)The United States Embassy has announced that Jamaica has been designated a diplomatic hardship post because of health hazards and rising costs.

title: Visiting Diplomats Get New Idea of U. S.
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 19A planeload of foreign diplomats arrived at President Ford's headquarters hotel this afternoon and toasted their visit to the Republican National Convention with imported Russian vodka in iced shotglasses.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: With society and the cultural scene supposedly returning to more conservative yardsticks, at 7:30 tonight WNBC offers Norman Rockwell's World  an American Dream, a half hour live action documentary that combines the noted illustrator, his narration and a couple of hundred of his paintings for a thoroughly appealing slice of Americana.

title: At the Movies
description: DON'T MAKE PICTURES like Joe Levine gasped the dying man, and Robert Downey has remained outrageously true to his father's wish. For the last three years, the pure but profane, logical but lunatic crusader who delighted and appalled audiences with the irreverent Chafed Elbows, Putney Swope and Greaser's Palace, has been toiling on what promises to be a lavishly nonLevine epic. Boasting a budget of $250,000 and a cast of over a hundred unknowns, Two Tons of Turquoise to Taos Tonight will have its premiere at the Telluride, Colo., film festival, Sept. 36.

title: NIGERIA PLANNING LOCAL ELECTIONS
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Aug. 19 (Agence FrancePresse) The Nigerian military Government announced plans today for elections of local government councils as a step toward civilian rule by 1979. The elections were scheduled for November and December.

title: Lakers Get West As Coach
description: Jerry West, the Los Angeles Lakers Mr. Clutch, who came out of Cheylan, W. Va. (pop. 500) to become a pro basketball legend, was named yesterday as coach of his former team.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: New York's voters enrolled in the Republican and Democratic Parties had little voice in deciding the 1976 Presidential candidates of their respective parties. Very few Republicans know the identities of the persons who supposedly are representing them in Kansas City. As for this spring's Democratic primary, many voters were effectively disenfranchised by the absence from the ballot of various candidates names. For example, Jimmy Carter did not appear on the ballot in more than half the districts.

title: Two Months in Korea
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Aug. 19 (UPI)First Lieut. Mark T. Barrett had been in Korea less than two months when he was killed.

title: Prices Fall On OTC And Amex
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market fell sharply yeserday in more active trading:

title: Body of a Queens Tavern Owner, Abducted Aug. 13, Found in Bay
description: The owner of a small Queens tavern who had been missing since his abduction last Friday was found dead yesterday afternoon in eight feet of water off the South Brooklyn waterfront.

title: A Tough Infighter
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19Robert Joseph Dole of Kansas, President Ford's choice for the VicePresidential nomination tonight, sa vors the pleasures and the risks of defending Presidents against Democratic majorities and declining odds. From his first days in the Senate in 1969, he was a oneman Dole Patrol, a fiery jackinthebox on the Senate floor and strong partisan supporter of Richard M. Nixon's Supreme Court appointments, Vietnam initiatives and, eventually, his Watergate defense.

title: Dole 2d Kansan to Get On Ticket in Kansas City
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 (UPI)Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas was the second Kansas Senator to be selected for the VicePresidential nomination at a Republican National Convention held in Kansas City.

title: JAILINGS PROTESTED BY POLAND'S CHURCH
description: WARSAW, Aug. 19 (Reuters)  Poland's Roman Catholic Church has criticized the dismissal and jailing of workers who demonstrated against proposed food price increases announced last June.

title: Dole Choice Conformed To the Wishes of Reagan
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 In selecting Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas today. as his. VicePresidential running mate, President Ford made a decision that conformed to the wishes of Ronald Reagan and brought to the ticket an aggressive and articulate political infighter.

title: Presidential Debates Would Be First Since 1960 Race
description: Both major Presidential nominees said last night that they were prepared to meet in the first televised Presidential campaign debates since 1960.

title: The Dancing Madness in Discothequeyille
description: WEST ORANGE, Aug. 19Thi:volume of the music is awesome and makes conversation nearly impossible, The music is continuous, in some places alternating between disk Jockey and a live band. By midnight, the floors are filled with twirling dancers in the latest chic fashions.

title: 14 Victims Of Quake Are Buried
description: SANGALI, Philippines, Aug. 19This fishing village northeast of Zamboanga City buried its dead yesterday14 children ranging in age from 12 years to seven months.

title: Fluke and Bluefish Active Along Coast
description: Fluke and bluefish appear to be offering the best action along the coast from southern New Jersey to Connecticut, although there are some signs off Montauk that striped bass are beginning to move out of their summer doldrums.

title: Mrs. Dole, a Southerner, Is Federal Trade Official
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19When Senator Robert J. Dole married a Federal trade commissioner, Elizabeth Hanford, a wag at the commission circulated an interoffice memo suggesting that the forthcoming wedding might constitute a violation of the nation's antimerger laws. Miss Hanford was highly amused.

title: Israel Says It Is Confident Egypt Is Seeking Detente
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 19 (Reuters)Israel today made clear its belief that Egypt wants to pursue dtente despite tough words by President Anwar elSadat and his troops alleged violation of the Sinai accord.

title: South African Police Open Fire On Blacks Storming Factories
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 19Policemen opened fire on a crowd of stonethrowing blacks today when they stormed four factories in an industrial suburb of the coastal city of Port Elizabeth in the second day of antiGovernment unrest. The death toll in the rioting overnight rose to 14 and the number wounded to 28.

title: Philadelphia Hotel Acts to Save Image In Mystery Disease
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 19 (AP)The Bellevue Stratford Hotel has asked its public relations agency, Spiro & Associates, to conduct a campaign to restore its image, which had been damaged by the mystery of legionnaires disease.

title: FORD PICKS SENATOR DOLE AS RUNNING MATE; OFFERS TO DEBATE CARTER FACE TO FACE
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 President Ford surprised his fellow Republicans today by selecting Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas as his running mate; then pledged to fight with a total will to win a great victory.

title: Soviet, Despite Effort to Court Third World, Limits Its Foreign Aid
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 19The Soviet Union's contention that it is the truest friend of the third world reached crescendo pitch as the nonaligned nations met this week in Colombo, Sri Lanka.

title: Congress May Not Attempt To Override Pesticide Veto
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (UPI) Congress may let stand President Ford's veto of a bill that would have given the House or Senate power to kill pesticide bans imposed by the Environmental Protection Agency.

title: Party Chiefs in 3 States Call Dole's Effect Neutral
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 President Ford is the clear underdog in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut and his choice of Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas is not likely to help or hurt him, Republican leaders and public officials from the three states agreed today.

title: Man With a Baton
description: Leonard Slatkin knows you need talent to become a conductor, and he has it. He also knows you need luck, and he has had that. But most of us who make it, make it on perseverance, the stocky young musician said the other day in reflecting on his peculiar profession.

title: Ford Phones and Dole Says Certainly
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 He hadn't heard a word and he had nearly given up hope.

title: Return of an ExMilitary Strongman Sets Off Alarm in Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 19 A ghost from Thailand's military past has thrown the nation's civilian Government into a turmoil.

title: Books of The Times
description: GERALDINE COLT, better known by her revolutionary comrades as Theresa, is wanted by the F.B.I. for murder, bank robbery and bombing. She is also wanted by Elf, her female lover and friend in the movement, for her soul and her sex. Elf, whose vocation is rage, has even been moved by Theresa to write bad poetry: Theresa is the sound of the stars, a sibilant whisper of infinity.

title: The MotorCity Blues
description: The news from Detroit and from Kansas City came almost as a single blow. From Detroit there were frightening reports about roving gangs of black teenagers shredding the tattered remnants of Detroit's civic fabric. And from Kansas City there came the Republican platform's analysis of America's urban ills: Without an urban policy, the Democratcontrolled Congress has created a hodgepodge of programs which have all but destroyed our once vital cities. The platform statement so missed the point that one could wonder whether the urban analysts in Kansas City had been living in the country where Detroit and the other old American cities are located.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: The problem presented to parents when their maturing children leave home is easy to Ignore. First of all, it's known by that ridiculous cliche, the empty nest, a laughable image that sounds as if it were borrowed from a nursery rhyme.

title: FRIDAY, AUGUST 20, 1976
description: President Ford surprised his fellow Republicans with his selection of Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas as his running mate. The delegates at the Republican National Convention ratified the President's choice, a conservative known for his aggressive partianship. A movement by some southerners to draft Ronald Reagan fizzled. In the prepared text of an address to the final session of the convention, President Ford pledged to fight with a total will to win a great victory. [Page A 1, Column 8.]

title: One of the Last OldTime Fairs
description: Most county fairs have their few days in the summer sun, then disappear for another year. The Little World's Fair being held in Grahamsville, N. Y., tomorrow and Sunday is changing that in honor of the nation's Bicentennial.

title: Rival Play in Richards Rift
description: In an action resulting from the participation of Dr. Renee Richards in the Tennis Week open at South Orange, N.J.. beginning this weekend, the Women's Tennis Association announced yesterday that it would hold a tournament at Westchester Country Club, in Harrison, N.Y., from Monday to Aug. 30, according to United Press International.

title: Schweiker Has No Regrets On Reagan Campaign Role
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 His threeweek baptism in national politics was over, his Secret Service entourage had decamped to guard Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas, and his wife, shinyeyed, pressed her lips together to keep from crying.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Health Department closed Tzaidah Food Service of Brooklyn, a processor involved in the Summer Food Service program for needy New York City children, for alleged violations of the health code. The company, under contract to the Hebrew Institute of Borough Park, had been serving 6,000 to 7,000 meals a day. It was closed for what a health official called evidence of rodents and insects, and no hot water. Fred Newman, director of the concern, said: I'll admit it wasn't the cleanest and best operation, but it was far from the nonsense they wrote up on me.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A New Jerey Superior Court judge has continued a freeze on a $51;000 bank account held by a man advertising New York City subway tokens for sale for 20 cents less than the city charges. The man, Kenneth Roberts, 23 years old, of Manhattan says he is motivated by charity to sell the tokens for 30 cents, but Judge John J. Geronimo said he found that hard to believe. The judge continued an order until at least Sept. 24 that bars Mr. Roberts from drawing on his account at the Garden State National Bank in Hoboken. New York authorities sought the order, saying Mi. Roberts's customers should be reimbursed because they never received the tokens they ordred..Mr. Roberts's lawyer, Frank Lucianna, said his client had been unable to send the tokens because he could not take the money from his account to buy them.

title: Reaction Mixed in Ford's Grand Rapids
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., Aug. 19  When President Ford narrowly won the Republican Party's nomination for President early today, it was difficult to find any broad display of enthusiasm in Grand Rapids, where his political career started and was centered for years.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. California Angels, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 8 P.M.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Up
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week ended Aug. 14 totaled an estimated 14.6 billion tonmiles, 0.3 percent above the yearearlier level. Carloadings in the same period totaled 445,890 cars, 2.4 percent below last year; The American Trucking Associations Inc., reported that intercity truck tonnage rose 6.5 percent from last year.

title: Events and Openings
description: THE GUIABALL RALLY, directed by Chuck Haif, starring Michael Sarrazln and Raul Julia, at neighborhood the. aters.

title: U.S. Stresses Toxin Clues in Disease Hunt
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 18The sample may be a little piece of human kidney, or liver, or a piece of lung about as big as a man's fingertip.

title: Orantes, Sue Barker Upset
description: TORONTO, Aug. 19 (AP)Two major upsets took place at the $155,000 Canadian open tennis tournament today as the defending champion, Manuel Orantes of Spain, and the topseeded woman, Sue Barker of Britain, were eliminated.

title: F.B.I. Data Seized By U.S.Prosecutors
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, assigned to investigate a series of burglaries carried out by their colleagues, removed today what one Federal official termed file cabinet after file cabinet from the bureau's headquarters here and from its field office in New York City.

title: Concert: A Fresh Breeze at Tanglewood
description: ALTHOUGH the old guard is having trouble acknowledging it, there is an interesting new breeze blowing through contemporary music. Evidence of that stirring, which the old guard probably prefers to regard as hot air, turned up several times at Tanglewood during the Festival of Contemporary Music that concluded Wednesday night in Lenox, Mass. After a long period during which a saintly asceticism ruled the writing of new music, composers seem to be asserting that it is quite legitimate to feel to think.

title: 3 Inflated Latex Statues Vanish From L.I. Museum
description: ROSLYN HARBOR; L.I., Aug. 19Three pieces of unusual sculptureirregular spheres of latex related to one another as they floated on a small, treeshaded pond behind the Nassau County Museum of Fine Art herehave mysteriously disappeared.

title: REAGAN, ON DAIS, SPURS PARTY ON
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 Ronald Reagan, defeated and apparently at the end of his political career. took the platform at the Republican National Convention tonight at President Ford's invitation and said it was a moment that will live in our hearts forever.

title: Beanie Team Wins, 269; Control Board Skeptical
description: If it looked like they were playing with a vengeance, it was probably because they were playing with a vengeance.

title: $2 MILLION BAIL SET FOR 3 IN DRUG CASE
description: Three men allegedly involved in major international narcotics operations were jailed yesterday in lieu of bail totaling almost $2 million after their arrest by Federal agents in Manhattan.

title: After the Reagan Insurrection
description: With unwavering determination, Ronald Reagan and his supporters carried their fight for the Presidential nomination to the very end although they knew as the balloting began Wednesday evening that they were almost sure to lose. It was the closest and most stirring G.O.P. convention struggle since the TaftEisenhower contest of 1952.

title: Mistrial Declared In Case Involving McGovern Aide
description: DEDHAM, Mass., Aug. 19A mistrial was declared today in the murder trial of the 1972 Massachusetts treasurer of the McGovern Presidential campaign. No date was set for a new trial.

title: Caramanlis Retains His Popularity Despite Big Tasks Undone
description: ATHENS, Aug. 19After two years in power, the Government of Prime Minister Constantine Caramanlis still enjoys extraordinary popularity and prestige here and abroad.

title: LOUIS PRENTISS, 76; WAS ARMY GENERAL
description: Maj. Gen. Louis W. Prentiss, who commanded Fort Belvoir in Virginia for part of his 35year military career, died Wednesday at Walter Reed Hospital in Washington. His was 76 years old.

title: Newark Fair Will Offer Health Tests
description: NEWARK, Aug. 19With more than 2,500 of this city's children found each year to have unacceptable levels of lead in their systems, the Newark Jaycees and the City Department of Health will sponsor the third annual Health Fair at Military Park tomorrow and Saturday from 10 A.M. to 6 P.M., offering free tests for blood lead levels.

title: New Truck Route For Queens to Go In Effect on Sept. 8
description: A new truckrouting system for Queens, intended to keep large vehicles out of residential areas, will be put into effect Sent, 8.

title: Art People
description: IN THE HIERARCHIES of paranoia no one stands higher than the artist from out of town who feels that he or she will never get a fair chance in New York.

title: GUERRILLAS KILL 2 IN ARGENTINA
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 19A retired army general and an executive of an automobile company were assassinated today in the first major guerrilla actions since a Marxist guerrilla chief was killed a month ago.

title: How to Star in Your Own Version Of Grand Hotel
description: W EEKEnd at the Waldorf, a 1945 remake of the Liassic Grand Hotel, peopled the Peacock Alley with the dashing likes of Ginger Rogers, Van Johnson, Lana Turner, Walter Pidgeon and Xavier Cugat.

title: May Stores. Post Profit Rise While Allied Shows Drop
Own More Than Just a Piece of the Rock
description: JAMESTOWN, R. I.Henry and Joan Wood are rulers of an island empire, In the littleknown Dumpling chain.

title: LUNA FLYING BACK WITH MOON SOIL
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 19 (AP)Luna 24, the unmanned Soviet spaceship that landed on the moon yesterday, is on the way back to earth with a sample of moon soil, Tass, the official Soviet press agency, reported today.

title: City Groups Make an Olympian Effort
description: Charlesanna Adams was nervously running round the podium area in Macombs Dam Park in the Bronx yesterday morning, tending to all the final details of the New York City Housing Authority citywide Olympics. When someone asked her to explain just what was going on, she blurted out, Right now I'm having a baby.

title: Doctors, Clinics and Druggists Penalized in Fraud
description: Both the New York State Department of Health and District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn announced actions yesterday against alleged perpetrators of Medicaid fraud.

title: Study Backs Atom Charm Idea
description: Evidence of the subatomic phenomenon called naked charm has been seen in some 50 highenergy physics experiments at the Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory in Batavia, Ill., according to an announcement yesterday in New York at Columbia University.

title: Ford's Doleful News
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19The political process has worked its way and produced two Presidential candidates worthy of the respect of the nation.

title: Yanks Defeat Syracuse
description: SYRACUSE, N.Y., Aug. 19 (UPI)Lou Piniella blasted a tworun, sixthinning homer to lead the New York Yankees to a 54 victory ovr the Syracuse Chiefs, the team's International League farm club here tonight. Catfish Hunter pitched three innings for New York with a relief pitcher, Ron Guidry, picking up the victory.

title: An Accounting Method Weighs Inflation
description: The accounting firm of Ernst & Ernst has proposed a standard method to reflect the effect of inflation on corporate profits.

title: Red Smith
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS N.Y., Aug. 19Yellow sunshine slanting through trees made splashes of brilliance between the barns where wood smoke curled up from under big kettles of water, and steam rose from horses getting a sponge bath after their morning's work. An old pappy guy with a face something had stepped on rode by on a stable pony leading a young thoroughbred that was buckjumping out of sheer high spirits. A young fellow in blue jeans leaning on the rail of the halfmile training track called a erect ing: Hey Apples, I thought you was dead. The old guy's tone was serene. I'll be on these ponies another 20 years, he said. He spoke more sharply to the frisking colt: Stop it, now! and led him through the gap to the main track. Apples, a man said. I love racetrack namesDog Wagon, Slow and Easy, QuickQuittin Steve, Squirrel, Lyin Fitz. In Maryland there was a groom named Telephone and his girl was Tingaling.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.2 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials rose to 207.8 from 207.6 last week.

title: Giants vs. Steelers Tonight; Jaynes Hopes for a Chance
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y.. Aug. 19David Jaynes and the rest of the Giants got on a plane for Pittsburgh today. The Giants were going to play the Super Bowl champion Steelers tomorrow night; Jaynes wasn't sure where he was going.

title: FORD PICKS SENATOR DOLE AS RUNNING MATE; SAYS HE WANTS DEBATE. AND CARTER AGREES
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 President Ford surprised his fellow Republicans today byselecting Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas as his running mate., then pledged to fight with a total will to win a great victory.

title: Dole Choice Conformed To the Wishes of Reagan
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 In selecting Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas today as. This VicePresidential running mate, President Ford made a decision that conformed to the wishes of Ronald Reagan and brought to the ticket an aggressive and articulate political infighter.

title: Van Winkle Revived At Tarrytown
description: There was a contagion in the very air that blew from that haunted region it breathed forth an atmosphere of dreams and fancies infecting all the land.

title: Poles Ban China Newsman
description: WARSAW, Aug. 19 (Reuters) Poland has withdrawn the accreditation of the chief correspondent of Hsinhua the Chinese press agency, accusing the agency of distorting reports of worker disturbances here in June, according to informed sources. A representative of the agency said the correspondent, Lio Pinchiang, would return to Peking tomorrow. But he rejected Polish allegations that reports of worker demonstrations following Government announcements of planned food pri cerises had been distorted.

title: Climax of Ford Bid Anticlimax for TV
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 19 President Ford's victory in the most closely contested political convention in a generation and his selection of a run ning mate both came across as anticlimaxes on the television screen.

title: SIMNKER'S GROUP ENDORSES CARTER
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Aug. 19 The American Federation of Teachers, meeting here for its annual convention, gave an overwhelming endorsement today to the candidacy of Jimmy Carter.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: The idea that jazz can also shake you up at high noon, not only in the wee hours after midnight, has been getting across in New York for a number of years. Various noontime jazz sessions, usually on Fridays when the slack is on for the weekend, have been a Midtown feature in hotels and restaurants. Sometimes the music is made by jazz buffs, some times by paid pro's. The latter make the Friday noonto3 music at Eddie Condon's 144 West 54th Street (2658277). It's a sixpack unit called Foleer's Pacers, after Ed Polcer, the trumpeter in Condon's house band, Balaban and Cats. What you hear will be traditional jazz. No cover, no minimum, no music charge. Italian dishes, $3.50 to $4.25; drinks, $2 at the bar, $2.25 at the table; beer is $1.75 at the bar and $2 at the table.

title: Examiner Assails Principal Who Ousted Girl Student and Proposes $3,500 Fine
description: A Board of Education trial examiner has sharply criticized Dr. Howard L. Hurwitz, the outspoken principal of Long Island City High School, accusing him of improperly and illegally keeping a student out of school last March, and recommended that he be fined $3,500 for unbecoming conduct and insubordination.

title: Antiques
description: AS MOST Oriental rug collectors know, a stitch time by a skilled restorer can revitalize a carpet and sometimes raise its value, too. And summer the season when people usually find it convenient to part with their Kirmans long enough for the fringes be replaced. the edges rebound and the surfaces renamed.

title: JAMES L. CRANDELL
description: James Louis Crandell, Superintendent of the Westhampton Beach School District, died yesterday at his Long Island home. He was 54 years old.

title: U.S. Crisis Unit Takes Up DMZ Killings
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19The Government's highlevel group that deals with world crises was convened last night and this morning to discuss military and diplomatic responses to the steppedup tension in Korea caused by the killing of two American military officers yesterday by North Korean guards.

title: Fratello Ed Captures Empire State Stakes at Saratoga
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 19A field of 17 New Yorkbred 2yearolds mixed it up today in the $38,425 Empire State Stakes at Saratoga Race Course, and after the smoke had cleared. Fratello Ed, onehalf of Assunta Louis Farm's favored entry, proved a decisive twolength winner.

title: Hispanic and Proud
description: When the Ballet Hispanico of New York gives a free performance at 8:15 tomorrow night in Lincoln Center's Damrosch Park, the program will reflect the special identity of its dancers.

title: The King of Kongs Reels Again
description: A farewell appearance of the original, uncut King. Kong will begin tomorrow at the D.W. Griffith Theater on East 59th Street. To hark back to the days of the film's release in 1933, the admission price from noon until 5 P.M. will be 10 cents, the standard price of the kiddie matinee at that time.

title: Japan Arrests 17th Official In the Lockheed Bribe Scandal
description: TOKYO, Aug, 20 (AP)The Tokyo district prosecutors office announced the arrest today of Takayuki Sato, a member of the lower house of Japan's Parliament, in connection with the Lockheed bribery scandal.

title: Ford's Rousing Address To Set Campaign's Tone
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 20 An emotionally high President Ford made the speech of his life last night and today his aides said that it would set the tone for the election campaign now about to begin.

title: William Fisher Weds Elizabeth Sherry
description: Elizabeth Ann Sherry, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William J. Sherry Jr., was married yesterday to William Daniel Fisher, son of Mrs. Thomas K. Fisher and the late Mr. Fisher. Both families are of Chappaqua, N.Y., where Msgr. Robert Skelley performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of SS. John and Mary.

title: Pro Transactions
description: FOOTBALL

title: Hollywood Losing Glamour Image As Tawdriness Replaces the Tinsel
description: HOLLYWOOD, Aug. 20 In a seemingly relentless search, the summer tourists head down Hollywood Boulevard these days. Most converge on the courtyard of the old Grauman's Chinese Theater and their eyes immediately shoot downward, searching for the names and symbols of celluloid heros and heroines of the past, and a Hollywood that really does not exist anymore.

title: Nixon Rated Mention, Rabbi Korff Asserts
description: WARWICK, R.I., Aug. 20 (UPI)The Republican National Convention should have condemned former President Richard M. Nixon for covering up the Watergate scandal but praised his achievements, Rabbi Baruch Korff said today.

title: Mondale Considers Republican Ticket Out of Mainstream
description: HIBBING, Minn., Aug. 20  Senator Walter F. Mondale said today that the nomination of Senator Robert J. Dole as his opponent for Vice President completed a Republican ticket that was outside the mainstream of American life.

title: MARY GRACE ENGLE
description: Mary Grace Tonish Engle, a retired fashion designer, died Thursday at Polyclinic Hospital after a long illness. She was 64 years old and lived at 4245 Corporal Street in Bayside, Queens.

title: 8 Housing Projects for Bergen Elderly May Start Next Spring
description: HACKENSACK, Aug. 20  Construction of $50 million in federally financed housing for the elderly in eight Bergen County communities could begin next spring and be ready for tenants in 1978, William J. Malone, executive director of the Bergen County Housing Authority, disclosed today.

title: Pacific Exchange Is Hit By Amex on Delisting Bid
description: The American Stock Exchange assailed the Pacific Stock Exchange yesterday for attempting to delist options in the United States Steel Corporation and the NCR Corporation because of an apparent lack of public interest.

title: Drug Panel Acts to Put Darvon On Controlled Substances List
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20  After several years of debate, the Federal Government is moving to tighten controls on the use of Darvon, a mild painkiller that is the country's third most widely prescribed drug.

title: South Africa Rebuffed
description: The United Nations Council for Namibiaas SouthWest Africa is called in the world bodyissued a statement last night that rejected as highly inadequate the proposals sponsored by South Africa to grant independence to the territory. Page 6.

title: 2 Differ on Effect Of Chemical Found In Mothers' Milk
description: LANSING, Mich., Aug. 20 (AP) Michigan's public health director and a state researcher on the toxic chemical PBB disagree over whether women should stop breast feeding babies because studies are detecting the chemical in Michigan mothers milk.

title: ThirdWorld Oil Boycott Threat Is Not Taken Seriously by France
description: PARIS, Aug. 20A thirdworld resolution calling for an oil embargo against France because of its arms deliveries to South Africa was seen by the Government here today as an empty threat.

title: U.S. ASKS AMENDS BY NORTH KOREANS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said today that the United States was demanding explanations and reparation from North Korea for the killing of two American military officers in the Korean demilitarized zone two days ago.

title: Alastair Sim Is Dead at 75; Was a Master of Comedy
description: LONDON, Aug. 20Alastair Sim, the British actor, died of cancer last night at University College Hospital here, his family announced today. He was 75 years old and resided in London.

title: POLLUTING FACTORY IN ITALY WILL CLOSE
description: MILAN, Italy, Aug. 20 (Reuters)The Swissowned lcmesa chemical factory at Seveso, where an explosion spread a cloud of poisonous pollution last month, will be closed down, Italian officials said today.

title: About New York
description: Our man, an innocent, fell by the 0TB parlor in Times Square the other evening. He was an innocent in the sense that, while he admired horses, he had been just once to a track, and never to a bookie, legal or otherwise. He was also an Innocent in that he imagined bettors on horses to be the last optimists in the bare ruined choirs of a oncegreat citya saving remnant of romantics.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Dr. John S. Marr, director of the city's Bureau of Preventable Diseases, was incorrectly quoted in The Times yesterday as having said that commercially prepared gefilte fish was preferable to the homemade variety because of the danger of contamination in the latter. Dr. Marr's warning actually was directed against the common practice of tasting the raw freshwater fish for flavor before the gefilte fish was cooked.

title: Through a Glass Groggily
description: Humanity appears to be doomed. It has been brought to this dreadful pass by an organization called the Democrat Party, with the connivance of a Secretary of State named Kissinger.

title: Silver Futures Follow Soybean Lead
description: Silver futures prices have been following the lead of soybean prices with such regularity, for the last year or so that traders often speak of parallel movements.

title: Horse Show Results
description: FAIRFIELD COUNTY SHOW

title: George Fowler Dead at 55; Official of Hurok Concerts
description: George Fowler, vice president of Hurok Concerts, died of cancer Wednesday in St. John's Hospital in Santa Monica, Calif. He was 55 years old.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Friday.

title: Carter And the Diplomats
description: AMERICUS, Ga.  One of Jimmy Carter's main strengths as a candidate is that he owes nobody any favors and this relatively unique asset among American Presidential candidates places him in a splendid position to improve the efficacy of United States representation abroad.

title: Threatened Attica Strike Brings Officials for Talks
description: ATTICA, N.Y., Aug. 20  Members of the State Assembly and the newly appointed chairman of the State Commission on Correction went to Attica prison today to listen to grievances of inmates and to try to defuse plans for a general strike at the institution on Monday.

title: South African Blacks Get New Concession on Homes
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 20 The South African Government announced a new concession to urban blacks today, but followed up the move with tough speeches suggesting that the basic conditions of life for the country's 18 million blacks were unlikely to undergo any fundamental change.

title: 3 Charged in Firebombing
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 20 (UPI)Three youths were arrested today and charged with arson and attempted murder in the firebombing of the home of a Puerto Rican couple in the Kensington section of the city. The threebedroom row house was firebombed Wednesday night when a soda bottle containing a, flamable substance was hurled against the front door. It caused minor damage to the door. Three other persons were arrested in connection with a rockthrowing incident at the couple's home earlier Wednesday in which two windows were broken.

title: New Byrne Counsel Took Cut in Salary
description: TRENTON, Aug. 20  It was like the ringing of the fire bell, Judge Alan B. Handler said today. I had been in government service for many years, so when the Governor asked me to serve as his counsel I just couldn't refuse.

title: Carolyn Jackson Wed in Nashville
description: Carolyn Merridith Jackson and Joseph Drexel LaBarbera, both candidates for doctorates in clinical psychology at Vanderbilt University, Nashville, were married there yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Harmon Wray, a Methodist minister, performed the ceremony in the Benton Chapel of the university.

title: New Building Method Uses Limited Variety of Parts
Meeting on Roselli Inquiry
description: MIAMI, Aug. 20 (AP)Senator Gary Hart, Democrat of Colorado, was in Miami today for a private meeting with Dade County detectives investigating the ganglandstyle slaying of the mob figure John Roselli. Mr. Hart said he made the unannounced trip to emphasize the interest of the Senate Select Intelligence Committee in the murder and to insure that Federal agents were cooperating with the local police. Mr. Roselli had testified before the committee about his role in a plot to assassinate Fidel Castro.

title: Moynihan and Mrs. Abzug at Odds Over Welfare
description: The fiveway battle for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator, from New York, a relatively lowkeyed contest until now, struck a sharper note yesterday when Daniel P. Moynihan accused Representative Bella S. Abzug of having opposed a welfare reform plan that he espoused.

title: No DES Discovered In 3Month Testing Of Livers of Cattle
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (UPI) For the first time since the Agriculture Department began regular testing for illegal residues of a growth stimulant hormone in meat, it has completed an entire quarter without confirming a single residue case, officials have reported.

title: Open Interest
description: Friday, Aug. 20, 1976

title: Bombs Expode in Subway
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 20 (Reuters)Several bombs containing pamphlets exploded here tonight and reports of more suspicious packages forced the authorities to close down the city's five subway lines, the police said. No injuries were reported in the explosions.

title: Prized Theological Library Sold To Emory U. for $1.75 Million
THE REV. A.L. CHILDS
description: The Rev. Alexander Luke Childs, a Benedictine monk of Portsmouth Abbey, Portsmouth, R. I., died yesterday of a cerebral hemorrhage in St. Joseph's Hospital, Providence, R.I. He was 36 years old.

title: Fans Berate TV Outlet For Shift From Parley
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 20 (AP)  More than 200 enraged fans of NBCTV's Republican National Convention coverage telephoned the lone switchboard operator at a local television station last night, protesting a programming switch from the convention to a war movie.

title: Marcos Tours Area of Quake; Death Toll Is Still Increasing
description: MANILA, Aug. 20As the death toll from the quake and tidal waves Tuesday continued to rise, President Ferdinand E. Marcos and his family toured the devastated area on Mindanao today and pledged full support for relief and rehabilitation.

title: Carter Says Ford Fails To Check Nation's Drift
description: PLAINS, Ga., Aug. 20  Jimmy Carter tried out today what may be the principal themes of his Presidential campaign accusing the Ford Administration of having allowed the nation to drift without a goal or purpose and saying that the voters choice was between new leadership in the White House or no leadership.

title: Rhodesia Accused of Attack on Refugees
description: GENEVA, Aug. 20A spokesman for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees said today that Rhodesian troops last week almost completely destroyed a United Nations  supported refugee camp in Mozambique that had housed 8,000 black refugees from Rhodesia.

title: Peking and the Quakes: Rejection of Outside Aid Is SelfReliance
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 20 As in previous cases of natural disasters, airplane crashes and shipwrecks, the Chinese have made public little specific information on the damage or casualties in the Tangshan area beyond referring to great losses. However, some Japanese, French and Danish visitors who were caught in Tangshan have spoken of it being flattened.

title: DELEGATES LEAVE WITII MUTED HOPE
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 20 Delegates to the 31st Republican National Convention streamed out of Kansas City today, exhilarated by the drama of'last night's concluding session but profoundly worried about the next 73 days.

title: Sada Rothman Applebaum, Music Writer and Teacher
description: Sada Rothman Applebaum, a music writer and teacher and the mother of Michael Tree, the violist, was killed in an automobile accident Wednesday at West Chester, Pa. She was 72 years old and lived in Maplewood, N. J.

title: 2 Differ on Effect Of Chemical Found In Mothers' Milk
description: LANSING, Mich., Aug. 20 Michigan's public health director and a state researcher on the toxic chemical PBB disagree over whether women should stop breast feeding babies because studies are detecting the chemical in Michigan mothers milk.

title: 4th Brooklyn Suspect Is Sought In Queens KidnappingMurder
description: A fourth Brooklyn man was being sought by the police yesterday as a suspect in the kidnapping and murder of the 46yearold owner of a small tavern in Jackson Heights, Oueens.

title: Renee Richards Angry, Resolute
description: KINGS POINT, L.I., Aug. 20Ever since I was an infant, I always wanted to be a girl, Dr. Renee Richards was saying. I used to go to bed at night and pray, I wish I were a girl, I wish I were a girl.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The United States Steel Corporation said it was temporarily reducing production and would lay off 400 to 500 employees at its Youngstown, Ohio, works in a effort to reduce inventories of raw steel.

title: Scientists Studying Mystery Disease Plan Further Test of Toxic Chemical
South Africa Rebuffed
description: The United Nations Council for Namibiaas SouthWest Africa is called in the world bodyissued a statement last night that rejected as highly inadequate the proposals sponsored by South Africa to grant independence to the territory. Page 6.

title: Drug Panel Acts to Put Darvon On Controlled Substances List
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20  After several years of debate, the Federal Government is moving to tighten controls on the use of Darvon, a mild painkiller that is the country's third most widely prescribed drug.

title: Boit Barely Misses 800Meter Record
description: WEST BERLIN, Aug. 20 (AP)Mike Boit of Kenya ran the secondfastest 800 meters in history tonight at a meet in West Berlin. His time was 1 minute 43.57 seconds, just sevenhundreths of a second off the world mark of 1:43.5, held by Alberto Juantorena, Cuban Olympic gold medalist.

title: The Party Over, Kansas City Relaxes
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 20The President and the Republicans in funny hats had gone today and Kansas City was left to languish once again in the fiery embrace of the August sun. The Gospel Music Workshop arrives next week, and after that the Poultry and Egg Institute, but Ralph Price of the convention bureau couldn't get too excited.

title: City National Bank Of Bridgeport Due To Quit Fed Setup
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Aug. 20 (AP)The City National Bank of Connecticut, which has reported a drop in revenue and earnings, has decided to leave the Federal Reserve System.

title: SOME GRAIN GAINS REPORTED BY PEKING
description: PEKING, Aug. 20 (Reuters) Chinese reports on this summer's grain harvest, a vital indicator of the nation's economic health, indicate relatively small increases in production, according to diplomats here. The reports, they said, were more restrained than those of previous years.

title: Almost Everybody Wants to Be an American
Colorado Flood Toll at 117
description: LOVELAND, Colo., Aug. 20 (AP)The death toll in the Flash flood of the Big Thompson River on July 31 has climbed to 117 with the recovery of five more bodies. Larimer County officials said that the bodies of three males and two females were found yesterday.

title: Quiet, Plush Turbine Train Makes Its Debut Upstate
description: Jaunty in a bright red shirt and plaid pants, Don Cole, a longtime engineer, is at the pushbutton controls in the spacious cab of New York State's newest train. The tram starts up with the ease and smoothness of an iceskater gliding across the rink.

title: Sale at a Green Market Canceled by the Police
description: The sale of fresh fruits and vegetables at a second Green Market site, scheduled for today at the northern end Of Union Square, has been canceled.

title: New York City Firemen Short Of a Chemical for Rapid Water
description: A bureaucratic bungle appears to have left the Fire Department with a critically short supply of  rapid water the chemical additive that enables engine companies to pour more water faster onto fires.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Glenn Ridge high school student was in critical condition after his right leg was severed in a onecar crash that killed three of his friends. David Nelson, 18 years old, described by his principal as a good student, lost part of his leg when a car driven by a friend apparently missed a turn and slammed into a tree. The rest of the leg was amputed at the hip at Mountainside Hospital. Killed in the crash were the driver of the car, Lance Gardner, 19; Cyril Grimes, 17, and Scott Schaffer, 18, all of Glen Ridge and all students at Glenn Ridge High School.

title: Britons Carry On With Dressing Up, In Rented Finery
description: LONDON, Aug. 20The 4 P.M. train from Victoria to Glyndebourne is crammed with operagoers in dinner jackets and evening dresses. Limousines deposit men in gray morning coats and top hats at Buckingham Palace for the Queen's summer garden parties. Black morning coats and striped trousers were de rigueur at a recent royal investiture.

title: The Dance: Love Songs
description: In its last week at the New York State Theater this season, the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater is still paying tribute to Duke Ellington, but is also presenting works from its nonEllington repertory.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Mopec Is Cleared On Rail Takeover
description: Merger of the Texas & Pacific Railways and the Chicago & Eastern Illinois Railroad into the Missouri Pacific Railroad has been approved by the Interstate Commerce Commission, the Missouri Pacific Corporation said yesterday.

title: Compromise at Sea?
description: If the nonaligned nations who concluded their meeting in Sri Lanka this week are serious about building a new world economic order, a good place to begin would be at the Law of the Sea Conference which approaches a critical showdown at its fourth working session this month in New York.

title: Today's Entries at Saratoga
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Citibank Holds Prime Rate
description: Citibank said yesterday that it was keeping it prime lending rate unchanged at 7 percent for the coming week.

title: Ford and Dole Found In Harmony on Issues
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 President Ford and Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas are likely to be a highly compatible team if agreement on the issues is any measure of how they will get along.

title: TEST CONTINUING FOR LIFE ON MARS
description: A Viking 1 lander experiment on Mars this week failed to rule out the possibility of life processes in Martian soil, scientists reported yesterday in Pasadena, Calif.

title: AMEX IS LOWER IN LIGHT TRADING
description: Prices declined on a broad front yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and in overthecounter trading on light turnover.

title: Texaco Cuts Prices For Gasoline 1 Cent; Armco Plans Rise
description: Texaco Inc., the largest marketer of gasoline in the United States, lowered its gasoline prices by a cent a gallon yesterday in 45 states. It was the first reduction in prices since early this year for Texaco, which had raised prices 4 cents a gallon since May, the last of which was 1 cent a month ago nationwide. Texaco's reduction, which is on all grades of gasoline to retailers and distributors, was attributed to the competitive situation in the marketplace.

title: A Family's Film on the Ages of Man
description: When John and Faith Hubley make a movie, it's a family affair. The voices of their children, whom the Hubleys have taped since infancy, can be heard in the latest animated film by the awardwinning pair, called Everybody Rides the Carousel. The 90minute movie is scheduled to be shown on the CBS television network on Sept. 10.

title: Massengale Keeps Stroke Lead
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Aug. 20 (AP)Rik Massengale, benefitting from a lesson by his brother, Don, clipped six more strokes off par today with a 65 and retained the lead in the second round of the $210,000 Sammy Davis Jr. Greater Hartford open golf tournament.

title: Market Place
description: The professionals on Wall Street  stockbrokers, analysts and assorted strategists often speak in a tongue that is strange to the layman, who is simply trying to make a buck in the market.

title: Baby Strangles in Crib
description: ROCHESTER, Aug. 20 (UPI) A 9monthold boy was strangled in his crib by a neck chain attached to a crucifix, which became entangled in an overhead crib toy, the police said today. The child., Jose Nieves, was found by his mother, Carmen Nieves, a halfhour after she had put him to bed last night.

title: Joe Gilliam Is Sentenced To Service
description: Joe Gilliam, the 25yearold quarterback placed on waivers by both the Pittsburgh Steelers and the New Orleans Saints this season, pleaded guilty in a Nashville General Sessions court yesterday to charges of reckless driving, carrying a gun and possession of marjuana.
