But the company spokesman said most customers had their power restored by midmorning.

title: Foster's 138 Leads Irish Golf by Two
description: PORTMARNOCK, Ireland, Aug. 27 (UPI)Martin Foster of Britain today shot his second threeunderpar 69 in a row, to grab a twostroke lead halfway through the $60,000 Carroll's Irish open golf championship.

title: Film: Alice in Pornland
description: In Porno Chicsuch movies as Emmanuelle and The Story of Othe action is given a lush romantic treatment, and the clothes, no longer on the actors, seem to be draped over the cameras: hence the misty effect.

title: Baltimore Editor Resigns
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 27 (UPI) William F. Schmick 3d, the 34yearold son of the publisher of the Baltimore Sunpapers, has resigned as city editor of The Sun for personal reasons. Paul A. Banker, the managing editor, announced the change yesterday by placing on the newsroom bulletin board a statement that said Schmick left the company and would be replaced by John E. Woodruff on Sept. 14. Mr. Schmick refused to comment in his resignation.

title: WARNER ANDERSON, FILM AND TV ACTOR
description: Warner Anderson, an actor prominently featured in motion pictures but best known for his appearances on The Lineup television series, died Thursday in Santa Monica (Calif.) Hospital. He was 65 years old.

title: Buckley and Peyser Headquarters Equal in Enthusiasm, if Not in Resources
description: In a sprawling, airy office on the eighth floor of 545 Fifth Avenue, at 45th Street, stack upon stack of computerized voter lists wait near the banks of telephones. Cardboard cartons full of the candidate's paperback book are piled outside the press secretary's cubicle. The detailed accountant's sheets on the campaign manager's desk show an income of more than $1 million.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: HERBERT MACHIZ. DIRECTOR, 57, DIES
description: Herbert Machiz, a theatrical director who had staged more than 300 plays, including several premieres of works by Tennessee Williams, died yesterday of a heart attack at his summer home in Brewster, N.Y. He was 57 years old.

title: Independent Party Picks Maddox to Head '76 Ticket
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 27Former Georgia. Gov. Lester G. Maddox, an avowed segregationist, won the nomination of the American Independent Party tonight to run for President in 20 or more states where the rightwing party will be qualified this fall.

title: Jets vs. Redskins Something Special
description: A fearsome pirate is the symbol of the Jets' special teams, a symbol so ugly that the Jets' image makers asked that it not be printed for public display because it was disgusting.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: In East Hanover, Nabisco said it was discontinuing test sales on the West Coast of a new food product pending an investigation into reports of illness involving the product. The company also advised customers to avoid using the product, Tuna Twist, a tunasalad extender made of soy protein, until the investigation is completed. A company spokesman said the action came after the Los Angeles County Health Department issued a statement on six reported illnesses believed by the county to involve Tuna Twist. But the company said the health department has advised that they do not suspect the product to be contaminated and that these few cases are probably an individual or allergic reaction.

title: FUTURE OF QUEEN IS PUT IN QUESTION BY BERNHARD CASE
description: THE HAGUE, Aug. 27The official accusation yesterday that Prince Bernhard was open to dishonorable requests and offers from the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation has damaged the prestige of the royal house and stirred questions here about the future of Queen Juliana.

title: Chief Awards at Dog Show
description: VARIETY GROUPS HOUND (Mrs. Lynwood Walton, fudge)1, Gayle Bontecou's and handle Rosen's Scottish Deerhound, Ch. Salutary's Alfred; 2, Charles Baris's and John Hart's wire. haired dachshund, Ch. Barber Minnie's Boy; 3, Dr. Russell Brown's basenji, Ch. Kahiah's Juju Witch Doctor; 4, Samuel E. Ewing 3d's Irish Wolfhound, Ch. Britten of Eagle

title: Charles G. Nowacek, 64, Of Department of Labor
description: Charles G, Nowacek, deputy associate administrator in the United States Department of Labor's regional Employment and Training Administration here, died Wednesday at his home in Manhasset, L. I. He was 64 years old.

title: TENSION GROWING IN ATTICA'S STRIKE
description: ATTICA, Aug. 27The atmosphere at the Attica State Correctional Facility is becoming increasingly tense, according to officials and visitors, as negotiators work diligently to end the sharp division in opinion among inmates on the acceptability of a proposed agreement that would end their fiveday old strike.

title: Disney's 'Matecumbe' Enchants
description: Take two small boysone white, one blackin quest of buried treasure needed to save the old Kentucky home in the postbellum South. Pursue them down the Mississippi and into the Florida keys with a passel of implacable carpetbagger villians. Throw in an orotund and rotund medicine man whose elixirs are at their most beneficial when used as Molotov cocktails. And an indomitable runaway bride-to-be, a handsome and brave ne'er-do-well, a few Indians, several alligators, a cutpurse and a hurricane, and what you have is a rousing old-time adventure movie, "The Treasure of Matecumbe," which opened yesterday at a multitude of theaters on a double bill with its Walt Disney stablemate, the revival of "Three Caballeros."Based on a novel by Robert Lewis Taylor, this is a literate movie blessed with good actorsprincipally Joan Hackett as the runaway bride-to-be, Peter Ustinov as the medicine man and Vic Morrow as the leader of the villainswho seem to be having a good time.In the midst of its excitement, gunplay, spookiness, music, dancing, gambling and river-boating, "Treasure of Matecumbe" finds time to plant a few ideas about the value of education, the sanctity of the environment, the repugnance of bigots and the consequences of disrespect for the beliefs of others. Cavils? Yes. Some less-than-proficent process of photography.At a showing yesterday at the Festival Theater, both the adults and the children seemed to be having a high time with "Treasure of Matecumbe." It may be a formula story. But the formula is one that has entranced generations.

title: SENATOR ACCUSES CADETS' LAWYER
description: The chairman of a Senate subcommittee investigating the West Point cheating scandal and the superintendent of the United States Military Academy charged yesterday that Army defense lawyers were with holding hundreds of affidavits by cadets accusing others of cheating.

title: Goodyear Pact Snagged by Balky Local
description: AKRON, Ohio., Aug. 27Ratification of a threeyear contract that would end the 129day strike against the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company met an unexpected delay today when a Jackson, Mich., local union rejected the pact. But union and Goodyear officials expressed optimism that the new agreement would be approved tomorrow, when seven other locals vote. Seven locals approved it today.

title: F.B.I. Aide Said to Have Defied Hoover in Allowing '71 Burglary
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Justice Department prosecutors have found evidence that Federal agents, apparently in defiance of an order from J. Edgar Hoover, carried out an illegal burglary in the last months of Mr. Hoover's life without his knowledge, but with the written approval of one of his top aides.

title: A New Game in Town For Times Sq. Marks
description: That chant was repeated over and over the other day by a slim, shiftyeyed young man named Slick, who was trying to separate about a dozen spectators from their money near the corner of 38th Street and Seventh Avenue.

title: Stock Prices on Amex Irregular In Lightest Trading in 3 Weeks
description: Prices on the American Stock Lxchange and in the OvertheCounter market closed yesterday mixed in sluggish trading.

title: Mr. Carter And The Atom
description: PLAINS, Ga.Jimmy Carter's energy and defense programs are directly related because of the importance played in each by the atom. Nowadays there is an inescapable link between a nation's dependence on the nuclear power that plays an industrial role and the nuclear power that represents ultimate military protection.

title: U.S and North Korea Agree on Meeting
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 27 The United States and North Korea agreed today to a meeting of the Military Armistice Commission tomorrow to discuss the American response to a Communist proposal for partitioning the Panmunjom truce village.

title: About New York
description: It is a Wednesday afternoon on East 78th Street, where moneyeating brownstones live. Wednesday afternoons are when those brownstones get rid of their wornout refrigerators, clothes trees and floor lamps that no longer stand up, threelegged chairs, desks without drawers, outgrown cribs, cardboard boxes of old emotions (The fashion in emotions having changed it was necessary to purchase a new set), bedsprings of broken marriagesall the big stuff.

title: Steve Cady
description: Without eating like a glutton, the average racehorse can put away nine or 10 quarts of oats a day. Add some hay, some sweetfeed and a carrot or two, and the daily feed bill at Aqueduct, Belmont Park or Saratoga climbs to $6, double what it was a few years ago.

title: Nearby Yachting Results
description: AT MANHASSET BAY Y.C.

title: U.S. TO SELL IRAN 160 NEW FIGHTERS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger told a Senate Foreign Relations subcommittee today that the United States had agreed to sell Iran 160 F16 fighter planes at a cost of about $3.4 billion.

title: Badillo Says City Hall Protects Velez
description: Representative Herman Badillo accused the Beame administration yesterday of providing massive protection for Councilman Ramon S. Velez, his challenger in a Democratic primary for the 21st Congressional District seat in the South Bronx.

title: Declines Outnumber Gains As Market Closes Mixed
description: The stock market yesterday managed to reduce its recent osses and ended mixed despite a Government report confirming that the economy was not gaining strength.

title: Citibank Holding 7% Rate
description: Citibank announced yesterday that it would maintain its 7 percent prime lending rate for the next week.

title: Economic Index Up 0.5% In July, 17th Straight Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Aug.27 (AP) The Government's index of leading economic indicators rose 0.5 percent in July, for the 17th consecutive monthly rise, the Commerce Department reported today. The index rose 0.9 percent in June, according to revised figures.

title: FUTURE OF QUEEN IS PUT IN QUESTION BY BERNHARD CASE
description: THE HAGUE, Aug. 27 The official accusation yesterday that Prince Bernhard was open to dishonorable requests and offers from the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation has damaged the prestige of the royal house and stirred questions here about the future of Queen Juliana.

title: She Takes Hurdles in Stride
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 27A victory by a female jockey in a steeplechase race, believed to be the first such success against male rivals at this track since Civil War days, provided an unusual item today at the the Spa. The triumph, scored before a crowd of 16,485 by Joey Ruhsam, was gained with the favored Lashore after a late rush. Beaten to the wire by 1 lengths in the 1mile event was Dearoldcorny. Lashore competed as an entry with Oh Feathers and paid $4.60 for $2 to win.

title: Rescuing Burma
description: During much of the Vietnam conflict, Burma's President Ne Win was regarded by many as a wily leader whose policy of strict neutrality had avoided serious trouble with neighboring China and had preserved his southeast Asian nation from expansion of Chinese support to Communist and other frontier insurrections. As part of this policy, the American aid mission was sent packing; economic as well as military assistance from other capitalist nations was renounced, except for some Japanese programs that had their origin in postWorld War II reparations.

title: Infectious Mosquitoes Plaguing Houston
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 27Stay inside at night. Keep doors and windows closed. Stay off the streets as much as possible.

title: Schlumberger Lists Foreign Payments
description: Schlumberger Ltd., a major oil well drilling company, announced yesterday that an investigation ordered by its directors had disclosed questionable overseas payments amounting to $2.4 million by unidentified foreign subsidiaries.

title: Small Device and Phone to Get Stock Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27An investor may soon be able to attach a small device to a conventional telephone and get stockmarket quotations by dialing a number. Patent 3,976,840 was granted this week to Spencer Cleveland, a former New York securities analyst, and Fred F. Coury a consultant in electronics, for what they have named the Stock Selector.

title: Consumer Notes
description: A home in Chester is one of several in New Jersey and Pennsylvania where onsite experiments are taking place to determine whether electric bills can be kept down through the use of heat storage.

title: Father Slain in Burglary
description: A 38yearold man was shot in the head and killed in Jamaica Queens, last night after he entered his apartment along with his wife and two children, 2 and 13 years old, and surprised four burglars, the police reported. He was identified as Ernedis Certuche of 8701 148th Street.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Rights Group Accuses Britain Of Torture in Northern Ireland
description: LONDON, Aug. 27 The European Commission on Human Rights has found Britain guilty of torturing suspected terrorists in Northern Ireland, newspapers here and in Dublin reported today.

title: Dance: Paul Taylor's Polaris Is Given Premiere in Newport
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 27Paul Taylor is a remarkable choreographer  consistent and yet somehow always surprising. Since he retired as a dancerapparently, for no formal announcement has ever been madehis creativity as a choreographer, particularly perhaps when he was using dramatic subjects, but he is now quite clearly one of the few master choreographers in the world.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article published in The Times on Monday concerning House passage of a bill to regulate toxic substances reported incorrectly that a similar bill passed by the Senate did not contain a prohibition against polychlorinated biphenyls, or PCB's. The Senate bill does contain a PCB amendment, though the provision differs from the version passed by the House.

title: Open Interest
description: Friday, Aug, 27, 1976

title: IranOccidental Talks
description: Iran announced that talks toward a huge investment in the Occidental Petroleum Corporation had ended unsuccessfully. The company's stock led the active list on the New York Stock Exchange, falling  to 17 Page 27.

title: In Memoriam
description: JANDEROVAEma. In loving memory of my dear mother. Ema

title: Clark Offers Plan to Cure Housing Ills in Older Cities
description: Ramsey Clark, a candidate for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator, charged yesterday that Federal housing policies that discourage the rebuilding of the older cities of New York while encouraging the development of new housing and communities in the nation's Sunbelt was a more direct cause for the Sun belt's recent growth than its desirable climate.

title: Armco Defers Price Rise Until 1977, Surprising the Industry and Wall Street
description: The Armco Steel Corporation announced yesterday that it was deferring until the beginning of next year its previously announced Oct. 1 price increase on flat rolled carbon steel products, thereby giving automobile and appliance manufacturers a possible three month reprise from higher prices.

title: GEICO Cut Deficit In Second Quarter
description: The financially troubled Government Employees Insurance Company in the second quarter of this year almost halved the loss of the first quarter but the deficit still was larger than the 1975 secondquarter loss. As a result, the unaudited report yesterday showed the deficit for the first half of this year $29 million more than a year earlier, reflecting the huge underwriting loss primarily in auto premiums.

title: Badillo Says City Hall Protects Velez
description: Representative Herman Badillo accused the Beame administration yesterday of providing massive protection for Councilman Ramon S. Velez, his challenger in a Democratic primary for the 21st Congressional District seat in the South Bronx.

title: People in Sports
description: Muhammad All has pledged to donate to the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People $100,000 of the purse money from his heavyweight title defense against Ken Norton. The bout is scheduled for Sept. 28 at Yankee Stadium.

title: ARTHUR KILL CLOSED AS BARGE SPILLS OIL
description: PERTH AMBOY, N.J., Aug. 27 A barge with 2.8 million gallons of oil struck a rock and sank near the entrance to a Hess Oil Company terminal at the foot of State Street here at 5 o'clock this morning.

title: Graham Leading At 67136
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 27 (AP) David Graham of Australia ignored the groans of Arnie's Army and shank fiveunderpar 67 today for a onestroke lead in the second round of the $200,000 American Golf Classic.

title: Forest Fire Contained
description: GRAND MARAIS, Minn., Aug. 27 (AP)A Forest Service spokesman said today it would take several more days to control the fire that has consumed more than 3,100 acres in the Boundary Waters Canoe Area. The fire in the Superior National Forest 40 miles northwest of Grand Marais was contained last night.

title: Principals Offer a Trade On Pay to Save 303 Jobs
description: The union that represents New York City's 4,000 principals and other school supervisors has offered to give up costofliving adjustments provided for in its recently negotiated contract in return for saving the jobs of 303 of its members who face economy layoffs next month.

title: Police Allegedly Told to Stress Tickets
description: Police officers in the 40th Precinct in the South Bronx, one of the city's highest crime areas, have made traffic summonses their top priority this week, officers in the precinct said yesterday.

title: Hunter Title At Post Won By Gelding
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., Aug. 27 Nick McQuaid, a consistent foxchaser all season, captured the final class and won the junior working hunter championship, Division A, today at the Nassau County horse show.

title: Soviet Convicts 3 Americans in Drug Case
description: MOSCOW, Aug.27 (Reuters) A Moscow court today sentenced three Americans to total of 20 years in labor camps on charges of having attempted to smuggle heroin through the Soviet Union to Western Europe.

title: Egypt Is Reported In Deal to Produce A French Missile
description: CAIRO, Aug. 27The influential semiofficial newspaper Al Ahram said today that France was producing a modifled version of its Crotale antiaircraft missile for eventual production in Egypt.

title: Experts Believe Epidemic In Pennsylvania Is Over
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 27 Federal epidemiologists expressed today the belief that en, epidemic of a mysterious disease that has killed 28 people in Pennsylvania has ended. In doing so, they said that any new cases reported after Aug. 18 would not be considered part of the epidemic.

title: ChurchState Conflict Troubles Latin Lands
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 27Earlier this month 37 Roman Catholic clergymen, including 13 bishops and archbishops, were arrested by the Ecuadorean military Government as they met in Riobamba, a small city 100 miles south of Quito, Ecuador's capital.

title: Judge Allows Delaware to Start Lottery Based on N. F .L . Games
description: WILMINGTON, Del.. Aug. 27 A Federal District judge told Delaware yesterday to go ahead with its planned lottery based on National Football League games, despite opposition from the league.

title: South Africa Plans Parley Next Week With Urban Blacks
description: PRETORIA, South Afiica, Aug. 27Asserting that the white man must accommodate the black man, and the black man must accommodate the white man, Justice Minister James T. Kruger of South Africa announced today that he would meet with urban black leaders next week for fresh talks on the antiGovernment upheaval that has cost at least 290 lives.

title: S.E.C.'s Chief Accountant Picked to Succeed A xelson
description: Mayor Beame has asked John C. Burton, the chief accountant for the Securities and Exchange Commission in Washington, to serve as Deputy Mayor for Finance, succeeding Kenneth S. Axelson, who is returning to private business next month.

title: Hunt's Car Fastest
description: ZANDVOORT, the Netherlands, Aug. 27 (AP)James Hunt of Britain, driving a McLaren, posted the fastest time today on the first day. of trials for Sunday's Dutch Grand Prix. Hunt clocked 1 minute 21.57 seconds on the winding 4.2kilometer course.

title: The Hoover Legacy
description: Talk about the F.B.I. still tends to conjure up the legacy of J. Edgar Hoover. But except for news of illegal burglaries and wiretaps, only limited information has come to light about the values and the attitudes that remain from the late Director's era. A few weeks ago, however, Edward J. Tulley, an instructor at the bureau's training academy at Quantico, Va., gave a speech to the association of Louisiana sheriffs which provided some insights into the Hoover legacy.

title: Police in Vail, Colo., Awaiting U.S. Help For Ford's Security
description: VAIL, Colo., Aug. 27 (UPI)President Ford has visited this mountain resort four times since taking office, but Police Chief Gary Wall is still making for Federal help with his security bills.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: FORD SEES FEAR OF CARTER AIDING G.O.P. PROSPECTS
description: VAIL, Colo., Aug. 27President Ford said today that the electorate's fear and apprehension about Jimmy Carter would help him to overtake the Democratic nominee in the Presidential campaign.

title: Medicaid Center Beats City to Locking Door
description: City Health Department officials had hoped to hand the owner of a building on East 127th Street that houses a Medicaid center an order to have the facility cleaned up. They had hoped to confront the six doctors who work there with a report by city inspectors that there were uncapped gas lines, outdated drugs and broken dental equipment, among other violations.

title: Jones Captures 20th By Beating Expos, 20
description: Randy Jones, who toils for a club that trails the National League's Western Division leader by 18 games, recorded his 20th victory last night as he shut out the Montreal Expos, 20, in San Diego Stadium.

title: Scientists Construct Functional Gene
description: A group of scientists in Cambridge, Mass., has constructed a gene, the basic unit of heredity, complete with its regulatory mechanisms.

title: Drought Disaster Declared
description: LINCOLN. Neb., Aug. 27 (AP) Gov. J. James Exon declared almost half of Nebraska's 93 counties a disaster area today because of an estimated $400 million in crop losses, caused mostly by drought. State agriculture officials said the main result of the declaration and approval by Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz would be the availability of lowinterest loans to farmers.

title: POPE PAUL WARNS EXFRENCH PRELATE
description: ROME, Aug. 27 (UPI)Pope Paul VI has personally warned a former French Archbishop, the Rev. Marcel Lefebvre, of further disciplinary action if he continues to defy liturgical reforms by saying the mass in Latin, the Vatican said today.

title: WORKERS ARE VOTING TO STRIKE AT FORD
description: DETROIT, Aug. 27 (UPI)Ford Motor Company employees in 39 states are voting nearly unanimously to approve a strike if the United Automobile Workers leadership cannot get a new contract with Ford, the target auto company, by midnight, Sept. 14.

title: Copyright Bill Gains In Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP)  The House Judiciary Committee today approvd a bill to revise the copyright law. The revision would insure that an author or composer would be protected during his lifetime.

title: SAM BEBER DIES; WAS A FINANCIER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Sam Beber, founder of the B'nai B'rith Youth Organization, which describes itself as the largest Jewish teenage movement in the world, and a Midwest financier, died in Chicago Wednesday of pneumonia. He was 75 years old.

title: 600Gallon Oil Spill Forces Closing of Arthur Kill
description: PERTH AMBOY, Aug. 27A barge with 2.8 million gallons of fuel oil struck a rock and sank near the entrance to a Hess Oil Company terminal at the foot of State Street here at 5 o'clock this morning.

title: Allred A. Strelsin Dies at 78; Industrialist and Arts Patron
description: Alfred A. Strelsin, industrialist, philanthropist and arts patron, died Wednesday evening of heart failure at his home at 936 Fifth Avenue. He was 78 years old.

title: MERRILL RAISES FEES ON OPTION;
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, the nation's biggest brokerage house, has quietly raised its commission fees on small options transactions to as much as three times the level charged by competing stockbrokers.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Aug. 27The State Board of Medical Examiners today temporarily suspended the license of Dr. Peter T. de Marco, the Camden County physician who has been linked by the Department of Health to more than 50 cases of serum hepatitis.

title: Ciro James Digangi, Film Producer, 65; Led Directors' Unit
description: Ciro James Digangi, a freelance motion picture producer, died Thursday at Roosevelt Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article published in The Times on Monday concerning House passage of a bill to regulate toxic substances reported incorrectly that a similar bill passed by the Senate did not contain a prohibition against polychlorinated biphenyls, or PCB's, The Senate bill does contain a PCB amendment, though the provision differs from the version passed by the House,

title: Big Ben Is Sounding The Hours Once Again
description: LONDON, Aug 27 (Reuters) The clock atop Parliament tower came back to life today after the longest silence in its 117year history when Big Benthe bell that gives the clock its namestruck the noon hour.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 1.1 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spotmarket price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials fell to 206.7 from 207.8 last week.

title: A New Game in Town For Times Sq. Marks
description: Red you win, black you rose; It all depends on the card you choose.

title: Yanks Score Five in 15th And Win, 50, From Angels
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Aug. 27 Catfish Hunter and Frank Tanana, the starting pitchers in a memorable game at the beginning of this week, clashed in another interesting struggle tonight as the Yankees faced the California Angels at the start of their last visit to the West Coast this season.

title: A StonehengeLike Find Reported at Loch Ness
description: Though frustrated in its search this summer for the Loch Ness monster, an Americanled team of engineers and scientists has reported a discovery that could be of considerable archeological interestsome apparently ancient stone formations in the shallow end of the Scottish lake.

title: Greeks Abroad Keep Hearing Call of Home
description: CEPHALONIA, Greece, Aug. 27Odysseus took 10 years to sail here from Troy, and Stella Makris took 10 hours to fly from Queens.

title: Boston Panel to Provide Forum for Racial Problems
description: BOSTON, Aug. 27 (UPI)Mayor Kevin H. White has appointed an 11member Committee for Boston to provide a forum for discussing the city's racial problems and to help assess preparations for the opening of schools under the third year of courtordered desegregation.

title: Oldsmobile Planning A V8 Diesel Engine
description: BIRMINGHAM, Mich., Aug. 27 (AP)Oldsmobile plans to become the first United States auto maker to offer a modern V8 diesel engine for passenger cars, sometime in the 1978model year, the General Motors division announced today.

title: Signatures Sought in Midtown To End Influx of Illegal Aliens
description: A group made up mainly of black New Yorkers has organized the Citizens Committee Against Illegal Immigration to get the Federal Government to stop the flow of illegal aliens into the United States.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: AULD LANG SYNE The double bill tomorrow through Tuesday of Hollywood's Tales of Manhattan (1942) and Flesh and Fantasy (1943), two episodic vehicles with allstar casts directed by Julien Duvivier, has twofold significance it the downtown Theater 80 St. Marks (2547400) as its sixthanniversary program.

title: I.R.S. Says ExGurney Aide Owes $37,918 for 197172
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI) The Internal Revenue Service says James Groot, once a top aide to former Senator Edward Gurney, Republican of Florida. owes $37,918 in back Federal taxes and fraud penalties for unreported income during 1971 and 1972 that Mr. Groot contends were political contributions to Mr. Gurney.

title: Splitting Hairs Over an Old Cosmetic Issue
description: In some cultures, bodily haira bit of a mustache or fuzz on the legsis supposed to add to a woman's sex appeal. Not so in this country. The girl in the bikini on an American beach is supposed to be as slick as a whistle, and anything more than some light down on her arms is usually considered too much.

title: Big Ben Chiming The Hours Again
description: LONDON, Aug 27 (Reuters) The clock atop Parliament tower came back to life today after the longest silence in its 117year history when Big Benthe bell that gives the clock its namestruck the noon hour.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Aug. 27 (AP)Paul Sargis, the winning pitcher, homered leading off the sixth inning today to break a scoreless tie and pace Campbell, Calif., to a 30 victory over Richmond in the Little League World, Series. The United States West champions, with a 150 wonlost record, earned the right to meet Tokyo for the title tomorrow in this 30th annual tournament for 11and 12yearolds.

title: American Wives In England Add Own Style To Politics
description: LONDON  Sheila Moore campaigns at coffee mornings in the center of Croydon, the seventh largest city in England. Deborah Owen likes to open fetes in Plymouth. Ruth Orbach helps out in Stockport, an urban center in the Midlands. Susan Crosland travels to Grimsby, a fishing town on the east coast.

title: Texasgulf Increases Its Prices For Zinc Metal Sold in Canada
description: Texasgulf Inc. announced in Toronto yesterday that effective immediately it was increasing prices of zinc metal sold in Canada by onehalf cent a pound. Texasgulf preclude prime Western and high grade zinc, 39 cents a pound, special high grade, 39.5 cents, and continuous galvanizing grade, 39.25 cents a pound.

title: Sleek Seek Stix Fix
description: In its old age, America yearns for the sticks. First it was the children, 10 years ago, chucking It all, chucking the tailored threads and the rat race and Dad's suburban martini pitcher, chucking the bright lights and the swarming excitement of conurbations, chucking it all to find salvation in the woods.

title: TEACHER UPHELD IN APPEALS COURT
description: TRENTON, Aug. 27The Appellate Division of Superior Court today upheld the reinstatement of a Brookdale College journalism teacher who was discharged after she wrote an editorial in the school newspaper accusing the chairman of the college board of trustees of a conflict of interest.

title: Notes on People
description: To the relief of the British Labor Party, John Stonehouse, the imprisoned former Cabinet minister, resigned as a member of Parliament yesterday after representing his industrial Midlands district for 19 years. Mr. Stonehouse faked his drowning in Miami last year and then turned up with his secretary in Australia. He was sentenced three weeks ago to seven years for theft, forgery and fraud.

title: A CARTER PARDON WOULD HELP FEW
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP)  Jimmy Carter's campaign promise that he would grant a blanket pardon to all who refused to be drafted for the Vietnam War would affect only about 12,000 of the 106,000 men considered to be war evaders.

title: Carey Seeks U.S. Aid For Hurricane Damage
description: Governor Carey said yesterday that he was asking President Ford to authorize major disaster assistance for New York City and Nassau and Suffolk Counties because of damage caused by the hurricane earlier this month.

title: Despite Setbacks, Moscow Is Pressing Subtle Experiments in Space
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 27 The earlierthanexpected return to earth of two Soviet astronauts this week has eclipsed some subtler aspects of their 48day flight aboard the Salyut 5 space research station.

title: Bronia Kwartin Dies at 89; Assisted Jewish Refugees
description: Bronia Kwartin, who aided Jewish refugees from Germany in the late 1930's, died yesterday at St. Vincent's Medical Center in Bridgeport, Conn., at the age of 89.

title: Principals Offer a Trade On Pay to Save 303 Jobs
description: The union that represents New York, City's 4,000 principals and other school supervisors has offered to give up costofliving adjustments provided for in its recently negotiated contract in return for saving the jobs of 303 of its members who face economy layoffs next month.

title: U.S. TO SELL IRAN 160 NEW FIGHTERS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger told a Senate Foreign Relations subcommittee today that the United States had agreed to sell Iran 160 F16 fighter planes at a cost of about 3.4 billion.

title: SEOUL DISSIDENTS SENTENCED TO JAIL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Saturday, Aug. 28 (AP)Kim Dae Jung, the opposition leader, and former President Yun Po Sun were sentenced today to eight years in prison after being convicted on charges of having incited rebellion against the Government of President Park Chung Hee.

title: Scotland Yard Called On Treasury Inquiry
description: LONDON, Aug. 27 (AP)Scotland Yard has been called in following a Treasury inquiry to investigate a possible breach of exchange control regulations by. Bank of England officers, police officials said today.

title: Kidnapped Woman Killed
description: LOS ALAMITOS, Calif., Aug. 27 (UPI)A housewife kidnapped by two masked men who also briefly took hostage her three children was found shot to death today. The authorities said the body of Johanna Seigman, 43 years old, was discovered In a ditch. The kidnappers had kept authorities and the woman's husband, John Seigman, waiting since Mr. Seigman, a grocery store manager, was told to wait for instructions in a telephone booth with a bag containing $8,000.

title: G.O.P. Plans to Block Bid For Congressional Pay Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP) A Republican effort to block automatic pay increases for members of the House of Representatives next year was disclosed last night on the House floor.

title: Bid to Release 2 Women Is Denied by Oregon Judge
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 27 (UPI)A follower of Charles Manson, the convicted mass murderer, and another Federal prison fugitive lost a bid for freedom today when two F.B.I. agents told a Federal judge they had admitted escaping from the women's penitentiary in Long Beach, Calif.

title: Market Place
description: While Wall Street money managers are busy these days hammering out a variety of investment approaches, up in Boston Leo H. Dworsky is sticking to his basic philosophy.

title: City Opera Putting Up New Curtain
description: It's curtains for the New York State Theater at Lincoln Centera new one, that is. The old brocade, with dark signs of wearandtear having grown more evident each season, has been replaced by gold velvet and glittering silver stripes that will be on view when the New York City Opera opens its season Wednesday with Turandot.

title: Samoyed Gets a Best And a Mark
description: CHESTER, N.J., Aug. 27A Samoyed came out of the Midwest today and proceeded to make history for the breed when he was named best of 1,155 dogs. The 7yearold white coat is Dr. R. J. Hritzo's Ch. North Starr King's Ransom, from Hubbard. Ohio, and his victory at the Schooley's Mountain fixture was his seventh top award.

title: CallGirl Ring in Morgue Alleged as 3 Are Arrested
description: Two city employees and an unemployed laborer were charged yesterday with operating a callgirl ring out of the city morgue and providing services that included chauffeuring prostitutes to clients in the Medical Examiner's official car.

title: Scientists Construct Functional Gene
description: A group of scientists in Cambridge, Mass., has constructed a gene, the basic unit of heredity, complete with its regulatory mechanisms.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Silence Confronts 3 Cadets Accused of Cheating
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Aug. 27 Cadets Ray Better, Stephen Ferris and Brian Fitzpatrick moved to their new quarters at the United States Military Academy here this muggy afternoon and walked right into a wall of chilly silence built by their colleagues.

title: Knitting Machines From Italy Facing Dumping Scrutiny
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP)  The Treasury Department said today it had found that certain knitting machines imported from Italy were possibly being sold in the United States at less than fair value in violation of this nation's antidumping laws.

title: CARTER CONFERS ON BLACK SUPPORT
description: PLAINS, Ga., Aug. 27 (AP)Jimmy Carter conferred today on ways to involve blacks and other minorities in his fall campaign.

title: GOLD PRICES DROP; DOLLAR ADVANCES
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 27 (UPI)The price of gold dipped agairi today, wiping out the previous day's small gains. The dollar advanced against all European currencies except the French franc.

title: Abercrombie Plans Biggest Sale As a Prelude to Reorganization
description: The Abercrombie & Fitch Company, which filed for voluntary bankruptcy Aug. 9 after 84 years in business, will hold the largest clearance in its history with a $2 million sale starting this morning in four of its stores.

title: Capital Gains Tax Revised By Congress Conferees
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 House and Senate conferees working on the big tax revision bill agreed today on the first significant change in many years in the manner of levying capital gains taxes.

title: Singer's Death Ruled Not Suicide
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 27 (UPI)  Kenneth Walker, lead singer of the popular American group The Platters, died by selfingested methadone poisoning but did not commit suicide, the City Coroner ruled today.

title: Houston Contractors Use Nonunion Hiring Program
description: DENVER, Aug. 27A major construction industry association said today that it had been running a successful nonunion hiring hall in Houston for the last two and a half years, but it urged that its sponsorship be kept secret for fear of union reprisals.

title: SENATOR ACCUSES CADETS LAWYERS
description: The chairman of a Senate subcommittee investigating the Weft Point cheating scandal and the superintendent of the United States Military Academy charged yesterday that Army defense lawyers were withholding hundreds of affidavits by cadets accusing others of cheating.

title: Today's Entries at Saratoga
description: Horses listed in oroer of post positions

title: Dividends Announced
description: FRIDAY, AUGUST 27, 1976

title: FORD SEES FEAR OF CARTER AIDING G.O.P. PROSPECTS
description: VAIL, Colo., Aug. 27President Ford said today that the electorate's fear and apprehension about Jimmy Carter would help him to overtake the Democratic nominee in the Presidential campaign.

title: Bombings Hit Synagogues, Navy Office in Buenos Aires
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 27 (AP) Bombs exploded at synagogues and an Argentine Navy building today as rightwing and leftwing terrorists continued their political violence.

title: FARM EXPORTS GET SENATE'S BACKING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP) The Senate voted today to limit the President's authority to embargo exports of farm products.

title: Bertolucci Upsets Fibak in Pro Tennis
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 27 (AP)  Unseeded Paolo Bertolucci, Italy's No. 3 player, pulled his second upset today by ousting Wojtek Fibak of Poland in the third round of the 49th United States pro tennis championships at Longwood. The scores were 61, 62.

title: A School For Ballet In Houston
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 26Unhampered by the financial difficulties facing cultural groups elsewhere in the nation, the Houston Ballet today opened a new teaching academy that its directors called the largest dance facility in the country.

title: Miss Navratilova Has Some Tears Year After Defection
description: PHILADELPHIA. Aug. 27She is 19 years old, some say 19 going on 35. She is rich, rich enough to own a MercedesBenz and enough gold jewelry to finance a Banana Republic revolution. She is talented, talented enough to be considered the third best woman tennis player in the world. She is Martina Navratilovaforever to be identified as Martina Navratilova, who defected to the United States in search of truth, justice and The American Way.

title: Books of The Times
description: Between 1968 and 1973, the Federal Government paid $15.5 billion to farmers in return for their leaving 233 million acres of land unplanted. According to a study by the National Farmers Union, the land could have produced 8,609 million bushels of wheat over the five years, or nearly a million bushels more than the actual United States harvest of 7,669 million bushels during the period.

title: AN ACCUSED AUTHOR FACES GHANA COURT
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Aug. 27 (AP) Kofi Awoonor, the African author told a special court here that he had confessed to knowledge of a plot to overthrow the military Government because his interrogators threatened to beat him, the court said in a statement released today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Capital Gains Tax Revised By Congress Conferees
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 House and Senate conferees working on the big tax revision bill agreed today on the first significant change in many years in the manner of levying capital gains taxes.

title: FUTURES OF CORN AND SOYBEANS UP
description: CHICAGO. Aug. 27 (AP)The possibility of short corn and soybean crops this year because of inadequate rains in recent weeks influenced higher prices for these futures on the Chicago Board of Trade today.

title: IRAN'S TALKS FAIL ON OCCIDENTAL TIE
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 27The Iranian Government announced tonight that its negotiations toward a huge investment in the Los Angelesbased Occidental Petroleum Corporation had been fruitless and were being terminated.

title: STUDENT AID BILL PASSED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The Senate passed a $35.3 billion authorization bill today that would extend Federal aid to higher education and vocational education for six years. The vote was 78 to 5.

title: Carey Seeks U.S. Aid For Hurricane Damage
description: Governor Carey said yesterday that he was asking President Ford to authorize majordisaster assistance for New York City and Nassau and Suffolk Counties because of damage caused by the hurricane earlier this month.

title: No Crisis, Vorster Says
description: SPRINGS, South Africa, Saturday, Aug. 28 (Agence FrancePresse)Prime Minister John Vorster said here last night that there was no crisis in South Africa and that those who said there was were crying wolf.

title: Madness in Argentina
description: Argentina's military rulers have used all the right words in condemning the mass murders of 47 people by rightwing terrorist organizations; but on the Government's record to date, its pledge to go allout to find and punish the assassins must be taken skeptically. The good intentions for evenhanded justice of President Jorge Rafael Videla and the officers of his circle seem always to be frustrated by military and police officials outside the ruling junta.

title: Zulu Chief Asks Unity
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 27 (UPI)Chief Gatsha Buthelezi, chief minister of the Zulu homeland, said today that blacks should not fight among themselves, but work out a united strategy to break the chains of oppression.

title: NEVADA TRIAL SET ON HUGHES WILL
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Aug. 27 District Judge Keith Hayes told a group of lawyers today he was on a quest for the truth and ordered them to prepare for a jury trial on the validity of a Howard Hughes will discovered in the Mormon Church headquarters last April.

title: Have You Heard About Mr. Jones?
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Mo.  I was standing at the counter of the general store In town the other day, idly eavesdropping. The woman next to me asked the man who helps out in the store how his cold was coming along. She was relieved to learn that it was better and had a suggestion or two for its treatment.

title: McGuinn Intense at the Bottom Line
description: The last few years that Roger McGuinn, the exchiefByrd, struggled into town with various backup bands, the results were pretty dispiriting. Mr. McGuinn seemed dead and abstracted up there on stage, woodenly going through his music in a way that served only to remind one of what he had once achieved.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold prices Friday.

title: 'Earth's Core' Monstrous
description: All the money used to make "At the Earth's Core" seems to have been spent on building monsters with parrotlike beaks that open, close, and emit a steady squawling as if someone were vacuuming next door. Close up, the monsters look like sections of rough concrete wall and the decision to film them in closeup is only one example of the total lack of talent or effort with which the picture is made.Dealing with the adventures of two English scientists who burrow too far down into the earth and find a lot of disagreeable surprises, the movie is a kind of no-talent competition in which the acting, the script, the direction and the camera-work vie for last place."Core," which opened here yesterday, is rated PG. The monsters will scare small children. On the other hand they will hardly convince larger children. Perhaps vacuum cleaners would enjoy it.

title: Marcos Says Martial Law Stands Despite Gains
description: MANILA, Aug. 27President Ferdinand E. Marcos said today that his martiallaw rule would continue despite the crippling blows that Philippine security forces had dealt to the Communistled underground.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The White Motor Corporation said it and its financing subsidiaries had signed a revolving credit agreement with a group of banks, replacing notes currently outstanding to the banks. The agreement covers $347.4 million.

title: People and Business
description: Two former UnderSecretaries of the Treasury yesterday urged that a council of governors be formed in the International Monetary Fund as soon as possible.

title: Strip Mining Again
description: Strip mining, when first practiced in the Appalachian coal fields, acquired an indelibly bad reputation. The strip miners, whether large companies or small operators, followed the law of smash, grab and run. They bulldozed hillsides as well as valleys, allowing soil and debris to be washed away, clogging mountain streams and leaving a desolate heritage of uprooted trees and ruined fields. Restoration of the landscape, even where it was practiced at all, was usually a patchy affair vulnerable to the first cycle of winter frost and hard spring rains.

title: Churches Criticize Shopping on Sunday
description: With a number of major department stores poised to open their New York City and suburban stores for the first time this Sunday, several Christian religious leaders have called on their church members to refrain from Sunday shopping.

title: Miss Renner Leads
description: DENVER, Aug. 23 (UPI)Jane Renner, a rookie on the Ladies Professional Golf Association tour, put together her best performance of the year today to take the first round lead in the $50,000 National Jewish Hospital golf open with a fourunderpar 68.

title: John R. King Weds Jeannette A. Meditz
description: Jeannette A. Meditz of Fort Lee, N. J., an assistant news editor at The Record in Hackensack, N.J., was married yesterday evening to John Robert King of Montvale, N. J., a freelance writereditor.

title: HARRY R. RICHMOND, RABBI AND CHAPLAIN
description: Rabbi Harry R. Richmond, who served as a chaplain in the United States Army in World Wars I and II, died Wednesday in Maimonides Hospital, Brooklyn, after a short illness. He was 85 years old and lived at 1445 Shore Parkway, Brooklyn.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: South Africa Plans Parley Next Week With Urban Blacks
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Aug. 27Asserting that the white man must accommodate the black man, and the black man must accommodate the white man, Justice Minister James T. Kruger of South Africa announced today that he would meet with urban black leaders next week for fresh talks on the antiGovernment upheaval that has cost at least 290 lives.

title: Major League Box Scores and Standings
description: EPatek. DPKaisas City 1, Boston 1. LOBKansas City 6, Boston 4. 2BF.White. Lynn 2, Fisk. 39Hobson. HRStinson (2), Ystrzemski (18), Fisk (13), Hobson (3). SBF.White 2. SCooper.

title: The Danger of Abandoning Taiwan
description: NEW HAVENAt the conclusion of his pageantlike China tour in 1972, Richard Nixon's communiqu acknowledged that . . . all Chinese on either side of the Taiwan Strait maintain there is but one China and that Taiwan is a part of China.

title: BOARD CITES DOCTOR ON HEPATITIS CASES
description: The New Jersey Board of Medical Examiners yesterday temporarily suspended the license of Dr. Peter D. DeMarco, the Camden physician facing charges of incompetence and gross malpractice for allegedly spreading serum hepatitis among at least 26 patients by using improperly sterilized syringes.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, AUGUST 28, 1976

title: Giscard Party Dominates New Cabinet in France
description: PARIS, Aug. 27A new French Cabinet was named today, with members of President Valry Giscard d'Estaing's party given a dominant role and substantial though reduced representation accorded the Gaullists, whose leader quit as Prime Minister on Wednesday.

title: U. N. Aide's Stand On Namibia Brings Protest From U.S.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 27The United States has protested to Secretary General Kurt Waldheim over Sean MacBride of Ireland, United Nations Commissioner for Namibia, because of his advocacy of punitive action against South Africa, diplomatic sources said today.

title: IranOccidental Talks
description: Iran announced that talks toward a huge investment in the Occidental Petroleum Corporation had ended unsuccessfully. The company's stock led the active list on the New York Stock Exchange, falling  to 17 Page 27.

title: High Cost Of Games Studied
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 27Official post mortems on the Montreal Olympic Games opened this week with charges of extravagance in the preparations that included the rental of cranes in the construction for $1 million more than it would have cost to buy them.

title: Infectious Mosquitoes Plaguing Houston
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 27Stay inside at night. Keep doors and windows closed. Stay off the streets as much as possible.

title: Mottram Upset by Hungarian
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Aug. 27Balaza Taroczy of Hungary became the first unseeded player to reach the semifinals of the $60,000 Tennis Week open when he upset Buster Mottram of Britain in straight sets today at the Orange Lawn Tennis Club.

title: DOLE EXAIDE LINKED TO ANTIABORTIONAD
description: TOPEKA, Kan., Aug. 27 (UPI) A Kansas newspaper executive said today that the press aide of Senator Robert J. Dole's 1974 campaign had authorized the publication of an antiabortion advertisement bearing a skull and crossbones.

title: Viking 2 Rockets Fired to Permit Vertical Photographs of Mars
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 27 (UPI)Viking 2 edged into a new orbit over Mars today that will allow it to take vertical pictures of the Utopia plain where the spacecraft's Lander will set down Sept. 3 to continue the search for microscopic life on the planet.

title: Unveiling
description: THE Unveiling of a monument in memory of Karin Joy Borus will take place on Sunday, Aug. 29, 1976 at 1:00 P.M., Beth David Cemetery, Elmont, N. Y.

title: BUCKLEY PRESSES HIS RENTERS' BILL
description: Senator James L. Buckley, who is campaigning for reelection, called yesterday for Congress to pass a bill that would give apartment renters one of the incometax advantages now enjoyed by homeowners and residents of cooperatives.

title: Teamsters Get a 2d Delay On Loss of Tax Exemption
description: The Internal Revenue Service has granted the principal pension fund of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters a 90day postponement of its revocation of the fund's taxexempt status. The postponement, granted yesterday, followed extensive promises by the fund that it would clean itself up.

title: Council Votes to Put Las Vegas Nights on Ballot
description: Voters in the November election will determine by referendum whether legalized gambling  socaned Las Vegas nightsshould be permitted in New York City to raise funds for religious and charitable institutions.

title: Prince Allegedly Demanded $4 Million
description: A former executive of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation said yesterday that Prince Bernhard of the Netherlands had once demanded $4 million from the company as a condition of its doing business with his country.

title: STUDENT AID BILL PASSED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The Senate passed a $35.3 billion authorization bill today that would extend Federal aid to higher education and vocational education for six years. The vote was 78 to 5.

title: Piero Is Stolen From Milan Home
description: MILAN, Italy, Aug. 26 (AP)A 15thcentury work by Piero Della Francesca was stolen from an apartment here as the custodian ignored an alarm bell, the police said today.

title: GOLDIN SAYS CITY LOSES AID IT'S DUE
description: Blaming clerical oversight and poor control procedures in New York City's Department of Social Services, Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin said yesterday that the city had failed to claim $6 million in Federal reimbursement for the support of children placed in voluntary childcare institutions.

title: Missile Launched
description: VANDENBERG AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Aug. 27 (AP)An Air Force Minuteman II missile has been launched hero, the 500th missile to be launched from this base by the Strategic Air command.

title: 19 Seized in Raids As Drug Pushers In South Jersey
description: CAMDEN, Aug. 27  The Camden County Narcotics Strike Force arrested 19 persons described as major pushers in predawn raids today in eight communities in Camden and Gloucester Counties.

title: New Peace Effort In Lebanon Ends Without Progress
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 27Lebanese rightwing Christian representatives discussed an Arab League peace proposal for an hour today at a meeting with League officials, but the discussions ended inconclusively.

title: Campers Competing for Stokes Park Sites
description: STOKES STATE FOREST,  Despite falling attendance at most state parks, campers are competing eagerly for the choice spots here. Although bad weather, increased admission fees and high unemployment are said to have caused a 10 percent decrease in park attendance throughout the state, campers here are being turned away each weekend, according to Ron Townsend, ranger in charge.

title: WILLIAM B. M'LEAN, NAVY RESEARCHER
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 27 (AP)Dr. William B. McLean, longtime leader in Naval warfare research, died Wednesday in a hospital here after a long illness. He was 62 years old.

title: London Gets a Little Rain
description: LONDON, Aug. 27 (Reuters) Brief light rain, the first in six weeks, tantalized Londoners today. But it was not enough to be measured by rain gauges. For London's newspapers it was frontpage news. That's Rain FolksGive It a Big Hand, said a headline in The Evening Standard.

title: Carrie Smith Sings at Michael's Pub
description: A great deal of Carrie Smith's growing reputation as a singer is based on her ability to project the spirit and flavor of songs associated with Bessie Smith (who was no relation). Her performance of several Bessie Smith songs was a high point of the New York Jazz Repertory Company's revue of Louis Armstrong's career, which toured the Soviet Union after being introduced in New York.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: L.I. Bishop Decries Sunday Shopping
description: With a number of major department stores poised to open their New York City and suburban stores for the first time this Sunday, several Christian religious leaders have called on their church members to refrain from Sunday shopping.

title: Deaths
description: ABRAMSONBen, beloved husband of Bertha (nee Green), devoted father of Mickey and Bill Spitalny, loving grandfather of Richard Spitalny and Jill Baten. Cherished great grandfather of Melissa, Amanda and Blythe. Services on Sunday, August 29, 2 P.M. at The Riverside Westchester, 21 West Broad Street, Fleetwood, Mt. Vernon.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP)The Nuclear Regulatory Commission says it may ask the Supreme Court to review lower court decisions that led to a slowing in licensing new nuclear power plants. Its chairman, Marcus A. Rowden, told a Congressional committee today that decisions by the United States Court of Appeals raised uncertainties about the commissioner's rulemaking responsibilities.

title: MajorParty Platforms Vary on Ecology Issues
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 27President Ford and Jimmy Carter swing into their campaigning with party platforms that reflect quite disparate outlooks on environmental problems and resource management.

title: Money
description: NE WYORK (AP) oMney rates for Friday.

title: Captain Kangaroo, 6,000 Shows Old, Still Young
description: The show has always come on the air at 8 A.M., right around the time the corn flakes are getting soggy, and it did again yesterday, for the 6,000th time. The children who watched the: first Captain Kangaroo broadcast, on Oct. 3, 1955, may well be married now, with children of their own. Captain Kangaroo, on the other hand, has not changed much.

title: Silence Confronts 3 Cadets Accused of Cheating
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Aug. 27 Cadets Ray Betler, Stephen Ferris and Brian Fitzpatricki moved to their new quarters at the United States Military Academy here this muggy afternoon and walked right into a wall of chilly silence built by their colleagues.

title: Dodgers Top Mets, 52: Kingman Reactivated
description: Dave Kingman returned to the punchless Mets last night, but the base on balls he drew as a pinchhitter in the ninth inning was far from enough to help them avert a 52 defeat to Don Sutton and the Los Angeles Dodgers in the opener of a threegame series at Shea Stadium.

title: And Then, You See, There's This Cat ...
Pro Transactions
description: BASKETBALL

title: Mobil Frustrated In Rhodesia Inquiry
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation, in a letter sent yesterday to the United Church of Christ, indicated that it had been stymied by differing policies of the United States and South African governments in its attempts to investigate some controversial oil shipments in southern Africa.

title: HaveNot Nations Threaten to Block Ocean Pact
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 27Spokesmen for 52 countries with little or no access to the ocean warned today that unless their demands are met they might block adoption of a global maritime treaty that the Law of the Sea Conference is attempting to write.

title: Ford's Strategy of Fear
description: WASHINGTON, August 28It seems fairly clear from the President's summit meeting with John Connally and Nelson Rockefeller in the Colorado mountains that the Republicans are goiag to emphasize foreign policy in the. Presidential campaign and try to provoke public anxiety over Gov. Carter's comparative inexperience in this field.

title: Committee in Limbo
description: HAUP PAUGE FIVE months ago, when questions about the financing and construction of Suffolk's Southwest Sewer District were being raised insistently, the Presiding Officer of the County Legislature appointed a blueribbon committee to study the technical aspects of the project.

title: The Harlem Renaissance
description: It was called The Harlem Renaissance because Harlem was where the action was. Some of the writers belonging to the movement didn't even live in Harlem. That didn't matter. Harlem became the symbol for the international black city. It was home of The New Negro (Uncle Tom and Sambo have passed on . . .) from the title of a book, compiled by Alain Locke, the brilliant Harlem Renaissance philosopher.

title: Editors' Choice
description: Fiction and Poetry

title: G.M.'s 1977 Line Runs Ahead of the Pack
description: DETROITGeneral Motors Corporation is gambling.

title: Mrs. Abzug Says She Won't Back Moynihan If He Wins Primary
description: Representative Bella S. Abzug said yesterday that she would not support her opponent, Daniel P. Moynihan, if Mr. Moynihan won the Democraitc primary next month.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: This Week:

title: A.D.A. BACKS CARTER; WARNS OF M'CARTHY
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 28 (UPI) The national board of the Americans for Democratic Action endorsed Jimmy Carter for President today and asked liberals not to support former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy, a liberal running as an independent.

title: Moving Too Fast
description: Senator Edward M. Kennedy is working hard to rush the new national security wiretap legislation through the Senate. The measure, designed to impose order and restraint on wiretapping activities in areas where there have been no legislative restrictions in the past, was originally developed by a bipartisan group of Senators on the Judiciary Committee and by the Attorney General. After the bill had been considered by both the Judiciary Committee and the new Select Committee on Intelligence, Senator Kennedy, with apparent impatience, attempted to schedule it on a highly expedited basis with severely limited debate on Monday.

title: The 19th Century Preserved in Maine
description: There's something a bit disconcerting about finding a sprawling 19thcentury restoration and museum in the middle of nowhere in rural Maine. Newfield, near the New Hampshire border in the south of the state, is an easy hour's drive from summer vacation spots like Lake Winnipesaukee, Sebago Lake and Kennebunkport and just two hours from Boston. But still, the immediate area is so sparsely populated that one's curiosity is aroused: Why here?

title: HOME CLINIC
description: MOST Long Island homes escaped with little or no damage when Hurricane Belle swept through the area a few weeks ago. However, several South Shore residents have written in to say that their houses suffered minor damage when gusts tore off one or two asphalt roof shingles, or in some cases curled several of the roof shingles upward so that they no longer lie flat on top of the shingles directly below them (and thus could let water get blown underneath).

title: The Nation
description: The United States Civil Rights Commission has issued a lengthy report on school desegregation that is generally positive on progress but strongly critical of the Ford Administration. The burden of the commission's findings was that desegregation works peacefully where communities and community leaders want it to; Mr. Ford's legislative proposals to limit the Federal judiciary's busing authority, the commission said, encourages community resistance.

title: Notes: A Dream City Rises in the Desert
description: One of the nation's most unusual communities, Arcosanti, rising on a remote mesa at Cordes Junction, 70 miles north of Phoenix, Ariz., will be the site of an arts festival Oct. 2931. The purpose of the festival is to introduce Arcosanti to the general public. The part now being built is the first stage of a projected urban complex that has long been the dream of controversial architect Paolo Soleri.

title: This Time, Attica Is Another World
description: A planned strike by nearly all 2,000 inmates of Attica prison, now apparently ending, proceeded tensely but nonviolently, in contrast to the uprising there in 1971 that took the lives of 43 people.

title: Thomas A. Elliott, Aged 55; Britain's Envoy to Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 28Thomas A. Elliott, the British Ambassador to Israel, drowned today while swimming off Caesarea. He was 55.

title: ART
description: LIKE other critics, art writers are addicted to the use of such words as still, although, nevertheless, however. notwithstanding, yet and but. These words are called adversative conjunctions, and art copy is chockablock full of them.

title: Kitty Kelley Wed To Michel Edgley
description: Katherine (Kitty) Kelley, Washington correspondent for New Times magazine, was married yesterday afternoon to Michael Peter Edgley of Washington, a publicrelations specialist for the National Council on the Aging.

title: State Urged to Revise AutoInsurance Rules
description: IN the last nine months, the average autoinsurance premium in New Jersey has gone up about 50 percent. But the insurance industry is not satisfied with that increase, and it is now involved in a wellorchestrated campaign to force the state to change its regulatory procedure, according to James J. Sheeran. the state's Commissioner of Insurance.

title: Utah Star Assets Fetch $14,500
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 28 (UPI)It took the Utah Stars five years to sink from the heights of the American Basketball Association into bankruptcy.

title: 5 Points Moral: In Time a Place Transcends Its Past
description: Strange are the ups and downs of neighborhoodsespecially the ups. There are places where angels, not to speak of ordinary citizens, may fear to tread. (Though to cover all the tough turf in town would require wheels.) But the lesson of a tour through the city's historical criminal haunts is clear: Places, like people, do sometimes improve with age.

title: INVESTING
description: Remember the good old days when the savvy investor put his trustand his money in Uncle Sam when the stock market was screeching downward?

title: Detroit Plans More Changes
description: DETROITThe entire auto industry is downsizing cars, although General Motors is getting the attention today.

title: Mrs. King and Miss Casals Gain Final Against Australia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 28The dresses they wear are pale blue, with American flags stitched onto the left hip, rhinestones sewn onto the white stars. When the rhinestones catch the light, they glitter, projecting a touch of magic, which is just what the occasion called for as Billie Jean King and Rosemary Casals, the United States team, showed the Federation Cup tennis tournament some magical play today.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE TRADE DEFICITexcess of imports over exports amounted to $827.1 million in July, the biggest in almost two years, the Commerce Department reported. The first seven months deficit was $1.88 billion, and projected at $3.2 billion for all of 1976, compared with a trade surplus of $11 billion in 1975 . . . The Index of Leading Indicators rose 0.5 percent in July to 109.5 percent of the 1967 average, compared with a revised increase of 0.9 percent in June.

title: Robert Curry, Helen Post Wed In New Canaan
description: Helen Stanton Post, daughter of Mrs. Allen F. Maulsby of New York and New Canaan, Conn., was married yesterday afternoon to Robert V. K. Curry, son of Dr. and Mrs. Donald E. Curry of New York.

title: The Delicate Frostiness Of Finely Etched Glass
description: Fashionable and expensive restaurants started it, this return to etched or sculptured glass panels that, in style, are Nouveau or Art Decoor maybe something in between. Are they likely to spread from Maxwell's Plum, Grand Caf, Crawdaddy, La Goulue and the soontobeopened Tavern  on  the  Green, into apartments and houses?

title: Miss Parker Bride Of Robert C. Gillie
description: Charlotte Huger Parker, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kennedy Bryan Parker of Flatts, Bermuda, and Llewellyn Park in West Orange, N. J., was married yesterday afternoon to Robert Cass Gillie of Greenwich, Conn., president of Gillie & Company, Greenwich dealer in military antiquity.

title: Farmland Act Assayed
description: THERE were compelling reasons for amending the Constitution of New Jersey to permit usevalue assessment of farmland. A principal objective was to halt the rise in farm taxes that prevailed in the 1950's by eliminating that portion of land taxes resulting from marketvalue assessment. This amendment would lessen the farmtax burden and encourage farmers to stay in business longer and, in so doing, preserve open space in New Jersey.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: ALTHOUGH most New Jersey homes escaped with little or no damage when Hurricane Belle swept up the East Coast a few weeks ago, some readers with places in shorefront communities reported minor damage to the roofs of their houses when gusts tore some of the asphalt shingles loose or curled them upward so that leaks developed where none existed before.

title: New York Rated as Low Priority to Ford Campaign
description: New York, which is traditionally Democratic in Presidential elections, is clearly a low priority state for President Ford, despite the protestations of the President and Vice President Rockel on Friday that no state is being written off by the Ford campaign. The words were contradicted by some clear signals from the Ford camp.

title: New Novel
description: Touch Not The Cat

title: MONDALE EXULTS OVER FORD CHOICE OF VOTING ISSUES
description: MORTON GROVE, Ill., Aug. 28Senator Walter F. Mondale reacted with delight today to the list of campaign issues outlined by President Ford yesterday.

title: SIAMESE TWIN DIES
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 28 (AP) One of the two Siamese twins separated two years ago in a rare operations has died in the Dominican Republic, Children's Hospital announced today.

title: Metros Beat Kicks For Soccer Crown
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 28 (AP)Eusebio boomed home a direct fre kick in the first half and his Toronto teammates added two goals in the second half to gain a 30 victory over the Minnesota Kicks today and the North American Soccer League championship.

title: World News Briefs
description: LONDON, Aug. 28 (UPI)The first rain in southern England in nearly 40 days brought no relief from the country's worst drought since the Middle Ages. In South Wales, where present water supplies will last only a few weeks, Water Minister Denis Howell dismissed crisis fears as wild talk.

title: Speedy Trials Imperiled
description: IN recent years, New Jersey's 13 prisons and correctional institutions, scattered from Cape May to the Pennsylvania line, have been full to overflowing.

title: The remating game
description: Perhaps it is the somewhat disparaging reference to pressure filled singles establishments. In any case, to numbers of middleaged New Yorkers who find themselves single again (often to their own astonishment) and also find that New York's singles scene demands risktaking, a tough skin and street wisdomqualities they didn't develop in marriage The Social Participation Club's ad attracts because it promises safety.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: ART

title: Laws for the Sea Remain as Elusive as Ever
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y.Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger will come to New York this week to try to break the impasse that has stymied progress in the Law of the Sea Conference. It is doubtful he will succeed, mainly because the conference appears to have become hopelessly split by conflict among competing ideological and interest groups.

title: FordCarter Race Found About Even Outside the South
description: President Ford's popularity after the Republican National Convention has risen to the point that he and Jimmy Carter, the Democratic Presidential candidate, are virtually tied outside the South, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: Zulu Accuses South African Police of Instigating Strife
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 28The leader of South Africa's 4.8million Zulus accused the police today of having instigated the black strife that killed at least 21 people in Soweto this week. He also said that the sight of policemen shooting black children was stirring hatred for all whites.

title: 3 Rent Oil Rig Pier Space
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Aug. 28 (AP)Three more oil industry support companies have rented pier space on former Navy land in Davisville as sites for servicing expected offshore oil rigs in the Atlantic Ocean, state officials say. The companies are Milchem Inc. of Houston, Schlumberger Well Services of Houston and the Harter Underwater Corporation of Maryland.

title: Outer Space And Inner Sanctums
description: Communications satellites began as fantasies of science fiction writers, who believed that they could link all the peoples of the world together into a single global village. By 1965 American scientists and engineers had succeeded in putting in orbit around the earth compact machines capable of bearing telephone messages across continents and beaming television signals over the seas. But in the decade since the first one went aloft, according to Michael Kinsley, an unholy alliance between business and the Federal Government has subverted the bright promise of this new technology. The theme of Kinsley's book, Outer Space and Inner Sanctums, is an elaboration on the observation of the French writer Charles Peguy that Everything begins as mystical and ends as political.

title: Coming Attractions: Shocks, Gimmicks, Sequels
description: For four and a half hours, the camera dwells on the victims and the survivors, the criminals and the judges who tolayed a part in the Nuremburg Trials. For more than five hours, an epic drama of Italy's political upheaval in the 20th century unfolds, and it may eventually be shown in two halves, at separate but neighboring theaters. An elderly man of letters reflects upon the intellectual and emotional associations that have shaped his art. The personalities of a group of French children, ranging in age from two months to 14 years, are scrutinized in clinical detail. Four actresses gaze inward, exploring the psychological forces that drove them to their private and public destinies. A legendary lover is revealed as a foolish fraud cavorting in a spiritual wasteland.

title: Henry Conolly, Anne Peterson Have Nuptials
description: Anne Horry Peterson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walker F. Peterson Jr. of Ruxton, Md., was married last evening to Henry Neal Conolly, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry B. Conolly of Darien Conn.

title: ah, for the good old days not long ago when the yanks didn't win
description: in 1941, age 11, one fine afternoon i went to visit aunt gus and uncle morris, alone, walking the hilly streets of yonkers, while radios blared from every yard and open window, i heard the first world series game i remember really hearing, it was a fine initiation. somewhere on attin drive, between two neat suburban houses, I heard it all as mickey owen dropped the fated third strike, the yankees did it to me and the dodgers, too, for the first time that day.

title: Miss McLean Becomes Bride Of Jay Woodruff
description: St. Andrew's Episcopal Church in Edgartown, Mass., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Elizabeth Preston McLean, daughter of Mrs. Grant McCargo of Sewickley, Pa., and Donald McLean of Stuart. Fla., to Jay Montgomery Woodruff. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Montgomery F. Woodruff of Kansas City, Kan.

title: The Creative Balance
description: Elliot Richardson, the current Secretary of Commerce and former Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, Secretary of Defense and Attorney General, has earned for himself, at the least, a place in the Guinness Book of World Records: he is the first person to have held four ministerial portfolios in the United States Government.

title: For an Independence Day
description: RIGHT now I am watching the front door of the Robinsons' house across the street. Their daughter Jennifer leaves today for college, starting her freshman year at Cornell. We have all watched her grow up. It's an exciting moment.

title: TV VIEW
description: To paraphrase an old Bob Dylan lyric: Something is happening, Mr. TV Newsman, but you don't know what it is. Despite, or indeed because of, the fact that various polls have revealed that most Americans get most of their news from television, the electronic press remains an object of intense suspicion. Everybody from professional critics to casual viewers has an opinion of the service provided, an opinion that generally runs from scorn to irritable toleration.

title: The Olympics Revisited: Perfection and Crybabies
description: Letters from readers about the Olympic Games indicate to me that the writers have never played any of the sports on the Olympic program, attended the Games or paid any attention to any of the Olympic sports except for a twoweek period every four years.

title: The Ranks Don't Seem to Mind
description: For two decades the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, the largest trade union in the world, has been the object of charges of corruption and the target of government investigations. The union, which represents 2 million of the 18 million organized workers in the country, was expelled from the American Federation of LaborCongress of Industrial Organizations because of its refusal to clean itself up.

title: National Conference: Cardinals Determined to Make Super Bowl
description: After trading next year's first draft choice last Sunday to the Falcons for John Zook, a splendid defensive end, the Cardinals' general manager, Joe Sullivan, explained that Atlanta was building for the future. We're building for January and Pasadena, he said.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Investors' growing concern over the slowdown in the economy caused stock prices to plunge last week in lighter trading.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The ownership of several major properties on Park Avenue has changed hands recently. Also, several new leases for important groundfloor space along the avenue have been signed.

title: The Summer Day Is Done
description: They were an unlikely pair: footloose untitled Englishman whose dangerous trade was espionage, and the beautiful, untouched daughter of the last Czar of Russia.

title: Close Race Is Captured By 61 Shot
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 28 (AP)Victorian Prince, Canadianowned, Canadianbred and ridden by a Canadian jockey, Robin Platts, defeated Improvisor and Bold Roll in a threehorse photo finish of the $130,000 Arlington Handicap today at Arlington Park.

title: U.S. Aides Meet Nyerere
