description: DETROIT, Aug. 30 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company said today that it would present the United Auto Workers with its first money offer tomorrow, giving negotiators just 14 days to work out contract compromises and prevent a strike by the company's 170,000 workers. The auto industry negotiations began in midJuly.

title: DUTCH REJECT BID TO ARRAIGN PRINCE
description: THE HAGUE, Aug. 30The Dutch Parliament came out overwhelmingly today against a leftwing call for the criminal prosecution of Prince Bernhard for his involvement in the Lockheed bribery scandal.

title: 2 in Senate Race Charge Some Liberals Are Racist
description: Paul O'Dwyer and Daniel P. Moynihan criticized yesterday what they called racism by some liberals.

title: New York Officials Place Medicaid Frauds at 20%
description: New York City officials agreed yesterday with a Senate report charging massive fraud and waste in Medicaid, but differed on who was to blame.

title: Advertising
description: In this era of consumerism, more marketers than ever before are attempting to get as close as possible to consumer attitudes and reactions to their products.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Administration, After Delay, to Publish A Report Criticizing Aluminum Pricing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30The Administration hasp decided topublish before Election Day a longdelayed study that criticizes pricing practices of the aluminum industry, but without the authors recommendation that the Government consider possible remedies which could be implemented if this industry continues to resist competitive behavior.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold prices Monday. London: Morning fixing Holiday, afternoon fixing Holiday.

title: RHODESIA SENTENCES EIGHT BLACKS TO DIE
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Aug. 30 (UPI)The Salisbury High Court today convicted eight officials of the African National Council, Rhodesia's black nationalist organization, on charges of sabotage and urban guerrilla warfare and sentenced them to die on the gallows.

title: A Bill That Can Wait
description: The Senate is about to debate Attorney General Edward Levi's national security wiretapping bill, so it's necessary once again to ask the question: What emergency justifies a Democratic Congress in rushing to pass a Republican Administration bill so full of loopholes and ambiguities? Why shouldn't suchan important matter be left to the next Congress, when either the CarterMondale Administration will be in office or the Ford Administration will have been given electoral legitimacy?

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: Bridge
description: A group of young players who have dominated team events in tournaments in the metropolitan area this year scored another success in the Swiss teams played Sunday at the New YorkNew Jersey regional championships at McAfee, N.J.

title: DR. TORSTEN NORVIG
description: Dr. Torsten Norvig, chairman

title: City, Short on. Cash, Will Use Water to Rebate Overcharges
description: New York City yesterday settled suits brought by two Westchester communities  Mount Vernon and Greenburghbut will pay the claims with water, not cash.

title: MONDALE SCORES FORD ARMS SALES
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 30Senator Walter F. Mondale today charged the Nixon and Ford Administrations with a profligate and scandalous record on arms sales and suggested that a special session of the United Nations Disarmament Commission be convened as a start toward control of such sales.

title: Firestone Gifts Under U.S. Investigation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30The Justice Department and the Internal Revenue Service have opened criminal investigations into the activities of the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company and its corporate officials involved in some $330,000 of domestic political contributions, according to court papers filed here earlier this month.

title: Program Is Seeking to Regain Audience
description: ed after a while, enough of this foolishness.

title: PistolPacking Cowboys Roam the Beirut Range
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 29 The cowboys of Beirut are the latest social outgrowth of the Lebanese civil war, now in its 17th month.

title: Books of The Times
description: Was Little Orphan Annie a dark parable of good and evil with undertones of Dickens and Hugo? Gasoline Alley, the lives and times of a small midwestern community [described] with a tenderness and serenity worthy of Goethe's Wilhelm Meister? Superman a wholesale creation of a mythical ontogeny?

title: Joseph Durso
description: Sports of The Times

title: Bayi 2d To Briton In Mile
description: LONDON. Aug. 30 (AP)David Moorcroft, a 23yearold Briton, defeated Filbert Bayi of Tanzania in an upset in the mile run at the British Games today.

title: Jesuit Priest, in Book, Urges Church To Reconsider Stand on Homosexuals
description: Homosexual behavior can be morally pond according to a Jesuit priest from New York whose hook, published yesterday with the permission of the Catholic church, challenges the church's traditional condemnation of all overt homosexuality.

title: Number of Resolution Votes Double for Stockholders
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (UPI) The number of stockholder resolutions voted at corporate meetings more than doubled this year although the resolutions continued to lose when opposed by management.

title: Prison Trial Figure Held
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Aug. 30 (UPI)Fleeta Drumgo, 31 years old, acquitted on charges of taking part in a San Quentin Prison breakout attempt that left six persons dead in 1971, has been arrested on a trespassing charge. The police said Mr. Drugo had been taken into custody Friday after a homeowner complained that a man matching his description walked into his home uninvited. He said that the man, appearing dazed, left after a few minutes. Mr. Drumgo's lawyer, Michael 1B Dufficy, said, He wasn't i doing anything wrong. He was just dazed and unsettled.

title: Army Denies Possibility That Release of Its Toxic Materials Caused Mystery Ailment
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 30The United States Army has denied the possibility that an accidental release of any of its toxic or infectious materials could have caused the epidemic of a mysterious disease that has killed 28 persons and sickened 150 others in Pennsylvania, state and Federal health officials said here today,

title: D.C. Fund Bill Passed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 39 (AP)The Senate passed, 85 to 0, today $1.1 billion appropriation bill for the District of Columbia. The bill includes a Federal payment of $259.9 million plus loans for capital outlays of $101.2 million. The measure now goes to conference with the House.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Before she underwent a sexchange operation last November, Dr. Renee Richards was known as Dr. Richard Raskind, an amateur tennis player who in 1974 ranked third in the East and 13th nationally in the men's 35andover division. Last week, before curious crowds buzzing with debate, the 42yearold ophthalmologist reached the semifinal round of a women's tournament in South Orange, N.J.

title: Swick, Rookie Quarterback, Sweats Out a Giant Trial

title: MILWAUKEE MEETS ORDER ON SCHOOLS
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 30Milwaukee schools will meet Federal court order to integrate this fall through voluntary enrollment, Lee R. McMurrin, the superintendent of schools, announced today.

description: WASHINGTON. Aug.30 (AP) Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said in a letter released today that there was no foundation in fact to charges that the board was dominated by banks and big business.

description: Albert Kner, for many years !a principal package designer and market researcher for the Container Corporation of Amer!'ca, died in Chicago Aug. 21. He was 76 years old and a resident of Chicago.

description: The legal and electronic hurdles in the way of the debates between President Ford and Governor Carter are being dismantled. Both majorparty candidates have agreed to meet on television; each already claims have challenged the other first; and there is no plausible turning back for technical reasons without appearing to deny voters this chance to learn more about the issues and how the two men handle themand themselves.

The subject of the film, who has been Uganda's dictator since he took power in a coup d'etat in 1971, is not the sort to use bushels to hide lights that would embarrass other men.

title: Attica's Inmates Ponder Gains and Losses in the Strike
description: ATTICA, N.Y., Aug. 30When James Cronk woke up early today in his cell at the Attica State Correctional Facility here, he did not, as he would normally have done, swing off his bunk bed. Instead, he lit cigarette and reflected on last week's strike by inmates to protest prison conditions.

title: U.S. BILL ON BANKS UPSETS GERMANS
description: BONN, Aug. 30 An American bill that would put tighter controls on foreign banks in the United States is stirring up talk of retaliation here against American banks doing business in Western Europe. The West German bankers say that if the American bill becomes law, it could constrict the flow of European investment to American companies and cities that badly want foreign capital.

description: Scientists working for the Army Corps of Engineers said yesterday they had found no evidence that dredgespoil dumps, such as the one that the corps operates six mines east of New Jersey, posed a threat to the environment.

title: Utility Board Orders Refunds Of Overcharges on Gas Costs
description: NEWARK, Aug. 30(AP) The Board of Public Utility Commissioners announced today that it would order the Public Service Electric and Gas Company to refund $17,113,000 to customers by reducing the utility's raw materials adjustment charge (RMA) by 6 percent from October 1976 to September 1977.

title: Badillo and Mrs. Chisholm Exchange Endorsements
description: Two members of Congress who said they were both heleaguered by opponents with similar political credentials endorsed each other's efforts yesterday to win renomination in the Sept. 14 primary.

description: OTTAWA, Aug. 30 (UPI)Canada's gross national product increased 1.3 percent In the first half, started slowly toward the Federal Government's predicted increase of 4.5 percent in 1976, Statistics Canada said today.

description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 30 (AP)Bjorn Borg of Sweden dropped an errorplagued first set, but then won the United States pro tennis championship tonight for the third consecutive year with a 67, 64, 61, 62 victory over Harold Solomon.

description: KYOTO, Japan, Aug. 30 (Reuters)Prof. Ichiro Morita, one of Japan's leading academics, died yesterday in Honolulu of a cerebral hemorrhage. His age was 74.

title: Honorable Miss, Relent Score As Racing Returns to Belmont
description: Two divisions of the Fall Highweight Handicap occupied the featured spots on the program yesterday as thoroughbred racing returned to Belmont Park for a 48day stand. And, as often has been the case in the 62year history of the stakes, highweighted horses failed. A crowd of 23,874 was on hand for opening day.

title: MEASURE TO EXTEND FUND SHARING VOTED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP): The Senate Finance Commit, tee approved a bill today that would extend Federal revenue, sharing five years and nine months, with payments to state and local governments totaling $41.9 billion.

title: You Can't Judge a Bagel By the Decor Around It
description: In the olden days, all a bagel needed to make good was lox and cream cheese:But judging by the looks of the successful bagel restaurants cropping up around townand across the country, those two ingredients are no longer enough. What the bagel of today needs to succeed seems to be that currently fashionable ingredient ambiance and plenty of it. The de rigueur formula relies on garish overdecoration with a confusion of natural wood paneling, mirrors, round (bagelshaped?) windows, a flood of sunshineyellow lighting, and, most of all, beautiful green plants suspended from the ceiling in slings of jute or macrame, preferably with bushytailed tassels hanging down to brush against the heads and brows of passersby. Add to this an assortment of real and fake junk antiques, and a crowded, sloppy selfservice cafeteria counter, and the formula for success is complete. The model for these bagel boutiques is Bagel Nosh, a chain with five companyowned restaurants in Manhattan, several more companyowned as well as franchised in local sub urbs and still others in New Jersey, Massachusetts, Florida, Colorado and California, with the newest addition opened in Philadelphia last week. Local imitators include the Bagel Buffet, Bagel And . . . Bagel Delox, and, the only nonlookalike, Bagel Chateau.

title: Patriots Bow, 3027, To Browns
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 30 (AP) New England's quarterback. Steve Grogan; threw for 335 yards and two touchdoWns, both in the last two minutes of play, but the Cleveland Browns came away with a 3027 victory tonight, their fourth straight National Football League preseason triumph.

title: Tanglewood Season Ends With Bach's St. Matthew
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 30Tlie ruling esthetic of the 19thcentury in music was that whatever was important had to be big. And so, since Bach's music had been acknowledged as important, bloated performances of distorted significance came to be the rule. We have come to take a different view of Bach's kind of grandeur, thanks to scholarly discoveries, but oversized performances are still with us.

But a spokesman said that definite plans had not been formulated.

title: FORD'S PARKS PLAN STIRS SOME DOUBT

title: 16 Killed as New Clashes Erupt in Soweto
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 30Black strife in Soweto is reported to have caused at least six more deaths in the last 36 hours, bringing the total who have died in the black township since a fresh upheaval broke out a week ago to at least 42. A total of 296 people are unofficially estimated to have died since antiGovernment unrest broke out in South African black townships two months ago.

title: Medicaid Scandals
description: Rumors and suspicions about abuses of Medicaid funds have been rampant for so long that the public, expecting the worst, may not react with adequate anger and disgust to disclosures by the Senate subcommittee on longterm care. Without the outrage these findings so clearly call for, there is small hope that the revelations will be quickly followed, not only by essential reforms but by criminal prosecution of those who have enriched themselves at the expense of the taxpayers and of the poor for whom the funds are intended.

title: Marshal Pyotr Koshevoi, 71, Soviet Infantry Commander
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 30 (Reuters) Marshal Pyotr Koshevoi, who led an infantry division at the Battle of Stalingrad and, from 11965 to 1969, commanded !Soviet Union forces in East Germany, died here today. He was 71 years old.

title: Foes Are Unmoved By Miki's Proposal Of Cabinet Shuffle,
description: TOKYO, Aug. 30 (Reuters)Prime Minister Takeo Miki offered today to shuffle his Cabinet and the executive of the governing Liberal Democratic Party in an effort to end the most serious crisis in the party's 21year history. But his offer drew a cool public response from his two main rivals. Deputy Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda and Finance Minister Masayoshi Ohira, who earlier demanded the Prime Minister's resignation: The two met with Mr. Mild for three and a half hours today to discuss proposals for a compromise.

Nearly 3,500 workers were laid off at the Jaguar car factory in Coventry because of a 24hour strike by 600 paint shop workers. The strikers are protesting Leyland's decision to build a $24 million paint shop at Birmingham instead of Coventry.

title: TV: Tom Brokaw Takes Over as Host of Today
description: Tom Brokaw assumed the mantle of host for NBC's Today show yesterday morning and, while it would be grossly unfair to evaluate his performance so early in the TV personality game, his presence was accompanied by several clues as to possible future directions for the venerable news and feature format. Long before Barbara iiWalters departed for her debut as coanchor on ABC, the Today ratings had begun to slip significantly. The time for tinkeringmajor and minor, casual and desperatehad obviously arrived

title: Winds, Spur Forest Fire

It is concentrated in the Seney National Wildlife Refuge and adjacent Manistique State Forest.

title: The New York Story
description: Although New York figured prominently in the Senate investigation of Medicaid abuses, the study, which also dealt with operations in NeWark, Passaic and Paterson, N. J., Chicago, Detroit, Los Angeles and Oakland, leaves no room for doubt that the scandal is nationwide. The New York experience nevertheless provides, against the background of the state's and the city's strained finances, a particularly poignant insight into the nature and the impact of these crimes.

title: U.S. Team Gains In Senior Tennis

Vic Seixas and Hugh Stewart, the American team, will meet Sweden in two singles and a doubles match at. Tennisport, beginning at 11 A.M. today.

title: Myer Set Down 15 Days

The track's judges felt that James B's eighthplace finish that night compared poorly with the one made on Aug. 27 when the same horse won under Myer's guidance. The horseman is eligible to resume driving Sept. 12.

title: High Medicaid Income Justified By Long Hours, Doctors Assert
description: There are a lot of abuses, I can tell you that, said Dr. Herbert Berger, a general practitioner with a oneman practice at 740 East Sixth Street, of charges of Medicaid abuse by doctors.

title: DOUG DAVIS, TRAINER OF RACE HORSES, 59
description: Davis died some 48 hours after one of his biggest racing triumphs, when Dancers Countess won the Matchmaker Stakes last Saturday at Atlantic City. In a career that began. in 1940 Davis saddled almost 50 stakes winners and last spring became Keeneland's career leading trainer with 160 winning mounts.

title: 5 Olympic Lifters Cited on Drugs
description: LAUSANNE. Switzerland. Aug. 30 (UPI)An International Olympic Committee medical commission said today that five weight lifters, including two gold medalists, took musclebuilding drugs at the Montreal Games. The commission's statement said B. Blagoev and Valentin Khristov Bulgaria. Zbigniey,, Kaczmarek of Poland, Phil Grippaldi the United States and M. Norrhack of Sweden took the bodybuilding steroids. Kaczmarek and Khristov won gold medals and Blagoev took a silver.

title: U.S. UNIT PROPOSES WINE IMPORT RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (UPI) Saying the American consumer needs more protection from possibly harmful imported wines, the Government today proposed rules to insure that the quality of imports is the same as that of wine produced in this country.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: MISSOULA, Mont.Bob Foster, 185 pounds, Albuquerque, N.M., outpointed Harold Carter, 193, Akron, Ohio, 10 rounds; Marvin Camel, Missoula, Mont., outpointed Johnny Townsend, 10, lightheavyweights.

title: Jersey Driver Is Killed
description: GLASSBORO, N. J., Aug. 30 (UPI)  A Gloucester County man was killed here today when his auto apparently went out of control and struck sev eral trees, the police reported. The man, Alex Pritchett, 24 years old, of Sewell, was pinned in the wreckage of his car and had to be removed by rescue crews.

title: ARGENTINA PUSHES FOR ATOMIC POWER
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 30A new study of Argentina's uranium reserves has determined that there is enough highgrade ore to fuel eight nuclear reactors, with an electricity output three times higher than the country's present capacity.

title: Westchester Ruling Backs Landlords On Rises in Rents
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 30Landlord groups won a court order today temporarily blocking the Westchester Rent Guidelines Board from implementing new limits on rent increases.

title: Fed Up
description: ATLANTAThey are supposed to be among the most powerful elements in the society, but they discover themselves virtually powerless. They have done all the things they were told would make them happy and secure, and after half a lifetime of bedeviled striving, they are neither.

title: Publisher of Dictionary To Spread Word by TV
description: How do you advertise a dictionary? The answer to that question has most often been, in newspapers and magazines that appeal to potential buyers. But the Collins and World Publishing Company has taken a different tack in its backtoschool campaign for Webster's New World Dictionary, Second College Edition.

title: Halpern Wins Powerboat Title
description: MARINA DEL REY, Calif., Aug. 30 (AP)Joel Hal. peril, a wealthy, 38yearold contractor from Bronxville, N.Y., captured the Marina Del Rey offshore powerboat race yesterday and won the national powerboat championship. Halpern, driving his 38foot Cobra with twin 428inch Mercury engines, traveled the I88mile course in about 21/2 hours.

title: The Program
description: GENERAL IDI AMIN, DADA. a do, umentary feature directed by Barbet Schroener, produced by JeanPierre Rassam and CharlesHenri favrod; executive producer. JeanFranco's Chauvel; director of photography, Nestor Almendros; editor. Denise de Casablanca; Producer, JeanFrancois Chauvel; diand Le Figaro. Running time 90 minutes. This Silm has rot been classified.

title: New Baseball Clubs Can Speed Deals
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 30 (AP)The Seattle Mariners and the Toronto Blue Jays, the two expansion baseball teams that enter the American League next season, have received permission to purchase players before the Nov. 5 league expansion draft, Lou Gorman, a Mariner official, says.

title: Canadians Score U.S. Tie of Saskatchewan to Potash Price Fixing
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 30Canadian sensibilities have been ruffled by the naming of a number of Saskatchewan politicians, senior civil servants and corporations by the United States Department of Justice as unindicted co  conspirators in charges relating to the fixing of the price of potash produced in the province and used in fertilizer sold mostly to American farmers.

title: Women's Bank Tries to Find Identity, Expertise, Support
description: The First Women's Bank, which attracted attention at its opening last October because it was organized primarily by women and looked more like a modern art museum than a financial institution, has spent its first year struggling with its identity.

title: Britons Told That Rain Has Not Eased Drought
description: LONDON, Aug. 30 (AP)Heavy rain fell on England and Wales over the weekend, but authorities warned that the downpour, though it amounted to as much as two inches in various places, did little to alleviate Britain's worst drought in 500 years.

title: byrne Signs Bill to Make income Tax Operational
description: NEWARK, Aug. 30  New Jersey's personal income tax, the first in the state's history, became operational today when Governor Byrne signed into law a revenuesharing bill and homestead exemption bill, thus completing the legal requirements to activate the tax.

title: Mars Polar Region Picked for Landing Of Viking 2 Friday
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 30 (Reuters)Viking project scientists today chose an area on Mars called Utopia, near the north polar cap, as the landing site for Viking 2, which is scheduled to touch down on the planet at about 4 P.M. Eastern daylight time on Friday.

title: TRANSIT AGENCY DROPS 215 RUNS
description: The Transit Authority eliminated 215 more daily train runs yesterday on the IND and BMT divisions, raising to 855 the total of runs dropped in the subway system since early 1975.

title: BUILDING INDEX EASED FOR JULY
description: Continued growth in residential construction contracts during July kept total contracts signed for new construction almost at the June level, on a seasonally adjusted basis, the ?. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yesterday.

title: judge Rejects the Harrises
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 30Judge Mark Brandler of Superior Court refused today to grant a new trial to William and Emily Harris, the accused kidnappers of Patricia Hearst.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Acid Rainfall Laid to Pollution

title: Canceled Price Increases In Steel Bolster Stocks
description: Stocks advanced yesterday in response to bargainhunting in blue chip and glamour issues as well as spreading cancellations of scheduled steel price increases by industry lenders. The steel price actions were viewed as encouraging news on the inflation front.

title: New York's State Fair PreparestoOpenToday
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 30In the carpenter's shop, the electric saws whined and in nearby barns, 4H youths brushed the animals they hoped would bring blue ribbons as the 1976 State Fair prepared to open tomorrow.

title: Red Sox Trounce Rangers
description: BOSTON, Aug. 30 (AP)Jim Rice clouted two home runs and drove in five runs tonight to lead Boston's 18hit barrage as the Red Sox trounced the Rangers, 113.

title: British Soccer
description: By Reuters

title: Rep. Rhodes to Return Army Pension to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP)The House Republican leader, John J. Rhodes of Arizona, says he will return to the Treasury a military pension to which he would become entitled next month.

title: Ethics Panel to Hold Hearings on Hays
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30The House ethics committee voted unanimously today to hold formal public hearings next month into allegations or improper and illegal conduct by Representative Wayne L. Hays.

title: U.S. Facing a Dilemma in Its Korea Policy
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 30 As a blackrobed judge read out guilty verdicts in the trial of 18 prominent South Koreans charged with antiGovernment activities last Saturday, the courtroom was suddenly shaken News by a sonic boom. Analysis It had apparently been caused by United States jet fighter plane on patrol near the demilitarized zone, only 30 miles away.

title: The Joys of Summer
description: For summer we went to the islands. Everyone said they were so much more wellbred than the swamps and not half so dressy as the Hamptons, and besides everyone we knew was going to the Hamptons, which was a bore.

title: 100 Years of East Hampton Artists
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I. Painters and painting are so fundamental to East Hariwton that the Guild Hall in this chipper little township could hardy miss with an exhibition that will be on view through Oct. 3. Artists and East Hampton: a 100year Perspective is its title, and it lives 0,p to it by going back to the 1870's, when artists thought of East Hampton primarily as an agreeable place in which to rent rooms for the summer. (Rowdy Hall was the name of everyone's favorite boarding house at that time.)

title: Preseason Football
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME Cleveland 30, New England 27.

title: Carter Stresses Leadership and Trust.
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 30Jimmy Carter quarreled today with President Ford's assessment of the most important issues in the 1976 Presidential election campaign, saying leadership and the restoration of trust in government were questions that would most affect voters this year.

title: Senate Votes to Preserve Headwaters of New River
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30The Senate gave final Congressional approval today to legislation aimed at saving the headwaters of the New River in North Carolina, regarded by geologists as the oldest river channel in the Western Hemisphere. from inundation by a hydroelectric Dower oroiect.

title: Moss Cites Slipshod Care As Common in Medicaid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30Senator Frank E. Moss sat behind mounds of medications that he said had been preiscribed for him and five equally !healthy aides today as they dejscribed in grim detail their exi periences masquerading as Medicaid patients in New York land other cities.

title: Wide Frauds in Medicaid Found by Jersey Inquiry
description: TRENTON, Aug. 30  The New Jersey Commission of Investigation said today that it had uncovered widespread fraud during an 18  month check of Medicaid mills in the state, and it recommended that the state hire undercover agents to pose as patients to try to keep the program honest.

title: The Two Images of Bella Abzug
description: Thrust at Moynihan Restores an Old Discarded Trait

title: Ultrasonic Search Is Set For Lost
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 30 (Reuters)A team of scientists and scholars armed with ultrasonic devices will set off for. Italy Sept. 21 to hunt for aLeonardo da Vinci masterpiece they believe is buried in a Florentine wall. John Asmus, an expert on art restoration at the University of California campus in San Diego, says the devices will be used to hunt for Leonardo's Battle of Anghiari in the walls of the Palazzo Vecchio.

title: Purple Majesty
description: Now come the days of rich purple in fields and meadows, denoting not only a time of year but a stage of maturity. It is as though the whole summer had been building toward this deep, strong color to match the gold of late sunlight and early goldenrod.

title: Tonight's Entries at Yonkers
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter Designates OTB listing

title: U.S. Court Says School Boards Cannot Remove Library Books
description: CINCINNATI, Aug, 30 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit ruled today that school officials cannot arbitrarily go through a school library and remove books they dislike.

title: German Contract in Libya
description: SALZGITTER, West Germany, Aug. 30 (Reuters)  A group cf West German companieS will construct a $500, million industrial complex at Abu Kammash, Libya, it was announced here today. spokesman for Salzgitter Industriebau G.m.b.H., the chief concern in the Consortium, said the complex would be built for the Libyan Government near large salt deposits in the area.

title: Major League Box Scores and Standings
An Antiburglary Plan: 2 Women With Shotgun
description: NORTH STONINGTON Conn., Aug. 30 (GPO)Two women with a shotgun today surprised a couple of young burglary suspects who entered their house for the'secondand apparently lasttime, the police reported.

title: Soviet Sub and U.S. Frigate Damaged in Crash
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP)  A Soviet nuclearpowered missile submarine collided with the United States Navy frigate Voge in the Ionian Sea last Saturday. the Navy said today.

title: Army Says It Has Found No Evidence That Its Sea Dump Perils Environment
description: Scientists working for the Army Corps of Engineers Said yesterday they had found no evidence that dgespoil dumps, such as the one that the corps operates six miles east of New Jersey, posed a threat to the environment.

title: ARIDA NEARING SENATE DECISIONS
description: PHOENIX, Aug. 27Arizonans will go to the polls Sept. to vote in two Senate primarges with a cast of characters Straight out of the pages of z. political potboiler.

title: Medicaid Also Suffers With Bad Case of Argot
description: Among the practices cited in reports by the United States Senate's subcommittee on longterms care and New Jersey's State Commission of Investigation are the following esoterically named specialties:

title: STEEL UNION HEAD SCORES INSURGENT
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Aug. 30I. W. Abel, who will retire next year after 12 years as president of the United Steelworkers of America, devoted much of his keynote address to the union's convention here today to an swering the criticisms of a 37yearold Chicago insurgent who is expected to seek Mr. Abel's 575.000 a year iob.

title: House Votes Raise In Aid to the Blind, Aged and Disabled
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (UPI) The House approved overwhelmingly today a bill to increase Federal payments to the needy blind, elderly and disabled by more than $32 million a year.

title: A New Towing Plan Starts For Illegally Parked Autos
description: The Police. Department yesterday morning started a yearlong experiment of using a private company to tow away cars parked illegally in the Midtown South Precinct, which extends from 29th to 45th Street between Lexington and Ninth Avenues.

title: Moss Describes Slipshod Care As Common in Medicaid Centers
description: diagnosis, unnecessary testing. unnecessary therapy, and what he called PingPonging, refering patients to unneeded physicians and pharmacies. Mr. Moss its chairman of the subcommittee on longterm care of the Special Committee on Aging, which conducted today's hearing.

title: Soviet Holds Nuclear Test
description: UPPSALA, Sweden, Aug. 301 (Reuters)An underground nuI clear test yesterday by the Soviet Union registered 6.6 on the Richter scale and could have been close to 150 kilotons, the Swedish Seismological Institute said here today. A SovietAmerican agreement to limit the size of underground tests to 150 kilotons went into effect earlier this year.

title: 15 Tenements to Be Rehabilitated for the Poor
description: Fifteen decrepit, largely vacant, tenements near the northeast corner of Central Park are scheduled to he rehabilitated into new housing for 272 poor and moderateincome families, Federal housing officials said yesterday.

title: Jersey City Police Radio Speeds Response
description: JERSEY CITYFour then sat in an cutofstate car beside a downtown service station in the middle of the night not long ago, and a suspicious citizen called the Police DeDartment.

title: Suspect Seized After Killing
description: ABILENE, Tex., Aug. 30 (AP) A man who kept the policemen at bay with rifle fire for more than 12 hours after youth was shot and killed surrendered early today, the Department of Public Safety said. A spokesman said that John J. Allen was taken into custody shortly before 7:30 A.M. Hasp111 attendants identified the slain youth as Nevile Ray King, 16 years old.

title: Bryant Testifies on CoachStaff Limit
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Aug. 30 (UPI)The University of Alabama's football coach, Paul (Bear) Bryant, and its basketball coach, C. M. Newton, testifying today on behalf of two assistant coaches fighting an N.C.A.A. rule limiting the size of coaching staffs, agreed that it would not be easy for the assistants to find coaching jobs at another maior university.

title: Buffs Make Buses Luxury Suites And Do the Driving Themselves
description: FRESNO, Calif., Aug. 29One by one, yesterday afternoon, nine 40foot buses backed into the dusty yard of John and Dee Mancebo on West Dudley Street here in this San Joaquin Valley city.

title: DUTCH REJECT BID TO ARRAIGN PRINCE
description: THE HAGUE, Aug. 30The Dutch Parliament came out overwhelmingly today against a leftwing call for the criminal prosecution of Prince Bernhard for his involvement in the Lockheed bribery scandal.

title: Yankees Beat A's, 52, for Figueroa's 16th
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 30 With 18 elephants and assorted other circus animals outside and Charlie Finley and his new hairpiece inside, the Yankees and Oakland played a game at the Coliseum tonight that held considerable importance for the A's.
